Reviews.Title: “A certain sense of style”
Reviews.Author: Mecid63
Reviews.Content: Downtown San Diego has quite a number of smart hotels, and some that aren’t as smart as they think they are, but the majority of them suffer from that international anonymity that leaves you feeling just a little bit more dead inside. Well the US Grant isn’t exactly a boutique hotel rippling with eccentricities, after all it is in the same market as it’s neighbours, but it has does have a certain individuality that come from it history. It is clearly a hotel which when built, sometime in the first half of the 20th century, had a sense of luxury and quality; the tasteful restoration has tried to capture some of this. Not everything about the hotel suited us, we found the only bar in the hotel a mixed blessing; it was relatively intimate, but in reality a little on the small side; some nights the live music was pleasant on other evenings it was annoying wall paper. The breakfast like wise had highs and lows, no one would recommend the Egg White Frittata and I wasn’t over impressed with the poached eggs on ciabatta which was an eggs Benedict type of affair with a rubbery poached egg and a poor hollandaise sauce. On the other hand fresh egg omelette was excellent and both the shrimp frittata and the smoked salmon breakfast were very good. On the whole, if you’re going to stay downtown in San Diego in one of the big hotels this is one of the more interesting, not the most luxurious and certainly not among the most expensive but very nice and with its own certain sense of style.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jxw22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business several years ago under a different owner. The hotel is still very nice with extremely helpful staff. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was remodeled with good taste and good functionality. The lobby is impressive as one should expect in a hotel of this caliber. The restaurant is quite good, too. The downside -- this trip we had a car, which cost $35 a night to park. Not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fradoc
Reviews.Content: Location and ambience: The US Grant is located centrally in the Gaslamp district. All important sights are in walking distance. The hotel has a luxrious, traditional-American interior. ***** Rooms: Rooms are large with especially large bathrooms. Interiors are luxurious. ***** Breakfast and Restaurants: I did not have breakfast or dinner at the hotel. n/a Service: Service was v gd. There was also a turn-down service for rooms which was more bothersome than helpful if I was at my room. **** Bang/Buck ratio: The hotel was worth the money (I was on a conference rate, though). However, if you do not care for luxury, you may find a better personal b/b ratio. **** Overall rating: **** 1/2

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel; not great for families”
Reviews.Author: Sweetgray
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazingly helpful and kind. The luxury was superb. The decor was beautiful! We came there for a business trip for my husband, and brought our young son. It wasn't such a great place for kids, but without kids it would have been just wonderful :-) Gaslamp is right around the corner, as well as a shopping center and bus/trolley stops. Great location for food and getting places. Because it is in the city, the noise from trucks and people is quite loud. We did enjoy the stay, and especially the staff!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sara x
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed my expectations, my family and I ended up here after running away from a horrible hotel. The beds were comfortable, everything was spotless, the staff was extremely helpful and welcoming. This is definitely a home away from home, I couldn't ask for more. The only thing I didn't like was that it didn't have free wifi service, but I survived that. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and is definitely on my top list of great hotels in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property! Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: AvenueFoch P
Reviews.Content: Let me start by staying, I did not stay in the sleeping room here. But I did do all the negotiating for my colleagues stay during our conference closeby. I did visit the hotel and view the public areas. Beautiful elegant hotel -- Very nice art gallery and dining on lobby level. Nice meeting rooms downstairs. Was so happy to get the Fed. Gov't rate for my colleagues to stay at this superb hotel - when we could no longer get the rate at the Westin Gaslamp around the corner. It was an easy walk to the conference and they had a beautiful hotel to come back to in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, great service & great stay”
Reviews.Author: Roziyou
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days at the US Grant and had a blast. Quick check-in, staff used my name every time, food was probably the highlight of my stay. Kids n wife loved the food. Staff provides excellent service. Great location for gas lamp. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eggegg
Reviews.Content: Wonderful palace with large impeccably decorated and furnished rooms. We booked a superior room (top floor, jacuzzi) - the bath tub was really big! All members of the staff were very helpful and friendly. Great cocktails at the bar and appetizers. Breakfast is à la carte and is very good. The hotel is perfectly positioned for all downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Travellic
Reviews.Content: Number 1 in the long list of things I liked - the bed! The bed was ridiculously comfortable and I had the most comfortable sleep ever there. There was a little street noise but it couldn't penetrate the lovely sleep experience. You could just nestle between soft white sheets and top that off with a puffy crispy-white duvet. My second favorite feature was the downtown location. Tons of restaurants and shopping are within an easy walk. Throughout the hotel has the elegance of times gone by, but it is a preserved and comfortable elegance. Everything looks fresh and works well, probably due to the $80 million dollar renovation in the 1980's. Outside the intricate facade of hotel is appealing in ways newer hotels aren't. It has so many pretty details that say "come inside". The lobby is inviting - I loved the checkered floors leading into the main lobby where comfy blue velvet chairs rest on cushy carpets under a spectacular row of large crystal chandeliers. We spend a fair amount of time just hanging out in this grand lobby. The Concierge answered my multitude of questions with thoroughness and grace. The stay in this hotel was a very pleasant experience all round.

Reviews.Title: “Why go elsewhere?”
Reviews.Author: quil59
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to personally thank you and your team for the great hospitality. It was a great experience all around. I would like to point out a few people who I thought exemplified great core values and teamwork. First, the impression made by Magdalena at the desk could not have been better. Even though my room was not ready (which is perfectly fine, didn't expect it to be), her genuineness and constant follow up made quite an impression. Worth the wait! The banquets team was superb for our dinner Thursday night. The only thing that should have happened was that I should have been more diligent in getting their names. I believe one gentlemen's name was Tom who seemed to step in even more as needed and was quite knowledgeable about the specialty drinks. He constantly checked in on our end of the table. But they all gave a great experience which along with unbelievable course selection created a unforgettable night. I had a quick dinner at the bar Friday night and got to see Tom and Bruce at the Grant Grill. What a fine example of team work. They knew their returning customers, educated on the wines specifically (the guest next to me was pretty detailed in what they wanted), and how they helped each other's covers added a nice touch to what can sometimes be a territorial area. Great job. Finally, I have to give credit to Nathan. He showed an all around great presence in the lobby and around the hotel. A great addition to your team and he will definitely grow the high standards already being displayed. Thanks again for making this a great experience. I don't think I could have asked for anything better this week.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2Calgarians
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend at this beautiful,e legant hotel in San Diego and just loved it! Great service and beautiful well appointed rooms!

Reviews.Title: “as centrally located as it gets”
Reviews.Author: maverickberlin
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel, great style. I stayed there for three nights and would be hard pressed to find anything wrong about it. The rooms are absolutely beautiful. I personally go more for the contemporary style, while I would call this probably contemporary classic. And I simply loved my room. If you're looking for a downtown hotel, this is probably as good as it gets: right at the beginning of the gaslamp district and across from Horton Plaza. We once had dinner at the hotel and we got a perfect seat even though it was a friday night and we had called just an hour before. The food was superb, the service likewise, as in the entire hotel. Why then only four and not five stars: It's a bit unfair, but I realized San Diego to me is not about downtown, but about the Pacific and the beaches. Or a bit more uptown Balboa Park/Bankers Hill area. Downtown can be a bit dodgy, and to me San Diego is still America's finest city.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptious elegant and well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MissHRaw
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here for 3 nights during our West Coast Road trip in Oct 2009. We LOVED the hotel, it was sumptious and elegant and the main reception foyer was very decadent and special. I felt like a movie star! We stayed on the 6th floor and had a good view over the Gas Lamp District. Considering the classy nature of the hotel we didnt pay much at all and i would definitely stay there again if i was lucky enough to go back to San Diego. I particularly enjoyed the chocolate we receieved on our pillow every day from the maids! Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “right at the start of the Gaslamp district”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: Right at the start of the Gaslamp district, this is an old character hotel with lots of charm. We stayed on the 5th floor where the carpets were a little dirty but the room was quite nice. There were lots of sirens which I suppose you would get at any downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prestigious First Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: -Taradise15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant April 11-15th with my boyfriend who was there for a business incentive. Overall the hotel was very luxurious. Before we arrived I expected the same sort of a feel as the Fairmont, but to my surprise they had renovated and kept the historic hotel very class and contemporary. The location is great, a little north of where I would have preferred, since it’s a block away from a somewhat dodgy area, but overall close to everything. The valet is the only downfall to this hotel, they gouge you on the daily price, especially because San Diego doesn’t have very expensive parking around. The meeting rooms and ball rooms were absolutely stunning and emanated luxury, I highly recommend this hotel to companies holding conferences/ work events because the rooms are of the best I've seen. There was construction on the west side of the hotel on the rooftop at the Westgate Hotel, so if traveling in the near future I highly recommend requesting a room that does not face this noisy construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, solid location”
Reviews.Author: rastaman85
Reviews.Content: Wandering around unfamiliar cities is one of my favorite traveling pastimes, and the area around the Grant is terrific--lots of local flavor in the bars and restaurants nearby. The hotel itself was quite nice, though they gouged us for parking. I also found the room to be a bit on the small side. Having written that, I would stay here again in a minute. Wonderfully comfy beds, nice and friendly staff, and cool amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Live2traveldaworld
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is old style luxury with thick walls and the best bed and pillows anywhere. The location is fantastic sine you are minutes from the airport, walking distance to the Gas Lamp District where there are many restaurants and bars, directly across the street from the Westfield shopping center, near the state and federal courthouses, close to the embarcadero (walkway along the Bay), etc. The staff is very friendly and willing to help with anything you need. The windows are old and you can hear the traffic and people outside so ask for a room that does not face Broadway or Third St. Construction on the neighboring Westgate hotel can be very loud, which is why I recommend avoiding Third St.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, different, worthwhile...”
Reviews.Author: bradleystat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting held at the hotel. It's "different" being a unique historical property. Overall very nice stay and I'd give it 4.5 stars. My room faced the front street and after 9pm it was quiet enough for sleeping; I'm a complainer about noise and this was ok. Beds are luxurious and rooms are interesting. The health club was... wait... was there one? It might have been a small room, I hardly remember. Better to bring some walking shoes and see the neighborhood. Restaurant is good; interesting. Service people are nice/ "interesting". Food is good / expensive. The hospitality for my company meeting event was very good and I'd recommend we have another meeting there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Virginia M
Reviews.Content: Wonderful week at the Grant . Incredible room and very friendly and helpful staff. Location was great for seeing the city and so many restaurants nearby. I was at a conference at convention center it was an easy walk away. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Gwynevere_NW
Reviews.Content: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this hotel. Unfortunately, have been remiss in wifi ting a review, though. Stayed last summer on two different occasions and thoroughly enjoyed both stays. This hotel is in a few short steps to the gaslamp district so tons of choices for food and entertainment. Also located within a 10 minute (max) taxi ride to the airport. The service is impeccable, rooms absolutely stunning (and clean, always important in my book). Every staff member is encountered from the valet to front desk, to housekeeping were always gracious, welcoming, helpful and seemed genuine in their interaction with customers. I highly recommend this hotel. It can be a be bit pricey, but worth it, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Business Travelling”
Reviews.Author: Tytti V
Reviews.Content: US Grant is the best, or one of the best, hotels where I've stayed. I was on a business trip, with a very busy agenda, but this luxury hotel made my stay very pleasent. Especially the breakfast with fresh fruits and delicious omelets was a great way to start the day. I also enjoyed the gym, just go there before 7 a.m. before it gets too crowded. The location of the hotel is ideal if you're attending a congress in the Convention Center, less than 10min walk from there and shopping mall, restaurants etc are just accross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The US Grant and found the hotel to be exceptional in every way. My room was beautifully decorated and spotless. The bed was very comfortable with many pillows to choose from. The staff was very friendly and more than willing to help. The concierge, Joseph Valdez, was especially helpful in guiding me to the best restaurants and planning my daytime activities. Even though there are many great restaurants within walking distance, be sure to dine at Grant Grill in the hotel where the food and service are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: iwannavaca
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed 4 nights in this fabulous hotel in the GasLamp quarter of San Diego. We had a beautiful, large room on the "elite" floor - 2 beds, a large bathroom, and a nice view of the courtyard. It was quiet and lovely. The room itself was stylish with museum-like finishings, including large one-of-a-kind canvas art work above each bed. The decor was like refurbished antique style. However, if you prefer contemporary/modern, you may not like it. The service was exceptional. The manager knew us by name, and we were greeted 'good evening" "good afternoon" etc. every time we entered and left the lobby. Those little details really made us feel special. We also enjoyed the complimentary lavendar infused lemonade in the lobby. The lobby itself is grand and gorgeous, and we enjoyed the jazz piano musician that played in the lobby bar one evening. The location was great - lots of restaurants nearby, easy access to transit, and a mall across the street. We relied on transit the entire trip (including to/from the airport) and it was fine. We both bought transit passes - I think it was $18 for 4 days for unlimited travel - so worth it! We visitied La Jolla, Pacific Beach, Balboa Park, Little Italy, Old Town, Coronado, and even Mission Valley - all on transit. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food there... there were so many reasonably priced places nearby that we wanted to try out. A warning - the neighborhood is a little sketchy only a few blocks away from this hotel, so you may not want to walk alone late at night, though we were never bothered by anyone. Tip - we found that 5th street is THE nightlife street - restaurants are packed at night, even on weekdays, and there is live music everywhere! It's great!

Reviews.Title: “Fine grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidSilverSpring_MD
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this grand old hotel. Our room was great but my daughter's had some weird smell (skunk like) on the second night which they temporarily fixed with spray. All in all, though, we had a good time there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff walked in on me and my Girlfriend..”
Reviews.Author: JohnFitch12
Reviews.Content: It seems the hotel staff wasn't aware that I was staying in the room that I was in. Around 10 am, after the first night there, a male housekeeper burst right into my room, without knocking, while me and my girlfriend were... occupied with each other. Needless to say she was very embarrassed, and this experience ruined our entire trip. I told the hotel staff about this incident, and they forwarded me to the hotel director who offered me a bottle of wine as an apology. Of course I accepted, as I figured this is quite a nice hotel with a very expensive taste in alcohol, at least it should be a good bottle. Nope, I was given a cheap $15 bottle of wine that wasn't even on the hotel's alcohol menu. What a joke, this was just a huge slap in the face. To top it all off, I asked twice to have a refrigerator brought up to my room. The first time I asked was when I first arrived, the second when I asked the concierge over the phone. Both times my request went unfulfilled. I ended up placing my perishables in the hotel mini-bar fridge out of desperation, which ended up charging multiple items to my hotel tab (due to the weight adjustment). I ended up owing about $100 in drinks I never even drank. By the end of the trip I was just so sick of everything, I didn't even care to check out. By the way for those wondering, apparently the US Grant thinks a coke not even the size of a small can is worth $4.95, and a small 8oz red bull is $9.95. Both of which are still inside the mini-bar. I guess I shouldn't forget one last thing, when we arrived my girlfriend (being the superstitious person that she is) asked the Bellhop if the hotel was haunted, since the hotel is indeed over 100 years old. Without skipping a beat, the bellhop tells her it is indeed haunted and tells her a few scary stories not paying attention to the face I was making to tell him to stop. This completely RUINED her experience, she was frightened most of the night and thought every little sound she heard was a ghost. How could someone from the hotel staff do this?! I spent over $1,000 to stay here 3 nights, and my girlfriend was completely distraught the entire trip. Needless to say, I won't be staying here again. I'd rather stay at a motel 6, at least I know their staff wont forget that I'm in my room, they'll be happy to give me a mini-fridge, and they will give me complimentary breakfast. Oh yeah, and a motel 6 won't scare the living hell out of my girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Total Glam”
Reviews.Author: prattjwb
Reviews.Content: I felt like a 1920s movie star. Building is so deco and gorgeous. Rooms are tight but lovely (I still wear my US Grant slippers!). Great location, tons to do. Staff was very nice. Even let us stash our bags the day we checked out so we could explore the city one last time. For a unique hotel experience in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter, this gem won't disappoint. I would absolutely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Copper07
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to restaurants and shopping mall. Service was both welcoming and helpful. A lot of history seen and read throughout hotel. Room was a good size for a couple. I was impressed by the luxury though you can notice it is an older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: Shaun77
Reviews.Content: After all the reviews on this property I was afraid I'd be disappointed, but I was not. This hotel is as amazing as 99% of the reviewers say it is. First off all, the staff: Sergio at check in was amazing. Our room wasn't ready right away, so he took our # so he could call us when it was. We were told of all the things we could do in the area while we waited. He is fantastic at his job and a great representative of this property. Next up, Leanne at concierge. She basically took us on a history lesson of the hotel while telling us of all the things we could do in the San Diego area. quite possibly the friendliest concierge we have ever come across. The hotel itself: you cant beat the area it's in. Close to absolute everything. Gaslamp, main shopping, water/piers, Hilcrest, and Little Italy all within minutes walking-no need for a car at all. It's beautiful, well maintained, and very comfortable. Would return here without a doubt! If I had to say one thing, the 150$ pet fee is too much. Even for a luxury hotel. I get the 35$ parking bc we are downtown, but even 75$ would be far more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in downtown San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: NelsonVNile
Reviews.Content: The US Grant hotel was built by the descendants on America's 18th President after the Civil War. It is a fine old fashioned hotel with charming rooms and great common areas. The hotel is well located for visiting the downtown sights, many fine restaurants and bars are nearby in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “No complaint!”
Reviews.Author: nononesense
Reviews.Content: CHECK-IN/VALET STAFF/FRONT DESK: The entrance to the hotel valet parking is quite tricky. You might go right pass it if you don't pay attention. We arrived to the hotel and were greeted by a very professional valet parking staff who had big smiles and addressed us as Mr. and Mrs. The professsional and friendly valet staff was consistent throughout our stay. We got 2 bottles of water from them everyday "for the road and the little guy". The young front desk staff was very friendly as well. Our son had a cold with temperature during our stay, the staff opened the closed gift shop and offerred tylenol (though we had to decline because we had to use children's tylenol). Overall, we couldn't be happier with the customer service. No complaint! ROOM: Our room is on the 4th floor facing the Westgate hotel, which wasn't a good thing because of their all day construction. Not very good for napping or sleeping in. Our little one was quite unhappy to be waken up so early in the day (around 5AM...) The room overall is more like a suite. The king bed was very comfortable with a ton of pillows. The decor is quite dated and dark, but we weren't bothered much by it. There was a huge mirror on the floor leaning against the wall (not safe if you have a toddler). The bathroom is nice and clean and has everything that we needed, from cotton balls to magnifying mirror and a lot of clean fresh towels with timed lightning. There were always at least 2 clean bath robes for us each day. We got a call every night to find out if we wanted our bed to be turned. Oh, there were 2 compliment wate bottles in our room everyday, which were very nice. ROOM SERVICE: The maids were very friendly and attentive. We had to use the long pillows to cover the pointy sharp night stand to protect our son from getting hurt. The maid understood that and didn't touch them (without us telling). When we saw them on the hallway, they were always polite and friendly to our little one. We ordered in-room service for dinner one night. The food was excellent, exceeded our expectations. We had the fillet mignon with seasonal garden veggies. Everything was very tasty and hot. We could tell that the veggies were very fresh. Our son was happy with his mac and cheese. The onion rings were very good, just like Red Robin. The room service staff was very warm and courteous when he delivered the food. We got a phone call about an hour after our dinner from the conceirge to see if we were satisfied with our meals. LOCATION: One word - EXCELLENT! The trolley is right in front out the door. The mall is one block away, which has a lot of nice shops and restaurants. Very close to Little Italy and about 10 min walk to the Harbor. 5 min drive away to the San Diego Zoo, Spanish Village, and the models train museum (you can take the trolley there). The SeaWorld is about 10 min drive away. The San Diego Sarafi Park is about 20 min away (you will have to go on the freeway to get there, but quite straightforward).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: athow
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, clean, great decor, super helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: anshu a
Reviews.Content: Hotel is awesome, staff is even better. Excellent location, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passenger_Side
Reviews.Content: I returned to the US Grant this month for the first time in a few years. It was even better than I remembered. It is rare to find such character in California hotels as most of the hotels are newer construction. I live in a house built in the same era so I felt right at home. Pros: - Great location...convenient to freeways and Gaslamp district. - Beautiful lobby and restaurant - Excellent staff. Every employee I dealt with was courteous and efficient. - I never waited for anything. Not an elevator, table, car, front desk...nothing. - The beds and pillows are amazing. - Bar/restaurant had great food. Happy hour menu is interesting and more affordable. Cons: - Old windows do allow some city noise. It didn't bother me at all but I could see how it could bother others. - Valet parking is a little steep. San Diego hotels should not have San Francisco prices. - My bathroom was cramped. I think each room is different though. Regarding the "musty" smell that some people complain about...I did notice it in the hallways but not in my room. I didn't view this as a negative. That's what 100-year old wood, plaster, etc. smells like. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, great location - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: King2502
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was living in my own glamorous apartment for a few days. The room was gorgeous, with a luxurious bath and bedroom with tall ceilings, and a living room area. In-room dining was delicious - especially a Reuben sandwich I had one day for lunch. Service was wonderful. I couldn't have asked for more. Also - I am not sure why others have said it was loud. I thought it was one of the quietest hotels I've stayed in. I was on the 8th floor, and heard nothing from neighbors or the street. The location is fantastic too - a full outdoor shopping mall is right across the street, with Nordstrom and other stores, including a CVS - great for any travel items you might forget. This is absolutely my favorite hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to spend money, stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Aaron S
Reviews.Content: I have lived in San Diego for the last 10 years and have stayed in some great places in San Diego and around the world. I was expecting the BEST that San Diego had to offer. However, I was sadly disappointed. I have driven by the US Grant more times than I can possibly count. It looks like the idea place to stay. I HIGHLY recommend the Sophia for less $$ and a Much better experience. Its right down the street and is an ideal place to stay when staying downtown. Heed my warning, you're wasting your money staying here. Your just paying for the name, not the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Very Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: Bryan T
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a wonderful place with rich history. The staff was very helpful and the room was beautifully decorated. HOWEVER, the hotel is located on a very busy and loud street in the Gas Lamp District. We had a front corner deluxe room that had 50 yr old windows that did little to dampen the street traffic and party goer noise down below. You will get little sleep on a weekend. My wife informed me that we will not be coming back....too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet staff”
Reviews.Author: Olivia T
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a rich history and it is absolutely fascinating to hear about. It is also just magnificently decorated in such a way that combines classic luxury with a modern touch. However, the highlight of this hotel is that each of the staff members work hard to go above and beyond their duties and keep you happy no matter how many times you bug them. They are very friendly and welcoming (with the exception of one particular front desk staff member who's name escapes me but he worked the desk at 4am). I found that I would almost find excuses to interact with the hotel staff.' The bedsheets could be softer but in no way impeded our sleep. Someone mentioned the sink was too large and took up too much space but I found that the sink actually increased tabletop space and the bathroom was very beautiful. I particularly liked the art above the beds. (Although they seemed like random scribbles, they actually depicted engaging scenes (such as musicians playing saxophones an a day on the beach)) There are a few drawbacks though. First, the hotel only offers valet parking for $35/day. There are $10/day options available around the downtown area, but they do not allow in-and-out privileges. Because I was going in and out often, I ended up using a combination of free 3 hour parking (with validation) at the Horton Westfield across the street and street parking from 6pm-8am. Second, although I was in a deluxe corner room on the 7th floor, there was quite a bit of street noise which could be a problem for some people (fortunately, my friends and I are heavy sleepers). Sound insulation is definitely a problem here. Third, the rooms are beautiful but are a little small. Find a way to upgrade to a suite if possible. (Unfortunately, I was not extended this option) Lastly, this hotel does get some high-class clients and although my friends and I were dressed cleanly in business casual, the high-class clients would often give us uncomfortable looks. The hotel can't help that but it does make us feel less welcome. But these were not major issues and my friends and I very very much enjoyed our stay and would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Emily M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant for 3 nights to celebrate a birthday. The location is THE best, close to shopping and restaurants for every taste. The hotel is really beautiful with top notch service. The rooms have been renovated and are lovely. The only thing that wasn't perfect is that the room we stayed in was pretty small and there was no bathtub in the bathroom, which was also pretty small. But other than that, it was a great place to stay. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gross... see what's hanging from the ceiling in my pictures!”
Reviews.Author: SEP0041
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the US Grant for business. When we arrived in room 701, we noticed small nests hanging from the ceiling. There is a previous review of another room (not 701) with a similar problem. After seeing the nests in another review, and now in our room, we got curious and removed one from the ceiling. When we placed one of the nests on the desk in the room, it started to move! Something started crawling out of the pod and moved around the desk. I have uploaded a video and I have also posted a few pictures on TripAdvisor. Please stay away from this hotel. It is unacceptable to be sleeping under nests of larvae hanging from the ceiling. The hotel would not even move us to a different floor unless we paid an extra $150/night, which is ridiculous considering the cost of the hotel. I was told that I would be contacted about getting extra SPG points after this incident, but of course I've heard nothing. Do yourself a favor and do not even consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way - a great place to stay in SD”
Reviews.Author: kersten1001
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference this week, stayed in a grand deluxe room on the 11th floor. From the moment I got out of my cab I was greeted by the most helpful young man who carried my bags an escorted me to the check in desk (where there was no line even though the hotel was booked). The staff was not snobby or rude at all but very friendly. Not only is this hotel stunning from the exterior but interior as well. My room was magnificent it has the old charm but with modern amenities. The bathroom was fully re-done with exquisite kohler fixtures and a jetted tub. I was very impressed by the attention to detail at this hotel. The housekeeping staff is very thoughtful. After I returned from dinner every night my bed was perfectly turned down, the lights were dimmed, my slippers were put by my bed, and the music was playing softly. What can I say? Just wonderful. The location of this hotel is also great. You are literally a block away from the charming Gaslamp Quarter, where you can find just about any type of restaurant your heart desires. The Grant Grill at the hotel is also acclaimed as one of the best restaurants in San Diego. I have seen a few people complain about the noise in this hotel. Remember that this hotel is 100 years old and the walls are a little thin. Also the rooms don't tend to circulate air very well making it seem a little stuffy. I consider these very minor drawbacks to a beautiful a historic hotel in the heart of SD.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: tiptoptrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the US Grant for a conference and couldn't have been happier. The most impressive part other than the heavenly bed was the friendliness of the staff. The front desk was welcoming and helpful. I ordered room service and concierge set up a massage and a hair appt for me within 3 hours on a busy Saturday. I enjoyed the fitness center that was open 24 hours a day and away from the rooms. It is located perfectly in the gas lamp with an easy walk to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired, smelly and dirty”
Reviews.Author: karenL08
Reviews.Content: The staff, location and lobby of the US Grant were great. Rooms not so much. Musty odor, poor heat/airconditioning and the upholstery stained. Windows and sills had visible dirt (I almost took and posted a picture. Room 738 was very noisy with trash collection and other street noise. Would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and infested! Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: eckertle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the US Grant last week for a conference. I was expecting an old hotel, but I figured that it couldn't be THAT bad since it's part of the AmEx Fine Hotels & Resorts program. Wow, I was wrong. We were initially brought to room 701 (SPG floor). I noticed some things hanging from the ceiling. I had seem something similar in another TA review, so my husband pulled one down to check it out. I thought it was dust or cobwebs, but it started MOVING. I just uploaded a video to TA that shows the bug crawling out of it's pod. There were several of these on the ceiling over the bed. What's really gross is that we were NOT in the same room as the previous TA reviewer... so this is a widespread problem in the hotel. I showed our video and the moving bug to several people (bell, front desk manager, housekeeping manager, etc.) and no one seemed surprised. We were told that we could be moved to either room 702 or 729 (no upgrade) and that they would consider giving us some extra Starwood points. Umm, we just found larvae in our room... and you're offering extra points?! Unfortunately, all of the hotels in the general area were booked because of the conference, so we were stuck at this disgusting place. After a lot of back-and-forth and 3 hours of wasted time, we went to room 702. We thought that the hotel would do SOMETHING... wine? No. Breakfast? No. Upgrade? No. I even told them that this video was going to end up on TripAdvisor and YouTube asap, but they could not have cared less about the cleanliness or reputation of the hotel. The manager that posts on TripAdvisor was nowhere to be found. Upon check-out, my husband expressed his disgust and they offered to reimburse us for about $90 of incidental charges... which is basically nothing compared to the cost of this hotel. Unfortunately, this wasn't our only problem with the hotel. Everything is dirty... not just old... but dirty. I have stayed in a lot of historic hotels and this one really should be shut down. Several things in the room were broken: lights, furniture, etc. The hotel is extremely dark, as are the rooms and bathrooms. Even fixing the lights in the bathroom didn't provide adequate lighting for getting ready. It was also difficult to have the room cleaned. We asked to have the sheets changed, and after 3 days of sleeping on the same sheets, I called housekeeping to bring me the sheets so that I could change them myself. See my attached picture to see the sheets that they provided... they didn't even cover the bed! When I called housekeeping to get another set, it took almost 2 hours at night for them to bring them when we were trying to go to bed. Also, forget about turndown service at this hotel. Turndown service happened twice in the four nights that we stayed at the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I will never, ever consider staying there again. I plan on sending letters to AmEx FH&R, Starwood, and the conference organization that suggested this hotel. I have never had such a gross experience in a hotel. To make matters worse, the hotel had no interest in making this up to us. Please do yourself a favor and consider any other hotel in the area. PM me with questions or for more information!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Prairiemother
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Rooms were very clean. Decor of the room showed some wear- a cushion and window shade were torn in spots. The service was excellent. The "spa breakfast" in the hotel restaurant was excellent. Overall a nice experience in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “WE WERE SPEECHLESS....”
Reviews.Author: LadiesMantle8
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is the KING of history in this fabulous old hotel. It is well preserved with amazing history displayed in all the public areas on the various floors. My husband and I discovered wonderful furniture pieces and old photographs displayed. Our room was the grand deluxe room on an upper floor. Very grand it was, very spacious, immaculate, and a very large bathroom. The bed was luxurious as expected. The halls were quiet, as was the street below. The front desk was gracious, friendly and professional. We ate breakfast in the restaurant. We splurged and I ordered the SPA breakfast. It was the best souffle omlette ever, plus the bread was terrific. Service was attentive. The hotel offers a state discount if one is employed by a state . Ask for this. The US Grant is one hotel I will always remember and I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel, average experience”
Reviews.Author: clickonline
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very old and historic but was restored over the past few years. The hotel is part of the Luxury collection and has an impressive lobby. Even though the rooms have been renovated, they are still pretty old. The bathroom was 'very' small, hallways gave the impression of a being in a very 'old' hotel. The location of the hotel was very good since it is right next to the Gaslamp district. I had an average experience and will probably not return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of Old World Luxury”
Reviews.Author: downeyb
Reviews.Content: This is a great old hotel that has been well maintained and is well staffed. The service was friendly, courteous and helpful in all departments. The only complaint I have is as a country girl I did find the street noise distracting in the night - the windows are single paned so we could hear everything at street level. Be prepared for this. Otherwise, great stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience from the location to the staff to the room”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler_bt
Reviews.Content: Our family visited San Diego for the first time and was glad that we stayed at the US Grant during our one week visit. The location was absolutely excellent, close to everything and very convenient. Some previous reviewers complained about the "homeless" problem in the park across the street. We saw only 3-4 homeless men at night there. No big deal. They minded their own business and didn't bother us like those in Vancouver BC. If folks are scared of seeing a few homeless men, they shouldn't travel. Period! We were very happy with the room although it was noisy with the construction across the street. It was very clean and had everything we needed, including complementary water bottles and safe. The decoration was a bit too dark and might be a bit dangerous for guests who have small children (due to a very large mirror leaning against the wall on the floor). We were lucky that our 3-yr old boy is not a "throwing toys" type of kid or the "running around" one. If you have small children, ask for a room with no large mirror on the floor. Also, if you see construction activities on the Westgate hotel, ask for another room, so you can sleep in a bit longer :) They started the work very early in the morning...like 5-6AM and went on all day long. My son even said, "Stop making noises misters...over there!" The staff was really the main reason why this hotel is excellent. They were very warm and helpful every time we saw them. The valet staff always offered water bottles to us "for the road" and politely addressed us with "Mrs" and "Mrs". After a long day at the zoo, we ordered room service one night, to our surprise, the quality of the food was a whole lot better than we expected. Our little one loved the mac&cheese. I loved the beef tenderloin. It was perfectly cooked and seasoned at perfect temperature. The winner of the meal must be the fresh veggies that came with the beef. It was worth the cost of the meal. I would have given a 5-star rating, but because of the noise and the cost of valet parking, I gave it a 4-star. Overall, we were very very happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WAMS88
Reviews.Content: The minute we arrived, we felt welcomed by everyone at the hotel. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous with a mix of historic and contemporary elements, beautifully done. We stayed for four nights/five days and every day we were greeted as if everyone knew who we were! Our check in process was seamless (thanks to Sergio) and I cannot say enough about the Concierge- they truly made our stay! Thanks to Mark and Lee, their patience, advice and help allowed us to see and eat our way through San Diego with a 4 year old and enjoy every minute! The hotel staff (especially Mark and the Concierge) was very friendly to our little one and made her feel very welcome, which was something we really appreciate! The rooms were beautiful, the bathrooms gorgeous! The location of the hotel was perfect, near great restaurants, the Gaslamp, Petco Park, the Marina, the Trolley, and about a $12-15 cab ride to the Zoo and about a $22-$25 cab ride to Sea World. We truly feel spoiled because I am not sure that I can come back to San Diego and stay anywhere else. I want to thank everyone who made our stay memorable! We hope to come visit and stay there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Hospitable Staff at Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lasha222
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to stay at the US Grant about two weeks ago. We were only there for one night but the hotel made a serious impression. The staff was so wonderful. My best example of this: the restaurant manager came around to chat with us during our early lunch and I told him that my grandparents got married at the hotel right before WWII. I had a picture with me from their wedding reception and he was kind enough to bring us down to the room where the reception was and take a matching picture of us. This is one of those priceless moments that only happen when the staff cares to be wonderful to their guests. And, wonderful they were.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip - awesome upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: kperk13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant for 2 nights in early March. Upon check in, we were told that they upgraded us to the Penthouse Suite (my husband is Starwood Preferred - I guess this was why??) We originally booked a Grand Deluxe room (one of our friends booked this same category and their room was large & lovely). Unfortunately the room wasn't ready so we had to wait a couple hours until we could get in. To help us through the wait, they gave us a 20% off coupon to the restaurant/bar & we had a glass of wine. The bar was beautiful & the service great. Finally we got our room and proceeded up to the 11th floor. There are only 2 elevators that service this floor so that tripped us up at first but when we got to the room - wow. It had a huge living room, dining room, bar and the bedroom & bathroom were in a separate wing. The bathroom was huge and beautiful with a tub that filled from the ceiling. And the view from the commode was spectacular! The room was in great shape - decorated beautifully. There are tons of windows so the light is great and the view to die for. Because we were lucky enough to score this room, we entertained a group of friends before dinner which was fun. The service was great - everyone we encountered was very helpful and super nice. If I'm going to be nit-picky, our breakfast was a little late one morning but when we called, they told us it was on it's way & it arrived shortly. Also, the bathroom sinks are very cool but totally useless. So hard to brush my teeth & wash my face. But I'll deal!! ;) All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at the US Grant!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: EmptyseaNZ
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at The US Grant in December / January. The impressive lobby was decorated beautifully for New Years Eve. Our room was large, clean and very well appointed. Service was great and our kids loved the chocolates on the pillows! We didn't experience any more noise than you'd expect for a hotel in a large city. The hotel is handily located, close to loads of restaurants and across the road from a shopping complex. Definitely worth a visit if you want a bit of luxury in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. The staff was wonderful. The food was excellent. The hotel was in a great location right next to the Gas Lamp District. My only complaint was that window to my room did not have a lock on it. I was on a lower floor and I could have gone out my window and walked across the roof and gone in to the room across from mine. Since I was staying alone in my room I had a hard time sleeping worrying that someone would come in my room.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great location and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jshappytraveler
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about what a great experience we had at the US Grant. It can be challenging for a family of four to comfortably manage in one hotel room. As Starwood Gold Members we were upgraded to a beautiful suite that functioned like a small apartment - a bedroom area with two king-sized beds and a flat screen, a living room area with a flat screen, a 4 person dining room area, foyer, huge bathroom. It made our week long stay thoroughly enjoyable. We were greeted with a delicious treat when we arrived and also received cookies and milk on our last night. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. We were able to walk or take a reasonable car ride everywhere we wanted to go (the hotel has a great car service that offers very reasonable prices throughout downtown and surrounding area). We had a great time and would definitely stay at the US Grant again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the San Diego Opera”
Reviews.Author: wknorman
Reviews.Content: If you're going to the San Diego Opera, this is the perfect hotel. Out the door, across the street, 100 yard walk, if that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let 'Luxury Collection' mislead you, make sure you get a cheap rate if you are going to stay here”
Reviews.Author: bulldogluvr
Reviews.Content: We took my mother-in-law here for a weekend getaway. All of us were thrilled and excited about staying at the US Grant. Our stay was both relaxing and disappointing at the same time. The hotel in general is lovely but we definitely did not have a 5 star experience. Pros: *beautiful lobby *friendly staff *really comfortable beds *great shower head *coffee (which we had to order from room service for $9 not knowing that apparently we could have requested to have them bring a coffee pot to our room) was served with bone china teacups and saucers which was really nice and the breakfast we ordered one morning was absolutely delicious Cons: * unless you have a suite the rooms are incredibly small and the pictures on their website are deceiving. we had no furniture in our room except the beds and the desk and dresser which is fine if all you are doing is sleeping but if you want to hang out in the room at all everyone has to sit on the beds together which is kind of awkward. *their website also says that "an executive desk with writing pad and telephone invites the guests to take advantage of Wi-Fi" which they tell you when you get to your room you have to pay for FYI *typically the first thing we do when we get a room at a hotel is go to the window and check out the view. we were greeted with the most excessive amount of bird feces splattered on the windows and caked in piles on the window sill that I have ever seen in one place. I actually laughed out loud. I realize what a nuisance birds can be but there are ways to deter them from landing places and at a historical hotel and a luxury collection hotel it was a real shame to have to look at that every time we walked to the bathroom or wanted to look outside. *coming back from dinner the first night we were greeted in the hallway by a cockroach who chased us to our room. Again, comical but really not what you want to see at a really nice hotel. motel 6 maybe, but not the US Grant. *we also were not too thrilled to discover what we have now determined to be about 15 small cocoons of some sort hanging from our ceiling and brown stains maybe from someone throwing something at the ceiling. At first my husband thought maybe they were spit wads or something that some kids who maybe got left in the room too long might have thrown at the ceiling but upon further investigation we are pretty sure some type of bug was living in them at one point. gross. * our ''300-thread-count-linens'' were lovely but were ripped on one of the beds and there was no way the person putting them on the bed could not have noticed it and they put them on anyway. nothing says luxury like ripped sheets. All in all we had a good stay but would not go back again unless we had points we needed to use up. It has become a running joke now with my husband and I that the Starwood Preferred Guest floors at these hotels have the worst rooms in the hotel because this is not the first time we have been given a room where we feel its one of those rooms they always have to move people out of and they really should not be renting them out at all. As a mom I really don't have time to look for stupid things to complain about which means these things jumped out and made me think to myself 'come on really? at a luxury collection hotel?' check out the photos

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful. It is in a great location! You are within walking distance of almost everything. Staff is excellent and very helpful! The Grant Grill breakfast was fabulous! The suite we stayed in was spacious and very clean. This is a top hotel. We would definitely return here again. We did visit the Coronado hotel, but I would choose the Grant hands down over that one...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful properties”
Reviews.Author: foodie007
Reviews.Content: Really a beautiful place. The room was top notch with wonderful finishes. If you like historic properties, this is the place for you! I recently renovated my 1887 home and will be borrowing some of there design ideas. I'm stayed at several 5 star hotels. Although the property was unsurpassed, I was a little disappointed with the checkin. My husband and I were traveling with our 3 and 4 year old. We asked for 2 double beds but this was unavailable. This was fine except the receptionist knowingly put a family of four in what was likely their smallest room next to the elevator that barely fit a double bed. I believe that this was because I booked the hotel through Hotwire. Regardless, this was not the behavior I expected from a 5 star hotel. Luckily, Ryan, who helped us with luggage, noticed the room with inappropriate and got us another room (thanks again Ryan!) Otherwise, I would have given this hotel a 6 out of 5 stars. I really loved the property.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for business and to see the Gas Lamp District”
Reviews.Author: NWOregonTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the US Grant on business and had a great stay. The hotel is located at the edge of the Gas Lamp district and directly across from the shopping area at Horton Plaza. The location can’t be beat and the staff was terrific. The only issue I had over my several day stay was the room key stopped working. This happened 3 different times on the first few days. I saw very few children during my stay; the US Grant does not have a pool but was told that a nearby property (the Westin) allows US Grant guests to use their pool. I did stay on a higher floor and was aware of the street noise especially on Thursday morning when the garbage trucks serviced the nearby businesses. The rooms were nicely appointed and the old hotel construction provided 10 ft+ ceilings in my room. The bathrooms as mentioned were also tastefully remodeled with a thick heavy clear glass shower door and wall. Some homeless were present near our hotel but they did not bother any of our group. There is an active police presence in the area, and always felt safe. I took a long walk one morning to the waterfront and did not encounter anyone but business people and street construction workers. I don’t however think I would take that same walk at 10pm alone. However in the Gas Lamp district next to the hotel the streets are alive with vast crowds of 20-30 year olds frequenting the amazing array of food and beverage choices. This area seemed very safe even late at night on Wed, Thurs, Fri, and Sat when the area comes alive. I would definitely come back with my spouse but probably not stay here with my family as the US Grant seems to be best suited for the Adult traveler. Home now but already miss the Gas Lamp nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Nite”
Reviews.Author: GobClan
Reviews.Content: It's taken a while to post this review, but as I relay so heavily on these reviews when traveling, I couldn't let the opportunity to share my experience at US Grant. We stayed here in April of 2011 - the first night of our honeymoon (we were flying out the next day). We could not have picked a better hotel or location! This hotel is beautiful and is definitely a luxury hotels of the past - or what I imagine they may have looked back then...lol. During reservations we mention it was our anniversary...we receiving a wonderful greeting card, with sparkling water and fruit waiting for us in our room. We were giving a great recommendation for dinner - Greystones, which was within walking distance of our hotel. Arranging car service the next morning was a breeze! Definite recommend for a special night or date night!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pxb123
Reviews.Content: Exceptional hotel. Very attentive. No negative comments but there is a fair amount of street noise. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: dstefan
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stay at the US Grant. Staff is very responsive to all your inquiries and needs. Love staying here whenever I am in San Diego. Delicious food so you don't even have to go out of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; amazing guest rooms”
Reviews.Author: megan1284
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January. We had just come from a convention and wound up in a motel that left just about everything to be desired, so our time at The US Grant was a major upgrade in every way. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was very modern. I tend to look at the bathroom before I'll book a hotel; I want a modern, renovated and tiled bathroom, which the US Grant had. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They also delivered a free newspaper each morning, which came in a bag that had Newspaper embroidered on it. And the location was great. We walked everywhere and for the excursions, we were right on the bus line. So, we just walked out our front door and crossed the street to get on the bus to the zoo. Note: Granted, the room always smelled like lavander after the housekeeping came, so if you have any sensitivities to strong perfume-like smells, I'd request that they not use them in your room. My only issue: We did go to the hotel's restaurant one night for dinner and it was pretty expensive for the options. And, they really did not have much in the way of vegetarian options. For the price, I did not find that the food was worth it. But we were exhausted and didn't feel like heading out that night, as we had just gotten in the previous night at about 1:00 am after a trade show in Anaheim. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great business venue in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Clemmie_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for a week. Central location, great restoration of historic hotel, great bar and restaurant (and I generally hate hotel restaurants so this is really interesting), high level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Conference in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa N
Reviews.Content: AMAZING and BEAUTFUL and THOUGHTFUL hotel!! I went here for a conference at the Hilton Bayfront and was worried that it was going to be too far (not knowing traffic and streets), however the US Grant is just a mile or so away and traffic is not bad at all despite the amount of people on the road. The room was very clean and artistic, the bed was amazing, the room service (while slightly too expensive) always was on time and delicious, and the tv had all my fav channels and at the end of the day, it was awesome to come back and watch my housewives :) I cannot say enough with the amazingness of this hotel. The staff is exceptional and handles every request I had with promptness. For all you ladies out there, you know how bad your feet can feel after walking all day in heels... I asked if they had any bandaids for my feet and they brought me so many in different sizes... I love that kind of thoughfulness. The valet is so kind and just as amazing as the guest services staff. They were able to tell my taxis various directions to restaurants and even helped me out of a cramped shuttle bus (keep in mind, along with those heels and sore feet I was talking about earlier, I had a pencil skirt on which is not the best in climbing out of packed shuttle vans). You can tell that the management takes pride in its staff and strongly encourages customer service and quality. I am the type of person that likes and pays attention to detail and you can clearly see they do as well. One last note: Turn down service is exceptional!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Your Step”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Just came off a three night stay at the US Grant in San Diego. It was my second visit there since October 2011. Couldn't have been less pleased. On my second night, February 6, I stepped on a nail or tack that had separated from the bottom of a desk chair. It pierced my foot. When I looked down to see what it was — and after lifting the chair to make sure — it was obvious to me that my room had not been vacuumed that day. That's because there was black soot all around one of the desk chair legs. When I asked the front-desk staff to have someone speak to me about this the next day, I was told I'd be contacted still that day. I never received an email, a call, not an acknowledgement of any kind. Given the price of the hotel, and the way it's been positioned as a luxury property, I expect good service, caring service, professional service.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we came upon this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: meebjt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minutes at hotels.com - we had no knowledge of the San Diego area and simply picked this place because the price was great relative to how nice the place looked. It looked "nicer" then other hotels online that were priced higher. The location was great for us because we wanted to do The San Diego Zoo (7 minute car ride away), Coronado Island (walking distance to the ferry) and downtown San Diego Gaslamp District (it's right in the heart of that). The room was exactly as it appeared on the website, there were no bad surprises. The service was out of this world - from the valet, front desk, to the restaurant - everyone was SO friendly. Even though we were there only 1 night, they even addressed us by name! We would recommend this to anyone. We had a room with two double beds on the 5th floor and we were 2 adults with 2 kids. The room was very comfortable, and they offer you complimentary bottles of water all over the place (in room, as you leave, as you check in). And even with the great rate, the room included turn down service, which is always a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “2 Night stay .... was not quite sure what to expect....”
Reviews.Author: acavenezia
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just returned from our 2 night stay at the US Grant.... and to be honest... im not quite sure how i feel about this hotel.... ill keep this simple because in the end i think ... i really like it..... im a frequent visitor at the Hotel Del Coronado, (love the ocean and the open-ess..., the stores, the ice cream parlor... simplicity....) ..... staying down at the gas lamp is a totally different experience - Loud, lots of people , traffic, simply a lot going on ... i wanted a relaxing 2 days needless to say. i dont think i could have found a better place. From the room service to the turn down at night , everything was spot on . the hotel felt private , yet in the middle of IT ALL! .... yes a few sirens at night but nothing major.... beautiful room, (crown molding everywhere) , beautiful bathroom, luxurious bath robes, chocolates at turn down, fully stocked mini bar, extra towels, outstanding gym with awesome equipment and fresh fruit and water on hand.... take as much as you want... great feature! Restaurant / bar downstairs very very nice, live music on the weekends.... overall great stay ! if not THE DEL , it will def be the US GRANT for me.... once you experience it , you will know why.... its a clean , quiet hideway, but yet everything is at your fingertips,... YOU decide... :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Member001
Reviews.Content: Loved the elegance and beauty of this hotel..the decor, and ambiance was breathtaking. The hotel room was charming and the beds were comfy! Though the bathrooms were elegant with glass shower and a raised sink, the water pressure was very low.. But I suppose the chocolates, robes and slippers make up for this :) The staff was phenomenal..from the valet to the front desk. They were kind and helpful and accommodated our every request. Would recommend this hotel to others..this hotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, close to Gaslamp, Waterfront and Little Italy!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonkeyCalgary
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the US Grant. Staff were very helpful and nice. The room we stayed in was beautifully decorated, definitely 5 star. The bed was wonderful and bathroom was beautiful, vessel sink, marble, lovely. Robes, slippers, nightly turndown with chocolates. Housekeeping also would stock the ice for you in the evening, so very nice. The hotel was very centrally located, close to all the must see areas. The only drawback is being so close to the fire hall and police stations, they are around the corner--sirens went off every night at some point. Not good for light sleepers. It is downtown San Diego so you have to expect some city noises, however this is why I've only rated as very good, rather than excellent. It was great to be close to Horton Plaza, Starbucks directly across the street, along with CVS so able to pick up the necessities close by. We walked to Seaport Village, Gaslamp District, Little Italy and Horton Plaza, so great location. We had a great dinner in LIttle Italy at Zia's Bistro, and brunch at Cafe 222, south of Horton's Plaza. Worth the walk to these two places. Also went for dinner at Croce's, live band on Saturday night so was alot of fun. Valet parking is the only option however at $35 per day so if you have a car, you do need to note this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent But For the Location”
Reviews.Author: C0rgiL0ver
Reviews.Content: I would have rated this hotel "excellent" but for the location and the particular room I was given. It is a grand hotel that has not entirely lost its early 20th century charm. The staff was exemplary and accomodating. The persons at the reception and concierge desks couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. The housekeeping staff was superb. My only complaints: (1) location--- I wish it had been closer to the waterfront; and (2) the view from my room looked directly into the windows of the room across from it. I felt as though I could have opened my window and touched the room across the way. But those complaints are minor given the overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room and great location in this elegant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQinHou
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the US Grant! The double king room is not to be believed! I was travelling with two teenage girls on a college visit, and was a little worried about sharing a room, but this room was plenty big enough. We had two king beds, open to the full living room with sofa, chairs and a dining room with 6 chairs. Flat screen tvs in the bedroom and living room. (Although it was really one big room so you couldn't be watching two different things very easily.) Service was perfect (although room service breakfast was pricey. If you want to order, be sure to share. The portions are huge!) The bathroom was also huge and well stocked. Great big shower. Everything was 5-star. The bar downstairs was nice and again, service here was incredible. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Diane N
Reviews.Content: I'm a local resident and enjoy exploring and contributing to the city I live in-then I can make recommendations to business associates, friends and family. After Salome we went to the US Grant for a bite and atmosphere and was impressed with the service at US Grant. Jamie K you are the most attentive, efficient, top notch, and personable server there and I recommend all who visit to ask for her. Alberto, look out she may take your job soon. Doug Korn - you may want to promote these two soon. Diane San Diego Marina Resident

Reviews.Title: “Pretty amazing experience..Thanks Grant!”
Reviews.Author: Palmerstrips
Reviews.Content: My first reviews were oddly all removed? Seems I am being stalked by someone I didn't give a glowing review to. Not quiting though. The GRANT was dynomite. I sure wish the Kimptons of this world would drop in and see how first class service including the housekeeping is and should be done. From the grand entry, to the second level where they have a magnificient art collection...on up to my room. It was pure magic. I think it was like it felt 90 years ago to be at the grand old hotels. I noticed some celebrities in the bar/restaurant. The Grant's happy hour is a big draw for the locals. My only complaint...tiny complaint is certain members of the staff checking their cell phones while they should have their head 100% in the game. My pet peeve. It just looks bad. Easy to over look though. Management has done a great job training the team.

Reviews.Title: “Best birthday weekend ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kolle22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant for my birthday weekend. Once we were checked in no sooner had we settled into our room, a cake was delivered to me on behalf of the hotel wishing me a happy birthday! The gesture made my day and it was delicious! Back to the room, it was a little smaller than what I expected. The King size bed and linens were plush, and the headboard was very interesting. The bathroom is clean and modern, nothing fancy. The location is perfect and the staff was always friendly. The collection of art is a must see and the hotel in general is a feast for the eyes. I only have two complaints, free wi-fi would have been nice, and I think the parking fee of $35 was higher than necessary, but everyone as a parking fee and you can't escape it! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oozes history, service and excellence but a Tip travellers”
Reviews.Author: IANandARI
Reviews.Content: This is a truly marvellous hotel with a great history and there are many artefacts to see displayed throughout the hotel and particularly in the lobby/reception area. We found all members of staff extremely courteous from reception to valet parking to concierge. The hotel is marvellously located in San Diego to simply have a short walk to the shops, restaurants and historic areas. We did not dine in the hotel but did use room service on one occasion and it was superb. We are Starwood cardholders and check-in went very smoothly. However, here is a TIP for guests. We had booked a suite and the room we were given was perfectly okay in terms of decoration etc but it was extremely small and certainly small by American standards. It was on one of the higher floors. The room was very odd because there was insufficient room for two bedside cabinets so whoever was sleeping on one side of the bed had nowhere to put a watch or a glass of water. The lighting was also quirky. The area for watching the television was very small with an enormous two seater sofa seemingly filling that part of the room and the bathroom was not only cramped but seemingly badly designed. For example, the basin was in a corner which made it impossible to lean over it and there was nowhere to put a wash bag or anything else for that matter. We immediately raised this with the reception and much to their credit they immediately accepted that it was a rather small suite and that another would not be available until the next day. True to their word, the next day we were put in a suite of enormous proportions, almost the equivalent of an apartment where we remained for the rest of our stay. The larger suite was on the seventh floor. We were impressed by the frankness and helpfulness of the staff but our TIP would simply be, if you have booked a suite, don't accept a small one. There are a large number of suites of much bigger proportions than the one we were given in the beginning. That said, the US Grant is "the" place to stay in San Diego and we would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego.... 911 is a lucky number here”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best Starwood property in San Diego. Within blocks of this property are two Westin Hotels, W hotel and Sheraton Suites. When you walk into the lobby, you almost forget that you just stepped off of Broadway into a palatial lobby that reminds you of the grandeur that the property was known for when the doors opened over a century ago. The property is not quite the same as you would expect but better. Upon driving up Broadway, you see a very stately white stone/marble building with a warm blue hue and little did you know that you have stumbled upon one of the most luxurious and best hotels in the city. The lobby is spacious and entrance way a grand opening for what will soon to be the most amazing hotel in S. California. This hotel is an architect's dream in that the restoration of this property in that crown molding is preserved as well as architectural features of the property including ornate plasterwork from the original building. The rooms are spacious, quiet and very nice. Flat panel TVs are located in the room in addition to the Bose sound system with superior sound quality. Personal individual coffeemakers using illy coffee pods are also found in the rooms. The rooms feature beautiful dark maple floors with an oriental-like carpet giving one the sense of luxury. The hotel features Remede amenities similar to those found in the St Regis chain from Aspen to Rome. The walkin shower was awesome with excellent water pressure. The robes are made from the finest Egyptian cotton and the slippers are embroidered with the name of the hotel. One of the most thoughtful things was finding chocolates on the pillow during the evening turn down service in addition to the very warm welcome letter that separates this property from its' competitors. The parking valet will have cold bottles of water waiting for you when you pick your car up without having you ask. The floors are decorated with bronze indian statues and are very nice giving you a sense of the heritage found in the property with the current owners. The property has a screaming wifi service which is great and features a beautiful workout room. The restaurants look nice and on my last day here, I plan to try them. The hotel is in the heart of downtown and within walking to the Gaslamp Quarter so there are many options. I could not find a better place to stay. Hotel's valet parking is 35 dollars/night which is not bad comparing it to the W or Sheraton Hotels where parking is 32 dollars/night with in/out privileges. The staff was amazing and my thanks go out to Hollie from the business sales dept to all of the hotel associates whom made this an awesome stay. I cannot wait to return. What an excellent property!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best managed hotels”
Reviews.Author: Shreveportspoon
Reviews.Content: Every staff member we encountered at the U S Grant was friendly, helpful and very well trained. The conceirge was most helpful in recommending restaurants but the bellman had a couple of great tips on local restaurants! We stayed at the hotel as I was attending a seminar there and we were thrilled with our experience. While we did not eat at the hotel restaurant, the meals served at the conference were the best I have had at a conference( think goat cheese pizza and corn dogs for afternnon snacks). This is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for customer service”
Reviews.Author: LoveNYCandABQ
Reviews.Content: Elegant and beautifully appointed hotel that maintains the grandeur of its past while adding modern amenities. Every member of staff I encountered was friendly, helpful and seemed empowered to make decisions affecting customer satisfaction. My 5-night stay was flawless. I was attending a convention and had the opportunity to enjoy the food service of the hotel daily. Everything was beautifully presented, delicious and creative. Location of the hotel at the "top" of the Gaslamp quarter is within an easy walk of many restaurants, pubs, PETCO park and about a 15 minute walk to the convention center. My only negative about the neighborhood is the sad presence of numerous homeless folks sleeping on sidewalks and in doorways. Certainly not a situation confined to San Diego--most cities are faced with this problem. Still, for a section of a popular city that is devoted to tourism, I would have expected more of a visible police presence or sidewalk ambassadors helping to move people off of sidewalks and toward shelters or parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: hollydaze
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November, 2011 for four nights while attending a conference. Here's the scoop: - a nicely equipped, albeit small gym - I need access to food (and cold beer..who's kidding who...) so I requested a fridge, which was delivered promptly to my room...nice - great bed and bathrooms..nice toiletries - lovely turndown service, but I tipped well...my colleagues did not get the same treatment, and they didn't tip, so go figure - free coffee in lobby in the morning - central location, but some sketchy characters hanging around across the street - really good restaurant with a cool happy hour - felt the halls and public areas could have been a bit cleaner - staff was courteous, but not totally service driven..expected a bit more All in all a really nice hotel...worthy of a full five stars.....hmmmm..just about, but not quite

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in 200 Miles!”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Montage, the Ritz, a few boutique spots and will still stand by my title. The US Grant is steeped in elegance, courtesy and style.
