Three nights of pampering and comfort is what I received this past weekend. Every staff member truely wants you to enjoy your stay. The rooms are perfectly appointed and wonderful in every fashion. I will stay @ the Grant every time I'm in need of a San Diego escape.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: khalida r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful! The rooms were very elegant and spacious. The service was excellent and the staff were very friendly. I had a comfortable stay. The best quality of this hotel is it's location. It's just 1 or 2 blocks away from some shops and restraunts and cafes. It was also right in front of an open mall. Truelly amazing and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: jeannietanz
Reviews.Content: US grant is a very comfortable hotel located right in the downtown centre area. It is walking distance to many attractions and accessible by both the orange and blue trolley (civic centre). Bus #7 brings u to the San Diego zoo as well and bus #992 brings u to the airport. The only negative thing is that it is rather noisy at night. A couple of bars are located nearby and the police siren is a standard "alarm" u'll hear at 1am.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff & Service”
Reviews.Author: JLEDC
Reviews.Content: What I love about this hotel: - Lobby: it is stunning and inviting, a perfect place to meet colleagues for conversation or to simply enjoy the piano music and relax. - Breakfast: It's worth the trip to eat the egg white frittata in the Grand Cafe. - Staff: accommodating and kind, thoughtful and smart. When I asked for the Sunday New York Times (which they do not carry) they offered both to get one for me and asked if I wanted one daily. (I did and they provided it.) - History: Even for non-history buffs, a tour of the hotel's photos is a must do. What was disappointing: - My room: If you can avoid room 329 or others like it, DO. Teeny, tiny, with a king bed but only one side w/ a table and lamp. It was dark because one could not leave the shades open - the room overlooked a portion of part of an overhang (littered with cigarette butts and trash) - and looked into (directly into!) a number of other rooms. There were so few lights in the room and bathroom that working, reading, or putting on makeup were a challenge. - Bathroom: Ditto teeny tiny and badly lighted. They have put a "ledge" on the toilet tank top but there is NO space around the bowl sink. (Stunning sink; totally bad for anyone 5'3" and shorter; no counter space; sink appeared to have the spout stopped up - perhaps lime deposits? - and the trickle of water was a problem.) The shower head was ok but reaching it to adjust it was a problem for .. anyone 5'3" and shorter. And it's a stall shower w/ no ledge for feet for shaving one's legs. - Distance from elevators: When I checked in I asked for a room not far from the elevators. It appears that many of the better rooms are a hike from the elevators. It's ok if your mobility is great; not so otherwise. - Elevators: Odd that one has to use a key card to push a floor but once 1 person has done so, anyone can. If this is for safety, it is missing. - Accessibility: I realize this hotel is no doubt grandfathered re ADA and the ADAA. However, even the elevator doors are narrow and someone using a walker or wheelchair may have trouble entering because of width and the short time the elevators stay open once they arrive. (There are numerous elevators and getting to the one that is open is not easy in the amount of time given.) - Gift shop/coffee: I learned that if one wants a coffee maker in one's room, asking is the only way. It wasn't offered at check in. The gift shop where they also have coffee was not open during the week and only limited hours on the weekend. I gather there are coffee places around the hotel but if one does not want to leave, it is odd not to have it available. (One can get a cup of coffee to go at Grand Cafe.) - Expensive wi-fi and wired internet. Need I say more? Clients have considered this hotel for meetings. If you do, or for leisure or biz travel, learn more about the room types and locations. For room 329, perhaps a person staying one or two nights who travels with few toiletries might be ok but .. not otherwise. If I were the hotel it would be one of the very last rooms sold.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed at. Beautiful art collection all over the hotel. The lobby is gorgeous with the exquisite floral arrangements. The room, although small, had a European feel, with a stunning artwork, gorgeous interior and furniture. I would definitely stay there again. The location is perfect too as it is just across the mall with the trolley tour stop. Good restaurants and bars, shopping (including Ross, walgreens, cvc) is just a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: RockstArrr
Reviews.Content: Brought my wife to SAN to celebrate her birthday. It was a perfect hotel at a perfect location. Rooms were great, people were nice and it was a great location. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: We can certainly recommend the US Grant Hotel as we had a very enjoyable stay there in December. The Christmas decorations in the lobby were beautiful and the hotel was lit red and green outside at night. The architectural style of the hotel is impressive and the interiors are imposing and grand, from the chandeliers down to the thick rugs and carpeting. We were delighted with our room, given we had booked the lowest category - it was a large size, attractively furnished and decorated, and well equipped. The bed was extremely comfortable and with good quality bedding and bedlinen. The service we received from all the staff throughout our three day stay was very warm, helpful and professional. Overall, we considered the hotel was great value for what we received. We also made the most of its downtown location and walked or took public transport around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and product”
Reviews.Author: dsenden
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely deserves the best scores. My arrival experience was perfect. A valet attendant that jogged to the car to help me instead of walking. The front desk associate, Magdalena, was friendly, efficient and had a great smile. She worked hard to find a nice room for me even though I arrived a few hours prior to check-in time. Great work! Brooks, another front desk attendant was very gracious, offering some water and directions to an event I was attending. When he saw me a few days later, he recognized me and greeted me again. The concierge was great and had perfect recommendations for exactly what I was looking for. The lobby is beautifully appointed. My room was outstanding, loved the Bose sound system. The bathroom is cavernous, with really nice towels and robes. I also loved the bath products and extra amenities. Turndown service had a few nice touches, including proper evening lighting. My housekeeping service was impeccable. If I had one small piece of advice, try to stay on a higher floor. It helped with the inevitable city sounds experienced in most every urban hotel. I really like the location as it's right next to the Gas Lamp district with an abundance of restaurants and bars. I walked to the convention center and back mulitple times.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Donna S
Reviews.Content: We had a room that faced the bars, we heard loud noise every night until after Midnight. On our last night, some construction crew woke us up at 1:00 AM and were erecting some kind of scaffold in order for a new roof to be implemented. They did not stop until 6:00 AM. We called the front desk, but that was worthless. So, no, we did not enjoy our stay at the US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Serious Housekeeping Issues”
Reviews.Author: sweetemily
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it being a part of American Express Luxury Collection which offer some nice perks like free breakfast and room upgrades if available. We stayed here for one week over Christmas break. The hotel is very nice, big and grand. Front desk check in, concierge (2) and valet parking employees were all nice and professional. We arrived early and they did not have any room upgrades available. When we checked in at check-in time we took the elevator up to our floor and entered our room. The room was very nice, but as soon as I went into the bathroom it was not clean in some areas. It looked like it was at first glance but not really. I let it go and thought with the holidays and all, maybe the maid felt rushed that day. I wish I could say everything was great but literally everyday there would be something. For instance, after the first night when everything seemed so nice, little chocolates on our pillows etc. the next night we got back from a long day and arrived back about 8:00pm the maid forgot to leave towels, literally none. No big deal, I called the front desk and someone brought some up. The next day they forgot to leave soap and shampoo. The next night we return and there is NO toilet paper. Everyday there was something. Another night there were no facecloths. There was no consistency. I finally spoke to housekeeping and the woman apologized, it sounded like she felt very bad and said they had been busy and promised the next day everything would be great. That next day we left at 6 AM and drove up to Universal Studios for the day when we arrived back about 6 that night. The maid had not made up our room yet. I thought for sure it would have been done and done extra nice. SO much for the Head of housekeeping letting her staff know. Oh well in two days we were leaving and I just let it be. The neighborhood is ok you can walk to the harbor but it is a little bit of a hike. The beds were comfortable and the room had a nice walk in shower (no baths in the hotel if you are a bath person) and breakfast was good. They had great complimentary coffee in the restaurants foyer for guests up until 9:00 AM, that was a nice touch. I think for the price it was a very good value but it didn't knock my socks off. If housekeeping had their act together I would have given it a better rating.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cmtj2657
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed because it is the U.S. Grant very attractive on the outside but I was disappointed first because our room wasn't ready on arrival, the receptionist asked for my cell phone number so she could call me when room was ready waited for 20-30 minutes No call. So I went back to check and then I was told my room was ready. Second it took forever to get my baggage brought up to my room and lastly the hotel carpet had stains and smelled!!!!!! For the money I paid it was DISAPPOINTING!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “study in contrast....”
Reviews.Author: jadubya
Reviews.Content: amazing lobby....good location....rooms are uniquely appointed and quite nice....unless you are facing East and get to look into the crackhouse directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: kimsez
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the US Grant after a holiday change of plans, and we're glad we did. Every person on staff provided superior and personal customer service, and our suite was just lovely. We stayed in a Landmark suite, and it was not only huge, with two full baths, but was just charming. Being greeted by name from the first day, an excellent bar/restaurance in the Grant Grill with soothing live music, lovely truffles brought to our room to celebrate an anniversary and an attentive valet parking staff all combined to make our stay memorable. We will most definitely return. And their location across from Horton Square at the edge of the Gaslamp District made our visit to the Maritime Museum and the Midway easy. The hotel is just gorgeous and full of history, like staying on the set of a Merchant Ivory film; if only I'd have packed a ball gown! Our room was not inexpensive, but was worth every penny. We were treated like rock stars.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Marnie33
Reviews.Content: Although the Grant is a bit raggedy (water pressure/temperature issues/single-pane glass, etc.), the ambiance and history more than makes up for the rough edges. We enjoyed sitting in the bar/restaurant listening to the great little jazz trio--a lively, classy scene. The food was very, very good as well. Wonderful holiday decor and cozy feel in December! If you're looking for a hotel with "old world" character, class and charm this is your only choice in downtown San Diego. (side note: parking is an astronomical $35 a night, but the parking garage next door is no bargain at $28, so just bite the bullet--egads!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jwalker780
Reviews.Content: I like "Four Seasons" caliber of hotels. This was my first stay at US Grant and the service was impeccable. Very comfortable and relaxing stay. Great location. This hotel just "feels good" the minute you walk in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel time after time”
Reviews.Author: eeeDallas_Tx
Reviews.Content: New Year's was my fourth time to stay at the U.S. Grant and again it was excellent. My favorite hotel in SD. The design of the public areas and rooms are exceptional. Food was great and the specialty drinks a plus. The concierge and staff are outstanding as well. I will stay there every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravelgal523
Reviews.Content: Very classy hotel with a lounge that brings you back to the roaring 20s. We had an awesome suite. Love how the hotel brought old and new together. We used luxury hotel through Amex and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel but lacking in essential guest service”
Reviews.Author: mjp66
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent 5 days at the US Grant & whilst there were had many positive experiences but we found that Housekeeping & Food & Beverage was certainly not on par with a luxury Hotel. Good points include the historic building housing the Hotel, the grand lobby with complimentary afternoon drinks,the proximity to Horton Plaza & department store shops,the mostly friendly staff,happy hour & the overall ambiance of the Hotel. Negative aspects included pricey valet at $35 per day, rooms not ready until almost an hour after check-in time,unvacuumed corridors on the way to our room,unclean "dress" pillows on the beds,dirty & dusty behind the beds with evidence of previous guests, tattered curtains in the bathroom,towels that needed replacing to meet 5 star standards,rooms not vacuumed over our 5 day stay & general lack of attention to detail. We also found breakfast in the Grant Grill to be extremely slow for what it was-a breakfast buffet is desperately needed with an a la carte option for those guests wanting more.One day we were told there would be a 15 minute wait for a breakfast table-so not 5 star!!! There were plenty of tables in the bar/lobby area that could have been set up but no enough staff to service their in-house guests.Really..bagels,toast & granola do not require such a fanfare at breakfast. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal out at Top of the Market & also the casual dining experience of the Yard House across the road from the Grant.We also enjoyed dinner at the Grant Grill one night but really nothing to write home about in "5 star terms". Location of the Hotel was central to the downtown district & shopping mall but this also made the location extremely noisy (like Manhattan at times with constant sirens going at all hours).Also many sad homeless people living in the park across the road made the walk to the shops rather seedy & something I wouldn't like to do after dark. All up the US Grant could be a 5 star experience if management address the housekeeping aspect of the property and the F&B department in order to create more positive guest memories...the staff are primarily well trained but the chiefs need to be more active in maintaining the quality & consistency of this property.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: parunach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grant for 3 days. It is no 5 star hotel. The big positive was the location superb, right in the middle of downtown. However, we were there on 24 - 27th december. There were no restaurants open on 24th and 25th, despite being in downtown. The hotel restaurant was prebooked for a party, so no admissions. That was a pain, we had to walk around more than an hour to find an open restaurant. The house keeping was good. The room and the bathroom was dim lit, this was a pain. They charged $11 for the wifi in the room, however, they had complementary wifi in the lobby. They had a high end wine bottle for sale in the room for $4200!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 1 night stay on December 23. While we arrived early, our room was not quite ready. The front desk staff was excellent, and made sure our needs were met. A special thanks to Ryan Koerper, as he went above and beyond to ensure we had the best room available. His attitude and persistence in making sure we we're satisfied should be commended. Although our stay was short, the front desk experience, and Ryan's extra efforts, by made our stay most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old fashioned luxury.”
Reviews.Author: jtlerman
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice and lobby is charming. Showers were disappointing as they used the "rain" type shower head that tend to drip more then shower. Paid the $11.95 a day for internet, but was unhappy to do so. Other, much less expensive hotels provide free wi-fi and the US Grant should too. Parking, at $32/day, is also expensive, but at least it is understandable. Parking is tough in the city. Once we parked, we walked everywhere we wanted to go. Location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the Gas Lamp District”
Reviews.Author: andycrna
Reviews.Content: I must agree with a few other reviewers, it is not five stars. The lobby is full of character and charm of a bygone era. The rooms are small yet well furnished and with a very nice bathroom. If you have a room with a joining door, expect to hear every utterance the party next door makes. I mean every utterance. :) The staff was wonderful. You can not find a more friendly helpful staff. The valet, though convenient, was very expensive. I felt safe walking at night from the hotel into the Gas Lamp district. I would stay here again for the right price, not $185.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: MamaofEnS
Reviews.Content: We were given this hotel stay as a Chanukah gift. It was our first time at the hotel, but we've been to San Diego many times. I already read previous reviews, and expected the $35 valet parking fee. We did search for cheaper parking, but found none to our liking, as the lots didn't look safe to leave a car overnight, or were comparable in price, with no in-out priviledges. Yes, the lobby was beautiful and dramatic. We were in a deluxe room on the 9th floor, and were able to check in before lunch! The room was quite spacious with more amenities than most hotels provide, like slippers, delicious coffee, and goodies in the restroom. Our view was great too. My husband's only complaint was that the TV seemed far away from the bed, because as I said, the room is quite large. The bed was comfortable, and I loved the robes. We didn't eat here, but did explore the hotel on the first three floors. The hotel is conveniently located near the Horton Plaza for shopping and the Gaslamp District for dining. There were unfortunately a lot of homeless wandering around the area, but definitely not inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of character and class”
Reviews.Author: amcsocal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had extra SPG points-we used most of it in London this past May-and decided to use the rest to go to San Diego for the weekend before Christmas. As you enter the lobby to go to the front desk, you realize you have entered a world of elegance, with a lot of character and class. It takes you back to history, and I can imagine how it's like when the hotel first opened many many years ago. From the chandeliers, the silk carpets, and decor, it was absolutely beautiful, and full of history. It was also decorated for Christmas and it was simply amazing. We got upgraded to the deluxe room on the 7th floor overlooking the San Diego skyline and the Westin Horton Plaza. If you can, upgrade to the deluxe room. The deluxe room is huge and comfortable. As everyone said here, the location is outstanding, just outside is the Westin Horton Plaza which we did some Christmas shopping and the Gaslamp district, has so many bars and restaurants, and great for nightlife. One of the reviewers mentioned that the US Grant can sometimes be overlooked, esp compared to another historic hotel we stayed at years ago in San Diego-The Hotel Del Coronado. Although the Hotel Del has a lot of history as well, the US Grant to me exceeds the Hotel Del. The rooms are definitely larger with the US Grant. There's also so many tourists that tour the Hotel Del, at times it gets too crowded in the common areas., which can be a negative. The US Grant to me is less commercialized than the Hotel Del, which is a big advantage. The US Grant is definitely San Diego's best kept secret. Lastly, the staff is amazing, and they treat you first class without being over the top. They understand customer service and are very sincere about it. If you get a chance, stay at the US Grant during the holidays, it's really absolutely beautiful with all the Christmas decorations inside the hotel. And outside, they light up the hotel with all the Christmas colors at night. The only negative-the room service prices are so high- but that's with every hotel we've stayed in. With so many restaurants within steps from the hotel, you don't really need to order room service. Definitely one of the best hotels I've stayed in-and we've stayed in many around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and bathrooms too small for this hotel to be 5 star or included in the luxury collection”
Reviews.Author: ald59
Reviews.Content: The most important part of the hotel for me is the room and while we were told we were upgraded to a junior suite the room was small and the bathroom while clean was very small .Yes the lobby is nice and the staff are friendly and the hotel is close to the shopping.The concierge Leanne was very helpful in arranging our boarding passes for our flights. Parking at 35 dollars is overpriced and you can park for 10 dollars 100 yards down the road in multiple parking lots and parking overnight on the street is free.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: L L
Reviews.Content: The hotel customer service manager was outstanding, and helped me and my disabled son before we even got there. The room was set up perfectly when we arrived, and she even arranged for an upgrade. The hotel was beautiful and in a perfect location. Great all around!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Patricia S
Reviews.Content: Having noticed the US Grant on a previous trip and having a mid-week discount, we decided to treat ourselves to an overnight stay in San Diego. Built in the early 20th century, the Grant has been remodeled to retain its historic character, but to also offer modern amenities. Our room was small--and a bit over-furnished--but quiet, comfortable, elegant, and with a fun view of downtown San Diego. The bathroom was beautiful and the shower was a treat. The bed was very comfortable as well. The biggest and best surprise was the fabulous restaurant. We splurged on a mixed-drink tasting menu for my husband and a regular entree for me: the food was outstanding and the drinks were creative, delicious and (mercifully) big enough to share. Breakfast the next morning was ample and tasty--especially the granola. The service was excellent throughout our (too short) stay. Be forewarned: valet parking is expensive, but the valets were very helpful and even provided a bottle of water for each of us. The location is excellent for all the major San Diego attractions, making the Grant perfect for a short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a work of art, beautiful in the extreme, and is truly a national treasure. What made my stay really unique, however, was the people. Everyone greeted me by name and made every effort to be accomodating. At a lot of hotels the concierge simply hands out maps and looks baffled by any genunine request for service. At the US Grant they instantly understand each guests requests and (better yet) attack the problem as if it were the most important thing in the world. They helped me get excellent directions to a fairly obscure museum, and I watched them spend 10 minutes helping a woman find the particular gellato place on the street she couldn't quite remember. I went to the Grant Grill for dessert and when the waitress noticed me admiring the historical photographs on the wall she gave me a tour and explained the history of that very unique and wonderful space. It was a really a thrill to stay there...like sleeping in an elegant museum, but with the warmth of being in a friends home. Hat's off to the staff at the Grant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... small annoyance”
Reviews.Author: Brett H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the US Grant for work... I almost always stay at the W when i am in San Diego which may not have as much charm as the US Grant but it is comfortable, clean, and new. The Hotel has a 35.00 a night Valet which is just too much money for downtown San Diego (Its not NYC) and I had a green light on the smoke alarm blinking all night. I pointed this out to the hotel staff as nice as I could and was just met with a "thank you" so I hope something was fixed so the next guest does not have a green light blinking above them the entire night. On the plus side the location is great (rooms are loud due to old windows but i dont mind that) and the restaurant and cocktail list is fantastic. They have 7 days a week a decent happy hour perfect for a snack after the trip in. I went against my own words that I try to always stay at the W and will be going back to the W, Its not a bad hotel, but it just did not deliver like I thought it should/would.

Reviews.Title: “Winter 2011 Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Lakers4Ever
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, excellent room, very clean hotel, great service from the valet parking to the front desk to the restaurant staff! Arrived at hotel before check in time, Raymundo at valet took care of our luggage and car so we can explore the area. Food and service at the Grant Grill are both AAA excellent! Free bottled water in the room and juice for guests in the lobby in the afternoon is a plus. Free WiFi and coffee maker in the room would have made the stay perfect. However, the US Grant is still my choice hotel by far in the San Diego area and will definitely recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel, returned to former Glory!”
Reviews.Author: Taveller49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of our extended tour of California in September. The Hotel was very recently refurbished at a huge cost (I seem to recall $30m+ !) and it is magnificent restored to its original standard when built back in the early 1900s. Our room was great, but the view was at the side of the building but still good, all the staff were very helpful and we enjoyed the stay immensely. We did not dine in the Hotel, however the restaurant looked very good, as did the menu - free coffe available too before 0930am, plus complimentary wifi in the lobby. Our car was ready and prepared each time we went out and the valet parking team were helpful and cheerfull. Great hotel, pity we were staying for such a short time - would return in the future! We really did not have enough time in San Diego, but saw as much as we could in the three days we had - Zoo (spectacular), the Bay area, Coranado and ships (especially USS Midway), The Gaslight Quarter (lots of really great and interesting restaurants to suit all pockets), the historic area - now an outdoor working museum.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcaus14
Reviews.Content: The property is super clean, renovated, great location, unique, with excellent customer service. But, I was over-billed, which I noticed several days into our stay. It took hours of my vacation time to fix. The hotels accounting department is very unhelpful, essentially said that if I had a prepaid they would have it in their system. I had to start looking at prior credit card statements to see if my memory that I pre-paid some rooms was correct. I was correct. It's amazing that a quick database search by the accounting dept could not find a payment for me. However, lots of credit for the front desk staff for finding the mistake and adjusting my bill. The front desk staff member was transparent, apologetic, and saved the day - really good service. Some other reviews mentioned traffic noise. I had several rooms for my guests. My room was an upgrade with a spectacular view. But, the extra windows definitely allowed a lot of traffic noise to be heard, even with a white noise sound machine running. My other rooms for the guests were relatively quiet. Therefore, if you have a problem with traffic noise, it appears your room can be changed. The hotel restaurant had top-notch service and great food, something I don't normally expect in a hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent. The gas lamp district is filled with restaurants, shopping, and the zoo, Balboa park are nearby. Make sure you are billed properly, and enjoy your stay at this spectacular hotel. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: El_Pago
Reviews.Content: Being a ''five-star'' lover and a slightly picky traveller - I have to take my hat off to the U.S Grant and commend them on this beautiful hotel! As you enter the hotel, you immediately notice the amazing lobby with antique furniture and a lovely grand piano waiting to be played (you obviously can't play it and that made me a bit sad!) The staff are very very helpful and gave me great advice on where to explore and where to eat some authentic Mexican food. The man at the front desk gave us directions to Old Town San Diego where my partner and I ate the most amazing Mexican meal - and would consider moving to San Diego all the way from Melbourne based on how great that Taco tasted! haha But anyway, back to the U.S Grant... The room was amazingly charming with the most comfortable bed you could ever sleep in! It felt like i was sleeping in a cloud and i didn't want to leave the pillows behind! There is a beautiful bathroom in the room also, with a very roomy shower and lovely amenities to make you feel pampered! The location is central and across the road from a shopping Mall, which is very handy! Only negative would be that there are too many homeless people near the hotel - which takes the faultless beauty of the location away a little bit. My Tip? Ignore them and you will be fine!! We didn't have any problems at all and absolutely LOVED our stay at the U.S Grant! You shouldn't consider booking anywhere else if you are planning a trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, TV reception is sporadic”
Reviews.Author: c l
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice staff, great location. Overall, very comfortable and enjoyable experience. I highly recommend to the staff they figure out what the problem is with the TV satellite receiver. Various HD channels come and go based on the whims of the weather or whatever. For example, I had a "dime" on the Giants versus Cowboys game and the NBC channel never came in, so was forced to watch it on Telemundo or something. I would expect sporadic TV service in Iceland or Ecuador, but not the U.S. I'll bet that Chris Collingsworth's bloviations were audible at the Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: attarfamily1
Reviews.Content: We were here in Oct,2011 just for one night. The place had kept its old look feel, yet its very modern and beautifully re-done.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia D V
Reviews.Content: Hi Doug, you have a lovely hotel. The service was fantastic. I felt very welcome and comfortable. My only critique is that I think the maid staff could have done a little better job. Please do not get me wrong, the room was clean. However, I was very sick and drank both my waters the first day. On the second day, they did not replenish my water. They did so on the third night, but not the second. Also, in the bathroom, I noticed that my tooth brush had left a ring on the little counter, the rings stayed there every day. Truely it is a lovely hotel and I very much enjoyed my stay. The above comments are minor, I know. I just thought a little critique will lead to an even better experience for the next guest.

Reviews.Title: “The US Grant is, without a doubt, the most wonderful hotel that I have ever had the pleasure to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia H
Reviews.Content: Amazing service! The beauty of the hotel was not exclusive to the lobby, as so many places are, but found in all aspects of the facility. The rooms have exquisite detailing and the bed was amazing! I look forward to bringing my family to San Diego this summer and will so be staying at the US Grant! The historical elegance of the US Grant is a welcome change from the popular chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: eileen c
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a great deal and stayed in many lovely hotels. This hotel is among the most lovely. Aesthetically beautiful, good service, friendly staff, great concierge. The hotel was decorated for the holidays and that added to its graciousness. I thought the room size was good for being located in a major city where real estate is at a premium. The design detail is similar to those hotels I have stayed in Paris. The location is good, accessible to all, many good restaurants within walking distance in the gaslight district. I was here as part of a conference so the rates were very fair. The trolley tour across the street at Horton plaza offered a nice overview of the city.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant a bit much”
Reviews.Author: zeek4
Reviews.Content: First of all, I need to say that the staff here is the greatest ever. Genuinely kind and friendly. The hotel is nice enough, but could they please lose the ridiculous Austin Powers music (punctuated with terrible Christmas music) in the lobby? Kenny G is also big.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ElQuesoGrande
Reviews.Content: Located smack in the center of downtown, across the street from Horton Plaza and a block from the Gaslamp District, the US Grant is a beautiful old dowager hotel. Rooms are spacious, service is great, and the hotel is registered as a landmark. As with nice hotels in the downtown areas of a number of American cities, one does come across a significant homeless population, but these people are (mostly) not dangerous. There is a great "happy hour" each afternoon in the restaurant, where one can sit back and relax while people-watching.

Reviews.Title: “Service was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: bigal080
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the service was amazing! The only reason why I did not give them and excellent rating is because the water pressure in the shower fluctuated a lot and I could not get the hot water in the shower. Aside from that the location is perfect, the room was beautiful, the service was awesome, the people very nice, and the bar (Grant Grill) was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NVRam123
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this hotel - I love the design and the beautiful Grant Grill - the lobby and even the rooms with historic character. The problem is the lack of attention to detail. After just leaving Pelican Hill in Newport where the service was fantastic this was a big let down. Upon check in when you book with AMEX Fine Hotels and Resorts they should upgrade you if an upgrade is available. They brusquely told me it wasn't available. When I saw how small our room was I called the front desk again and asked if one was available if we paid. They told me they'd call me back - 45 minutes later they called back to say a bigger room was available. Huh? I thought no upgrades were available. We stayed put since we'd already used the room (we have kids!) and didn't want to pay for an upgrade we should have gotten automatically. We stayed in 513 and there were poorly patched cracks in the walls and the room is pretty small. The lighting in the bathroom was bad. The in room movies didn't work. We had a view of the homeless people in the park across Broadway. The paintings in the bathroom was not just weird but down right creepy. The paintings in the hallways just super crooked. The capper was all the drunks coming home at 1-3 in the morning and how incredibly loud they were. I was awake from 1 to past 3 listening to their drunken conversations and doors slamming. The hotel is historic so I get that it will be a bit noisy but come on. They should designate party floors and family floors with walls that thin, I'm sure this wasn't an isolated incident. Finally on check out they informed us that the $100 food and beverage credit we got with Fine Hotels and Resorts had to be used on one meal (I thought it could be used for breakfast and then the remainder lunch, dinner, cocktails, whatever just $100 towards F and B). This was not clear at all. If it had been I would have ordered an extra sandwich and cocktail and hand delivered it to the homeless guy in the park. Bad for the hotel and bad for the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Service extraordinaire--wonderful urban, "historical" location”
Reviews.Author: jandc2
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the US Grant Hotel and it was again very enjoyable! No car needed --It's an easy walk to restaurant row, Gaslight district, tour trolley, train and transportation stations, shopping, Petco Park, etc. And, when needed, a taxi or hotel car service are quickly available and fairly reasonable. The coffee and crepe spot around the corner, the brew restaurant across the street, and french bistro nearby were nice surprises...as was the jazz in the hotel bar on the wkend. We will definitely be back to this hotel with so much interesting ! Our room upgrade was quite nice...although rooms are small as somewhat expected in an urban hotel. The staff at the front desk, maid service, and concierge bend over backwards to ensure a positive experience. The only reasons we didn't rate this as "excellent" are the small rooms (even with upgrade), the "under-whelming" fitness room, and, although we loved the hotel's restaurant for a tasty, quality breakfast, it was way over-priced especially given the local competition. Thx for another fun experience in SD!!

Reviews.Title: “They got it right!”
Reviews.Author: Gordon R
Reviews.Content: From the great friendly staff, beautiful historic hotel and wonderful rooms you can't miss with this hotel. I will always stay at the Grant from now on becuse of this first stay. I am that impressed. It's the people that work there that puts this hotel over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Vwilli4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant with my boyfriend for a four night vacation in San Diego. The downtown (Gaslamp) location is ideal as you can walk to several great restaurants, bars, and activities. You have easy access to everything in the San Diego area; it’s a short drive from the airport, the zoo, the beach, etc. You can even walk to Petco Park. Rates can be a bit pricey, but you absolutely get what you pay for at this hotel! The building is in pristine shape and accommodations are modern and relaxing. We arrived a little early and were able to leave our bags with the front desk staff and go get lunch at a local restaurant and walk around the area. When our room was ready, the staff at the front desk called my cell phone and had our bags delivered to our room. We had a corner room, which is a bit of a walk from the elevator, but we had a great view and it was very quiet on our end of the hall. Despite our corner location, we were not disturbed by any outside noise. The bathrooms are spacious and the shower is AMAZING. The bedding is extremely comfortable and we were well rested after a few days of being on the go all day sight-seeing. We used the hotel gym in the mornings to get our day started. Although the gym is small, it is equipped with what you need to get a good work out in. Complimentary water, ear buds for the TV screens on the machines, towels and fresh fruit were in the gym for our use. All staff members are truly there to please the guests. From the staff at the concierge desk, valet, front desk, to housekeeping and room service the service is friendly, helpful and genuine. We especially enjoyed the turn down service at night. The US Grant is ideal for couples and adults groups. The only drawback I had was that there was no pool on the property, but who needs a pool when you are only a short trip from the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sailtim
Reviews.Content: Went to see the America's Cup Race. Hotel was everything it stated. Only complaint is that I booked thru their site, read all the details then paid for our stay. When I printed out the conformation only then discovered that there is a 35.00 a nite parking fee. Service was first class and as primised got a corner room with a city view.

Reviews.Title: “Hall of Fame Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: BBQfanatic
Reviews.Content: On a morning when the dysfunction of the US Congress is screamingly obvious, it is nice to have just seen how the staff at the US Grant work together perfectly. In the top ranked hotels I’ve stayed at, all staff are polite and pleasant. However, The US Grant staff are all genuinely committed to the guests. A pride in their work is evident in everyone, from the general manager to housekeeping. Alberto, in the Grant Grill, was charming, and his recommendations about the menu were perfect. Like everyone else in the organization, he brought information and an attitude directed at the success of our stay that is typically what defines a concierge. At the concierge desk, Mark is charming, encyclopedic in his knowledge, and genuinely solicitous of a guest’s satisfaction. Demi, the guest loyalty coordinator, assured our loyalty to the US Grant forever. She saw that we had spectacular accommodations, and enhancements that made our anniversary celebration one that will be remembered forever. Like many others on the staff, she eagerly shared hotel history, including the great story about the restored painting where Wyatt Earp had shot out U.S. Grant’s eye. When I asked to meet the general manager to tell him about his wonderful staff, it was clear why the staff has a familial feel and uniform commitment. When the front desk person called to tell him that I wished to speak with him, the general manager asked him how he was that day. Watching his face, it was clear that this solicitation was not unexpected. The general manager spoke with such pride of his hotel, and it became clear why everyone on staff shared that sense. In selecting these four individuals for praise, it is largely due to the limits of my memory, and an attempt to be concise. solicitation was not unexpected. The general manager spoke with such pride of his hotel, and it became clear why everyone on staff shared that sense. In selecting these four individuals for praise, it is largely due to the limits of my memory, and an attempt to be concise. The service of every individual at the hotel was superlative. The Grant is a beautiful, historic hotel. Magnificently restored, it has no signs of the century it has been in existence. The opulence of the lobby is enchanting the moment you enter the hotel. That beauty continues throughout the hotel. Guests who review hotels on sites like hotwire and tripadvisor often seem to strain to find negatives in their evaluations. Some might complain about the noise level in the downtown site. However, earplugs accompany savvy travelers anytime they sleep away from the familiarity of home or on board the Petri dishes with wings that masquerade as commercial aircraft. If you have to find something to complain about, you will find it anywhere. The complete experience of the US Grant is something any traveler would revel in. Don’t miss it, when you are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: wesny
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the US Grant many times. We are never disappointed. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed and the service is impeccable. What a perfect place to call home while you are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeniorishTraveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Grant. A few "buts" -- the room(s) had new high def TVs but high def hadn't been activated; apparently it's coming soon. Hey, S.D. is fantastic; we didn't spend our time inside; so not a big deal, but still. Also, no pool. They do have a lovely herb garden on the fourth floor, but if we had stayed for more than a weekend then it would have been a problem. On the bright side, the rooms are well-appointed. The plumbing and bathrooms are new. The shower is terrific --- in fact, I loved the shower. It's a good location and it's a classy place. All concierges we consulted with were very helpful and thorough. Read this one as four and a half stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service by the Staff, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mailjen
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed here for a business trip, I brought my family along with me. I have a 15 month old daughter. As we got to the room, the bellhop immediately offered to send up a fridge for my child's milk without me asking. And sure enough within 15 minutes, another staff came and delivered a fridge and plugged it in. The guys working the valet parking were also tremendous. They were always courteous and welcoming. It was very easy to hit the "valet" speed dial button on the phone and just ask them to bring out the car and when you get down there, your car is already waiting. The guest services, reception and concierge staff were all very helpful starting from the moment of checking in and providing room keys, offering a beverage and to providing directions and a map to places we wanted to see. The attention to detail and service is what really impressed me. The bellhop took the time to even tell us that the canvas painting above the headboard is unique in every room painted by an artist.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlaJersey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is treated as an historic landmark are really lives up to expectations. The room was great and the fact that we were on the edge of the Gaslamp District and opposite the Trolley Tours stop made it perfect for us especially as my husband had injured his leg so walking was a problem. The concierge was fantastic providing maps and recommendations as well as little tips. Highly recommended and we would definitely stay there again as San Diego has so much to offer and we hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in the heart of San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Olga_trvlrfrmla
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at the US Grant for two nights. First of all, I'd like to thank Ewa Skoog, the concierge, for helping my boyfriend to orchestrate a perfect evening at Mister A's, during which he asked me to marry him!! He called the hotel inquiring about the restaurant and Ewa took it upon herself to notify the restaurant and arrange the best table in the house for us. It was a truly unforgettable night and speaks to the quality of service at the US Grant. Onto hotel itself... Beautiful historic building, our room seemed to be recently renovated, very clean but a bit small, even though we had a Deluxe room. Although that's perfectly normal for historic hotels as they must work with building design. Complimentary water in our room was a pleasant surprise, you just don't get that at many hotels anymore... So why 4 stars and not 5? While the hotel location is very convenient, right next to the Gas Lamp district, that comes with a lot of noise... party goers, traffic noise and on the weekend we stayed there, Occupy San Diego demonstrations. I realize that the hotel tries to keep the historic charm going, but you can hardly sleep on party nights and sound proofing their windows should be a priority. So bring earplugs and ask for a higher floor and enjoy your stay! But seriously, THANK YOU US Grant for making our stay truly magical!!!!

Reviews.Title: “U S Grant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayRL_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night here at the start of a road trip up the coast of Calif. the hotel is a reatored gem in the Gaslight section of San Diego. The public spaces are beautiful and well kept. Good staff, eficient service. The room was very well appointed, somewhat small but very clean and comfortable. The hotel can be expensive but also participates in Priceline. We liked it and its location bery much

Reviews.Title: “Good memories, great location”
Reviews.Author: natalia64
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the US Grant with my parents, as a child. It brought good memories to stay a couple of nights this week, the hotel has been renovated and is a very good option to stay in downtown San Diego, great location, very nice and comfortable beds, cozy!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel ... my favorite in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl V
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at the US Grant was with my husband for our first year anniversary. Albeit very short (just one day, during the Halloween weekend), it was just as we had imagined it would be ... and more! We arrived and was able to check-in and lay our bags down in the room within minutes. Although purchased online through Hotwire for a standard room, we were put into a superior room, larger corner room. This room was FANTASTIC. Sweeping views of Downtown. Super quiet floor, absolute one of my favorite rooms at the hotel (right up there with a Junior Suite we stayed in last time). I guess my husband dropped a hint that it was our anniversary, because when we returned after happy hour drinks --- you should really check out the bar ... it has quite the drink selection and the ambiance is fantastic --- we found a plate of truffles and strawberries waiting for us. And as I traditionally do there, we ordered breakfast in. Breakfast in bed, truffles and chocolate, Sunday morning news/football, and bathrobes at the Grant has to be one of my favorite experiences in the whole world. I have stayed at the US Grant on several other occasions, and this hotel is, by far, my favorite. There is just something about the extreme luxury and elegance that the hotel offers that is hard to put my finger on, but it just hits what I love in all the right spots. Unlike other 5-star hotels anywhere I have stayed, the Grant is not pretentious or in-your-face expensive-looking, it just provides a top-notch, top-quality, easy stay for both traveller and visitor alike. The customer service offered is also some of the best around. When my husband solved my baked potato craving (I know, from Wendy's across the street at 1am), he forgot to bring a plastic spork. The wait staff brought up some utensils right away. I was able to have my $1 potato with silverware and a linen napkin. :) (Sorry, US Grant.... I love your food but woke up that night really wanting that cheap stuff, too!) Everyone from reservations to front desk to waitstaff to cleaning crew... they all do a tremendous job and are there to just assure your stay is a safe and excellent one. Also, the hotel's prime location makes is walking distance to anywhere we'd like to go in the Gaslamp. Valet parking is easy in and out. Very accessible from the freeway, and more than usual there is a room available any day you need it (sorry, except for ComiCon weekend). A+++++!!!!

Reviews.Title: “old school charm with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: azgal_33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant for 2 nights for work. All the staff were incredibly accomodating - from check in to check out. They allowed me to have a late check out because of a last minute teleconference I needed to be on in my room and removed a mysterious honor bar charge. Turn down service was a nice touch. My only complaints were: 1) the sink bowl in the bathroo is quite high for a petite person like myself, 2) the noise on the 3rd floor was loud at night due to the trucks and buses on Broadway street (I found on the second night the noise was louder from the bathroom window so I closed the bathroom door), and 3) a pet peeve of mine at luxury hotels, but I hate being nickle and dimed for things like internet service. I rather they just include it in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulstevo1978
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here on our road trip down the coast. Excellent hotel, great location very near the gaslamp quarter and very attentive customer service. No complaints at all and would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Diego? If we return to San Diego I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Luxiourous an great location!”
Reviews.Author: reej501
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend the US Grant in SD. Not only is it historical it's classy, clean and luxiourous. The bed is comfy, bathroom is gorgeous and make sure you get the grand delux with the jet jacuzzi, totally worth it. Also the view on the 11th floor is amazing! Definitely a romantic small weekend getaway. Walking distance to all the major restaurants and the mall at gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “A presidential stay in a historical landmark”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 marvelous nights at this historical landmark in downtown San Diego. From the moment of our arrival, the spectacular lobby was just a backdrop to the outstanding service and attention from staff (Raymond and Magdalena) when checking in... We knew right away that we were in for a special treat and memorable stay that included a fabulous upgrade to a luxury suite with a lovely view on the upper floor. We enjoyed breakfast and dinner with exceptional cuisine and service from Grant Grill staff... The egg white omelet (breakfast) , and sea scallops over polenta were simply divine! We travel a lot and have stayed in many established hotels, and at the US Grant we immediately recognized an exceptionally well-managed hotel from the attention to detail and service from all staff (Raymond, Magdalena, Jacquelyn, Eva and Demi). We loved visiting Southern California, San Diego and the US Grant is by far our #1 choice when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “So grateful!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: I must admit that when we arrived at this hotel I was blown away with it's elegance,charm and sophistication. I was also a little concerned that I was traveling two small children and not sure that it would be child friendly. We were so blessed to find that everywhere we turned the associates were so wonderful to my kids! Everyone had stickers in their pockets, they made us Mickey Mouse pancakes for breakfast and the overall experience was wonderful. Our Gold level SPG membership and some extra points got us upgraded into a BEAUTIFUL suite and we had a wonderful time! Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Grant”
Reviews.Author: MontanaGirl050
Reviews.Content: We have been fans of the Grant for along time, but have not stayed with them since the remodel. They have maintained the charm yet the renovation has added alot. The staff was amazing. We did miss the old Grant Grill though. We stayed on Saturday night before Halloween and the GasLamp district was a floor show all by itself.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant...a must visit”
Reviews.Author: CraigLieberman
Reviews.Content: Located in the Gas Lamp District, this hotel is sometimes overlooked. While not as new as others, it's been fully renovated and combines old world charm with modern amenities and decor. This very elegant hotel features marble floors in the lobby, ornate wall decor, fine restaurants and nicely updated rooms with wood floors and lavish bathrooms. While the room we had was relatively small, the bedding, electronics and decor was clearly top shelf. The restaurants and service were superb...five star....but I give the hotel four stars large due to the small room. Wasn't a great value but competitively priced and the location was great. All in all, it's very unique and upscale and certainly worthy of consideration.

Reviews.Title: “historic hotel with all the modern touches”
Reviews.Author: bulld0gm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant hotel the weekend of the 21st of October 2011. The Hotel is located north of the Gas Lamp District and Horton Plaza, shopping center. It is walking distance from the waterfront, seaport village and the convention center. There are tons of great restaurants all over this downtown touristy area. We enjoyed breakfast at the US Grant restaurant. The concierge was very helpful to direct me to seaworld in a very economical way. I easily took the trolley to old town (very touristy) and switched to a bus to seaworld for only a $5 ticket on the sdmts (san diego metro transit system). The admission to seaworld was 69.00 but ask for a discount and get admitted for 49.00. I dont know why but it works. They honor discounts if you ask for them per concierge. I also rode a tourguide old town trolley for $34 to tour old town, balboa park, coronado, and little italy. The Art museum in Balboa park has a wonderful spanish art exhibit, El Greco to Dali. This exhibit is only seen and resides in Mexico City and because of the new curator, San Diego has this exhibit for a limited time. Overall the hotel is first class and very clean with modern amenities. The elevators are very small due to the age of the hotel. The wifi is charged in the room but free in the lobby. There is a great complementary "virgin last cocktail" in the lobby, made from lemonade, juniper, cloves and rosemary. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and hardworking. Great place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome at a first rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequentfiler
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have complained about room sizes, but this is a European style city centre hotel, oozing old world charm and elegance, where the size of the room is pretty much irrelevant. Our experience was first rate throughout, with attentive staff on hand at all times. Would happily use this as a base for any future trips to San Diego. So much more character than any of the standard chain offerings in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: QueerTravelers
Reviews.Content: This is the grande dame of San Diego, well-located if you don't care about being on the water or having a view of it (at least from the "suite" we stayed in, despite having written ahead to request the "best view"--looked directly into another building, no street or skyline or water visible). Reserved a Legacy "suite" which was much smaller than many deluxe rooms in nicer hotels, with minimal room for luggage, no nightstand on one side of the bed--very inconvenient, and a tiny bathroom with barely enough room to turn around in. The carpets were dirty as well as stained, and the woodwork was nicked and furnishings overall tattered a bit, mainly from a lack of maintenance and good housekeeping. We used Amex lux service, which is supposed to include an upgrade if available at arrival, but when I asked if one was available at check-in, the clerk looked at me like i was crazy and responded, "You're in one of our nicest suites." (wow, I'd hate to see their worst!). I suppose if you reserve a regular room, you get the upgrade, but if you fork over for a "suite" you don't get upgraded to a Landmark suite, which appears to be their true suite. When I pressed, without even glancing at her computer, she said "we're full." Whatever the case, we waited for over an hour for our substandard "suite", requested a fridge at check-in that never arrived until a second request hours later, and couldn't tell if someone had freshened the room or not after we went out for the evening. Concierge didn't know the area very well, but tried to help with directions to an address in La Jolla. The lobby is grand, but also could use a little extra housekeeping and maintenance, although not as much as our cramped room. The bright spots were the restaurant, which had a nice breakfast, and the very efficient, friendly valets working the carport. (But the impression that give is of a much nicer establishment than what's revealed inside, which gets poorer the deeper you go.) Amex program and Starwood need to reevaluate this one, which is obviously skating by on reputation.

Reviews.Title: “ISSUES”
Reviews.Author: BECKY C
Reviews.Content: I left a handwritten note at the desk listing my issues, but will reiterate them here. 1. The room, appearance was very nice, but not very comfortable. Too much furniture for the space. Not enough pillows on the bed. AC would only go to 65 degrees and at times that was not very cool. 2. The bathroom was definately not designed for a short person. I am only 5"1' and I could not reach the sink to wash my face. The sink was too big for the "counter" -- which left very little room for make-up, hair styling tools, etc. Using the sink always made a mess -- water splashing everywhere. The lighted mirror on a stand was a nice touch, but because of the small area on the counter, it was too close to the sink. I shocked myself 2 times turning off the sink water -- and accidently touching the mirror because it was so close. 3. The "public restrooms" in the rest of the hotel also were not for short people. I was not able to reach the hook on the door of any stall I entered -- therefore having to put my handbag on the floor. I was shocked -- because the first one i went into was handicapped and even it had the hook too high. 4. No coffee pot in the room 5. Dirty carpets

Reviews.Title: “Clausterphobic”
Reviews.Author: Ltlhump
Reviews.Content: Room was small and the carpets were dirty. No tub to soak in and this was considered an upgraded room. Hallways were dirty with stained rugs and trash outside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place and people.”
Reviews.Author: noelle s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were treated like royalty at the US Grant in San Diego. Many Many thanks to Lee Ann who helped us book a reservation at an amazing and delicious resturant. Bryan the doorman surprised us by Knowing who we were before we even met him! We felt famous at your Resort. Front desk staff could not have been more helpful, and suprised us again by upgrading our room for our special occasion. They were so wiling to please! Service at the den/resturant was impecable. I would deffinitely stay again, and inform everyone I know who visits San Diego to do the same. Thank you so much for making our Anniversary more than we expected it to be! Noelle Strength

Reviews.Title: “Go on spoil yourself....you deserve it!”
Reviews.Author: Sjc462
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the finest hotels I've ever stayed in and we paid with starpoints. Everything about this hotel is top drawer, without having that air of snobbiness. From the moment you arrive and the valet parking welcome you. Everyone from the receptionists, bell staff, concierge and housekeeping are all very friendly approachable and welcoming. We had a room the 8th floor looking out towards broadway, there was a split where we had a kind of lounge area with a 2nd TV. The beds are comfortable, with top quality products in the bathroom, my only gripe is the designer wash bowl, which sits higher than a standard one, and the designer tap which can be a bit faffy! The payoff is you have plenty of fluffy towels. However each room has a different work of art painted on the headboard which are nice. And I've never had a trun down service before where they put a towel on the floor beside the bed so you're feet don't touch the carpet. The ice machine was difficult to find as it was on the floor below, which is easily accessible as this hotel was born in the days when people used stairs (1910). However at turn down the maids will bring you ice. My wife and I didn't eat here as it was a bit too pricey but if you don't want to stray too far there's the Yard House Opposite, in which it was all too easy for me to get lost in the world of beer! In the morning it's also worth walking to Brian's 24 for breakfast on 6th Avenue (about 2 blocks?). In summary if you're umming and erring about where to stay, this place is in the heart and is well worth going to (did I mention you get a free USA Today in a cloth bag?).

Reviews.Title: “US Grant during the fall”
Reviews.Author: Fulton E
Reviews.Content: I was given a small room for a legacy suite. Having applied on lne I knew there was more. I complained and was upgraded to a two bed unit with loads of space. I would definitely rent this again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay for a conference”
Reviews.Author: poodia
Reviews.Content: I'll get the negative out of the way first: the air conditioning came on during the night in my room with a very, very loud noise that woke me often. Other reviewers are correct that street noise is very loud as well. So, not a good hotel for sleeping. That said, the staff at this hotel is exemplary. I watched the Texas Rangers game in the bar and thought it was not only beautifully decorated and comfortable, but the bartenders we just excellent. The place was busy too. The front desk staff was efficient and professional. I was attending a conference and thought the ballrooms and set up in our lobby area was first class.I even ran into a maintenance man on the elevator who asked if I minded if he rode in my elevator car and wen I said "not at all" he thanked me profusely. I had a lovely breakfast in the restaurant, but otherwise had meals outside the hotel. I took a $20 cab ride to Coronado and spent a lovely afternoon at the Hotel del Coronado. On a beautiful day, sit on the Hotel del's Sun Deck and enjoy a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-event could have gone better”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLawGal2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel recently for planned event- nice rooms, excellent housekeeping and room service staff. Event was nice but could have been better- expected more attention to detail for $$ we were paying. Would recommend for weekend getaway

Reviews.Title: “Great for short visit but watch falling shower head!”
Reviews.Author: rgiusto
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable. Everything was fine until I took a shower and shower head, full of water, fell out of the shower arm and barely missed my foot while water came pouring out of the hole hitting me in the face. A real wake up call! I usually get up and out of the room fast and had to run to a meeting so I jammed the shower head back into its arm and prayed it wouldn't fall out and hit me in the head while I finished taking a very fast shower. I told the front desk upon checking out and they made a note of it.

Reviews.Title: “A top quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: David186377
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 nights at this magnificent hotel in the heart of San Diego. The hotel throughout is well maintained and oozes luxury. Despite a snag over delayed check in, which was sorted by the power of twitter - there was little else to fault. The room and bathroom were exceptionally comfortable, the Grant Grill offered first rate service and food; and the location is perfect. San DIego is also a wonderful city although we were wary as to where we walked - a lot of homeless on the streets which was at times intimidating.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay but great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jlfor
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in the restaurant's private room. If you are doing a meeting over a meal this is the way to go. We sat 10 and there was no charge for the room. The food was excellent, all members of the party enjoyed their order. Nice variety of sandwiches and entrees. The hotel is beautiful, recently redone and a very upscale feel. I would love to stay on my next trip to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Baybtt
Reviews.Content: I rated the value a 3 because I dont know what my employer paid for the room. I was SO comfy at this hotel except they didnt have a coffee maker!!! The robe, slippers, wine cork, linen napkins, lighted hand mirror, and spaciousness of the suite was just what I needed after a long flight. The in-person service was impecable but I didnt get my wake up call. Also, they were supposed to have a fridge and microwave waiting for me but I had to call for it. Comfy beds! Great room lighting. All in all... A beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KonaNimmer
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the US Grant. Perfect location for walking to the Gas Lamp and waterfront. Room was smallish but well appointed with a very nice, large bathroom. Noise was not an issue. Staff and service was outstanding, particularly Eva, a concierge who secured last-minute reservations for a fully-booked restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Upset about Starwood Points and Process”
Reviews.Author: cosmo17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. We stayed in a Grand Deluxe room and the room was a nice size. Everyone's review said to be warned about the noise. With this great advice, we requested a room on the non-Broadway side. We were given a room on the top floor (11th). The bathrooms were the best part (very updated and modern). Enjoy your stay! It is in a great location for walking around and enjoying San Diego. However, I am disappointed in the Starwood brand. They gave us a decent rate, which we prepaid for to get a slight discount and they gave us 0 Starwood points. This is a horrible practice and they penalize you for not paying full price. That was the only reason we stayed here and it has definitely left a negative impression for us on the Starwood name.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant Hotel. San Diego, CA”
Reviews.Author: LabchickGA
Reviews.Content: The room was attractive and the hotel had very nice and helpful people working the desks and phones. However, the sheets had small rips and the room was so dusty I had to wipe everything down with a damp cloth before I could sleep. Even after bringing the dust issue to the front desk, I still ended up dusting daliy since the cleaning staff did not think it was necessary. Another issue was the staff's inability to remember there were two people in the room; they only turned down one bed and I had to ask for two coffee cups every morning with the breaskfast order.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: This stay at the USGrant was an excellent experience made possible by the most helpful, courtiest staff and beautiful, comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: M3Power510
Reviews.Content: The service, hotel staff, location and hotel amenities at the U.S. Grant is a 10+. We really appreciated the great suite and cleanliness. Views of downtown are awesome and my wife will always remember the U.S. Grant as a place to stay when in San Diego. A sure place to stay when visiting San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Central location - crazy rates for parking - hotel more suited to business than leisure”
Reviews.Author: NiamhfromIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in this hotel with my husband on a recent leisure trip to San Diego. The hotel was lovely and very clean. The staff were excellent. Great central location - however I think it's more suited towards the busiiness traveller than couples. It lacked a swimming pool but we were able to use the pool in their sister hotel around the corner. $35 per day for parking is ridiculous and a hidden charge you don't see when you're booking.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and Classy”
Reviews.Author: Cavloacher
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite with many amenities. Excellent location to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill”
Reviews.Author: Roque R
Reviews.Content: I was double charged for my stay the one night I was there and after they had fixed that problem. I found I was also charged twice for parking when I checked out. Make sure you check your bill before you leave so as not to be over charged as I was. Other than that I found the hotel to be very nice but the charges left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “not the place to stay if you need a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: tamera r
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but impossible to sleep at night with the emergency vehicles passing by all night long!!! We were exhausted in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in the Gaslight district”
Reviews.Author: TangoBabe
Reviews.Content: Broadband is free if you use it in the foyer. Use it in your room and pay an arm and a leg. Very professional hotel, nice rooms, beautiful fixtures and fittings, chocolates on the pillow at night. A taste of luxury. Try the free mocktail near reception - very refreshing! If you're catching the train you can pick it up virtually outside the door to go to Old Town, or Santa Fe station to catch the Amtrak to LA. Spacious rooms but mine had a crap view.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been good if i hadnt been lied to and overcharged!”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the property on August 13 2011. I had contacted the hotel ahead of time when they sent me an email and unfortunately they never returned my email. Why ask for guests to contact if they won't take the time to respond? Called in about the possibility of an early check in around 1230pm on the 13th and was told that the room was already set to be checked into. Arrived around 1pm and suddenly they are not sure and have to get in touch with housekeeping. After 15 minutes of waiting I ask the front desk for status and they have to make another call. Another 10 minutes later and finally we get checked in when the room had been ready an hour before according to the staff member i originally spoke to. Room was fine, but im glad I was able to find it at a lower price on a competiors website so that the price was ok and i did earn 2000 starwood points for the low price guarantee that i applied for. So why the 1 rating? well when i checked in I wanted to store some beverages in the fridge, but they had a mini fridge that was activated by movement. There was a note saying they could deliver a fridge to the room, so i called in for it. Unfortunately they were all out, but the person on the phone told me that I could take items out and that they would note my account that I wasnt using anything from the mini fridge but had taken the items out so that we could place out beverages. On check out day, my folio was under my door and the correct amount was listed on it, obviously if the fridge had detected the movement of items and autimatically charged me for them they would have shown up on this folio. Im sure you know what happens next.... A month later I receive my spg amex card(yes U.S. Grant, I am both an spg member and a loyal spg amex card holder as well) and my bill is $70 more than it should be!!!! WOW, lied to by the front desk, and by whomever printed out my folio. Tried chatting with an spg agent about the issues, but they wound up closing the chat before we had finished the discussion! Chat agent Sarah H must work at the U.S. Grant and work at spg chat on the side! Finally had the issue resolved by calling hotel and speaking to the manager, I was given a measly 500 starwoods points for my inconvenience. Had I been aware of the issue and been on site to dispute im sure that I would have received greater compensation for my troubles, but what do they care, i've long since checked out. I had an issue arise across the street at the Westin Horton Plaza that I brought up during my stay, and they took care of resolving the issue in a professional manner and I felt treated like a valuable spg member. The U.S. Grant, well they brushed up their nose at me and didnt find me worthy enough I guess. This property has lost a loyal spg member, and I WILL NOT recommend it to any of my many friends who frequent san diego as a property they should patron. Much better locations downtown like the hotel solamar, the W and westin horton plaza(both starwood properties)

Reviews.Title: “MIght have been perfect in 1901”
Reviews.Author: trickdog1
Reviews.Content: To start with the bad this grand hotel is an old building, and while in good shape needs the 21st Century sound proof windows to handle the industrial age of nightly street sounds, especially Emergency vehicles that are even more horrifying on the lower floors than the upper floors. That said, if you are a heavy sleeper and/or do not mind the likely annoying zero dark thirty wake up and can get back to sleep quickly, then you might love this place. Also on the negative side is there is not much drawer space for clothes as there are no chest of drawers to place your clothes in. And as for the bathroom weight scale, I do not understand why you would want your guests to weigh themselves on a glass weight scale, if they might come to consider that there are getting fat and might want to skip dinner. Also, I appreciate the free water alot as that was a huge plus, but please do not tempt me with a bottle of wine near the television that does not have a clear sign that should read, "not free." Anyway, I smartly figured it was not free. Now, there are many good things to staying at this plush downtown hotel. The location is superb and you can walk a block south to Panera Bread and the nice outdoor mall, and 4th & 5th avenue top notch restaurants are just another block or so away. Also, the service at the Grant is the best possible that it could be as they will as much as they possibly can to help you or make things right for your stay there. If you do not like your room and there are rooms available on a higher floor they will definitely take care of you, and likely a higher upgrade too if you were not happy with your first room. There is free Wi-fi in the lobby and the restaurant so consider that too, but it will cost you if you want it in your room. And you will love the large very nice showers with swinging glass door - would love that in my house! Another thing I did not like was that they insist that you cannot personally handle the luggage carts and that is another way they can collect a tip from you. But not necessarily a big deal. I just know that I could have done it myself with no problem. Also, the parking fee is steep at $32 and should not be assessed if you do not take your car out that day.
