But you do not have much choice if you have your car since you cannot leave your car in a street space overnight due the street sweepers. On a final note, if you are a light sleeper ask for a room on a higher floor, otherwise you might not can stand more than a few nights if the noise bothers you. Besides that, if you do not mind the expense and want to be near the action, then this is a prime spot for you. Also, the trolley stop is right next door and that is very convenient for you as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel with all the Modern Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Notourhome
Reviews.Content: Our deluxe suite was beautiful and the service was great. Although a small thing, we appreciated the free water that was offered us routinely by hotel staff. We were celebrating our anniversary and the hotel left special treats in our room with a personalized note. San Diego lost power during our visit and the staff worked tirelessly to keep guests comfortable and well fed in the lobby. When we wanted to climb the stairs to our 11th floor room, one of the staff, Brock, personally took us so we wouldn't get lost in the maze of hallways and stairs. Although we cut our visit short due to the power outage, we want to go back and stay at the Grant again!

Reviews.Title: “Treated First Class”
Reviews.Author: froaction
Reviews.Content: Get what you pay for at the US Grant in San Diego. Vintage hotel in great location near the end of the gaslamp and horton plaza shopping center. The rooms were spacious and had a vintage decor to it. The most impressive aspect to me was being treated first class. Valet and front desk always spoke to me as "Mr" and always thanked me for staying at the hotel. I scored a great internet rate and it was well worth the weekend away with my wife...

Reviews.Title: “Chargers Opener!”
Reviews.Author: Msbness
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed one night after the Chargers home opener this past Sunday. We are Starwood Preferred Guests and were put on a floor specific to that group, the 7th floor. I love this hotel and have stayed here before. However, the carpeting on that floor looked to be the unfortunate victim of severe water damage. Several other people on our floor noted it and voiced their disdain. It was unsightly. Our room was lovely, but as you would expect from a hotel of that age, small. We were not provided a bellman to take our bags or provide ice, etc. upon arrival and we were two sunburned, tired girls who spent the entire day being quite festive at Qualcomm! We needed a hand and a cocktail! Despite our Starwood status, and the hotel being sparsely occupied we were denied an upgrade. We asked for a car to take us to Mortons for dinner and were denied. I had heard they had a house car, but was told by the concierge that this was not true and cabs were the only method other than one's own vehicle. I'm giving the hotel a "very good" rating because it truly is so very lovely and inviting. I love the old brass mail box next to the elevators for instance as it reminds you of a time gone by that was romantic, gentle and patient. (Can you imagine sending a love note that would take months or more to get your recipient!); the flower arrangements are original and striking against the high ceilings in the vast lobby. Additionally, the location is ideal with many restaurants, bars and shopping a few steps away. I would stay here again, but I would do so by qualifying my expectations to staff prior to arrival via Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but should be better for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Jordan J
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and had a lot of character. I grew up in Europe and it reminded me of some of the nicer hotels in Europe. Loved the high ceilings and plush pillows, and the furnishings and art were in excellent taste. I spent 2 years living in a flat in downtown London, so I may be immune to street noise, but I did not notice any excess noise as has been complained about here. Sadly, the hotel "missed" in my mind. Our check-in was fantastic, one of the best experiences anywhere in the world, staff was friendly, helpful, fast and polite. When we got to the room, the bathroom was very small, but a very nice room. The first night was terrible, the AC simply would not get the room cold enough and I was miserable, at 11:30 I called down to the desk to have them send me a fan. Half an hour later, still hot and uncomfortable and tired, I called back down asking where the fan was. The front desk did not know the status so I asked for a followup call with more information. That call never came. 15 Minutes later I called down yet again asking for a status, the same situation happened but with a different staff member, I asked for a return call and no call came back. About 15-20 minutes later the fan arrived covered in dust. With the help of the fan I made it through the night and when I complained in the morning the staff was fantastic about making things right. The manager on duty did an amazing job and put us in an large and incredible suite. She took our number and said she would give us a call when it was ready. After getting the call and coming back, we went up to the room to find someone else's luggage there, and not ours as well as the headboard to the bed on the floor having fallen off the wall. After bringing this up to her she again was very apologetic and said she would get it fixed right away. And that she did. The room was very nice with 2 large bathrooms one with a fantastic tub. Sadly things were just still off from what I would expect for $300+ a night. There was what looked like animal droppings in the corner of the window, it may have just been a massive pile of dirt, but neither is expected. There was a rip in my sheets I noticed the next morning. When trying to turn on the news in the living room, I noticed only one of the TVs actually worked. While we stayed there we ate 3 times at the onsite restaurant and I will say I was very impressed. The breakfast was very possibly the best I have had in my life, both the french toast and the waffles are to die for. The Juice was fresh and with a large variety, over all I am very very happy with the breakfast. Dinner was OK - the service was impeccable, absolutely top notch, and their staff made us feel special and welcomed. Both of us ordered steak, she ordered the $38 one and I ordered the $48 one. Now I am a steak snob, and her steak was fantastic, cooked perfectly and packed with flavor. My steak was mediocre at best, not what I would consider to be fine dining in any respect. When I brought it up, they offered to recook the steak, but I declined - I ended up eating less than half of it. (which is not like me) All in All, this seemed very much like a $150/night hotel, not a $300+/night hotel. I love the charm, but next time will stick with the other Starwood properties in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Best ever!”
Reviews.Author: Greg M
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights for combo biz and pleasure trip. Everyone was so friendly and customer-focused, especially during 12-hour blackout when staff provided continuous stream of sandwiches, beverages, chips, bagels, etc. in lobby at no charge and always with a smile. Amazing service! Hats off to Mr. Korn and Harry Siebert and their staff - well done! US Grant is now my SD home away from home! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Europe_78
Reviews.Content: I booked into the U.S. Grant for 2 nights (Fri and Sat) on the Labor Day weekend in September 2011. The hotel is really well appointed, and the standard room was spacious and luxurious, with a comfortable bed. The staff (particularly the valet parking staff) was friendly and welcoming, more so than I've experienced in other hotels of a similar standard. However, the drawback and the lingering memory was 2 nights of awful sleep, due to the noise from the streets outside: the windows block out nothing and sirens and party-goers seemed to be on the go all night. Additionally, there was plenty of noise from the corridor that wasn't blocked out. All in all, the lack of sleep left me feeling poorly for 2 days. Given the price range of the U.S. Grant, this was a side effect I wasn't expecting. Overall, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, beautiful hotel, fantastic care - especially during crisis”
Reviews.Author: Dayna S
Reviews.Content: The single night we spent at the US Grant just happened to be the night of the huge power outage that left most of So Cal and parts of Arizona in the dark - literally. The hotel was prepared. They had backup generators so there was some light in the lobby. Extra staff showed up including management just to take care of guests. They kept the hotel secure, they fed us endlessly - for free - since all restaurants were closed and made everyone as comfortable as possible. I am positive if we were in a lesser hotel we would not have been treated so well. We will always be grateful that we had such a lovely and safe place to stay during such a stressful event. We highly recommend the US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EarthWanderlust
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is in a great location, its a beautiful and elegant historical place, the down side of that is there is no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: Carlo_Milan_Italy
Reviews.Content: The US Grant was a nice surprise in our stop in San Diego. Very elegant and stylish, both rooms and common spaces are very enjoyable. Service is up at the standard of a five stars and honestly we couldn't ask for more. Food at the restaurant is excellent both for breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Above average but...”
Reviews.Author: LAnewlyweds
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a superior room. That's what they call their regular rooms. Everything is beautifully furnished and clean. The staff attentive and friendly. If it was just myself and my husband, we would've enjoyed the accommodations immensely, however, we were traveling with our 1 yr old. The room we were assigned was on the 6th floor right across the street from the Yard House. The street very busy and loud with traffic and emergency vehicle noise. Our 1 yr old sleeps at 8pm, so we were afraid the noise would wake her. I'm just thankful we were a little higher up. If we'd been on the 4th floor the noise would've been much worse. The elevators were cramped so it was a little difficult to maneuver the stroller. It was just large enough for 2 adults and a stroller. Thankfully there are 4 elevators. Like I said, if it had just been myself and my husband, I might not even have noticed these inconveniences. Hazards of traveling with baby i guess.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service”
Reviews.Author: jennyi
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here for a conference my husband was attending. We first rented a house in La Jolla for a few days before staying here. By the time we had the car unloaded, all bellman knew our names as well as the front desk clerks. It was early in the day so she helped us get our luggage ready to go up after our room was ready. Since it was only 11:00 we knew it would be a while so we went to the consierge's desk and spent about twenty minutes basically receiving a complete history of San Diego! The desk clerk came to us and told us our room was ready, (the exact kind I had previously requested) as well as the fridge I also requsted when I called. Our luggage was already in our room. Every time we came down, walked through the lobby or out to get a cab, they acknowledged us by name. After finding out that my son was homeschooled, Leann, I think was her name, printed out multiple activities for us to do that involved the history and founding of San Diego. The rooms were spacious, spotlessly clean. Turn down service included ice in the ice bucket, bottled water, chocolates and soft music on the radio every night. Walking around in the Gaslamp disrict was easy and safe. Plenty of restaurants. We walked all the way to the water to catch the ferry to Coronado on a Sunday and the streets were teaming with people. We walked back through the huge marriot complex and I was so glad to be where we were. Quiet, refined and understated elegance. I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A dream of a renovation and a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCTravels
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the US Grant several years ago, and although it was a bit tired, we booked for this trip as well because of its fabulous location. The hotel has been completely renovated and is spectacular. We were completely blown away with the reno, the luxury and the staff. When we enquired at the front desk about buying stamps, they just took our letter and mailed it. All the staff were very helpful, the rooms were sumptuous and the bathrooms unbelievable. The only negative, if there was one, was that the bed was more firm than we care for. Otherwise, this was a terrific experience and we'll surely go back there. Right in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter and easy access to everywhere. Shopping literally next door at Horton Plaza, and restaurants and clubs at your doorstep. Windows that open, but rooms that are quiet. A fantastic place. The only downside is that, as in so many other hotels of this calibre, wireless internet should be provided, not tacked on to your bill at $12 a day extra.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but noisy in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenMax
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The US Grant which is really a beautiful hotel but during the night there is so much noise from outside since the windows are old model with one layer glass and they do not close really perfect. It is really sad since the hotel is absolutely beautiful. I wish they could do something about the windows and the noise. I stay in New York City about 20 times a year and never experience these problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with solid staff”
Reviews.Author: cadamsesq
Reviews.Content: The one hotel in San Diego, that stands above all others is the US Grant. It looks and feels larger than it is. But the level of service is more personal, like a smaller, luxury hotel. And the dining room had excellent food -- one of the best Cobb Salads I've ever had -- served by an outstanding waiter named Alberto. Fast, efficient, knowledgeable, helpful and friendly, he was just what anyone would hope a server to be. The room was well appointed (though the art bizarre). I was in a suite, so maybe not a great comparison to the other rooms, but the shower was the largest I've ever been in. The shower alone was almost as large as my entire bathroom in my apartment, and could comfortably fit 4 people at the same time (though trying that would turn the place into an entirely different kind of hotel.) Anytime I'm in San Diego, the US Grant is my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely..”
Reviews.Author: Toniabum
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights. The service was excellent, room were clean and modern, the lobby is beautiful...Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant "Alberto" was a very attentive waiter. We really enjoyed our stay....Highly recommend the US Grant....Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel perfectly situated in the Gas Lamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl424
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the US Grant very much. The property and the rooms are in excellent condition. We were upgraded to a suite as a Starwood Preferred Member and never had an issue with noise that I noted some complained about on lower floors. The staff were all very friendly and accomodating. The conceirge was very helpful whenever we asked about anything we needed help with. Every single time we asked for a cab, the bell staff found us a nice town car instead at an equivalent or cheaper rate than a tax might have charged......even when we were going all the way out to La Jolla. We appreciated the great service very much. The bed and linens were so comfortable we slept well and never wanted to get up! The rooms were extremely clean and well-maintained. The only slight complaint is the furniture in the living area of the suite was not particularly comfortable although it was pretty and of an art deco style. The location is excellent. It is a short walk to the harbor, Fifth Avenue and the ball park. We also walked to Balboa Park and back because the weather was so beautiful and enjoyed the exercise. The Grant Grill is classy and relaxing. We will definitely be back. It was the first time my husband and I had been able to really explore San Diego and the vacinity as we'd always just traveled on business there.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Craig M
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our week at the US Grant. While the rooms were nice, comfortable and clean, they were rooms. What did make a difference for us was the staff. From the front desk to the maids, to the concierge. Everyone was great. Good old fashioned customer service. We had the concierge desk assist us with several items (we were playing toursit) and they were FANTASTIC. Also - the location you can not beat if you are wanting to see San Diego. We did not rent a car, Taxi from the airport was $15, and you can catch buses/trolleys/etc. right in front of the hotel for $5/day. Plus a lot of places you can walk to. Just a couple of blocks to the Gaslamp resturant district. While they are not the cheapest place in town, they are worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: jehnot
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, it is very well kept with modern rooms. I was here for businss by myself. i did find the area a little intimidating, being a 28 girl traveling on my own. There are A LOT of homeless people in the area, one morning i thought i would venture out for breakfast before my convention and found myself to be one of the few business people to be out at 7am, all the bums were folding up their beds on the street, and the street corners smelled of urine, but what I can i saw it is a big city i guess it should be expected, but be prepared. The hotel is only blocks away from the gaslamp district which you must atleast see if your there... and fullfilled my craving for mexican food while there. The hotel is also across the street from Horton Plaza which is very nice, and the trolley has a stop right behind the hotel which can take you most anywhere you want to get to. I found the trolley to feel pretty safe riding by myself. I was on the 6th floor on the side of the hotel, the Yard House is across the street and sounds like it can get kind of rowdy but for the most part just fine...also a good place to eat. But as long as you don't sleep late it shouldn't be a problem, they take out the bottles and stuff from the bar around 7am and that is loud.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: Avgtrvler
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about this property. From check-in to check-out the staff was great. We arrived late, valet was waiting for us when we got there and Collin at the front desk was very professional. The public areas are beautiful and the rooms are flawless. If you are going to the San Diego area, stay here. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved this gorgeous hotel and look forward to returning.”
Reviews.Author: slivernois
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is located in the heart of downtown San Diego and occupies and entire square block. It is within walking distance of many restaurants, pubs, movie theatres, etc. Our room was beautifully decorated with a view of the rooftop garden where they grow their own herbs. Room service was exceptionally fast and all of the staff were exceedingly friendly, polite and gracious. The lobby is very large and nicely decorated. Valet service was prompt, friendly and courteous. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: traveler_362
Reviews.Content: My cousin's and I needed a little getaway girls trip that had to be short but sweet and it was fulfilled here at the U.S. Grant in San Diego. Upon checking in at the front desk the receptionist was courteous and knowledgeable and even opened up the hotel giftshop for us to purchase drinks. Not only did he give us great suggestions on where to eat and the best hang outs, he offered us complimentary toothbrushes upon over hearing our conversation about forgetting out toothbrushes. Our room was small but comfortable and clean. We were there during a weekend and didnt notice too much noise from party goers even though we were facing the main street. Overall, the mission was accomplished and the stay was fantastic. I will defnitely return to this hotel when I come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The US Grant is the place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: travelingcowgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a very luxurious hotel that is very convenient to anywhere in the San Diego area. We stayed for 10 days. The front desk was so professional, helpful and accommodating. I asked for and received a refrigerator and an extra chair for our suite. The shower is very large and delivers a lot of hot water. The hotel serves a wonderful lime aid with mint each evening in the lobby and it also provides a choice of several newspapers each morning. Besides the hotel being so historic and beautiful, we chose it primarily because it was so well situated for public transportation. We didn't want to deal with a rental car and parking so we rode the city trolley and the city bus. The trolley runs along the north side of the US Grant and the busses run along the south side on Broadway. The public transporation is very quick and easy to use to the Zoo, Balboa Park, LaJolla, Coronado, Point Loma and Old Town. The hotel is within walking distance to the Hard Rock Cafe and several restaurants. The hotel is across the street from Horton Plaza which has several department stores and a major pharmacy.

Reviews.Title: “Graet rooms and terrific service”
Reviews.Author: skyhawkd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the US Grant for a quick getaway from the kids. The service was impeccable the entire time. Everyone was so friendly and courteous.... valet, front desk, waitress, etc. We are SPG Platinum members (as well as Marriott and Hilton) so we've seen lots of hotels around the world. This one was definitely one of our favorites. The room was very classy and comfortable. Location-wise the hotel is in a decent place. I found it very convienent to take the trolly and buses which both have stops within a block of the hotel. This saved us a lot of money and we were still able to visit the zoo, Mission Beach, Coronado, and the Midway Museum. We ate at the Grant Grill and it was amazing. Perfect service, great portion sizes, and a very interesting menu. My husband had the tasting menu and it was a highlight of our trip. I will look forward to returning to the US Grant in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: canadiandiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights for our 10th Wedding Anniversary. it is an absolutely beautiful property - very elegant but not pretentious at ALL. The location was perfect. The rooms were clean and lovely. Service was outstanding. We would highly recommend this hotel. We accidentally left some very personal items in the safe, and an employee at the hotel delivered it to the Torrey Pines Lodge, which was where we went for a couple of nights after staying at the Grant... Thank you thank you!! Oh - and the BEST BEDS and pillows!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Ronski766
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4-night SD getaway with my brother and his wife. We decided to try the US Grant because of its location and reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is situated across the street from Horton Plaza and at the north end of the Gaslamp Quarter. It is a short walk to the harbour (USS Midway, Coronado Ferry, Trolley, Harbour Cruises, Maritime Museum and Seaport Village), so no need for a car and the resulting $38/day parking fee). Cabs are plentiful and cheap, as are town cars (see the valet). You could also rent a car for the day as we did if you want to venture to the beaches or up the coast. The concierge can get you a good deal. The hotel itself has been elegantly renovated with every modern convenience; while still retaining its original charm. It is obvious from the moment you walk through the door that this place is incredibly well managed. We were treated like royalty at every turn, and we used almost all the services (reception, lounge, concierge, valet, room service, etc). Before I forget; the beds were heavenly. We even pulled the covers back to note the mattress make and brand so we could get the same one at home! Housekeeping was discreet and thorough. The entire hotel was spotlessly clean! All in all, a fabulous hotel with incredible staff. Tips: Rent a car by the day to avoid the exorbitant parking fee, eat/drink in the lounge during happy hour or be prepared to pay big $$$. One note: some earlier reviewers commented that the hotel is in a seedy area, but don't let this deter you. The back of the hotel faces the still under-developed north part of downtown, but in 3 directions there are restaurants, shops and people galore. There is nothing to see or do north of Broadway, so you will likely never venture in that direction anyway. If you do, as we did late one night, you will be perfectly safe. There are a few (very harmless) homeless people that are drawn into the area because there is a church handing out blankets and food a little further afield. As I said, this area is under-developed and a bit of an eyesore, but these people are harmless and likely won't even acknowledge your presence.

Reviews.Title: “Oozes class”
Reviews.Author: wahili
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here as part of a road trip. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. I know hotel staff are paid to pander to guests' wants and needs, but the staff here are genuine and clearly enjoy what they do. Nothing over the top, but professional and executed in an old-fashioned, non-invasive way. In particular, I'd like to mention Julie on the front desk and Sam the bell hop. Both very accommodating and polite. The building is beautiful and exceptionally well maintained. Very minor gripe.....had to make a couple of telephone calls to housekeeping. Our room was regularly missing items such as creamer for coffee, coffee cups. However, these items were delivered very quickly. Not so minor gripe (which appears to irritate many other reviewers).....absolutely outrageous car parking fee. Yes, I know everywhere else charges, but that does not make it right! Absolutely loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: fexfex
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, walk to gaslamp and water, beautiful hotel, exceptional service. We can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice classic hotel, near the action”
Reviews.Author: Devon J
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, classic elegance and near the action of the Gas Lamp district. Jazz in the bar on the weekends. The service is very attentive. Good restaurants nearby and easy access to highways for the childrens' attractions. The only detractor is that the hotel is on the edge of the Gas Lamp which tends to be a little more seedy with all of the homeless people around.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality hotel for the price in gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: talyler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in downtown San Diego last weekend for a show. I wanted a nice hotel that wasn’t too pricey. Thanks to other reviews on trip advisor I chose the US Grant. It was $60-80 less than other “nice” hotels in the area, and very highly rated. The hotel is located in the heart of the gaslamp district, and is walking distance from many good restaurants and bars. There is even a mall across the street. I was impressed the moment I walked into the lobby. This place has class. Chandeliers and nice decorations scattered throughout the hotel. Everybody was in suits and dresses. I felt out of place in a t-shirt, shorts, and flip-flops. I arrived 30 minutes early for check-in. The lady behind the desk was VERY friendly with a warm smile. She was helpful with any questions I had. I had the cheapest room, so I wasn’t expecting much. My room was on the 3rd floor on the southeast corner of the building, facing the “Yard House” on 4th ave. I will start with the bad. It was loud in my room, but that’s not the hotels fault. It’s a busy part of downtown. If you don’t want noise, I’d suggest avoiding that side of the hotel. Many rooms do not face that street. I brought a white noise machine which helped drown the noise at night. I couldn’t hear any noise from neighboring rooms. I only heard people in the hallway briefly as they walked by. The hotel was sold out, so I expected it to be loud and crazy…which it wasn’t. Now the good. The room was amazing! My fiancé busted out the camera and started taking pictures immediately. She was in love. The rooms are well maintained with modern appliances and nice decorations. The king size bed was VERY comfortable with plenty of soft silky sheets and a nice comforter. The bed had like 8 pillows, it was awesome. The bathroom came equipped with nice lotions, good exfoliating body wash, shampoo, etc and a nice shower. I was very pleased with everything about the room. As an added bonus we received turndown service (which I didn’t pay extra for). When we returned to the room after a long night, the bed was made with chocolates on the pillows. The floor on each side of the bed had little mats with slippers. And they put complimentary bottles of water on each side of the bed with a glass for each one. That was a welcome surprise! I had a great night’s sleep. Checkout was fast and easy. I would stay there again, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel full of old school character”
Reviews.Author: OverSeaOverLand
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a lovely old school hotel in the heart of San Diego. Stayed here at the end of a 2 week Californian road trip. The Grant has got a lot of character with massive entrance halls, with chanderliers and big lobby. Although the hotel is old dating back over a hundred years, I believe it's had a big facelift as everything has been given a big lick of paint and completely refurbished internally. The staff were really helpful, friendly and attentive. The room was really nice, high ceilings and great bed and bathroom. Hotel location is good around the corner from the top of Gaslamp Quarter with all the bars and restaurants. Can get a bit noisy at night because of the revellers, but that's a function of the area rather than the hotels fault. Maybe ask for a room on one of the higher levels on facing away from Broadway and 3rd. The Grant is also directly opposite directly opposite the Horton shopping plaza, which has all the usual mainstream shops you could need. Stayed for 2 nights and on the thursday night, they have a live jazz band and singer in their bar (which used to be speakeasy during prohibition times). Overall really nice stay at the US Grant, would recommend for a nice stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TJP66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights this week. Service was friendly and prompt. I had to request the feather bedding be changed and it was done quickly and with no hassles. The valet service was quick and we were always offered cold bottles of water to take on our outings and asked if we needed directions anywhere. The location is fabulous. Walking distance to the mall across the street, many many great restaurants and movie theatre. We will definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again. We found it very convenient for our activities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but noisy streets”
Reviews.Author: Ramey501
Reviews.Content: I come down to San Diego for work about twice a year for the past 3 years and my manager and I always stay here because the hotel itself is quiet and the rooms are great. Big plush beds, turn-down service and great bathroom amenities. I've always stayed on the West side of the hotel and been fine, but this last time I was put on the East side of the building on the 5th floor right across from a popular restaurant/bar - The Yard House. I live in a city, so I'm used to late night conversation at 2am when bars close...I barely woke up for that, but it was first the garbage truck emptying large steel garbage bins crashing into each other and then the Grease truck that comes in at 5am to suck all the grease out of the Yard House for almost 2 hrs. So from 5-7 am you will feel like you are in a truck yard. It sounds like an 18 wheeler semi idling right out your hotel room window. They offered me free breakfast in the am after I called twice to see what was going on, but all I wanted was my sleep back! So...the hotel is lovely, but make sure you stay on a high floor on the West side of the building!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: UkField
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel and many others around america i can only truly say its lovely and cannot fault it at all. The staff were very kind polite and helpful, at all times they made you feel welcome. We stayed on the 7th floor the room was very clean and beautiful, we had turn down service where slippers were layed out on a cloth for us and chocolates provided, also complimentary water. There is complimentary coffee in the grill in the morning for guests and complimentary internet in the lounge where there are lovely sofas to sit and relax catching up on the internet etc!! We had valet parking when our car came to us and we got in there was also ice cold complimentary water for each of us. I truly cannot fault this hotel and the lovely staff. We had breakfast in the grill each morning and it was perfect the staff there too were very polite and helpful, they helped us with places to go and visit and general information. You must try this hotel!! enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “It's perfect for one night!”
Reviews.Author: 143fay
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel very much, its clean and very luxurious but for the price it should at least add a continental breakfast, plus swimming pool. I highly recommend it if you are looking for a one night sleep over.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: LA_J_P_Glendale
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Valet, though bell hop, check in & room service, our whole family was very impressed by the very consistent quality service provided. Thanks for maintaining the good ol' fashioned service which is still hard to find nowadays.!! We will be back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference site.”
Reviews.Author: c v
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous accomodations, with elegant rooms for lodging and business meetings. I was disappointed not to have a coffeemaker in my room but was pleased to find complimentary fresh-brewed coffee in the bar/lounge in the morning. I had to order hotel internet service for my work laptop and did not realize until checkout that 24-hour internet service is charged by calendar day and not for the 24-hour period from the order. This was kindly resolved with reception staff at checkout. The concierge is friendly and recommended great spots within walking distance. Looking forward to my next business trip out here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but had an unsettling experience”
Reviews.Author: debsg_11
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I'll stay there again soon. However, there was a man staying at the Plaza hotel across the street who I caught using binoculars to spy on me while I was in the bathroom. I sense that he does it often (Plaza may be a down at heels residence hotel) because he also hung his phone number out of his window and it was obviously pre-written. Very creepy as he stayed at his window for a long time peering at our window.

Reviews.Title: “Great great great”
Reviews.Author: Passionatetraveler11
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel. Clean, nice decor, easy check-in and check-out. Our room was quite small but we don't need more for the time we were actually in the room. It was very well isolated so you could sleep well. Very helpful Concierge and Valet (very expensive valet parking though).

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mxiscool
Reviews.Content: upgraded to larger room based on availability on the second night. Staff very helpful. Happy hour at the grill with live music was nice touch. Bed very comfy and room design lovely. Had to ask for coffee maker in room, but was provided with a very nice one. Would be nicer if had jacuzzi tub in rooms, but showers very fancy. Overall, enjoyed the stay in San Diego very much. Did not need a car, public trans.very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beauthiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: feistyfoodie
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located downtown and yet easy to get to the beach. The room and bathroom were beautifully remodeled, but the room had a smell. Our view was of the transient hotel across the street, but the other 3 sides were okay. The staff were excellent and very accommodating. I know it is downtown and parking is pricey, but I don't like paying $32/night for parking, when the room is over $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Sergio saves the day!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieN60
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I were waiting in the beautiful lobby for our daughter and her boyfriend to arrive before going into Grant Grill for cocktails. I accidentally left my expensive, new Nikon D5000 camera on the sofa in the lobby, but didn't realize it was missing until we got up to leave the Grill, almost an hour later. When we got back out into the lobby, I could see that it was no longer on the sofa where I'd been sitting, and my heart sank, thinking it was unlikely I'd ever get it back. Thank goodness dear Sergio, from reception, saw it and put it behind the reception desk for safe keeping. I am so appreciative of his keen eye and caring attitude. It turned what could have been a horrible start to our weekend into a "restored faith in humanity" moment. Thank you, Sergio!! You're the best.

Reviews.Title: “The finest hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Carol-Bermuda
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel about 3 times a year & have been doing so for the past 6 or 7 years it's the only place to stay. I like it because the staff never changes, they always remember you & treat you like a friend when you return. Hotel is gorgeous, very luxurious and the rooms are beautiful. Cannot fault it in any way. Ideal location couldn't be better for shopping and getting around on the wonderful trolley system.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, but slept in ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: loudsne
Reviews.Content: The hotel was kept well, although the hallways had an old odor to it. The biggest and only problem I had was the location of my room, which was on the 4th floor and faced the mall...really noisy!!! The hotel is also near to a fire house and I could hear the trucks all night! The area the hotel is in isn't the best either...someone was shot just one block over during my stay. Prior to staying at the Grant, I stayed at the Marriott Gaslamp which is closer to the convention center and I liked that hotel A LOT more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in an Wonderful Location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PatentGeekLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a recent business trip (2 night stay) and we were deeply impressed with the wonderful old world character of a hotel that had been beautifully updated and artistically appointed with millions of dollars of unique art items. Even the head boards on the beds are original works of art! The service staff was exceptional and our group had several meals during the trip on property that were 5 star. The hotel is on Broadway only about 6 or 7 blocks from the ocean and the USS Midway. Also, it's right on the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter with plenty of restaurants, bars and clubs just a few blocks away. Be advised that Valet Parking is the only option, and that is $32 a day. In room internet is $11.99. Finally, our Bellman was kind enough to inform us that the in room mini fridge/bar was of the new type that JUST MOVING AN ITEM IN THE FRIDGE RESULTS IN A CHARGE TO THE ROOM. Needless to say we kept that door tightly closed during our visit (Container of M & M's $8, plus tax, plus a restocking fee). We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reillybrianm
Reviews.Content: I am from the East Coast, so i have different expectations, but i have to say this hotel is very nice, but like typical California, service is extremely weak.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: michele030
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the US Grant, unfortunately it was only for one night because we were on our way out of town. I would have stayed there longer if possible. The rooms were luxurious, comfortable bed, soft sheets and bedding, quiet room, I slept perfectly. Lots of little extras like comfortable robes and slippers. The restaurant in the hotel is fantastic, we ate dinner and breakfast there and they were both very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Pepe97
Reviews.Content: Luxury is an understatement for this hotel. The details in the design and architecture are beautiful.. They don't make hotels like this anymore. The Service is what makes this hotel great. The staff are very courteous. Location is great, it's across Horton Plaza and just a hop and skip away to the Gaslamp Quarter. We stayed here for a wedding. The Bride and Groom had the penthouse suite. It was very nice, it had a panoramic view of downtown San Diego. The room we stayed at was nice as well. Not much of a view though except another guest rooms window. It was very clean, the bed was very comfortable. My only gripe was the lack of free wifi in the guest rooms. You have to hang out in the lobby area to get wifi, they charge you for internet hook up in the guest room. And also, I'm not a big fan of the $32 valet fee. But overall, this is probably the best hotel I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: LA_and_beyond
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely - historic and beautiful without being ostentatious. Even the standard room was good sized, lovely marble bathroom, and wonderfully comfortable bed and linens. And the service was top notch. It's a bit a on the pricey side for San Diego, but would cost double or triple what it does in any major city, so worth the indulgence!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully remodeled hotel”
Reviews.Author: minuit999
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is my favorite hotel in San Diego. It has been immaculately remodeled (it's the oldest hotel in San Diego!) and refurnished with exceptional detail. The rates are incredibly reasonable for the quality of the hotel, and I would highly recommend it over other hotels in the downtown area (including both Westins and the Sheraton). The lobby is stunning and the rooms are uniquely decorated. They have the feel of rooms in a boutique hotel, despite being in a fairly large building. A short walk takes you to nearby bars and restaurants galore, although the area directly surrounding the neighborhood is fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, but in a sketchy part of town”
Reviews.Author: OneFlipper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in July and booked through starwood points program. We paid $160/night [extra discount for AAA] which was a really good price because the Sheraton was charging $150/night. It was a good deal but we almost had a heart attack when we found out there was a $32/night parking charge. We circled the hotel for street parking and if you go one block north--actually, just head north and BEFORE you even cross the street is some kind of row packed with homeless(?) people. It felt bad paying so much for parking but then also felt worse just leaving the car outside. I get that it's an old hotel so the location wasn't picked recently, and they couldn't help how the city developed around the hotel but still--charge me $32/night for parking when I'm paying to stay in the room; otherwise leave my car outside when your own concierge told me NOT to walk out of the north side of the building because it is very "colorful"?? Kind of sucky... If you cross the street on the east side though, you start to get into the gas lamp district which is where shopping, bars, restaurants, theaters are! Awesome. We had good food the entire time we were there and were able to walk each time. We requested a minifridge so we walked to the Ralphs market five minutes away and stocked it with drinks and fruit. They didn't charge for it and it was waiting in the room for us when we checked in, so that was nice. Overall, beautiful hotel. Very pretty decor and furniture but the carpets in the hallway and rugs in rooms were kind of dirty/stained. They had fresh cozy bedroom slippers so I was still happy!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sedknins
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Staff, Food, Rooms, and Location. This is the ONLY place I stay while in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: gugburke
Reviews.Content: Hello, I just wanted to express my appreciation for the hospitality and service me and my group received during our recent stay (July 12-14th) there at the US Grant. I suggested to my company that we try the US Grant for our meeting and I was overwhelmed by the service and amenities we enjoyed during our stay. The banquet food was amazing; one of my colleagues went back for seconds and commented- "when was the last time you ever got seconds of banquet food?". I appreciate that the Director of Operations, Mr. Scaramellino took the time to introduce himself to me. Biddy and the rest of the meeting staff were gracious and very helpful. I apologize for not getting all the names of the folks who made our stay and meeting enjoyable but suffice it to say every person we encountered from the time we walked through the doors was outstanding! Well done. Sincerely, John Burke John E. Burke RT(R)(CV) Senior District Manager COOK Medical

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: GTKarol
Reviews.Content: My husband,13 year old son and I stayed at the US Grant July 9-12. This was our first visit to San Diego. The US Grant is located in the Gaslamp district. Great shopping and dining were only a few steps away. This hotel was absolutely beautiful inside and out. The rooms were well appointed with the softest linens and the most comfortable beds. The turn down service was appreciated-my son especially enjoyed the chocolates on his pillow every night. The staff was extremely polite and very helpful. The concierge assisted us in planning our daily activities. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room on a daily basis. We rented a car and used the valet parking. The young men that assisted us with valet were very polite and personable. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel when visiting SanDiego. You will not be disappointed. It is close to all of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: MVWeekendTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Grant regularly for the past 2 years and enjoy all my stays. The hotel has all the character you expect from a 100 year old hotel, but the rooms are very modern and comfortable. The service at the Grant is exceptional. The front desk staff, waiters and bellmen all recognize me and greet me by name. During my most recent stay, I was upgraded to a great suite and provided with wine and cheese in my room because it was my 10th stay at the hotel. I highly recommend the hotel as well as the Grant Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay, as always!”
Reviews.Author: nicholasevans
Reviews.Content: I was in contact prior to my stay by Demi Dalisay. She was warm and welcoming and provided good information for my upcoming stay. She asked for my arrival details and was able to put my travel partner's information on my room as he was arriving before me. We were in a beautiful Landmark Suite and it was simply perfect. Great furnishings, wonderful bath products, an enveloping bed and a terrific view of San Diego and the bay. We've stayed at the US Grant before and we will certainly again. Many thanks for your terrific work!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel- will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Carbongirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant for a business trip. Overall, I was blown away. The hotel was beautiful with elegant details. But the one thing that I have to say is that their service is the best I have encountered in a LONG time, and around the world. The best meaning that everyone from the front desk, bell hop, valet parking, chamber maid, phone operator- they were responsive, courteous, helpful and without an ounce of pretense. What a refreshing change! Kudos to US Grant for bringing back service. My room was lovely with quiet, old world elegance- excellent amenities, luxurious touches such as slippers and robes, turn down service. And it was very clean. I absolutely loved it. The only down side is that it is located in the gaslamp district. And I say downside because to be among the excitement and entertainment, you will get the noise. My room faced 4th ave and was on the 4th floor, and I heard every drunken conversation until 2-3am and delivery trucks at 7am. And this was during the work week! Just bring ear plugs !

Reviews.Title: “Elegant walk through history”
Reviews.Author: Achilles07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night to be in town and near the airport for an early flight. Considering the incredible luxury and prime location next to the gas lamp district, it was a good price. The hotel is a perfect mix of history and modern ammenities. Walking through the hotel provides a glimpse of early 1900s opulence. Yet, the facilities and rooms contain modern luxury like slippers, robes, glass showers, and even stationary!! You can walk to most downtown attractions. Service was outstanding. My bedspread had some shoe stains, there was no mp3 connection, and the bath window couldn't accommodate both privacy and natural light - but those are nitpicks given the other luxury. You will enjoy it and the incredible lobby.

Reviews.Title: “From A Birthday To A Proposal!”
Reviews.Author: CBertram
Reviews.Content: Dear Mr. Scaramellino, I just wanted to take a moment to tell you about the STELLAR service I received at your hotel last weekend. From reservations to check out it was the most amazing experience I have ever had in any of the Luxury Collection Hotels/Fine Hotels and Resorts... Actually, in any hotel ever! It was my boyfriend’s birthday and also the day of a charity 100 mile bicycle ride he had organized. I was following the riders in my car from Huntington Beach to San Diego and supplying them with food and drinks along the way. I had previously spoken with Jeff Josenhans of the Grant Grill and arranged for a post-ride cocktail and dinner celebration, with a custom cake for my boyfriend. I called ahead that morning and by a stroke of fabulous luck, got Julie Larkin on the phone. I asked if it would be possible to arrive a little early to decorate the suite with birthday balloons and congratulations signs. (No tape on the walls of course!) Upon my arrival, social host Michael Curry was wonderful in helping me with a carload of luggage, gear and decorations. I then went to the Grant Grill and met with Jeff Josenhans, who had already arranged for a reserved section for my group, had already taken care of the cake, and even took some decorations from me for the table. As if that weren’t enough, I then met with Julie Larkin who informed me that not only did I get above and beyond my FH&R upgrade, but that she had upgraded us to a bi-level Presidential Suite! From Rita Casares at the front desk, to Jeff and Michael and Julie, the entire staff offered to help me blow up balloons and even decorate the suite. When my boyfriend and the other riders arrived at your hotel, they were greeted with applause from the staff. They felt like rock stars! Our time in the Grant Grill was wonderful, and his cake was spectacular! And the special touches in the room (fruit plate and sparkling water) for his birthday were so thoughtful. All in all, it was a truly magical weekend. And when we got back home, he proposed! I will forever connect the most important day of my life, with my weekend at the US Grant. All my best, C. Bertram

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property - good for families and business travelers.”
Reviews.Author: mooshai
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days with family, have very few complaints. It is a grand old hotel in every sense of the word, but with modern, very nice touches. The in-house restaurant (Grant Grill) had one of the best menus and most supportive staff I've seen in years. Pricey, but worth every dime. Great feeling of history and place in the hotel. Had a bit of a tech issue late one night and the concierge (I wish I had gotten her name) was so helpful it really made an impression. The down sides: 1. no pool, which is a disappointment if traveling with kids 2. they charge for internet, which is kind of cheap in this day and age (considering that most $69 a night airport hotels have it for free) 3. location is not as ideal as some of the places closer to the water, but still walking distance from whatever you want to see. Overall I highly recommend and would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular experience”
Reviews.Author: Firefyter55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made a spur of the moment trip to San Diego for some time just the two of us. The hotel and rooms are stunning. I have never walked into a hotel room and had such a sweet welcoming smell. We also had breakfast at the Grant Grill and may I say they have the most wonderful food and staff. Alberto was our server and was nothing short of perfect. Try the french toast, you wont be dissapointed. Justin & Jami

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while at a conference in SD. This Hotel is awesome. Super high quality and relatively cheap ($240 per night). The room was very high quality. 4 huge feather pillows, down duvet and very comfy bed / matress. I slept like a baby all 3 nights. It feels like a much more expensive hotel. I had a breakfast one morning and while it was astronomically expensive, it was very, very tasty. Some observations: 1. I asked them to clear my mini-bar out so that I could use the fridge. That was fine, however it took ages. And also when i checked out they tried to charge me for the entire contents...for all 3 nights!!! 2. Ring down for your car before you need it. If in a hurry. 3. Breakfast was nice but way overpriced. I paid $36 for..wait for it...one piece of toast, a bowl of oatmeal and a small plate of fruit. Oh and a cup of tea!!! 4. The outside noise is considerable (being downtown and near the gas lamp district None of these points justify a '4' however. I love this hotel and will be back for sure. Love the art-work, the modern feel and the small details that make this place definitely a cut above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly will return”
Reviews.Author: vigilaware
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that our card to access our room did not work the next morning and we had to show ID to prove who we are just to have it working once again. Otherwise, it was beautiful, the breakfast was delicious, and the aroma was outstanding. The staff was very friendly and professional and the bed was extremely comfortable. We slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “room from hell”
Reviews.Author: nicklesPasadena
Reviews.Content: my room was very small the carpet was dirty in my room my room was next to the stairway so all i heard was bamming all night i could not sleep and i took this trip to rest i was glad to get home on a good note the service was great

Reviews.Title: “Lunch was Awesome at the Grant Grill”
Reviews.Author: vicmera
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the US Grant, we went there for lunch. The Service was amazing. Alberto was our server and he was welcoming, he provided recommendations, and he went above and beyond to locate an off menu special request and was successful. He had great people skills, was friendly and exemplified the service you would expect from the US Grant. We look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic renovated hotel gives off spooky atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Dana23
Reviews.Content: We visited The US Grant for a few days in august during a business trip. While the overall hotel is up to 5 star standards; (turn down service, room amenites, decor,) The poorly lit and narrow hallways made the hotel feel as if it was still the turn of century at the time it was built. Even during the daytime the atmosphere seemed subdued. No loud noise to complain of and the room service and hotel cleanliness was impeccable. However I disregarded earlier posts regarding the surrounding area, while very accessible to the gaslamp district, the amount of homeless people around the hotel was staggering. There needs to be a medical clinic and shelter in the area in order to accommodate the homeless needs in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel. Fantastic restaurant. Great beds.”
Reviews.Author: Garemick
Reviews.Content: Ask for a courtyard or 3rd Ave view. 4th Ave is noisy and has a view of dilapidated buildings.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: royalbaby_11
Reviews.Content: Rooms are elegant, very clean, tastefully decorated, yet very comfortable. The location is excellent being right in the middle of the Gaslamp district of San Diego. The restaurant, Grant Grill, is top notch. Service is the best. I have stayed at a lot of hotels traveling for business. This is one of my all-time favorites. I stay here whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soo30t
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and must say it's one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The room was tastefully done and serviced very well- loved the little touches like the slippers by the bed and chocolates! It was a little bit noisy from traffic outside but then we were in a city after all! All the staff were very friendly and helpful except maybe the barman at happy hour who failed to mention it was in fact happy hour and made no suggestions to us and we ended up paying full price for all our drinks! ! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I also found blood on the sheets.”
Reviews.Author: ducky123_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and found blood on one of the pillows. It was late so I just slept on the other side of the bed and made sure to put the card on the bed to have the maid change the sheets for the next night. The maid DID NOT change the sheets. I found the same bloody pillow!! Then, the next morning, woke up to the maid banging her key on the door even though I had put the "privacy" sign on the door. She came back another 2 times and did the same thing. This was a few hours before checkout. It seemed like she couldn't get me out the room fast enough. I told guest services about this when I checked out, but the girl didn't seem to care. Don't know how this hotel has a 5 star rating. I will definitely not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, but "suite" was lacking.”
Reviews.Author: LaiLaiGirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the US Grant. The first time we stayed here, we got a deluxe king room. It was fabulous! It was so spacious and, since they are all corner rooms, there are plenty of windows. The bathroom was spacious as well. When we decided to return, I wanted to book the deluxe king room. Unfortunately, there were non available for our stay. So, I booked a Legacy Suite. I expected it to exceed my expectations. Instead, I felt a little disappointed. First, it felt cramped. There is barely a foot between the wall and the bed (closest to the window). The bathroom was cramped and not as nice as in the deluxe room. The seating area was nice, but overall, it just felt cramped. I really expected more for a suite, considering how much more it cost over a deluxe room. Despite that, the service was good overall. The valet were always helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a great location -- across the street from shopping, near the trolley station and walking distance to Seaport Village. My only other complaint is that when we were going to check out, my boyfriend call to have a luggage cart brought up. He called at 11 AM (check out is at noon). We waited for 20 minutes, and nobody came. We decided to stop waiting and took all of our luggage and pet down ourselves. It was a pain, and I was surprised we even waited at all, since everyone was usually so prompt and courteous. I don't know about the other rooms or suites, but if you have to choose between a deluxe room and a Legacy Suite, go with the deluxe room. You won't regret it! Additional Notes: 1. There is no swimming pool at this hotel. I believe patrons at this hotel can use the pool at the Westgate Hotel, which is right across the way. 2. Valet parking is $32/night with in and out privileges. 3. Pet friendly - There is a $150 non-refundable cleaning fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: lucybob22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant over the 4th of July and had a great time. The location is near all downtown activities. The service exceeded our expectation. One day, we left the do not disturb sign on the door until 5pm!! We removed it and went to dinner. We did not expect to get any service that day but to our surprise, when we returned at 8pm, the room was clean and the beds were turned down with little chocolates on the pillows. Slippers were placed on the side of each bed and the light were on but dimmed!! Fantastic US Grant!! We love you!! Now that's the kind of service that makes your day!! Also the beds were soooo comfortable I sank right down into the soft sheets and slept like a baby. Dreaming..........

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: AVisitor80126
Reviews.Content: The staff and service are second to none. We would call from the room to the valet and the car was there by the time we arrived. Room was excellent, and the entire hotel is gorgeous. Based on other reviews, we did not eat here. Cannot say enough about the staff. The noise level in the room was acceptable (better than other hotels I have stayed at in San Diego) and turning the fan in the room to medium drowned it out. My one big complaint is $12.95 for internet access. When I can get free wifi at rest areas, coffee shops, etc. this fee is ridiculous. And the $2.00 charge to make an 800 call was a bit petty also. Some reviews spoke of the shady neighborhood. Our room did face the Plaza Hotel, which appears to be a flophouse, so not the best view. But we used the front entrance on Broadway and did not have any issues at all. We walked to the Gaslamp several times from the hotel. Brians 24, a few blocksaway and an easy walk, has an awesome breakfast. If you are arriving by car from the airport on Broadway and using the valet, be aware the entrance is off of 4th Ave and not easily accessible from Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous management”
Reviews.Author: pursuit
Reviews.Content: There are 2 surprising (not in a good way) points about this Starwood hotel which is listed as the only 5 star hotel in this part of San Diego--the location and the staff. Being from NYC I am used to walking by the homeless but not to this degree. It is very unsettling and very surprising that the hotel is in this part of town, although I do not know anything about the history of this area so perhaps it was not always that way. It was unfortunate as I chose to take taxis most places when I would have otherwise walked. The other is that the front desk is managed by college students. Well, they may be older than that but no one looks over the age of 25. Again, shocking for a 5 star hotel. Needless to say, they were very polite but lack the experience and polish expected by the clientele. The management, however, is all 5-star. I had an issue with my room that was resolved the very next day. This is my first time staying at a Starwood property and I was very pleased with the attentiveness and professionalism of the manager. The concierge staff were also very knowledgable and helpful with ongoing events and even last minute opera tickets that were a steal. But for me, should I return for another conference to this area, this would not be my first choice for hotels given the unfortunate location.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every way,”
Reviews.Author: sidney7474
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. Really nice rooms, every person that works here is extremely nice and very helpful. Even though it has been restored they left a lot of the original touches. Ceilings are really high, rooms are very comfortable. The only thing I didn't love was the frosted glass door in the bathroom. Great location, you walk right out to he gas lamp district. The restaurant across the street, the taproom, was excellent! We ate there twice. Also the hash house which is a few minutes away is probably the best breakfast I have ever had. Go hungry!! We loved Coronado and the safari park. Pay extra to go in the pens, we fed giraffes and rhinos, amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “I Was Completely Blown Away at Every Turn”
Reviews.Author: d3johns3
Reviews.Content: After searching through many hotels in San Diego and reading through many reviews I finally decided on this property. I have honestly never been impressed by a hotel like I was with this one. From the moment I approached guest services I was welcomed in a very warm way. The hotel is so impressive and the service is even better. The food was to really die for and the living room is incredibly gorgeous. There is so much history in this hotel and you really need to stay here for a couple nights to really appreciate it. Hats off to the staff at this hotel and I'm sure to be back. Also don't forget to order the French Toast in the restaurtant! Also last thing about parking...Yes it's really high, but it's very much in line with the other hotels in the area. To avoid paying this charge, just park in one of the many lots in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm with Excellent Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: luvwillngrace
Reviews.Content: Oh the US Grant, it's an experience on its own. If you are in San Diego for anything, the US Grant is a must. You will feel its poshness as soon as you step in the building. The valet takes care of you as if you were the only guest there. The rooms are well designed and matches the age of the building, but with all the modern amenities. Now, the shower needs its own review. Because I always stayed at the suite, the shower is pure decadence, and you will definitely want to take some time to shower, at least when your skins starts to wrinkle. I have been here numerous times and it does not disappoint, and yes it can be pricey but it definitely exceeds the cost. Breakfast at the Grant Grill doesn't disappoint either.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: comom08
Reviews.Content: I think I've stayed at some pretty bad hotels in the past b/c this one just blew me away. I read some negative reviews, but really can't agree w/them. The valet, guest services (check-in) and concierge were all great. Our room was beautiful, very clean, very pretty & very comfortable. Yes, the hotel is older, but it's really well-kept. Yes, there is some noise from the city, but duh, you're in a city. Yes, there are some homeless about on the streets, but that's an unfortunate thing in every city. Yes, parking is expensive, but the valet staff were really the best. They had our car ready every time we called down. despite dealing w/weekend crowds & wedding guests. Randy was the best! We had a late check-out and wanted to do some sight-seeing before heading to the airport. He took our bags to our car & kept it waiting in the garage for us. Also, the concierge staff helped me get checked-in for my flight. The only down side I can say was the housekeeping services. I think there was some confusion as to how many ppl were in the room. So, the first night we both received turn-down service, but not so on the 2nd night of our stay. Also, they did not put away the iron & ironing board that we had used in the AM. I've payed over $100/night to stay in some dive hotels, so I thought the rate was reasonable. The location is great for the Gas Lamp district, Harbor, etc.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and still loving it! My favorite hotel in Downtown SD!”
Reviews.Author: Iceberg20
Reviews.Content: The service is just exquisite! I love staying here at the US Grant. Very elegant and very homey at the same time. I always get hooked up with good views from my room and I like the fact that it's right across the Horton Plaza shopping mall and fine dining. The Grant Grill have awesome food! Overall, great experience!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the service and the Food was absolutely fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Rockstar77750
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on Travel Zoo to try lunch at the Hotel. Alberto made our experience extraordinary. We will be back for sure and to impress our friends...

Reviews.Title: “Right where I wanted to be...”
Reviews.Author: davidmasuda
Reviews.Content: Usually trips to SD would involve getting a room at a chain hotel somewhere around Hotel Circle (Mission Valley). This time, I decided to use my Starwood points to book a room at a nicer hotel, in downtown. We chose the US Grant because it reminded us of the St. Francis Hotel in San Francisco- I figured they wouldn't disappoint. They certainly did not. This was the way to travel- it really made out trip special, being in a fancy hotel, right in the downtown/Gas lamp. We caught a Padres game and found the walk quite enjoyable (about 5-6 blocks). The US Grant was right where we wanted to be- no driving necessary. Since I used Starwood Points to redeem the stay, I can't really say if it was worth the price. For the points we used, it was well worth it! (10K per night)

Reviews.Title: “We loved Alberto!”
Reviews.Author: FunintheSunSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We went to the Grant Grill for a special lunch celebration. We had a wonderful time mostly due to Alberto our server. He is profession but also very easy to talk to. Thanks for making our day even more special Alberto. We will be back because of you. Lunch was fabulous too. I had the roasted chicken and my husband had the pastrami sandwich. YUM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great room w lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: bebedani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant after a recommendation from a co-worker. It was great. Turn down service each evening with chocolates on the pillows and your slippers laid out for you. The room is full of charm and decorated beautifully. There is a headboard designed by a comissioned French artist. The beds were soft and comfortable. The room had a minibar and safe. The room did not have a cofee maker, but you can request one from the front desk. The bathroom was nice and had a large shower (no tub) but I never use the tub so I loved it. The location is great as you are right in the Gas Lamp district. The staff was all very nice, and check in/out was easy. Only down side is that there is no parking and you have to valet, which was $35/night. The valets were all very nice and I hope i tipped them well, as several will help at one time and i didnt know who to give the money to!

Reviews.Title: “Smile and smile ...”
Reviews.Author: dominiquejames
Reviews.Content: Blogging about a recent visit to Venice, one published and award-winning author said he couldn't help but "smile and smile." I immediately recognized what it feels like because I felt the very same exact thing when I was at the US Grant. I couldn't help but "smile and smile" that my jaws hurt. So, ok, the US Grant is the lap of luxury, and theater. But it's possible to live it. It is the true meaning of home away from home. It's an amazing experience--wonder, awe, and magic all rolled into one! I'm here in Missouri for a week. The spirit of St. Louis is very strong. I'm opening up my heart to the city. I'm staying at a hotel in St. Louis Frontenac. It's a nice hotel. But after having experienced the US Grant, I now judge each and every hotel I stay in, fairly or unfairly, unwittingly, against a very high but effortless standard. I believe in the saying that "you get what you pay for," but really, I just can't help it. Let me just say this: I miss the US Grant--most keenly when I saw my hotel room here for the very first time and my heart sank (I even have to ask to have my room changed), when I bumped into a very friendly man at the elevator who said he was from San Diego, and, the first night I went to bed without those delicious chewy cookies and fresh milk. And although I cannot fault the front desk and staff of the hotel where I'm staying right now--well-groomed, good-looking, and even gorgeous, always with a ready, genuine and infectious smile, who are friendly, ready, polite, and helpful, and I am satisfied with room service--efficient, quick, always smiling and happy to serve, someone from this hotel has yet to call me by my first name.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Not so great area”
Reviews.Author: Rorick11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, rooms are updated. Nice extra touches (magazines in room) and staff was great. Downside is the location given it is so near to the edge of a less than optimal part of San Diego. It is great for the Gaslamp District but not so good for the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “The service and accommodations were fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sna2ogg
Reviews.Content: I planned a little getaway to San Diego, (from Orange County) for my wife for her birthday. I picked the U.S. Grant because I had previously been there on business for a meeting, but didn't actually stay there. It looked very nice inside and was obviously different than most hotels. I selected a suite and spoke with Demi Ricario and Albert who work in the concierge services. The two of them were fantastic!! They helped me with special arrangements and services to make the weekend extremely special for my wife. Everything from having special items put into the room to having flowers from an outside shop delivered. I couldn't have done it without them. When we arrived, the service was top notch. My wife felt like it was the "Nordstroms" of hotels. The staff was very friendly, they wished my wife a happy birthday and were there for anything that we needed. The room was beautiful, clean and well kept. The rooms were prepped for bed while we were out for dinner and the room service meal was delicious. When we checked out the next day, they made us feel just as special leaving as when we arrived. My wife had a GREAT time and we will definitely be coming back again! Thank you to all fo the U.S. Grant staff for making our visit special and giving my wife a fantastic birthday weekend. You guys are great!!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to the Presidential Suite!”
Reviews.Author: RoseTroy3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the US Grant June 11 -14 and reserved a Landmark Suite with the Taste of Luxury package. When we arrived the receptionist checked for our reservations, asked for a credit card, and disappeared long enough to make me nervous. I even looked up our reservations on my phone while she was gone to give a confirmation #, if needed. When she came back, she said we had been upgraded to the Presidential Suite! I don't know how this happened, but it was awesome! When we first arrived to our suite, we came in on the 10th floor foyer that overlooked the downstairs level (yep, it was 2 levels!). To the right of the foyer was the bedroom and en suite bathroom. It had a king bed with overstuffed chair and ottoman along with a padded bench and flat screen TV. The bathroom only had one sink, but it was a raised pewter sink that was beautiful. The huge walk-in shower was nice as well. The stair leading to the 9th floor were trimmed in wrought iron and the flooring was dark walnut hardwood. On the lower level was a large open space with six chairs placed around the room, a blue velvet couch, and a desk. To the left of this was a butler's pantry that lead to a dining room with a table for six. There was also a half bath on this floor and, if needed, a king size room that could be purchased to make this a 2 bedroom suite. There was also a huge balcony overlooking the front of the hotel. We were blown away with the beautiful chandeliers and art work that was in this suite. They were impressive! SInce we bought the taste of luxury package, we ate breakfast every morning at the US Grill. It was fancy, but not stuffy. The waiters were helpful on answering any questions about the food selection and even gave us tips on what to do and places to eat in certain parts of San Diego. The concierge was also helpful. We made the mistake of buying wine to take back home and didn't ship it, not realizing that now WE had to get it home without it breaking and ruining our luggage. The concierge gave us bubble wrap and also helped with our San Diego Zoo tickets and dinner reservations. Overall, this was a wonderful trip. The only thing I would have changed was the price of parking. At $32 a night, plus tipping every time we left and came back with the car, it was REALLY expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: wanderingfork
Reviews.Content: Spent four (4) nights at the hotel. Although in the heart of the Gaslight District, it is secure and a room key is required in the elevator to access the room floors. Plush carpets in the hall keep hall noise down, however you are in the middle of downtown, so there are sirens and some partying at the street level which echos up - including shouting, sirens, cars with heavy bass levels on their sound systems. I had a really good rate for the hotel as part of a conference. I don't know if I would pay the regular rates to stay again in terms of the property itself, but the service was on par with the Carlyle and other five star establishments. I still become frustrated with paying for internet access ($11.95/day) when I can get it for free at mid-level hotels. I was double charged for internet access on a couple of days, presumably due to a glitch. (I have contacted the hotel to get the issue resolved.) Valet is $32/day. The hotel is centrally located and very convenient to all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for all”
Reviews.Author: Cookie710
Reviews.Content: The ballrooms are a little challenging with large pillars - but the staff was amazing in helping us work out the logistical issues and were always at my side whenever I needed the slightest thing. The food was amazing - delicious and well presented. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location - all in all, would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “blood on the sheets”
Reviews.Author: skitowin
