Reviews.Content: When I checked in, all seemed in order. When we pulled down the sheets of the bed that night we found blood on the sheets. The people at the desk offered to change our room but the kids were already in their bed. (we looked carefully at theirs too, no problem there.) So I had the housekeeping staff come up to change the bedding. This took nearly an hour. No call from a manager. In the morning as I checked out the staff did not have any idea about what transpired. They offered to take the parking charges off of the bill. No manager came out to discuss this and I received no call from anyone. Not happy, no not at all.

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: g0lfer059
Reviews.Content: We went to the Grant Grill for lunch. The service was outstanding. Our food was so good! We will try dinner there some time. The prices are what you'd expect for a hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding food and service!”
Reviews.Author: krchap5
Reviews.Content: We ate Father's Day lunch at the Grant Grill. It was the best restaurant experience we have had in a very long time. The service was wonderful from the time we pulled up, until we left. The valets were friendly and courteous and our waiter, Alberto, was excellent. Alberto gave great food suggestions. He spoke to us professionally yet made us feel as comfortable as family. The food was amazing. We are Starwood members who live in San Diego so we know we have many options. We are looking forward to coming back to the US Grant!.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel; great service.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMike067
Reviews.Content: This was our first time here and were delighted with the hotel. The location was very good, near many things to do and great restaurants. The service, from the housekeeping to the concierge to the front desk, were all very nice and very efficient. I called ahead to have a bouquet delivered for my wife's birthday and we were stunned at the arrangement for the price. We splurged on breakfast in the room and had a great time (not cheap, though). I'd stay here again if we visit SD.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel; great service.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMike067
Reviews.Content: This was our first time here and were delighted with the hotel. The location was very good, near many things to do and great restaurants. The service, from the housekeeping to the concierge to the front desk, were all very nice and very efficient. I called ahead to have a bouquet delivered for my wife's birthday and we were stunned at the arrangement for the price. We splurged on breakfast in the room and had a great time (not cheap, though). I'd stay here again if we visit SD.

Reviews.Title: “Normally 4 star but...”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the lobby was particularly inviting. We stayed in a mini-suite, which was really just a room with a couple of chairs, certainly not what you would define as a mini-suite.. The bathroom was huge. The bed was comfortable and the room spotlessly clean. So why just 3 stars? How about $32 park your car (the valets were particularly nice, but that doesn't make up for the exorbitant price). How about $11.95 for internet access? How about a Jacuzzi bathtub that you need a stool to get in to? How about windows and walls that are paper thin? We have stayed at many different locations in Downtown San Diego. Unless the price is really attractive it won't be here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service - Service - Service”
Reviews.Author: VCBILL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the US Grant to attend a family members wedding. Too bad the rating system only goes to 5 because I would give the US Grant solid “Tens” in all categories. From the moment we arrived the car valets, yes there more than one, immediately helped with our baggage and helped us to the lobby. Upon reaching the front desk we were greeted by Sergio who could not have been more accommodating by getting us check-in to our room, even though we were a bit early. Once we had our keys Brook helped us to our room and was the perfect guild to help us by point out the rooms features and a bit of hotel history. We especially enjoyed telling us about the unique art work and its one-of-a-kind commission by the artist. Thank you again for making our quick stay such a success and so much fun. By the way, the wedding we attended was perfect! In large part to the fantastic staff at the US Grant

Reviews.Title: “BEST TRIP”
Reviews.Author: milka911
Reviews.Content: Thank you so very much for all of your hospitality! Our stay was amazing! Your hotel is beautiful! We enjoyed staying there. The king bed was so comfortable and the room was great with the view of the Gaslamp area. Thank you for the "special" touches of cookies, strawberries, milk, and the sweet note you wrote. Also, each person on your staff was so friendly and helpful. My mom had the BEST time! Thank you for giving her this amazing experience. She wanted to extend our stay!! I look forward to hopefully seeing you again some day.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Impressed”
Reviews.Author: bahdlb
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure to stay two nights in a Landmark suite for a mini-vacation. Due to our schedule we also dined at the hotel on three occasions. Room - Due to our original room type not being ready by check-in time the hotel staff quickly upgraded us to the aforementioned suite. Lucky us! To say the least we were quite comfortable and the king bed made with luxury linens was a treat. Dining - We had two breakfasts and one dinner at the hotel and were impressed with the variety and quality of the food. The attention to detail and the freshness of ingredients was appreciated. Often, pricey hotel food is bland and formulaic. That was certainly not the case here. Service - We can't say enough about the positive attitude, quick responses and thorough training of the staff. Everyone we encountered appeared ready to help and selfless in the service they provided. Overall - We would return to The US Grant without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “I would not choose anywhere else in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LindaBamford
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beaten and the Grant Grill has great atmosphere & food.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical cookie cutter, but watch out for noisy street side rooms”
Reviews.Author: MikeN_Omaha
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for its location. The location ended up being great. It is close to all San Diego attractions. The hotel also apparently recently went through a major renovation. You can tell from the common areas. The rooms are also very nicely done. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. This is certainly not a cookie cutter big chain hotel. My only complaint is the noise from the street outside. Even with the windows shut, I could hear lots of noise and commotion outside. My travel companion was located in another location in the hotel and had no noise issues

Reviews.Title: “Historic Beauty”
Reviews.Author: CdnSingle
Reviews.Content: The hotel restaurant is excellent, do check it out and indulge a little. The lobby is lovely and the location perfect. Its is right across the street from Horton Plaza, where you can catch the city tour bus, an easy walk to the Harbour, Little Italy and Gastown is right there. I asked for a higher level floor based on the previous reviews and found noise not at all a problem. There are homeless people around, but on a very small scale compared to most cities. San Diego's downtown is busy in the evening yet very laidback for a large city. Beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barmills26
Reviews.Content: We wanted an historic hotel in the center of town. This fits the bill and then some. All the staff - hotel and restaurant - were wonderfully trained and incredibly helpful. The concierges were so knowledgeable and in the restaurant Alberto,Sean, and Ike were super. I like too that the local native American nation owns the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Bearister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the US Grant for a 3 night fun trip in San Diego. The hotel is older but has beautifully renovated. The that impressed us the most was the service for the staff in every area. You felt as if you were among friends. If you choose to dine in the restaurant, ask for Alberto -- he was our favorite! The Swains

Reviews.Title: “Better than outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: amymineiro
Reviews.Content: We recently moved to the San Diego area, but hadn't even gone downtown yet. So, for our 18th anniversary, my husband surprised me with a stay at the US Grant. I have never taken the time to write a review like this, but couldn't let the excellent treatment we received go unnoticed. We love historic hotels, and we fully expected it to be to be great...but oh my gosh! I can't say enough about the service we received at every turn. Demi had helped my husband set up this surprise with flowers and strawberries in the room ahead of time, and she was ready and waiting for us when we checked in! After getting to our room (which was so lovely...see the pictures online) we realized there might be a noise issue from the neighbors. As my husband has a medical condition and really needs his sleep, we went back down to ask about possibly switching rooms. Raymond, who had checked us in, didn't hesitate a moment to not only switch it for us...but upgraded us to an even better room! Every concern was for us as the guest, and we felt so well taken care of. The next morning, he was quick to ask if it had worked out all right, and if my husband had slept well...knowing it was a factor of his condition. Breakfast at the Grant Grill was not only delicious, but Alberto our server was one of the most delightful we have ever had. So friendly, and since we arrived early and we were his only table, he spent extra time chatting with us and answering our many questions about the area, the hotel, and such. A fantastic start to the day. I don't want to leave anyone out, because all the staff was really over the top. Our valet Carlos helped us out several times with special requests, and even had bottled water waiting for us when we came back from walking down to the water. A great guy doing a great job. Anthony helped us when we switched rooms, and also very cheerfully spent time answering questions we had on more than one occasion. (Hint: He does tours of the hotel I found out, so I would definitely recommend asking for him!) Lee Ann at the concierge desk was very patient and happy to help when we grilled her for dinner reservations...which she set up for us as well. The quality of the hotel is excellent to begin with, but we wanted to recognize the caliber of their staff. We have never encountered such consistently excellent people who were so ready and happy to serve however it was needed. It was the best "get away" we have ever had because of them, and we actually met with the hotel manager to thank him in person. And by the way, he was great too! But we weren't surprised! Thank you again to everyone at the US Grant for making it the best anniversary in 18 years. No question at all that we will return many more times. You make it a fantastic home away from home for your guests, and we are very happy to have met you all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but would consider others next time”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler884
Reviews.Content: The U.S. Grant is a charming older hotel in the Gaslamp district of San Diego. While it is close to shopping, dining and other attractions, I felt the hotel lacked a few things and didn't pay alot ot detail. For instance, ithe hotel only has one restaurant, which the service was not very good and I did not enjoy the meal. The food was bland and it took more than 45 minutes to get a burger when their were 3 patrons in the restaurant. The mini bar in my room was in disrepair. There was no real atmosphere in the lobby, just very quiet and a little stuffy. Also, there wasn't a do not disturb button or door tag, so starting at 7 a.m. housekeeping kept knocking on my door which was annoying. Also i could hear a lot from the room next door. I will say, the hotel associates at the front desk were very pleasant and I enjoyed their service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Jlopez36
Reviews.Content: Staying at the US Grant in their signature suite was the best hotel experience I've ever had. The concierge was so helpful on many matters; quick responses from reservations, housekeeping, room service, technicians, bellmen, the valet etc. Rooms were extremely clean, bedding and beds were amazing. So worth the money and then some. Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodation and service was incredible.”
Reviews.Author: Ian255320
Reviews.Content: After spending a month in California and Las Vegas and sampling many wonderful Hotels this was by far the best, not just because of the great location, beautiful rooms and decor but the attentive service from the staff especially Pablo and Alberto was well over and above anywhere else on our entire holiday. I would and have recommended this hotel to anyone travelling in Southern California it was great place to stay,eat and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Happy2Travel_123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Room was nice, clean. Was by myself and did not spend a lot of time in the room, so it was cozy for one - would have been very cramped with 2 people. Great room service & food. Service was excellent, check in was quick and pleasant. Great location - across from shopping mall. The on-site restaurant was pretty good, but check out other dining options in the area, for the value. I would give the hotel another try if I am in the area again. Enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: aftrans
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the US Grant was a fantastic experience. We were upgraded on arrival and our room on the top floor had upgrades that I haven't even seen in home improvement magazines. The views over San Diego and the water were outstanding! The lobby is elegant and the nearness to the Gaslamp District was just an added bonus. I don't know what the other rooms are like but the next time we're in San Diego, I plan to find out!

Reviews.Title: “Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: CaliMaroc
Reviews.Content: You will be treated like royalty here! Beautiful lobby and rooms with great customer service. We had forgotten a couple things from our car and they got it for us and brought it to our room. We also forgot our iPhone chargers at home and they let us borrow one! We were facing the street with a beautiful view, however if you want complete silence then I recommend a room that doesn't face the street. I didn't mind it, the whole experience was great! We will come again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice for Luxury, Service, and Location”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: My first stay here. Centrally located right at Gas Lamp district. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Quiet hotel inside and out. Lobby furnishings a little dated, but heck the place is 100 years old. Smiles and greetings from all staff. Bar area was very pleasant to sit and read in the morning with free newspapers and complimentary tea or coffee. Elevators were small but no waiting. Suite room was large with huge bathroom and first quality linens and towels. Bose radio was a nice touch. Overall, very pleased with my selection. As a Platinum SPG number, got the upgrade and points, so could not be happier. The only negative was the outrageous price to use the business center computer. No need to charge 50 cents a minute plus printing costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bttravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: Nothing but positive things to say about The US Grant - hotel staff were exceptional from doormen to check-out. Our room was large, well-appointed and clean and was reliably cleaned every day of our stay, with thoughtful touches. The hotel itself is elegant and well-located: literally across the street from multiple restaurants, bars, even an outdoor mall. Located at the NW corner of the Gaslamp, it's close enough to reach everything in the Gaslamp by foot, but far enough that it is not affected by the incessant noise of the nightlife. We requested (and received) a room not facing the street and were happy with it - though the doors themselves could use some sound-proofing as noise in the hallways tends to bleed through into the rooms. The hotel is also a long, but certainly manageable, walk to the USS Midway and the Coronado ferry. I would definitely recommend the US Grant to others and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: tridout
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the US Grant. The room was huge and the quality of amenities and services excellent. It is also an ideal location to access a cruise ship, downtown, or Balboa Park and its museums. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: jodilig
Reviews.Content: May daughter and I cam to San Diego to celebrate our birthdays. I have to say that the staff at the US Grant are simply wonderful. The concierge's were extremely helpful, informative and very nice. They helped us find our way around the city! The room was lovely and we could have not asked for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed with the entire staff! (Manager, front desk, bar, wait staff, bellman...)”
Reviews.Author: jimmyo58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grant Hotel with my wife for a one day "get away". Everything exceeded our expectations! Comfortable room, great dinner and breakfast, but most of all the wonderful staff! I work in the hospitality business, and it was refreshing to experience an entire staff that were so pleasant and accommadating. Every employee seemed glad to be there, and in turn, made my wife and I glad that we were also there! Thanks everyone for making our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great, relaxing and beautiful haven.”
Reviews.Author: elyse55
Reviews.Content: I loved this experience! I am a Native American Indian and most places where I have stayed that are luxury are also pretentious, but the staff here are very kind, helpful and down to earth. They made me feel very welcome. I have never enjoyed such a place as this before! The room was exceptionally clean! I usually do not sleep well in a strange bed, but I slept like a baby in your bed. The only downfall was the fan noise during the night, for at some points it would wake us. The food was incredible! The room service was exceptional as well. The staff in the dining room was very attentive. My husband and I were impressed with the service we received from Jason and Ceasar! Both of these gentlemen made us feel welcome and at home, while being very attentive and professional. Amazing service! I truely want and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Skool hotel at it's very, very best!”
Reviews.Author: Gilbertodepiento
Reviews.Content: Smack dab in the center of downtown just across the street from Horton Plaza. Couldn't ask for a better location in San Diego. We were upgraded to a massive suite and it was simply perfect. Great couple of nights rest with amazing service during our time here. You're paying... but it's worth it in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay at a great price in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pmartin63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in a corner "city-view" room for our 24th anniversary. The room was spacious and beautiful at a great price(buy 2 nights get the 3rd night free). From the moment we checked in, the staff was courteous and made us feel like their most important guests. The concierge was great for breakfast recommendations (we had our dinners already reserved) and the location is terrific for Gaslight Quarter and Harbor destinations! The complimentary champagne and chocolates/strawberries set the tone for a great weekend..we both thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay AFTER I switched rooms”
Reviews.Author: la_jazz_girl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel over my usual SD one because the photos looks amazing and I love historic buildings. When I first checked in just before 5 p.m., I was given Room 322. I walked in and immediately walked out. The room was tiny, cramped and, worst of all, it was side by side with the roof. If you looked up, you saw the other "wing" of the hotel. But if you stood up looking straight out, you were eye to eye and inches away from the roof of the center of the hotel. The absolute worst "view" imaginable. (Wish that I had taken a photo for you.) I was extremely disappointed. That said, when I went downstairs to ask for another room, I was immediately given a new room assignment and it was a wonderful room. Plenty of space, nice, open windows, etc. I loved the 2nd room and wished that I could have extended my stay (but couldn't due to business). My only complaints are: (1) that they tried to assign me to Room 322 in the first place, (2) not a biggie, but turndown service didn't happen, (3) again, not a biggie, but I was charged for valet parking even though I didn't drive there (quickly taken off my bill upon request), and (4) water pressure on "rain" shower was very low and there were no other settings. Otherwise, the decor and amenities are fabulous and I'd definitely stay again -- but I would make sure to confirm in advance which room I'd get.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant, "Best stay I have experienced"”
Reviews.Author: xxxxx54
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for business for some time now. This was the first time I stayed at your hotel while I was in San Diego. My first impression upon entering the hotel was the elegant old world charm it reflected. From check in to check out your staff could not have been more accommodating or gracious. I was immediately upgraded to a larger suite without even asking. It was the most comfortable, cleanest, room I have been in. The service was beyond expectations and made a business trip seem more like a vacation. I will continue to stay and recommend the US Grant whenever I am in San Diego. I will also look for any Starwood Luxury properties in any city I will be traveling to. You should be proud of your hotel and your staff, Kudos to all.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel! top notch”
Reviews.Author: rchandler240
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is top notch when it comes to service and comfort. Maybe I am just not used to someone brining me ice and bottled water in the evenings, and after working all day its a breath of fresh air. It seems they have thought of everything! one word of advice...if you want to work in your room, dont get in the bed! if you do I promise you will fall asleep before even getting your computer booted up!

Reviews.Title: “No Place Better in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SBpicky
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called Hollie in sales to book five rooms for four days, to the moment I checked in with Sergio to the moment I checked out, everything and every request was perfect. The hotel is immaculately restored, the staff are attentive to every detail, the rooms are beautiful, the location is perfect, the gym is great, the bar is beautiful and the Happy Hour is a bargain. Thank you for making a very stressful trip for me and my staff a perfect respite from all of the work we had to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbacusTT
Reviews.Content: The U.S. Grant is a grand hotel. Conveniently located in center city and near everything. With a great lobby with high ceiling chandlers and spacious comfortable seating. Staff is very accommodating and friendly. Great people to ask for assistance. Rooms are modern, clean and comfortable although the bathroom was a bit small. Cocktails and dinner in there grill was excellent. Try the "last cocktail" the only thing that needs improvement is the coffee shop near the front entrance. Sunday Morning coffee was not really hot and the bagels were dried out and stale. A little work is necessary here. But otherwise, great spot and do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: PCHan888
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Landmark Suite. What a great space?!! We enjoyed the room but thought it was odd that there were only two trash cans in the whole suite and they weren't in great locations. No trash can by the sink? Also, no entry closet for jackets, shoes, etc. And it was impossible to get cold water. Our sink only offered very warm and boiling hot water. Again, minor items but we can't rate this as "excellent" with these basic shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “The elegance of The US Grant offers a warm & inviting atmosphere, making me feel exquisite & relaxed while on vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Yogini31
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at The US Grant Hotel. It is so luxurious and elegant with wonderful service. I look forward to going back and staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Demandthebest
Reviews.Content: With one exception (a mistake they put right very quickly) we had a superb stay here. If you like city life then this hotel is close to the best of what San Diego has to offer. Their bar is also great and the staff are as good as I've encountered. This was out first visit to San Diego and we're fairly sure that one of the reasons we want to return soon is our experience at The US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: fozzetti
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a tremendous hotel. By far the most luxurious downtown option I have stayed in. The US Grant's service rivals any hotel I've stayed in, any where in the world. The rooms were terrific and main areas of the hotel are beautiful. The food at the Grant Grill was spectacular. I can't say enough good things about this place. All of this at a tremendous value for the quality of the stay and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Family Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Fieldbus
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel, room and the service was awesome. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: BusheyHeath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Christmas holidays before we took our cruise. On checking in we were greeted by the concierge and receptionist. Without asking we were informed that we were being upgraded to one of their Signature Suites, what a pleasant surprise!!! We were only there for 2 days but each time we entered and left the hotel we were greeted by name, the staff were all excellent and we would stay there any time we were in San Diego, weel done the US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “As Close to Perfect as I've Experienced”
Reviews.Author: adman1010
Reviews.Content: We selected the US Grant because of its location, but after experiencing it, I'd select it even if it was well out of the way. The room was spacious, the bathroom was outstanding. The staff treated us as if we were a guest in their home. We had dinner at the Grant Grill, where the food and service couldn't have been better. We returned to the Grant Grill twice -- fairly remarkable since we were there less thna 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, not very good at cleaning though”
Reviews.Author: peacock88
Reviews.Content: Did not clean or replenish the wine glasses. Left lights on all over the place. Too hot, could not cool the room down enough

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is definitely at the top of our list & surpasses the Beverly Wilshire Hotel in terms of comfort & room staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne_Henandez
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a superior room with view, the accomodations were very comfortable, clean and the room was tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed luxury”
Reviews.Author: snusos
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Rooms were not huge but very well appointed. Robes, slippers, nice toiletries, turndown service, etc., Staff were very helpful and professional but without that forced "corporate" feel that some hotel staff has. The lobby and building in general is gorgeous. Well located in the Gaslamp District. The Grant Grill is pricey but food was lovely (try the Shrimp Frittata for brekkie. Yum!) Only complaint about the room is that the bathroom layout does not leave much room for storage of personal items, and the semi transparent bathroom door is distracting. Otherwise, an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at The US Grant made my day perfect.”
Reviews.Author: pcarter657
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a day only but was able to have lunch at the US Grant. The food was very good but the staff was wonderful. Just the right amount of attention and very generous with information where we had business interests that coincided. I would go back to spend a night or two just enjoying San Diego and the US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: anony12
Reviews.Content: Our stay was one of the craziest. From the moment, check out was at 3 we arrived 3:15 and we waited till 4:45 around then to get the room. (While we waited they let us have drinks on the house!). Next we enter our room which was a "surprise" for my husband so i wanted it to be beautiful and spacious with a jacuzzi, but sadly it was really tiny and barely any room to move but it was nice and I was content. So as it was night time we came to turn on the jacuzzi and it was splashing everywhere wasnt pouring into the tub properly turns out its NOT FUNCTIONING properly!!!!! That was a huge disappointment since I did pay around 280 only for the jacuzzi. So I called them and they sent someone up then apologized and moved us to pent house-which actually wasnt nice at all:/ but my husband liked it so the jacuzzi was cool but IT WASNT working also the tools inside to keep water warm and lights werent working and the water kept gettin cold and draining out quick! then we just gave up telling them and went to sleep. Next morning they gave us complimentary bfast to make up for the chaos. Then we called to ask for a couple of hours in a functional jacuzzi as to make up for the past rooms. So they finally gave us a room 2 hours later and let us have 4 hrs in it, now this was the room i wanted in the first place!!!! Large spacious king bed, with FUNCTIONAL jacuzzi (but the lights weren't working but the warmer was so it worked) and we had the best time in those 4 hours if only we had that room to start with! It was supposed to be relaxation but 4 hrs was all we got:/! That was my stay! Last 4 hours made it for us! Oh and when its ur anniversary which it was for us(not sure if id go again during anniversary) u get amazing stawberry covered choclates mmmm!

Reviews.Title: “The US Grant is an Enchanting Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mariparrot
Reviews.Content: Great weekend getaway! We love the hotel and evening music in the bar. Lots to see in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Like home, but better..."”
Reviews.Author: Jodandrea
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the US Grant. The rooms were as comfortable as home, but better; with friendly staff, wonderful food and very helpful concierge service. We will be making the US Grant our home away from home whenever we are in the San Diego area. Thank you so much for the wonderful hospitality. It's a beautiful and luxuriuos place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Lyubs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip with 2 kids (ages 7 and 14) to San Diego. The purpose of the trip was zoo/SeaWorld/LegoLand visits. US Grant is located very convenient to public transportation, 1 block away from Transportation Center, 15 min walk from the harbor, 10 min ($12) ride from the airport. Our room was facing the "terrace" and was very very quiet. The lobby of the hotel looks beautiful. Staff was very accommodating to all of our questions about the area (restaurants, taxis etc). Hotel itself smells a little musty but is amazingly clean. It seems like the carpets are vacuumed every day (all of the hotel is carpeted)! The room itself was very neat, cleaned twice a day. When we left a tip for the cleaning lady we got a Thank you note back. We are glad we picked US Grant as a place to stay in San Diego and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay so much we extended it!”
Reviews.Author: MusicalMinds
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay here two days, but loved it so much we stayed an extra night. The hotel is incredible -the food, service, decoration, architecture. The food was so incredible that we ate in the Grant Grill 4 times during the 3 nights I stayed there! The twice-daily maid service was a lovely surprise. Easy access to public transportation-the blue ine trolley stopped just outside the back of the hotel, and numerous buses were in front. Check out the shopping mall across the street-it's so interesting architecturally!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: FlygirlSydney
Reviews.Content: As an SPG (Starwood Prefered Guest)member my husband and I stayed here for one night before we embarked on a cruise from the nearby pier. Location wise it was extremely convenient. I couldn't fault the staff or the cleanliness of the rooms however the property has some major flaws. As it is a heritage listed building they are not allowed to install new windows so you hear everything, from the town drunk screaming at 2am to the emergency service sirens screeching every 20 mins. It got to midnight and we had to call the front desk to send up earplugs. Also There was no bathtub which I thought was not of the standard of a Starwood Luxury class hotel. On the plus side the bed was very comfortable. All in all a very disappointing experience

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel, you won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Shrubber1
Reviews.Content: I am fussy. I am picky. I am critical. I am demanding. I travel a lot. I expect great service. I liked the US GRANT... a lot! We paid $250 per night (plus tax) which was a lot cheaper than the rates quoted by the Hard Rock, the Omni, the Hilton and the Marriott. It's not the cheapest but so what. If you want to spend $99 for a Holiday Inn or a chain hotel then go for it. We wanted something with character, history, beautiful architecture and top quality service. The food is great, the staff are great and the building is stunning. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant suite”
Reviews.Author: CAH2-14
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, roomy suite which was very clean. Great location and easy to walk most every where. Enjoyed to coffee bar each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: immarshall
Reviews.Content: The employees were, without exception curtious, friendly and welcoming. They are a great bunch. Th evalet was extraordinary and better than the concierge at knowledge of the area. The room was way too small and especially being represented as a suite (807). That is not a suite! Shame on you. The hidden fees found on our bill gave us the notion we will not come back nor recommend friends. One can stay out of the downtown and evade this clear taxation without representation. Your food costs are out of line and far wide of the mark for those traveling for pleasure The wine bottle being out is too brazen for our tastes in commerce. It is outrageous that you ask me to certify my opinions when you blatantly do not have a suite you are selling as a suite. And I certify that opinion.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego - Great City!”
Reviews.Author: DSHawk
Reviews.Content: The location of the US Grant is perfect for touring the city. Everything was within walking distance and if it wasn't we hopped on the Trolley which was located right behind the hotel. The hotel itself has been beautifully renovated and was very clean. The staff were pleasant and very helpful. My only complaint is the cost of valet parking at $32 per day - it's more than I paid for one nights stay. There is lots to do and see in the city - we did not run out of things to do during our week long visit. Great shopping and resturants. The zoo is a must see. You see quite a few homeless people on the streets; not once were we bothered by them. Great Beach on Coronado Island which is a short Trolley ride.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Elegant, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryan_tina09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love San Diego. This was our fist time staying at the US Grant. Its a very beautiful, remodeled hotel in the heart of Downtown. My only complaint is the $32.00 for parking and the prices for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Experience is worth a thousand words.”
Reviews.Author: TerryLow
Reviews.Content: I came to the US Grant with high expectations. The photos looked wonderful and I thought it would be higher end luxury. I came for the Gran Fondo San Diego and had my bike shipped to the hotel. The hotel handled the package and even delivered to my room which was fantastic, thank you. The rooms are tiny. I'm talking S.F. room tiny. With my wife and a one year old, plus a crib, we were tripping over ourselves. The photos weren't exactly aligned with my expectations. The lobby is gorgeous, but the room and upper floors are older, with a touch of remodel. The biggest thing my wife and I were unaware of was the street noise. The sirens from police, ambulance, and fire is super loud. You can also hear people partying from the Gaslamp district. Drunk people yelling and laughing all throughout the night. If you're looking for a restful sleep, you'll have a hard time. Especially if your baby wakes up in the middle of the night. The rooms are very clean and the service is excellent. All the staff is very helpful, especially the bellhop and valet guy. I felt semi-rested for my 100-mile bike ride on Sunday, but would have preferred to been fresh from a good nights rest. Another thing about the location is the homeless. There are homeless people everywhere. Plus, they sleep right on the sidewalks in rows next to each other. Safety is a factor since I have my wife and child, so I would not recommend a romantic walk after 9pm. There are a lot of good restaurants within walking distance so you can walk or I'd prefer to take a cab if I didn't have a car. The hotel is central to everything, but maybe to central for us. I think next time, we'll look for a hotel 15 minutes outside of Downtown so it's more peaceful and less stressful. Business center is free if you have your own laptop. No free wi-fi is available in the room. I haven't understood that yet. Stay at a cheap hotel and it's free, but stay at a premium and you pay? Hmm. Also parking is valet and $30+ dollars a day. I think it's worth it considering there isn't much place to park in the congested Downtown area. Last thing, I was very excited to be able to take a bath with my 1 year old and take him swimming. Just a basic expectation without having read all the features and amenities. That was my fault. When I got there, I was disappointed on both counts. None of these features are available. Had to give my 13 month old son a stand-up shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: susansbusd
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a beautiful hotel in a location perfect for night life, dining and shopping. Close to transportation and convenient to airport. Service is excellent. All amenities are extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected delight!”
Reviews.Author: jessie0485
Reviews.Content: I don't usually leave comments about my travel experiences, but my stay at the US Grant was so exceptional that I feel compelled to tell others about this wonderful hotel. From the lovely decor in the lobby, to the warm and friendly staff, to the amazingly quiet and spacious rooms and comfy bed, I actually had to force myself to head out to the convention center. My husband swore that the restaurant served the best hamburger he had ever eaten. I didn't expect such a treat given that the price was so low relative to most of the area hotels....if your plans take you to San Diego, this hotel is a great place to stay. (I promise, I don't work for the hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: swong32
Reviews.Content: What an incredible property! So luxurious and comfortable without the pomp and ceremony. We have always resisted staying at the US Grant since, with young children, a swimming pool was alway de rigeur. However, this time we got away with a booking at the US Grant because we were only stopping through San Diego for one day. Well, after that one day, my kids want to return, despite there not being a swimming pool! Now, that's impressive (my kids and the hotel)!.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service - Would 100% Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Jennybee18
Reviews.Content: We had over 100 of our employees at this facility last week for a conference with over 50 staying in rooms. The service was flawless, the conference rooms were beautiful and well set up, the hotel rooms were fantastic, and when 40 employees had to wait over 2 hours for a late bus in the lobby, the hotel went above and beyond to make them comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for business conferences or leisure - it's located in the gaslamp district within walking distance of many great restaurants. A+

Reviews.Title: “We Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: S_M_Calif_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, excellent location. We were most impressed with the staff. They were very helpfull and most of all very polite. We were really taken with Maria in the breakfast buffet dining room. She was curtious & prompt and knew all of us on a first name basis. Impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but mediocre food and a problematic shower.”
Reviews.Author: Kencfox
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a gorgeous, historic hotel that I have stayed at before, but this time we got put in what seemed to be a more handicapped accessible room. The biggest disadvantage to this was the shower which was configured so that you can't help flooding the bathroom floor. We were also very let down by the pricey and frankly pretty bad breakfast we got from room service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, elegant, meticulous service. It exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: PickMi
Reviews.Content: We took a last-minute anniversary trip and chose the US Grant by reputation. We were a little wary that the price (affordable) meant it would be more shabby chic than super chic. But we were very pleasantly surprised. From the bellhops and room service, to valet and housecleaning, everything came faster than promised, was grander than advertised, was more helpful than requested, and completely worry-free. We travel extensively and appreciate quality accommodations. It's challenging to have a diverse staff bring their "A" game every day, but our four-day stay didn't encounter a single hole. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe you can't do better in the city..”
Reviews.Author: SurfergurlEast
Reviews.Content: Public spaces are beautiful, the location is good (albeit a little sketchy) and the breakfast that came with booking through AmEx was fabulous but I wouldn't say that we felt all that welcome. Something went wrong with booking so we ended up with a couple of double beds instead of a king. The Grant was full so they couldn't change it. I forgive them but the telephone calls confirming "You'll be checking out shortly, RIGHT?" made me feel like "don't let the door hit your butt on your way out." Mixed drinks for $12 were weak. Stick with beer and wine or head out. Its a pretty spot for a city hotel but I've been spoiled by better treatment elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Do Better”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you just fall in love right away. This is old world class right on the edge of the Gaslamp with very proper service and elegance dripping from every crystal on every chandelier. Yet somehow it's not stuffy. It's amazing how some places can pull that off. I only spent one night here, but managed to explore most of the hotel. For whatever reason, I was upgraded from a Deluxe room to a Signature Suite (they did seem to pay particular attention to Starwoods Preferred status) and now I'm ruined for all time. If I stay here again, I would pay to have the suite again. The decor is beautiful with the large swirl murals behind the bed, the plush furniture and the detail in the woodwork. The sig suites are basically a large room split in half between sleeping and living areas separated by a half-wall with arches over them. There's a dining table with its own mini-chandelier plus a conversation grouping of a desk, sofa, and armless easy chair. The bathroom is the crowning glory--a wonderful open space with long counter and two enormous porcelain bowl sinks. And then the shower--I would have been happy to pull a cot in there and have that be my room. It's about 36 square feet with an L-shaped bench and about six shower heads that will spritz you from several angles and levels. The Grant Grill has a very classic hotel bar feel, which is one of my favorite things. They also have a great happy hour daily from 4-8 when the small bites menu is half price and there are wine and beer specials. Fantastic. Service throughout was smooth and quite solicitous. Everyone was a pleasure to interact with. The only awkward thing about the place is that the valet entrance is on the back side of the lobby, meaning you enter all the way across from the hotel registration area. However, logistics kind of dictate this given that you wouldn't want to try to handle hotel traffic out front on busy Broadway. The trolley stops immediately behind the hotel on C street, so public transport is easy. It's a pleasant 10-minute stroll down to the Broadway Pier. The Westgate Hotel is directly next door, and despite the fact that it kind of looks like the apartment building on "The Jeffersons", it's been redone with ornate elegance inside. Tried the bar in there as well, which is smaller and a little stuffy-feeling for my taste. The Grant Grill was far superior.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MrStrider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for the weekend for a getaway from the kids and work. The hotel was in a perfect location. Restaurants, clubs and the Balboa Park all in walking or taxi range. The employees were all top notch! Mark, the chief concierge, was a pleasure and all the advise he gave was correct. If you want the best burger in town, go to Nicky Rottens! Thanks, Mark! Last, but not least, the beds were heaven on earth! It was like sleeping on a cloud on steroids!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: tjaeckel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiance in January this year. The hotel is centrally located in downtown San Diego and everything around is very walkable. Rooms are very spacious and beautifully furnished. Very comfortable beds (we had a huge King bed with lots of pillows) and nice design in general. Street noise can be heard sometimes as the hotel building is 100+ years old. There has however been put a lot of attention to detail during the recent renovation. The staff was very friendly and professional and the concierge was extremely helpful in providing tips for places to visit that are a little different from the main tourist things to do. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again asap when in San Diego next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel In A Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: goodshink
Reviews.Content: This is a old hotel with a modern look. The hotel is very clean but the rooms are very small. The hotel is within walking distance of the Gas lamp Quarters. The parking is a little expensive $32.00 a night for Valet service. The only complaint I would have is there is no pool on site.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences ever!”
Reviews.Author: margie1019
Reviews.Content: This is truly a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the hotel staff is second to none. We have stayed at many luxury hotels around the world and none have been able to obtain the same level of quality as the US Grant. This was our second time staying at this hotel, and we will return again. It is the perfect place to stay if you are wanting to enjoy the hotel amenities while also being within walking distance to all of downtown San Diego. One thing to note, this is definitely a city hotel. I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for a poolside summer vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but where's the sunlight?”
Reviews.Author: ciaocat
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay locally for my birthday so we decided on the US Grant. We are SPG Platinum members and got upgraded to a suite so it was definitely a nice plus. The suite was somewhat cozy so I wonder how a regular room may look like. Also we were afraid to pull up our window shades because our outside view was straight into someone else's room or bathroom. Overall, the room was lovely and we got a good rate for it but I think I would prefer to stay outside of downtown San Diego for a more spacious room with sunlight. If I had to stay in downtown for a convention, I would probably shop around because there's plenty of other hotels with good ratings to try.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the US Grant for a business conference and brought my wife. A classy hotel with great service and well appointed stylish rooms. Food was first rate and the lounge/bar had great jazz music on the weekend. Location is great for touring the downtown area and all kinds of public transportation is nearby for venturing to other locations.. Street noise is a little intrusive (police and fire sires, must be a firehouse nearby) but it quiets down around bed time. Would definitely stay at the US Grant again.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities, scheduling could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Ed 'n Sue
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were well trained and very cordial. They were also very responsive to requests. However, there were areas that could stand improvement: - on one day, we had to call and request our room be cleaned at 5:00 p.m. - the cable TV options were very limited; and, the TV seemed antiquated - the internet access charge seemed out of line as free internet service was abundant in the area and could actually be used from the room

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Skotti56
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with many potential positives. We stayed for four days in early January and had two rooms (a deluxe and a connecting grand deluxe) on the 11th floor. First impressions were very positive, efficient and friendly valet and professional check-in. The rooms are beautifully and tastefully furnished (although they are small for the price) and the bed was probably the most comfortable I have ever experienced. My wife and I were celebrating a birthday and they kindly left a cake and a half bottle of wine in the room on our first day. Dinner in the Grant Grill was very good and the service was pleasant and professional. So far so good. Things only began to go downhill when we tried to sleep. The hotel is right in the heart of downtown with older windows. The noise was absolutely incredible (even on the 11th floor). I don't know if they have installed tertiary glazing on the lower floors but we were kept awake during each of the four nights we slept there with police sirens etc. This is largely outwith the control of the hotel, however, there was renovation work going on and the preparations began at around 6 each morning. We were woken with the sound of trucks and deliveries being made. If you are a light sleeper, please consider your options. Admittedly, we were not in the best frame of mind when going to breakfast after very little sleep but by any standard, the breakfast service was poor. Food was fine but we encountered condescending and unprofessional service which was totally in contrast to our positive dinner experience. Not a place to eat breakfast if you have any time pressure. The building is beautiful and is very centrally located but is unfortunately about two blocks out of the gaslamp which is well policed feels safe. Broadway and the area behind where the US Grant is situated is populated by many homeless people and although I fully accept that this is a part of modern life, it made the immediate vicinity of the hotel unpleasant in the evenings and were were accosted each evening when returning to the hotel. There is no doorman on the front entrance to Broadway and this would make a positive difference. Because of this environment, I would not stay here with small children and I would choose one of the hotels at the lower end of the gaslamp where this is less of a problem. I am an SPG member and the week after our stay, they sent me an e mail asking me to give feedback on our stay. I wrote a very detailed review which I sent to SPG around two months ago. I have received no feedback on this at all. The owners have invested a huge amount of capital in this historic building and it should be the reference for San Diego hotels, but until the service levels match the price of the rooms and the area around is cleaned up, I would definitely not stay here again. (Final point, being charged for Wifi when spending over 700 dollars a night for two rooms is just not acceptable these days)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Felt like a king in his own castle :)”
Reviews.Author: mihand
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked very nice; huge rooms, ideally located - 10-15 min walking to the conference center; 2 minutes walk to a big shopping mall, 5 min walking to the animated area of San Diego (bars and restaurants). Gym is available, restaurant is good - waiting time for breakfast is a bit long. Free high speed internet available in the reception area. The Italian Fed Cup team was staying at the same hotel during my stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a beautiful, comfortable museum.”
Reviews.Author: mcbc79
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully decorated, luxurious, hotel located in the Gaslamp district. The room was gorgeous and the bathroom was large with a granite shower, lush towels and nice toiletries. The bed linens were the finest, with turn down service and complimentary water. The service was excellent...friendly and helpful. I didn't like the city noise heard from the windows...sirens, trash trucks, etc...and there were a lot of homeless men living in doorways next to and across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was below my expectation.”
Reviews.Author: BellaJung
Reviews.Content: We requested for late check out at front desk when we checked in, but the next day about 4 knocks by the housekeepers on the door and trying to wake us up. With a 5 star hotel, I would expect a better communication between the front desk and housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Pampering Experience”
Reviews.Author: CanariaTravel
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in San Diego and the US Grant Hotel just made it fantastic one. The entire staff, from valet, bellboys, guest services, concierge and cleaning staff worked seamlessly and in perfect unison to make my family's stay a unique and pampering one. All our requests were fulfilled in very timely manner and we never heard a "no" or a "but". As a new recent SPG member, I can only say that my stay at the US Grant made me a loyalist to the Starwood brands but specially to the US Grant Hotel in San Diego. Besides their great staff, the hotel is a great location: right by the Gaslamp with countless food choices and a short walk from the oceanfront. The only negative comment I have would be about the Business Center: a little bit pricier for what it really offers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: GolfGirl427
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with fantastic service. The location is great and within walking distance to major shops and restaurants, as a result it can be a bit noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mmkenzie
Reviews.Content: Totally remodled. Now a first class hotel in a great location right across from Horton Plaza in Gaslamp District. Superb service. Happy hour food in the bar was excellent. Service was TOP NOTCH in the entire hotel. I even ended up buying one of the robes (new one of course shipped to my house). Comfortable bed. Only complaint was housekeeping. We were on a leisure trip and wanted to sleep in. Housekeeping knocked on the door THREE different times in the morning despite there being a newspaper hanging from my knob. Isn't there a better way of determining whether we have checked out?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Great Location! But Encountered Problems as a Family with a Toddler”
Reviews.Author: nej323
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations at spg.com but at the time of check in the reservation had disappeared. The check in host was very responsive and was able to find us one of the two last rooms available that evening and offer us a better rate. As such, we were very pleased with the responsiveness and results. However, we requested both a crib and refrigerator for our 2 night stay. We did not receive the crib or refrigerator the first night. The first evening our 18 month old found a piece of candy on the floor and gave it to us. Thinking it was an isolated event, we tossed it. The next day she found another piece and handed it to us. I also found a piece of candy on the floor. The candy was both a potential choking hazard, as well as unsanitary as she could have easily eaten it. We saved one to speak with the front desk about it. Mark spoke with the front desk about it but she took the candy and threw it in the trash rather than keep it to show a manager and housekeeping. Although she apologized, she did not offer to have housekeeping inspect our room and provide any assistance other than to say she was sorry. Mark also advised that we did not receive our crib or refrigerator. I found this response below my expectations and asked to speak with a manager after we had breakfast. The manager on duty had housekeeping specially inspect our room and bring up the crib. Upon further discussion, she provided some courtesy starwood points. We never received the refrigerator despite ultimately 3 requests. Overall, we found the room and the hotel beautiful but the fact that candy was left on the floor from a prior guest after the room was presumably cleaned was very problematic for us since we have an 18 month old child. Our expectation was that the room would have been thoroughly cleaned. Further, we were disappointed that we had to make 3 requests for a crib before receiving one and never received a refrigerator despite the same number of requests. We had to throw away food for the baby because it would not fit in the mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant luxury, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CarolinSJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful -- a little more pricey than I normally choose. My corner room was very large, spotless. But I wish these luxury hotels would not charge for Internet in the room. $12 for a 24-hour period seems just ridiculous. Sort of like airlines charging for luggage. If they feel they need to charge, why not offer a reasonable tiered plan for x hours of connection time over the entire stay? Yes, you can go to the lobby, but I ended up adding $24 to my bill for my 3 night stay. I walked a lot: to the Gaslight area for lots of food choices, to the waterfront to watch the old sailing ships and a tour of the gigantic USS Midway. I also took the lightrail to Old Town. But the main reason for the trip was to see two theatrical productions at the wonderful Old Globe and La Jolla Playhouse with a small group of theater people from the Bay Area. Very special.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: jlu24
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this lovely hotel. The room was very elegant and spacious. The location of the hotel was perfect in the gaslamp district. We had excellent service and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Services.....”
Reviews.Author: scglg
Reviews.Content: I am attending a business conference at The US Grant Hotel in Feb 2011. This was a great experience with the excellent hotel services and also the nicely decored rooms.... The hotel staff always greeted guests with smiles and offerred great advices and help.... Just made us feel home!! If I really need to find something to criticize, it would be the food quality served during the meeting....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing "Suite"”
Reviews.Author: GGTraveler
Reviews.Content: After seeing so many positive reviews, we changed our reservation and booked 2 Legacy Suites and 1 Landmark Suite at the Grant for my family (couple with a toddler) and two couples traveling with us. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location, but our Landmark Suite is a poorly designed room with a view of a wall and trash outside the windows. The Starwoods website clearly says a Landmark Suite has a sofa and a club chair in a separate living room. Our living room is about 8'x12' and has no sofa -- and not enough space to fit a sofa or even a rollaway. There is only one chair in this "suite." Because the hotel is older, each room is slightly different -- well, if they offer you Room 814, say no thanks. It is cramped and lacks enough space for a couple with a child (it is smaller than our friends' cheaper Legacy Suites). The front desk staff was nice when we asked for a more appropriate room, but unable to find us anything better even though we checked in early and didn't need the room right away. On our second day, I showed the manager a copy of the Starwoods' website and she eventually offered us a $75 daily credit (on a $360 room) after acknowledging that the room was incorrectly advertised. In my experience -- and I travel enough to be an active gold (and past platinum) Starwoods guest -- most other hotel managers would have comped at least one night upon seeing that a room was mislabeled. This isn't a situation where I subjectively consider the room small -- it is falsely advertised. Three other complaints -- there is no ice maker on the 8th floor, housekeeping hasn't made up our room yet (as of 4pm Saturday) and the hotel has not offered us any Starwood Gold benefits on any of the three rooms I booked. Positives include location (tons of good restaurants in walking distance and only one mile from Balboa Park and the waterfront), a delicious breakfast in the hotel, and a super friendly valet staff, restaurant waiter and concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: mlctkc
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was memorable for all of the right reasons...the US Grant is truly a 5 star hotel! The rooms were comfortable and very relaxing. The service was top notch...from turn down service to the concierge...the staff worked to make sure that every need was met. I would recommend this hotel without reservation...it does not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: k8thelate
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right on the fringe of Gaslamp without the busy-ness of Gaslamp. It's also just across Horton Plaza so that's a big plus. I simply adored the teal and chocolate themes of the lobby, looks so plush and elegant. The fresh flowers in the lobby were magnificent and the aroma was just delightful. I never had any problems with beds before (hard, soft, firm, lumpy, etc), never been really picky about them, but I would say they have the best bed I have ever been in. The beds smell great too! There's too much to appreciate in their guest rooms, but the only thing I didn't like were the GIlchrist & Soames (sp?) amenities... I wasn't too fond of the smell nor the bottle shape. Grant Grill had a certain old school appeal to it. I was expecting a steak house theme to it, but that wasn't the case. Well prepared cocktails and appetizers I should say. Stayed here during Comic Con with 1 ticket short... Concierge came to my rescue with securing me a much coveted All Access Pass!

Reviews.Title: “romantic weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: tlerrn
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time, excellent service, from happy hour to complimentary coffee in the morning and breakfast was all an excellent experience with the service and friendliness of the staff. We were able to walk to the mall and down to gaslamp district for dinner and night life. Great location and service with luxury getting but not to stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the US Grant.”
Reviews.Author: CoachAaron
Reviews.Content: Everyone was helpful, informative, and kind. All of our needs were met. We had a wonderful time and will recommend the hotel to all. Great job US Grant Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Truly 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: I have always been a hotel snob, and thru my travels never trusted the Star system as a true benchmark of what you actually experience. Well, abolutely no smoke and mirrors on the US Grant. Amazing Hotel, great provenance, service by everyone was so amazing and most importantly, consistent. Only drawbacks (and they shoudn't stop you from staying here) is the room WiFi should have been free, the Valet parking was very expensive ($32) and the room service seemed quite expensive. Thruly memorable place to stay, within walking distance to all of the best places to eat. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “A trip through time”
Reviews.Author: david422
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience in a well kept hotel that has all of the amenities one wouild expect at a luxury hotel, but also has features that are normally associated with a bygone era including a highly motivated staff clearly interested in catering to guest's needs

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility, but....”
Reviews.Author: WorldCruzr
Reviews.Content: The staff is very nice and very accommodating, the lobby is beautifully restored, and the rooms are nicely decorated. On the other hand, my room on the top floor (Eleven) had little to no insulation in the walls so that hall noises and sounds from adjoining rooms were quite intrusive. The over-large bathroom appeared to be very nicely appointed, but the shower head design is absurd!. You must be standing under the shower head to turn on the faucet. The initial flow comes out of a hole in the wall, dumps onto the soap dish, and then into the tub. After you get the temperature set the flow can be diverted to the overhead shower nozzle, but the initial flow onto your head and body is COLD until the flow stabilizes. In addition, the European glass shower deflector ensures that a good portion of the shower water ends up on the floor. Not the most soothing bathing experience! Most importantly, the additional charges are obnoxious and expensive. $12/day for internet connection is totally unreasonable today, especially after just staying at a low rent hotel in Tucson the day before and getting free internet included in the bargain rate. Valet parking (essentially the only choice) is $32/day as well. So - in spite of the nice people and nice appearance of this hotel, one likely leaves with a bad taste in the their mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Sirens, Truck Noise ans Slamming Doors!”
Reviews.Author: RSL201
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weeks stay and now I need isolation to get some rest. Traveling from East coast to west you always arrive early and being a Starwood member I have always had a room waiting - nope not this time. My "King size" bed turned into a double and my view of the city turned into a rooftop view with lights and a/c units. My shower didn't have hot water the first 2 days, my bathroom sink plunger wouldn't plunge and my AC sounded like I was at the airport. Now - this place is beautiful - deco, furnishings and the staff were just plain super but the room I stayed in should be closed.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: marvinonino
Reviews.Content: So my wife and I love to do Hotel getaways for the weekend. We are San Diego Locals and every other weekend or so we take trips to stay at hotels, trips ranging from local to Mexico and Denver. So we decided to finally try the US Grant. Well take this from someone who does ALOT of hotel stays......this place is stunningly beautiful. Once you walk in to the lobby you will be in awe at the setting and wall art. The staff was very friendly and polite. The room was beautiful. We stayed in the one with the two king beds and it had a nice view of the downtown area. The hotel is located right in the middle of everything so the malls, shopping, nightlife , restaurants are all withing walking distance....We also ate dinner at the Grant Grill and the food was great. The have a live jaz band the setting and service was outstanding. Bottomline, this is worth every penny that you will spend as there are other hotels that are in this price range in San Diego but so far none comes close to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss...”
Reviews.Author: Gregory666
Reviews.Content: Had been to a Charity event at the US Grant....so when I was looking for a romantic getaway for my girlfriend and I...I booked a reservation online @ Starwood as I am a longtime member... A beautiful Saturday afternoon and checked into the US Grant, while after waiting 20 minutes for 4 staff to wait on 2 guests and myself...I finally asked if I was at the right place....I had confirmed one of their nicer King suites / luxurious bathroom....after another 15 minutes we were up to our room...where we discovered 2 beds along with a large crib bed standing up along with diaper bucket and high chair....when I called down I was told that that was the suite I had ordered....next morning were off to start our day....and our shower had no hot water, after the engineer came up twice they gave us a room key to another room so that we could take a shower....walking the halls of the US Grant in bathrobes.... Anyway we are back to San Diego this weekend and we know we won't be staying at the US Grant.....

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: jgall5
Reviews.Content: good all around, love historic property, service, stylish rooms, and location for v. reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, wonderful location and lush beds...”
Reviews.Author: RadGal1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a party to attend in nearby Chula vista, and opted to stay the night San Diego. At my friends urging, we stayed at the US Grant....brilliant idea, dear friend!!! Firstly, upon walking in, the lounge / sitting area is so elegant, charming without feeing stuffy. The staff was completely accommodating, friendly and gracious, without overdoing it. Our room? Omg, amazing. Loved the hallway, the lush carpet, the dim lighting and when we entered our room it was old school, yet interesting and sleek. We immediately made a beeline for the bed, which was seriously like a lying in a cloud. And at 2 pm, we fell asleep on said bed! At night there was a hush of city noise, a few loud drunk folks outside,but mostly, our room felt like a special haven. the bar downstairs was simply lovely, with great wines and a really wonderful bartender. In the morning we ate the Grant Grille, which we were both assuming was being overly touted by the staff. No. It really was the best restaurant we could have chose and again, it was elegant and beautiful without feeling stuff or snooty. The location was perfect. We walked for blocks and ended up a great farmers market, walked around in the mall and took in the beautiful morning weather of San Diego. Thumbs way up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel-can't wait to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: OC_M_Lu
Reviews.Content: BF and I went on a weekend getaway to San Diego and decided to check out the US Grant. The location is fantastic as it is across from Horton Plaza and walking distance to the fabulous restaurants of the Gaslamp area. The lobby is well-appointed and nicely decorated-truly gushing with sophistication. We did not get a chance to dine in the restaurant on the first floor as we met friends for meals in the Gaslamp district (which is just as well because the menu and price is uppity-up). The room was spacious and we had a great view of the Coronado bridge. My favorite and most important features of my stay are the bed, pillows and comforter! I slept soooo well and really enjoyed the high quality sheets and softness of the comforter. The only downside is the expensive parking ($35/night) which I gather **from complaining to the concierge** is a separate company handling the parking structure. Gah! All in all, I recommend this hotel, especially if you're just flying into San Diego and won't have to park a car. Also, when we were there admiring the lobby and taking pictures, we chanced upon a board advertising a future bridal event. We asked a lady named Demi about the event and she graciously answered our questions not only of the event but recommended a nice walking route around the hotel and Little Italy. What a delight to have a pleasant encounter. I look forward to another excuse to go down to San Diego and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ramona02
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on trip advisor. I figured I should write one since I rely on the reviews to plan a trip. I went on a girls trip to San Diego and thoroughly enjoyed my stay ay the US Grant. The hotel is beautiful with it's architecture and cleanliness. I am not a great sleeper but slept very well on the comfortable beds. The service was excellent by all employees. There was a slight mix up with our reservation but that was quickly corrected the following day by friendly reception staff. The concierge was extremely helpful. Valet attendants delivered quick and efficient service. They were always asking if we needed directions. The Grant Grill wait staff were friendly and helpful. Some great evening cocktails were recommended! I felt safe walking around the area were the hotel is located which I believe is important. Great time, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Unassuming luxury...would definitely go back again!”
Reviews.Author: kimscsr
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the US Grant. The decor is extremely tasteful but keeps w/ the history of the hotel. The staff was unbelievably attentive w/o being overbearing and so knowledgable about the lore of the hotel. The rooms were extremely clean, decorated beautifully and seemed brand-new! The bed was like heaven as were the linens. Had a B&B feeling as is our usual accomodations. Right near the Gaslamp district, lovely walk to dining/nightlife, but off the path for noise. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely go again! One downfall was $32 a night parking....but got a great rate on the room. Sooo...oh well!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Incredible Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: MananaGirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is gorgeous and the rooms are spacious and beautiful (& I just had a regular room with double beds). I've never stayed at a hotel where I can honestly say that every single employee (front desk, concierge, housekeeping, restaurant) was incredibly gracious and provided excellent service. Very much enjoyed an interesting tour of the hotel by Anthony who shared so much of the history that has occured there. Location is good; walked about 8 blocks from train station; trolley that takes you throughout San Diego is 1/2 block away. Grant Grill offered the best martini I've had in a long time, as well as wonderful food. I'll definitely stay there again, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Eatingouttoomuch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the US Grant while in town for a conference. Beautifully restored historic hotel in San Diego. Rooms seem small but have a nice, rich feel. Walls/doors appear to be thin - noise from hallway can be an annoyance. Concierge was very helpful in suggesting and making dinner reservations. Enjoyed Happy Hour at hotel bar. Try their house Manhattan cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Pure timeless elegance!”
Reviews.Author: nivekpunk
Reviews.Content: What an absolutely beutiful hotel. Everything was top notch, from the linens and china to the engaging service at every turn. A perfect weekend getaway and perfectly situated in the heart of downtown right at the begining of the gaslamp and across from the outddoor shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenathay
Reviews.Content: My stay at the US Grant was great. It is a very elegant hotel and the customer service provided by ALL of the staff was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL AND ELEGANT”
Reviews.Author: sphere18
Reviews.Content: i traveled to san diego with my 8 year old granddaughter. We stayed for two nights at the US Grant. The hotel is beautiful, they room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was huge and modern. The staff was so friendly and warm. Breakfast was great, they have a children's menu - pancakes in the shape of mickey mouse with fresh fruit - for the most reasonable price of $8.00. MY granddaughter was in heaven! thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Knocked Your Door When the Do Not Disturbed Sign Outside”
Reviews.Author: funjlee2010
Reviews.Content: This is unexpected life time experience in this Luxury Collection Hotel when I had the "Do Not Disturbed Sign Outside" and I still got a knocked door from one of housekeeper. The time was not checked out since I am a elite member of the program and I was entitled late check out until to 4:00 PM, and the time was 12:30 PM I got dood knocked. It was so disappointed someone would igorn the sign outside and knocked the door to bother you when you were relaxing. One thing was so dissatified about this inccident when I called to Front Office Manager, she never returned my call back and never provided any investigation result even I never directly to discuss issue with the hotel management team at all nor General Manager once.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, COMFORTABLE and COZY”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaIndian
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference there in December. My daughter attended with me and we stayed for four nights. The room was clean and the bathroom was especially nice and clean. The housekeeping staff was helpful and friendly. The room was cozy and very comfortable. There was a turn down service that put chocolates on your pillow. There is a mini bar and snacks in the room that you have to be careful not to open or even remove to look at or a sensor will go off and you could be charged. The hotel provides a small refridgerator for your room upon request. They offer very large and soft towels and robes. They offer complimentary slippers. Also it is convienantly located to lots of places to eat. In the evenng there was a piano player in the lobby and if your there for a conference, it gives it a nice atmosphere to hang out in the fancy lobby and meet people and visit. NICE! The elevators are old and a little scary and small. Not real convienant for handicap or wheelchairs but they can fit, its just a tight squeeze. The only downfall is that it is so noisy that you can hear every word and yell on the street. The windows are old and thin. We bought earplugs at CVS across the street at the mall and that took care of the rest of the week! Love the art gallery and luxurious furnishings of the hotel. The food for the banquet was great!! We had a great time the conference and enjoyed our stay. Thanks to the owners! Plus they treated us with alot of respect as minorities. =)
