Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience I have had to date”
Reviews.Author: bjking521
Reviews.Content: I attended the Rejuvenation of the Aging Face conference and stayed in the hotel for 5 nights to make my activities more streamlined. Although I was a little disappointed by the size of the room based upon the room rate, the quality of the room made up for it. Actually, it was the service that really made up for it. This was the best service I have encountered, Every member of the staff was exceptionally gracious and was able to anticipate my needs. I would highly recommend this hotel. As I said, the room was small. I've had more room in the Hampton. When I got to the room, I noticed that there was not an extra refrigerator or coffee pot and I mentioned that I wished i could have one. The bellman got right on the phone, ordered both for my room, and both were brought up within 15 minutes at no additional charge. I assume it wasn't stocked with these items to save room space.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't have been better.”
Reviews.Author: dianealm
Reviews.Content: Dear Rachel, I want to thank you for the EXCELLENT accommodations while my friends and I stayed at the U.S. Grant in San Diego over Martin Luther King, Jr. weekend. The deluxe rooms numbered 643 and 724 were so spacious and comfortable, and very luxurious. Every detail was in order for our party of women and we were humbled by the fruit tray provided from management. I assure you I will be back to the Grant Hotel and recommend it to my friends and neighbors. The free slippers were another perk and very appreciated. I think that my stay at the U.S. Grant was also made pleasurable by Mark at the concierge desk. The waitresses, bell boys, and reservation desk employees also all did their jobs with warm efficiency. All in all I can't say enough good things about our very pleasurable stay at your hotel. Thank you, Diane Alm

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Tilpin
Reviews.Content: Luxury in the heart of San Diego - within walking distance to shops (main plaza directly opposite), the port and trendy gaslamp district (just a block or two up the street). Also very close to the T station. We found the US Grant to be real haven when the rains poured down and we slept so so well in the comfy bed. The room we stayed in was small but luxurious. The bathroom was huge and stunning with a large marble shower and high end toiletries. Small touches made all the difference - including chocolates on our pillows before bedtime, replenished bottles of water and towels each evening. Firiendly and helpful concierge and staff. The only negative was the stained (but clean) carpets over the top of the gorgeous wooden floorboards and no free WIFI in the room (although this seems to be a common cost cuttung measure in supposedly higher end US hotels in my experience). All of this was very decent value for approx $160 per night. I'd recommend to anyone travelling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The Grant was fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Tutuloke
Reviews.Content: The ambience and art were great, the service impeccable, and the 100 year anniversary bourbon in the Grill was amazing. I would return and would recommend this hotel. I liked the location--very convenient with lots to do in walking distance, yet close to the freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness, Anticipation equals 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: nib22152
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at the hotel and were happily greeted by the valet staff and helped by them to get us oriented to the hotel. We were early and our room was not ready, but the Front Desk offered to call when it was. They did, indeed, call us, and were very enthusiastic about the room we had reserved. It was truly a grand room for us! Our luggage arrived and the young man acclimated us to our room. We were spoiled by the turn down service as well as the complimentary water each night. The next morning, I received a note from Demi Dalisay-Ricario. She and I had talked the day before our arrival and I was impressed that she remembered me and our conversation! Throughout the next four days, it was the same - incredibly friendly and helpful staff. From the valets to the conceirge, the waitstaff and the room maintenance staff...always with a warm smile and helpful attitude. It is quite apparent that although the Grant is majestic in it's physical presence, it is the staff that truly makes this an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations - Friendliest Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonbud67
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the US Grant to attend a conference being held at the hotel. All of my colleauges and I were beyond impressed at how friendly the staff was...remembering people's names, going out of their way to say hello or to assist in any way. It really was remarkable. The hotel itself was very nice as well, but clearly the staff made this visit extra special.

Reviews.Title: “There is only one word to describe our stay at the US Grant--FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: BrookTMSU
Reviews.Content: I flew in to San Diego for a quick Mom/Daughter weekend with my 26 year old daughter who is in school there. The hotel was within 10 minutes of the airport but we never heard planes landing or taking off. From the moment that I got out of the taxi and was greeted by the doorman to the time we left the service was topnotch! Check in was easy although the check in desk did look a bit more like the concierge desk rather than your usual check in counter. But this just added to the elegant living room feel of the lobby. Located right downtown we were within walking distance of the Gaslamp District and shopping as well as the waterfront. The front desk was most helpful with restaurant recommendations and sent us to a great French bakery-bistro for breakfast that has endless Mimosas on the weekend menu! Our standard room was quite roomy with a good sized bathroom with a walk-in shower and huge towels. While the room was located next to the elevator we never heard any elevator noises. We did hear some people out in the hallway but you can hear this in any hotel environment. We also ate in the Grill where the food and the service were some of the best I have had anywhere--- and I am a food and restaurant snob! One of the real hidden treats of this trip was the spa services. Manned by great staff from a spa down the street, you can have services in your room or in a very nicely appointed space within the hotel. The spa staff were very knowledgeable and did not try to sell any products to us -- which was a real pleasant change from some of the other spas I have used while traveling. Being located in a downtown area the hotel was also very aware of security and a key was required not only for your room but also for use of the elevator which helped my daughter and me to feel comfortable in the hotel proper. All in all we had a great ladies weekend and I would definitely book there again. And for those of you who look at the prices and may be scared away - do check out the specials on the hotel website. We got a great deal on pay for two nights, get the third night free and the cost of the first two nights was quite reasonable when compared with other hotels in the area.. Treat yourself to a little luxury. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Customer satisfaction is not on the top of the US Grant's list.”
Reviews.Author: BobbyShah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my family. The rooom service took over an hour. Every possible service was slow and the hotel was not fully booked. All the rooms have little or no sunlight. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Updated room but noisy”
Reviews.Author: horselover11
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to coming to this hotel and having a restful time away from work. I thought that would include getting a good night sleep. After checking into the hotel at 3 am my time i was awakening with a truck driving by shaking my room and nosiy at 6. With a National Registar hotels I am hoping to be moved to a quieter room . I will keep you posted.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and the staff are absolutely fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: susieq1234
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The customer service is exceptional. The staff is friendly and efficient The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are large and beautifully appointed. The staff refers to you by name. One really nice feature is that they provide you complimentary water in your room every day. The US Grant should be the gold standard for all other hotels. Thanks for making my trip so fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with gracious service”
Reviews.Author: Cathy0113
Reviews.Content: I checked in here for only one nite, but it was the lap of luxury. The service was fabulous, my room was amazing and we ate at the restaurant for dinner and breakfast and it was great. I have only positive things to say about the US Grant. I will never stay anywhere else when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The helpful, friendly staff makes this hotel special.”
Reviews.Author: DFeine
Reviews.Content: I have spent hundreds of nights in hotels all across the US. The staff at the US Grant is by far the most polite professional group of hotel employees I have ever encountered. "Rita" at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly. She made a point of accommodating my request for early check in with a smile and extreme efficiency. She remembered my name when I asked for a boarding pass to be printed two days later. I feel bad I didn't get the gentleman's name who actually walked me out of the hotel and half way down the block to get me close to a pharmacy when I asked for directions. The US Grant is an old hotel; but the staff has figured out that they truly make the difference. If I ever return to San Diego; I will be staying at the US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Danaboo1804
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. The customer service, the rooms, the food...all fantastic! Special recognition to Magdalena Loza Flores, Rita Casares and Anne Burcell.

Reviews.Title: “A classy romantic New Years Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mckenahaar
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing weekend at the US Grant. The rooms were simple but elegant. The bed was so plush that I can't remember the last time I slept so great! We enjoyed a very romantic dinner at the Grant Grill. They had a terrific live jazz band and the hotel lobby decked out in beautiful Christmas/New Year's decor. We definitely intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at The Grant”
Reviews.Author: Alinachka
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I went on a trip to San Diego to celebrate my birthday. This historic and luxurious hotel is absolutely beautiful! The chandeliers are a work of art. We really liked our suite - the art on the walls is very unique. The bathroom was spacious and it helped to have two sinks. Aside from the beauty of the rooms and the hotel, there are two other important things to note. The first is the staff - every single person at the hotel we interacted with was personable and helpful. The second, and very important thing is the LOCATION. There isn't a better location when you want to stay in the Gaslamp district close to everything. (We also walked to Little Italy, it is a local's spot and is worth checking out. )

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Lee1fish
Reviews.Content: My wife and I lucked into the US Grant Hotel with Hotels.com and we cannot believe our good fortune. From the wonderful rooms to the incredible staff and Hotel restaurant, we felt like we were wrapped in a warm, fuzzy blanket the whole time. LeeAnn, the concierge, went out of her way to make sure our San Diego experience was everything we wanted it to be. We had a private tour of the entire hotel which was arranged by her and conducted by the head of hotel security on his off time. Through him, we learned of the fantastic history of the hotel and were allowed to see the Presidential suite from where Franklin Roosevelt delivered one-third of his "Fireside" addresses to the nation during the Great Depression. The dining experience at the in-house restaurant, the Grant Grill, was among my top 5 in my life. The food, the service, the atmosphere was incredible. The staff at the hotel went out of their way, in every way, to make our stay more than we had dreamed of. It felt in every way like a warm and fuzzy blanket wrapped around us. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are comforting and ornate, and I will go back again and again when I travel to San Diego. Best value ever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our wedding weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Stellina0523
Reviews.Content: We had a destination wedding in San Diego and decided to choose the US Grant as our "home base" for the weekend. It couldn't have been a more perfect choice (aside from our decision to marry each other)! As a member of the Starwood loyalty program we were able to get upgraded to an amazing corner room with large windows for lots of sunlight. The room, the decor, the lobby, were perfect for our initial wedding photos. Magdalena at the front desk was very accommodating and completely acknowledged the reason for our stay. Also the bellmen and concierge who helped with our luggage and set up our car service to our ceremony at the Japanese Gardens and then to our reception at Salvatore's restaurant nearby the hotel. We received 5 star treatment during our stay! Also compliments to the chef for their lavish yet healthy breakfasts served on property. Although a little higher priced, we highly recommend eating breakfast at the hotel at least one day...the fruit juice, the teas, the breads, and main dish are delightful. Thank you to the management and staff at the US Grant for making our wedding weekend even more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: islddreamer
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, historic hotel owned by the Kumeyaay tribe. I enjoyed the luxury touches, such as the free slippers and the use of a bathrobe. I especially liked the complimentary shoe service. I had old boots that were super-scuffed and they came back like new. I definitely recommend the service! Concierge service was mixed--one lady recommended some great restaurants (went to Buon Apetito since Filippi's had a line, followed by Extraordinary Desserts), but two other men were not as helpful. Not that close to convention center, but can walk there in 10 minutes. Can also walk to Little Italy in about 10 minutes. Walking distance to train station and to terminal for harbor cruises & whale watching. Definitely recommend whale watching! Like any expensive hotel, Internet is not free--always a downer.

Reviews.Title: “Wish Grant-ed!”
Reviews.Author: MrDanBoise
Reviews.Content: The US Grant lives up to it's high reputation for excellence in San Diego. They can do everything. The rooms we've stayed in (909 & 726) are both tremendous. 726 has the better view- but neither are less than superior. There was a wonderful woman at the front desk- Magdalena Flores - __?__ who is Amazing, she was on the spot helping us find great places to wander, wonderful places to eat, and is a great asset to a great hotel. Internet wifi is free in the lobby but $11.95 for use in the room. For the price of the place, free internet wouldn't kill them...

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: syknyc
Reviews.Content: I went here with my husband for a holiday weekend get-away and feel confident in saying this is probably one of the nicest hotels in San Diego. The hotel was nice from every aspect. The service was great (we asked for a DVD player and they were able to accommodate), the beds were comfortable, and I enjoyed the modern decor. The location had easy walking access to buses (to beaches), mall shopping, and many restaurants (gas lamp district). I would say the only downside to the hotel is that there are many vagrants and homeless directly in front of the hotel, but I dont think you can help that in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY ATTENTIVE TO EVERY NEED. THE BEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT!”
Reviews.Author: Smith007700
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you fellow travelers, this is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. My family was thoroughly pleased with everything. From the moment we parked the car in the grand entrance to the hotel to the time we left we were pampered. The entire staff is remarkably polite and extremely attentive to every need. I mean every single need. Whatever you need they will accommodate you. You can't beat the 24 hour room service with five star foods at a reasonable cost. I have stayed at five star luxury resorts like this before, but this hotel is off the charts. This place is great for the whole family. Daniel the Security official at the hotel was amazing. He printed out directions and a whole itinerary for us without hesitation. Thanks Daniel for making us feel at home and for your gracious demeanor. We had a great time at Balboa Park, were glad you suggested it. We took the kids to the museums and they loved it. Thank you to all US Grant staff. Please go see for yourself and bring the kids. Very kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service in luxurious settings”
Reviews.Author: Lanooba
Reviews.Content: While the location is more business than residential, the US Grant is the gold standard for luxury. Gorgeous design, large rooms with the best bedding in town. The bathroom is the size of many NY City hotels. The same can be said for their staff. From remembering staff members calling us by name; to them offering insider tips to the best places to visit in San Diego; to Harry the manager from Pittsburgh, who upgraded our room and gave us a tour of his Penguins memorabilia once he found out we also reside in Pittsburgh; everyone was fantastic! Best of all, the price is very reasonable. I would definitely return. Overall

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rjannis
Reviews.Content: We spent NYE and enjoyed every moment. We decided to have dinner in our suite, ande everyone from Brooks, the bellhop, who heated our appetizers, to Mr. Scaramellino, who made sure we had dinner plates and silver, it was perfect. The lounge show was great, and it was a perfect way to ring in the new year. Won't hesitate to do it again next year. Thanks to a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “so, so”
Reviews.Author: raydezz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the U.S. Grant and were not blown away: The good: *Location, location, location and location! *Rate: Hotwire $189 per night basic room *Design: beautiful interior (this is a historic building in the city, so curb your expectations) *Gym-small, but great equipment and TV, cold water, towels. also, had good range of dumbells up to 75lbs *Cocktail hour and entertainment nice that they had it Bad: Not a 5 star in my book, I would go 4 star (being generous) *I know this is a historic building, but for the 50, or so million $ renovation, they could have done better. *Crappy TV picture quality.. tiny LCD tv with no HD *no bath tub, shower only??? Shower was excellent though! *Bed not comfortable, sore back *Noise- I know we stayed in the city, but on the 4th floor, we could hear the cross walk beeping all through the night. That is pretty absurd, How about some double pained windows???? *overhead lights for the bed, switch was across the room, poor design, should be next to bed. *No pool-have to go to the Westin (sister hotel) *Dining-1 option, but u=hundreds of places adjacent, so no big deal. *The $10k are work over the bed, was a waste, could have used that money on a nicer TV with actual HD. *Cocktail hour and entertainment (not exactly the hippest spot) Bottom-line- it was a nice hotel, but not 5 star resort can't wait to go nice. Certainly not worth the $380 they ask , $180 was not really worth it in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, elegant, hotel in the heart of the downtown.....but could use a couple small improvements.”
Reviews.Author: ajkinney
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 7 yr old son stayed at the US Grant for 2 nights. We reserved a Legacy Suite and requested the largest suite available and a roll away bed. Upon check in at 3:30pm (ck in is 3pm) our room was not ready, which after driving for 3 hours was a little bit of a disappointment, but they had A LOT of check-outs that day and were playing catch up. It would have been nice if they offered us a free drink in the grill or something..... They also told us once we check into the room they will send up the roll away. Once we arrived to the room, it was lovely, a separate small living room and the attached bedroom with desk, HUGE floor mirror, closet, dresser and two night stands. It was nice to have the extra small fridge and 2 tv's. The lush carpeting, and all the room decor was beautiful and the room was very clean, but the small living room felt a little small without a window. But the bedroom had a wonderful large window. The down points: - I think a hotel of this caliber should have HD service. They have two lovely LCD TV's but the picture quality was poor! - Also, charging for wireless...... SERIOUSLY?? - We did not receive the roll away until 9PM!!! After a couple calls and firm requests that we need this, they were finally able to track one down from another hotel. The hotel needs more than 10 roll aways! - The cordless phone did not work. - The bathroom is painfully small. I understand the hotel is housed in a historic building, but the bathroom I feel a bathroom for a suite should be larger. However, the bathroom was lovely, great toiletries and amazing towels. However, the large vessel sink was too big for the bathroom. - The shower curtain smelled of mold. - I also think parking was too expensive at $32 per night. However, I heard that's pretty on par with other downtown hotels. Overall a great hotel and we would definitely stay there again and if you get a chance.... eat breakfast at the Grill, the best pancakes I've had in a long time!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Historical Gem that you must experience for yourself”
Reviews.Author: jalfong
Reviews.Content: For those who have seen this gorgeous hotel on camera then you have to experience for yourself. The US Grant is stunning and an experience to behold, can I recommend you stay there on slow business periods of time. It is a real find...you will want to explore more of this stunning jewel in downtown San Diego...the parking is expensive for downtown I have to admit and the charges for internet in your room seem unnecessary when so many other places now give it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambiance, great service, delightful stay.”
Reviews.Author: Henry_Baxter
Reviews.Content: We were there on Christmas Day. They had eggnog, cider and Christmas cookies in lobby. Delightful! We had dinner in the lounge - terrific food at great prices before 8 pm. Our room was lovely. Historical, elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: dogtraveler10
Reviews.Content: Harry and all the staff greeted us with good cheer and efficiency. From the valets to the housekeeping we felt they were making an extra effort for their guests. We enjoyed your wonderful old classic of a hotel with a room that was classy and delightfully decorated. Oh, and the dog was fawned over and I have to give the staff four stars for being so dog friendly. Great location near the Gaslight district and the morning room service coffee was sooo goood!. Happy New years to everyone at the Grant.

Reviews.Title: “productive for work with a side of luxury”
Reviews.Author: amylee2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a colleauge in December. The hotel was convenient for everywhere we needed to go and the room was set up well to get additional work done. Even better, the main room, bath, closet, and entry way were all plush and sensible. I enjoyed a leisurely in-room breakfast in comfort before heading out for my day.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a little too tight for comfort”
Reviews.Author: _JB2SanDiego_
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the lovely US Grant for 2 nights. Lobby area was very nice. It was not busy, but they gave us one of the worst rooms facing a wall about 20' outside our window looking into other rooms across the way. The room was extremely small. There are no drawers for clothes, and the bathrooms have no shelf space at all for toiletries. A tight squeeze into the small bathroom, that is very warm, as there is also no fan in there. It is in a great location, but next time, we would probably stay across the street in either the W Hotel or the Westin for the extra room/comfort. It rained while we were there, so we had to sit in the noisy lobby, because there was not enough space in our room to relax. Also, when we checked out, there was a bill for $35 for a bottle of liquor. I opened the refrigerator door once to see if there was room to place a bottle of water, but there wasn't, so I immediately closed it. At the desk they told me there is a sensor. Well, that's fine, but there was nothing missing from the refrigerator when we left, so what exactly did it sense? Upon checkout, they graciously took it off the bill. But just watch for that. Also, not very pleased with the $32/nt to park our car that never moved. Staff very pleasant and bed very comfortable. We ate at the Grant Grill one night. Very small menu with few choices, but the food was very good. My husband had to go the lobby to use their free internet. It is not free in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Kris089
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work and the US Grant outshined all of the places I have been. The service was fantastic from the moment we got there. The valet, check in desk, concierge and event staff were all smiling, helpful and really valued each guest. The big things for this hotel were easy, but even when it came to "the little things" that guests appreciate the staff was right there and sometimes doing things for you before you knew they were there and gone! Nightly turn down- awesome- water, ice, slippers and chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: NativeSD49
Reviews.Content: As a native San Diegan, I have heard of the US Grant Hotel for years and always wanted to stay there. When my company decided to hold their annual holiday party there this year I thought it would be a perfect opportunity. I decided to stay two nights so we could explore Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp at night. I reserved a Legacy Suit room and was really disappointed. The sitting area was very cramped, and the sides of the loveseat were so high you could not rest your arm on it. We ended up sitting on the bed to relax and watch TV. The bathroom was cramped, did not have a tub and the shower head was so weak that you could not rinse the soap out of your hair. I brought a couple bottles of wine and two glasses to enjoy in the evenings, but the maid took one of our glasses. When I brought it to her attention she said she would replace it but never did. Room service was extremely poor. The first night we requested a bottle of Sprite to calm our stomach and it took over an hour to arrive at our room, not to mention the cost of $10. The hotel lounge does not have live music and the common area by registration is poorly designed so that you cannot see the piano player and singer that they had preforming during parts of our stay. The bed was comfortable but the noise from the sirens would wake us up at night. For the amount we spent to stay at this hotel I think I can find a better place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: MVPStudios
Reviews.Content: As usual our experience was awesome. It was made even better by the excellent service we received in resolving a problem. The hotel manager went out of his way to solve an accounting problem for us from a previous stay. He went above an beyond. We love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A truly remarkable experience”
Reviews.Author: STZGRLZ
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Grant, my wife and I knew we made accomodations at the right place. From the minute the valet help us with our luggage to leaving the hotel, we have never had such an enjoyable time. The staff was beyond first class and always greeted us with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious..with special touches.”
Reviews.Author: RecessionaryMary
Reviews.Content: My new favorite hotel! We stayed four nights and were wowed! Fabulous entry, amazing art, super nice employees, the rooms were not huge but tastefully apointed. The location can't be beat! My budget saving tip is to definately have happy hour in the Grant Tavern. It's a very sexy place to have a cocktail and have 1/2 price appetizers. The most amazing people watching! Wireless is available in the lobby and rooms. The Grant lobby is one of those magical places you will feel like you are in a movie. Just hang out and forget the cold cruel real world. Only complaints are about the night clerks. They should have some kind of rule about reading text messages while on duty. Looks so tacky and they should not have any distractions when helping a guest with questions. We especially appreciated the maid bringing us a coffee maker and one of the clerks remembered we prefer the WSJ and he had it delivered to the room every morning. The over priced trolley is a good way to get familiarized with the city. But don't commit to more than one day. The drivers are clowns that are of little use if you are serious about history. I prefer the bus or getting exercise walking. Trolley was a big waste of money. Check out the museum district. Mind blowing!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Louise100_10
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who posted reviews in the past – you made organizing my December 1-10, 2010, trip easy where we stayed in eight different California hotels. Wonderful hotel. Most comfortable bed on the trip. Clean. Friendly and helpful (definitely not arrogant) staff at every moment. Incredible location within walking distance of Little Italy, Balboa and Gastown districts. Soundproof bathroom - when your partner is having a shower, you can't hear anything. My husband forgot his shirt in the wardrobe – when we called about it, they quickly hunted it down and are shipping it back to us. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: redrn3
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the US Grant for our anniversary about 10 years ago and it was a so-so experience. This time around was completely different. Everything was amazing. The decor, the amenities, and the bed. Oh, that bed!!! Lush, soft, exquisite linens, pillows... And the room service breakfast was the icing on the cake. Seriously, I did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wendym001
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel. It was a great experience. I received some of the best customer service I have ever received at a hotel. I arrived 3 hours earlier than the check in time and there was no issue with getting in to my room right away and even though I had booked a double bed, I was pleasantly surprised with a king. The staff were friendly, outgoing and helpful. I asked for a map and some directions and the girl at the front desk very cheerfully helped me out. My last night there, the gentleman at the front desk member was extremely helpful in assisting me in getting my boarding pass printed. At checkout, the front desk staff assisted with getting me another copy of my bill reprinted even though it took a little time due to some complications and was extremely friendly while getting it done. Every interaction that I had with the staff was a positive one and everyone of them were polite, friendly and helpful. They all seemed to sincerely enjoy assisting guests. The room was clean, the bed was good (which is very important), always made up in a timely manner and I appreciated the little extras like the complimentary water. The location was perfect for getting around with the trolley station less than a block away. The Embarcadero was a 10 minute walk through Gaslamp Square and it was a 10 minute walk to the cruise ship dock/pier. I would recommend your hotel to anyone who is looking at going to San Diego and I will certainly stay there again. The only thing that detracts from the overall elegance of this hotel is that the carpets in the hallways on my floor (6) were marked or stained somewhat. Please give my thanks and recognition to your staff for a job superbly done.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Chuckman2010
Reviews.Content: These hotel rooms were some of the nicest I have stayed in around the world and by far the least expensive of this caliber of high quality. The entire hotel including the lobby, conference rooms, restaurant/bar and guest suites were a very nice blend of old-world elegance with a well-chosen splash of modern flair. The bathrooms were beautiful with very spatious glass showers. The beds were very comfortable and my room was always quiet. The staff was pleasant and attentive and went out of their way with room service, concierge assistance, and even helping me to retrieve my lost wallet :-) The food was exceptional. The catering for our conference rivaled most weddings I have attended - even the "box" lunch left us all recurrently commenting on the quality of the food. In fact, one of my colleagues has decided he wants to return for his wedding - that is how impressed we were with our stay! My only complaint would be that there was not free wireless internet in the guest rooms. It was available in the lobby and in the conference rooms, but it would have been nice to also have this feature in the rooms themselves. Parking is $32/night but allows endless come/go which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best San Diego Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FNPMSN
Reviews.Content: Was fortunate for my employer to allow me to stay @ the hotel for a conference. I have to say the only negative is all the homeless around the area, approaching you, etc., which is not the hotels issue, but our nations as a Family Nurse Practitioner. I have traveled/stayed in hotels of all types, chains, etc., across the country personally & professionally and a Native Nevadan, spoiled & not use to paying for parking, but this is an issue in all large cities. It was also even more beautiful as the hotel, Little Italy, & Gaslight District all decorated for Christmas. I had not spent time in San Diego for > 34 years & we also had lovely dinners every evening. We only had a normal King room, which was huge & very elegant. Cannot imagine the more expensive rooms.This was better than the Millineum Knickerbocker in Chicago & close second to Embassay Suites in Niagra Falls King Suites w view of all 3 falls. Truly a historic experience. The staff & valet were all stellar every minute of every day. Also felt very safe as they lock all the doors except for Valet @ 2400. I am a very light sleeper, etc., & now use ear plugs, but I believe this was 1 of the few quiet hotels, but again, it was only the conference attendees in the entire hotel, but our room faced the street/Westin & has large window in bedroom & bathroom. The only thing missing was a view of the bay, but if you are a city person, love lights, etc., I would stay here again. If I wanted a view, Embassay Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: trvlqueen77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a historic gem with a prime location. The service was impeccable from the moment that we arrived. We occupied two rooms, one suite and one standard in size. They were both the ultimate in luxury. The suite had the most amazing shower that I've ever seen. It was larger than most entire bathrooms. Both of the rooms were beautifully appointed and immaculate. The staff was warm, friendly and efficient. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place in SD I Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: Coming from NYC and being well-traveled, not much overly impresses me anymore. However, the first time I stayed in the US Grant, I vowed this would be the ONLY hotel I stay at when I'm in SD. The US Grant is somewhat of a hidden gem, in that it is overly lavish for the neighborhood. The hotel is wonderfully maintained, having just celebrated its 100th year in service and having undergone a very costly, worthwhile renovation ($56m or so). Walking into the lobby for the first time, you will feel like you have been taken to another world with the plush carpets, overstated furniture and chandeliers. The staff is professional, never stuffy and very eager to help make your trip to SD an enjoyable one. The rooms are extremely comfortable -- especially the robes. The hotel itself is located across the street from Horton's Plaza (main shopping plaza) and right on the perimeter of the Gaslamp District. The Gaslamp is the center of SD's thriving entertainment scene with restaurants, bars and clubs -- it has something for everyone. The US Grant is perfectly situated. Please be aware, unfortunately SD has a lot of homeless beggars around the hotel, so you do need to be aware of your surroundings....that is not to say the area is unsafe, but you will see a number of homeless people no matter where you stay. Hope this helps, and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Gunnerman8
Reviews.Content: My stay at the US Grant was one of the most enjoyable hotel experiences I've ever had. Every single member of the staff that I had any encounter with was completely courteous and helpful. My wife and I stayed here for several nights and made several requests (be it a DVD player, room service, or bag pickup) during our time, and every one was met in a timely manner and with a smile. I simply cannot say anything bad about the hotel. It was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous place and service (beware of the restaurant though)”
Reviews.Author: webvan
Reviews.Content: Just spent five nights there and we had a great time, the place is marvelous (historic hotel refurbished in 1985 and 2006) and the level of service provided by the personnel is excellent overall, of particular note the concierge desk (arranged for car rental and kindly printed some e-tickets) and the personnel at the front desk (where the cars/taxis arrive) really went above and beyond and it was done in style (the person in charge sounded British, probably a "posh" accent acquired over the years!). Didn't hurt that we got a great deal via Expedia, $122/night - 10% vs the $569 rack rate for a superior double room, at that price it was a steal, but hey you've got to luck out some of the time ;-) As for the room, excellent overall (decor, lush carpet, size) but a few small problems : the sink was clogged when we arrived, not sure how they could let that happen, but they sent someone (an "engineer" who reeked of tobacco sadly) right away to fix it...at 10PM. The faucet of the shower was falling off too, no biggie but same thing, how can that happen, they need their housekeepers to report that type of problem. Some dust in the corners too...maybe that room doesn't get used that often. No problem getting hot water in the shower (unlike a previous comment) but it was a bit cold in the bathroom and there was no way to control the temperature. Many towels, almost too thick and heavy. Beds are super comfortable and the turndown service is a nice touch. WiFi in the room costs $12 per 24 hours but it's available for free (and it's fast) in the lobby and there are plenty of comfortable sofas to choose from as well as power plugs. They don't mind having people there and I was even offered a bottle of water by one of the bellboys. Only disappointment was the main restaurant we used for a quick breakfast and for dinner on Thanksgiving, absurdly expensive and very small portions and they served me a straight-up gin that was basically undrinkable. The waiter seemed clueless and a bit confused to be honest, guess we got the wrong guy. They have several panels explaining the history of the hotel in the restored carriage entrance hallway, very interesting, but during its history it ran into problems because the owners couldn't command the rate they needed to keep the hotel going, wonder if it's not happening again...

Reviews.Title: “Stunning in every way”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghKate
Reviews.Content: Stunning building, fantastic hotel, excellent staff and perfect location. Next to Gaslamp Quarter which had busy nightlife and walking distance from Waterfront. Perfect in every way, only disappointment was that we were here for one night. Only time I've ever given a hotel top rating for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime, grand accommodation in the centre of a friendly, interesting city.”
Reviews.Author: prhkt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grand room, loved the marble and ambience, central location and service, we slept well, but some may find it a little noisy and confronting being right in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Always a fantastic stay at the U.S. Grant”
Reviews.Author: Mokita
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay at the Grant when I'm in San Diego--the rooms are an oasis of calm when I'm traveling on business. On my recent stay, of eight nights, I was upgraded to the landmark suite and it was simply perfect, a calm luxurious place to come at the end of each crazy day. Everyone made me feel welcome and responded to all my needs quickly and with grace. I can't say enough about how much I love staying a this hotel. Can't wait until I go to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel style and service”
Reviews.Author: yucanuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a meeting at the convention center. It was close enough to walk, and quiet enough to get a good night sleep. Staff were very friendly and inviting, offering their attention to all details to ensure a quality stay. A history of the land and hotel can be found in the foyer off 4th St and adds a bit of history to this classic hotel. Would not hesitate to stay there again and encourage others to do so.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingrrrl
Reviews.Content: This is in a great location and is just everything a hotel should be! It's in a great location with lots to do within walking distance. Great service and excellent staff. I was there for a meeting but had the opportunity to add a couple leisure days on the end of my trip. Met friends and spent some time in museums and the zoo. Business was good, but a great break before the holidays as well. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke668
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose to stay at the US Grant. After our flight home to Australia being delayed at Los Angeles for another 3 nights, we decided to leave the madness of LA and see what San Diego had to offer. We drove past the front door of the US Grant at night and had to stop. The lobby itself is AMAZING! The staff were all so friendly, especially the woman that served me. She even suggested a BEAUTIFUL restaurant in little Italy. (Called Bon Appetito! If in town I highly recommend!) Our room was outstanding for the price, we even decided to stay an extra day than planned. All in all a wonderful experience, I would recommend to everyone and I hope to get back there one day!! :)

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel we stay at when visiting San Diego”
Reviews.Author: susana1
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the US Grant and feel that this hotel is a truly wonderful place to stay and dine while in San Diego. Expect to pay a bit to stay at this hotel but it's so worth it. The food is wonderful but again very expensive!! They do have happy hour so take advantage!! The dinner I had was the Halibut which was the size of two ice cubes very small portion even for me!!I eat very little and I left HUNGRY the cost of this meal was $30.00 so do take this into consideration. The Kobe beef burgers are awesome so are the sliders!! My key did not work at this visit making my visit a bit frustrating but the staff at this hotel is so accomodating they are attentive and very kind!! I LOVE this hotel and hope that you will too

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: apickytraveler
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Wonderful staff! Got upgraded to a suite. Didn't get a chance to experience the Grant Grill but will do so next time. Beds are very comfy! The only tell tale sign that this is an 100 year old hotel were the small elevators. Otherwise, I would have guessed 30 or 40 because everything is so up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: bspong
Reviews.Content: While I was only at your hotel for one evening, the experience was truly extraordinary. The lobby was spectacular and the employees were quite proud of their hotel as they explained the history of The Grant to me. The Grant Grill was a wonderful dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: ckdnl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The staff are fantastic. The property is located right next to the trolley system and the Gaslamp District. We would recommend the US Grant to all.

Reviews.Title: “near perfect lots of style and charm”
Reviews.Author: Dohan68
Reviews.Content: Top! friendly people - superb bar - concierge very helpful - great rooms - Breakfast staff sometimes not fast - convenient location walkng distance from Convention Center

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in nearly every way”
Reviews.Author: SueDeal
Reviews.Content: The service from all the staff has to rate as one of the best we have ever experienced, even for 5* hotels. The quality of the rooms and the common areas was exceptional. From the minute we arrived the staff, from the valet desk to check-in, went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We have to, however, single out for a special mention the concierge desk. The whole team on the concierge desk were so helpful, whatever our request, whether it be a recommendation for an "All American Diner" experience or booking us a table at one of San Diego's top restaurants! If we had to pick any negatives, for us there were only 2 little niggles: the bathrooms were rather short of shelf space for toiletries and secondly we found the bar area uncomfortably dark for enjoying a drink and snack with friends. Altogether the US Grant is a first class hotel and we couldn't recommend it highly enough for anyone staying in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 star historic hotel delivers a memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: murfeesborohardware
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the US Grant for 3 nights. I typically stay in with Four Seasons, Fairmont or Ritz Carlton. Due to none of these having locations near downtown San Diego, I was forced to look elsewhere. Insted of staying at the 4-star chain where my meetings were held, I decided to give the Grant a try, and I am very pleased I did. First, let me encourage you to look at the spg.com website - they almost always have a 3 for 2 special going (or a similar offer). With these rates, you will be in the same ballpark with Priceline.com's typical best accepted offer. You will see this hotel listed as a 5-star on most sites. I think it comes close. This hotel has a great feel - you can sense the character and history in the place. Having said that, it had all the modern amenities one would expect out of a much newer hotel. I have seen several comments about room size - I believe I was given a standard room, and I felt it was plenty spacious. The room had a small entry way, very nice sized bedroom, and modern bathroom. The bathroom did not have a tub, but had an oversized shower which was very nice. Nice furnishings with club chair and desk, free wireless internet, nice English toiletries, and complementary bottles of water were provided in the room. I stayed on the 6th floor. My only complaints were that 1) there was a considerable amount of street noise, including bar patrons, and sirens; and 2) The only close parking option with in and out privleges was the hotel's valet, and the price was $32. However, this has gotten to be the norm 5-star hotels. The service was excellent - most of the staff were young but very service oriented. If I come back to San Diego and need to stay in this area, I will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing next to Europe...”
Reviews.Author: nichristx
Reviews.Content: Yes, I was supposed to be on a European vacation, but due to unforeseen events had to switch gears. A trip to San Diego and at this wonderful property was the best 2nd option. The service was wonderful; the Front desk staff to Concierge, housekeeping to Valet. It was truly top of the line. Room cleanliness was impeccable, and again, the service was phenominal from all departments!!! The location is great; everything is within walking distance. There are wonderful restaurants nearby and we never failed when the Concierge directed us certain places; choices on my own were not so great. ;-) I'm in the industry and stay at many hotels, so I'm very picky, and few have "Wowed" me like this one. If you want different, not the standard business travel or convention type hotel, you will LOVE this property!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Wonderful Service, and a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jct6878
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so incredibly impressed with this hotel. When we travel, we prefer Starwood hotels in general, but this one went so over and above what we ever could have expected. From the minute we walked into the hotel we were welcomed by every member of the staff. The lobby is amazingly beautiful, probably one of the nicest I've seen. Since we were traveling with our 1 year old, we asked for a room far away from other guests so as not to disturb anyone, and they did all they could to accommodate us and even upgraded our room. They helped us find restaurants (even at odd hours), told us what attractions to see/avoid, and genuinely seemed to care. Probably the best part of it all was that we were meeting friends who live in San Diego, and the hotel gave us a great place to meet and was centrally located. I will admit that the room was on the smaller side, but not uncomfortable by any means. My only real regret was not spending more time in San Diego, and more specifically, at the US Grant. It was our last stop on our 7 day trip and I wish we had just stayed there for the whole 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Old Hotel in Gaslamp District in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: chuckwagon1
Reviews.Content: I think the place is overpriced, but if you can stay on someone else's dime, you need to do it. The rooms are super small, but clean and well appointed. The hotel robs you for every little thing you do, which is pretty typical for a Westin. However, the location is superb and the staff is pleasant. If you want to party in the Gaslamp District, there is no better place. Other than the nickel and dime treatment of hotel for every little service, the only other annoying thing is that you must insert your keycard everytime you use the elevator. I think they do this for security. There is no pool in the hotel, but they let you use the rooftop pool at the Westin Gaslamp about a block away. The Gaslamp District in general is not optimal for ladies late in the evening. It has a little of a frat house atmosphere at night. However, it is quite fun for groups and couples. This is not a place for kids.

Reviews.Title: “great service, hotel could still use tlc”
Reviews.Author: fromsocal
Reviews.Content: We came down to SD for the night as a get away. The location of the hotel is right across from horton plaza and a block from the end of gas lamp alley. So needless to say you can walk anywhere. San Diego howvever seems to have a great deal of homeless in at least this area, so it made the walks a little uncomfortable at times. The hotel is a beautiful 100 year hotel that was restored. It is not a place if you are looking for the modern features. The rooms were smaller than we thought, although comfortable. The flatscreen had a poor picture, although I just may be used to HD at home. Outside the rooms in hallways were in need of TLC. There was dust build up in corners etc. The restrauant was nice but a little pricy. And if you drive you will pay 32/day to park. Overall we did not regret staying there, but may try something else next time. We have stayed at the hotels next to seaport on water and at other end of gas lamp, and really enjoyed them more. Again though the service was top notch

Reviews.Title: “Trendy cosmopolitan Hotel with antique sophistication”
Reviews.Author: sswinson
Reviews.Content: The suite was quaint with a contemporary flair. The staff were responsive and extremely accommodating, in line with the customer service you would expect with a luxury brand. I will frequent the US Grant again on my next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Castain
Reviews.Content: An absolutely wonderful experience. Our room was fantastic and the hotel is gorgeous. We stayed for our anniversary and had a splendid time. I can't say enough about the staff. Everyone was very gracious and attentive from the moment we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely spacious room”
Reviews.Author: missD07
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a lovely hotel and is walking distance to all the shops, bars and restaurants in the Gaslamp quarter. Very convenient location. Our room was spacious as we had two double beds and the chocs on the pillow every night was a lovely touch. Would definitely recommend it as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “This was an amazing 25th Anniversary Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda12360750
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for making this event wonderful! you upgraded our room, brought us chocolate covered strawberries...the staff was amazing! We would do it again in a heart beat! It was great to enjoy downtown San Diego from your central location too! The suite was so big we were able to invite some friends up for some coffee and conversation! It was the best anniversary we've had! We were delighted with our choice to pick the US Grant for this special time in our life!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: blairsacalis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at The US Grant for our one year anniversary and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The management was very friendly, helpful and attentive. (I should also note that we had a really noisey neighbor, and when we called the front desk to notify them about the noise, they immediately called our nieghbors who quieted down.) The rooms were clean and were appointed with many nice amenities like slippers, bottles of water (which they refreshed daily) and numerous toilettries. They did accidentally charge us for two nights of valet parking at the hotel but promptly removed the second night charge upon our check-out. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in San Diego, especially becasue of its location in the Gaslamp District. We walked to many great restaurants and bars in about 5-8 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Specialkaludwig
Reviews.Content: Beautiful chic hotel, but for the GasLamp--an area that is supposed to be "hopping"--this trip was a snooze. The hotel itself charged us "extra"...nearly $200 "extra" and claimed to release these funds at check in (mind you, I was already charged an initial deposit! and I am still not sure what the "extra" holdovers were for. ) When the staffer felt like she had sufficiently explained the charges to me, I asked if I could read her my statement which contradicted with hers, and I was placed on hold for about 10 minutes. The high -pitched "so sorry about that"... didn't help. The room had a fly in it upon check in and the shower took a full 5 minutes to warm up--all I wanted to do was take a hot shower after a long flight. Not worth the money...or the locale! This place was dead.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LMCouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent the night at the US Grant Hotel to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. When I reserved the room online, I made a special request to check in early and I let them know it was our 25th anniversary. I reserved a Legacy Suite (which is a smaller suite). I called the morning of our stay, and they said they'd call me if a room opened up early. Around 11:30am, they called and said our room was ready. When we checked in they told me our room was one of their signature suites, which I thought meant a suite unique to their hotel. Well, when we got to the room, it was HUGE. It had a dining area, a living room area, two king size beds and a bathroom as big as a bedroom in our home, with a walk-in, mult-sprayer shower. Wow! What an upgrade. In the afternoon, there was a knock at our door with a hotel employee delivering four huge, chocolate covered strawberries as a complimentary, anniversary gift. In addition, the location was great. Once we parked our car, we didn't use it again until we left the next day. We had lunch in a very nearby Brazilian Barbeque restaurant that was great, and later that evening, we met some friends in a nearby jazz club to have drinks, appetizers and dessert while listening to music. The stay in the room was very relaxing, romantic and comforable. The staff, on every level, was very pleasant and helpful. We had a great time! One other thing; I took advantage of a government employee discount when I made my initial reservation and we received all the above (upgrade and all) for that discounted rate on the smaller suite I had reserved. They were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sandrasok
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the US Grant. The front dest was very nice and helpful. Room is clean and roomy. across the street from horton plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance with great service”
Reviews.Author: mpflana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant for one wonderful week. The staff are attentive and go out of their way to ensure that your stay is memorable. The attention to detail and the elegant interior made for an unforgettable vacation. I would also recommend the Grant Grill, breakfast was fantastic. Despite the age of the building, the rooms were spacious and updated. The only thing missing was a pool, which wasn't a problem since guests can use the pool at the Westin across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Our visit to San Diego was a wonderful romantic interlude due to the gracious U.S. Grant Hotel Staff and Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: twoparsons
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the U.S. Grant in San Diego was very memorable and we highly recommend a visit. Only negatives were noise from outside fan and no t.v. in sitting area. Otherwise...perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - really, really!”
Reviews.Author: bruppelin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The staff is the finest I've had the pleasure of dealing with... a special thanks to Humberto who was providing the turn down service Monday evening. I was headed out for the evening and passed him in the hall. He asked if I needed anything - I did not need more mints, soap or towels. He insisted and I admitted that I did need something -- a lint roller for the next morning ( I had been planning to search for one after attending a function that evening). He smiled and said he'd take care of it. Arriving back at my hotel later that evening, I found he had indeed taken care of it. I was thrilled. My one caveat would be the ventilation systems. The system worked to keep the room cool enough (but it weather wasn't all that warm to begin with) but it was loud. Upon start up the blower rattled loudly for about 45 seconds. Every time... I mentioned it to the desk and they promised to have it checked. I don't know what they did or didn't do but I failed to notice any change. It didn't keep me awake but that could have been a result of 9 hours at the Convention Center and 3 hours of entertaining each evening :-)

Reviews.Title: “Classic SF/Paris/NYC hotel.....in SD.”
Reviews.Author: lbh2315
Reviews.Content: Weird place to stay in San Diego, very classic urban. Simply stated, it works. Totally different experience in SD when compared with La Jolla, Carlsbad, Mission Bay hotels. The lobby almost reminds one of a classic European hotel and the rooms harken me back to stays in NYC. Our room was smallish, but wonderfully appointed. Sharp white walls contrast perfectly with the hardwood floor foyer - and the lighting was well thought out. Nice bathroom remodel in classic white and the sheets and bedding were crisp. Walk north and it gets dicey, walk south and you are two mins to the heart of Gaslamp and Petco. This is not by any means my go-to San Diego hotel merely because of the location - but for a good change of pace when you tire of the crowds at the resorts and want to catch a Padre game and some good meals, you can't go wrong. One final note - use Priceline, this hotel is always in the mix and can be had for a very good deal. And you can park just north of the property for $8.00 overnight - don't be had by the $30 valet!

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: missbodog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Legacy Suite on the 9th floor. The bed was very comfortable. Got separate TVs in both sitting room and bedroom. We asked for a fridge inside our room. The location is very convenient and we used public transit to go everywhere. However, the bathroom is quite small, we are not big people and there is no way 2 people can be inside the bathroom. Also, we didn't like the location of the bedside TV, why would anyone put a TV at 90 degree with the bed? I also tried the gym at the basement level but wasn't too impressed. Also, the lack of a swimming pool is a drawback too but it is a 100 year old hotel. We also ate at the Grant Grill. Very stylish, felt like in Mad Men on TV. In 2006, we stayed at the Manchester Grant Hotel near the Seaport Village but didn't like the hotel far away from Horton Plaza, Gaslamp district since we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous and staff goes above and beyond to please.”
Reviews.Author: maddysmomml
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and I loved the whole experience. The hotel itself is gorgeous and the room did not disappoint. The bed was hard to get out of because it was so comfy and they provide you with all of the amenities that you could desire. The staff goes above and beyond to please and they're all very friendly. It's centrally located in the Gas Lamp and within walking distance to just about everything. I would definitely stay here again and again and would recommend to all our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh, what a gem!”
Reviews.Author: KBUSC
Reviews.Content: I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with a weekend trip down to San Diego for his birthday. Found out about this luxurious hotel on Trip Advisor and decided to stay here based on the great reviews. Our stay was perfect! The staff was very attentive, and the bed was comfy. I was even able to get some amenities delivered to the room as a birthday surprise - cake, wine and chocolate covered krispies. Suffice to say, he enjoyed his birthday surprise! We spent our evening shopping and walking around the gaslamp, and the location was ideal because it was close to everything, yet far away enough from the riff-raff of the bar/club scene. Would definitely stay here again! Thank you US Grant!

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: debramccullen
Reviews.Content: The most comfortable bed I ever slept in. The staff was exceptional. They seemed genuinely interested in my needs. The location was very convenient. Easy access to restaurants and shops. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice...but...”
Reviews.Author: hmaldi
Reviews.Content: The staff was so gracious here and the room was lovely. The hotel is nicely designed and the neighborhood is fun. However...the room was super hot and the windows don't open more than a crack for safety. The air conditioner was so loud that it was really a toss up whether to be hot or suffer the noise. Also, the equipment in the gym was 75% broken. The restaurant is worth skipping. Even for a foodie like me, it was pretentious and over the top trying way too hard. Still, I'd recommend it as a wonderful place to stay. Just skip the gym, the restaurant, and bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: shej0
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Slept well. The Grill's food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjsmac0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, apparently has been remodeled to celebrate its 100 birthday. Every room is different, we selected a room with jacuzzi tub, and the bathroom was enormous, very elegant and had a fabulous spa resort feel to it. The shower was a little bit weak though, hard to get wet but I think thats just because the building is older and we were on the 11th floor. The actual bedroom was a little smaller because of the large bathroom, if you dont need a tub then you may prefer to select a larger room with a sitting area. There is a mini bar but its automated and if you move anything it creates a charge, so no way could we put our own drinks or water in there. The happy hour is great with lots of half price cocktails, the appetizers are 50% off too so we had the fruit plate every afternoon and it was always different with plenty to eat. Didnt like the calamari, little too chewy. All the staff are very friendly and helpful, could not fault the service. Valet parking was expensive at $32 per night but we were on vacation so decided to accept it rather than find alternative parking, which I think you can do fairly close by if you prefer. The location is great, close to everything. Whilst we felt parts of the neighborhood were a bit run down we never felt worried about going out, its so close to walk to Gas Lamp, the shopping mall and even to the waterfront. So no need for taxis. Would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to returning to it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and rooms, but NOISY.”
Reviews.Author: DEVIANN
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel in a great location. I love hotels where you can actually open the windows, but his one is on a very busy street with very loud street noise until late at night, making it difficult to keep the windows open. Also, if you have a car, be prepared to pay $35 for overnight parking. Loved the robe!

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: pfarrma
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego to connect with an old friend and attend a baseball game. I could have stayed at a hotel closer to the ballpark but wanted to be in a quieter, more peaceful environment. The US Grant was recommended by a friend with impeccable taste and the hotel did not disappoint me. The staff was very courteous upon arrival and throughout our stay. The decor was beautiful and the room was extremely comfortable. I would highly recommend to anyone wanting a luxurious get-away at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “I could live at the US Grant!”
Reviews.Author: Leigh_Ann_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Landmark Suite for a getaway weekend, and the US Grant exceeded my expectations. The room itself was beautiful. Tastefully decorated with so many nice furnishings and fittings. The attention to detail was divine, from the specialty rugs and carpets to the herringbone tile in the shower. Additionally, the room was absolutely immaculate. I am extremely conscious of cleanliness in hotels and it was so nice that I felt right at home here. The amenities in the room were appropriate and I had everything I needed. The only thing that would have been nice was a his and hers robe instead of just one large bathrobe. Service at the hotel was terrific. The staff was extremely helpful and respectful to all guests, ensuring that all needs were met. We especially enjoyed talking to Sergio and Sergio at the Guest Concierge. The location is great, if you would like to be downtown within walking distance to the Gas Lamp District. The best sushi I have ever eaten was at Taka. You won't be disappointed, and just let the chefs prepare whatever they like within your parameters. It's a little on the high end, but well worth a splurge. All in all, I highly recommend the US Grant and will return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Small Suites”
Reviews.Author: omniskye
Reviews.Content: overall, i have mixed feelings regarding the US Grant Hotel. staff was courteous and helpful throughout our 3 day stay. rooms and hotel seem somewhat elegant and clean. fitness room had high-tech equipment. now for the cons: EXTREMELY disappointed in the size of the Legacy Suite. we paid an extra $60/night for a suite (vs. Superior room), but yet the size of the room was only a tad bigger than our friend's Superior room. very disappointed in this. even the Superior rooms are smaller than most other San Diego hotel rooms. i guess overall, if room size isn't an issue, then the hotel is great. otherwise, i would look elsewhere. would i stay here again? i might, only if i expect to stay at a smaller room vs. other hotels. i just feel ripped off for upgrading to a suite and getting a tad bigger room from an already smaller room.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: EdDocs
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the US Grant was nothing but phenomenal. Turn-down service included a bag of ice and chocolates. Clean rooms with a modern motif to a historical building. Staff was exceptionally hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: Bob33252
Reviews.Content: It seems like a very luxurious hotel. Unfortunately, the Gaslamp District needs to be renamed the Redlight District. We thought it would be a charming location. Instead there are bars at every turn with drunk, provocatively dressed girls and drooling guys. From our hotel room, we had a lovely view of a wall with graffiti all over it. We woke early every morning to voices from the room next door. Beware that parking is an outrageous $32 per night. The best part of our stay was the bed. Very comfortable and we got a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: anonymous60713
Reviews.Content: We originally checked into a small room, wasnt aware the room was this small. We upgraded for an additional price. It was worth it. The second room was absolutley spacious. I loved it. Customer service, room service and turned down service was superb and on time. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, you cannot go wrong with Majestic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: NickT1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic Elegance for 1 week with my wife and another couple celebrating our anniversary. We paid around $2800 per couple for 8d/7n, including round trip air from Los Angeles and their Elegance Club. Upon getting to the hotel, we were greeted by Angel, he proceeded to give us a tour of the property, which we did not want to take, since we had been in the air for 7 hours to Puerto Rico and another 1 hour to Punta Cana. Next we waited at the Elegance Club lounge for them to check us in. To make a long story short, it took approximately 2.5 hours for them to get us a room and put on our Elegance Club bracelets, which was very dissapointing. The food and service at this resort is average, nothing to write home about. Furthermore, I got sick for about 2 days due to the food. Our rooms were modern and clean. Make sure you brush up on your Spanish since most of the staff members do not speak or wish to learn any English, eventhough 80% of their business comes from Americans. Anotherwords, if you spoke Spanish, I felt that you were served differently. I speak some Spanish and we tipped often so we received good service throughout. Make sure you stop by the sea and see bar and say hello to my friends Mr. Wilson and speedy gonzales.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: jsaucer
Reviews.Content: For $200/night you should not be wakened by sirens and garbage trucks. My wife looked at the homeless shetler across the street and said we should stay there next time, because we would have a better view. It's obious the city of San Diego does not care if the city has future visitors because they do nothing to stop the numerous panhandlers that acost you every time you go outside. Then there is the $32/day parking fee plus tips, the $12/day internet fee, the $14 mixed drinks and the automatic 18% gratuity the Grant slaps on everything. I guess that auto gratuity explains why they don't provide better and more friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great history & a great staff”
Reviews.Author: travelfun40
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to let you know that we really enjoyed our stay at your hotel. (even dropping a glass in the sink and getting a pretty serious cut, did not mar our experience) I did want to point out a particular highlight. One evening we were walking around downstairs and were approached by one of your security guards, Clifford. After ascertaining that we were guests touring the hotel, he offerred us a private tour of the ball rooms accompanied by an interesting talk on the hotel & its history. His enthusiasm for where he worked was a pleasure to see. Thank you & we look forward to visiting again if we find ourselves in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Victoriag2008
Reviews.Content: The US Grant hotel was a really nice place to stay in SD. The hotel was located right in downtown-just a walk away to great shops, restaurants, bars in the Gaslamp district. The rooms were very nicely decorated and clean. The staff was incredibly friendly and willing to help with anything. The hotel bar/restaurant was delicious-got breakfast one morning, but it was veryy expensive, however their happy hour is reasonable. The downside was- no pool, more of a business hotel, very "fancy", also alot of outside noise made it hard to sleep some nights. overall, i did enjoyed my stay and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: lizfonti
Reviews.Content: Grand, smart, posh (but not stuffy) simply had a wonderful two nights here. The hotel has been tastefully restored and elegantly furnished with a contemporary twist. The staff were all fantastic; professional but friendly. The entire place was immaculately clean. The beds were very comfortable and the art work headboards were impressive. Free fitness suite was welcome, small but well equipped. Only had breakfast which was superb; pastries were to die for and the cooked food was just sublime! The parking was the most expensive on our trip at $32 per nt but don't know the area so can't judge.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get over charged stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: veterancowboy
Reviews.Content: First off if you want there parking it's $32 a night to park. Internet is $12 a day. You are charged $100 A DAY for incidentals and do not get reemersed till you check out so if you use a debit card you are charged the $200 a night for 5 nights=$1,000 plus $100 a day for incidentals so thats another $500 don't forget the $160 for parking and $60 for internet so thats $1720 will hit your card for 5 days. So Bestern would be alot better off and just drive to the downtown area. We were also charged for a $48 breakfast that we never ate that we had to argue. Your room there is no microwave, fridge, tv guide, room is small we were afraid to use anything for fear of getting charged. The buisness office charges you 70 cents a minute and a dollar a page to print so if you need to print your airline tickets you will be paying yet again. Best Westernt it's free. I suggest FIND ANOTHER hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DixieTango
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a lovely place to stay in San Diego's charming and eclectic Gaslight District. The hotel is over 100 years old but updated with a modern feel and decor. The only downside to staying there was the room service. The food was overcomplicated and fell well short of the gourmet fair the restaurant was trying for. As an alternative I recommend Brian's 24 (open 24 hours, breakfast all day) or one of the other amazing restaurants in the area which are all within walking distance. There is also an open air shopping center directly across the street. We would absolutely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “no water pressure in the shower on the 11th floor”
Reviews.Author: CaseyNorthridge_Ca
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and 2 kids, and we booked a double bed grand deluxe room. The room was on the 11th floor, and extremely small for 4 people. The bathroom was elegant, but there was very little water pressure in the shower. The beds were extremely small since they are smaller than a standard queen. There was an old smell as you get out of the elevator. As for positives, the hotel is situated in downtown, so it is close to everything. The lobby is nice, and rooms are elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic elegant hotel, ideally located, concierge excellent”
Reviews.Author: Marks_review
Reviews.Content: Rooms great, very quiet hotel and quite plush/posh but not in imposing way. We were made to feel very welcome with our 2 young kids. We booked through hotels.com and were supposed to get an upgrade on check in but the hotel claimed they knew nothing about this. Nevertheless the room we had was superb and I can't fault it at all. The concierge (Marc) was very helpful arranging a hire car as it was cheaper than taxi's to the wild animal park. He was also very knowledgeable about restaurants to eat in etc, I would recommend asking for advice. The hotel is ideally suited for the Gaslamp area which is very lively in the evenings, but I would recommend this hotel compared to others which appeared a lot more lively and noisy, and what I would term as more standard hotel and less luxury than the US Grant. There is also free wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: KingDevil
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Signature Suite, and it was truly exceptional. From the bathroom (what a shower!) to the living room and bedroom, it was top notch. Besides a maid waking us up on our checkout morning at 8:30am, the service was excellent. We ate at the Grant Grill and our waitor was excellent and personable. We truly enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. In fact, I'm already considering heading back in December. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations.”
Reviews.Author: clint411
Reviews.Content: My wife has always wanted to stay there, we normally stay down the street. It was disappointing to find out there was water on the 3rd floor on the carpet. The smell of mildew was prevalent. Very disappointing. Housekeeping did a poor job keeping the hallways clean. The carpet in the room obviously needed to be cleaned. Other than that it was very nice. Great location and the lobby area was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury meets Quality and Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ayush17
