Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the US Grant, I was greeted by the valet staff who were all very pleasant, very willing to help and a pleasure to meet to me. The hotel is a beautiful site that is modern day royalty. The decor of the hotel is breath taking and you constantly want to capture the beauty with your camera. The front desk staff and concierge service are extremely helpful, welcoming bringing customer service to a new level. A special note to Front Desk Staff member, Harry. He went above and beyond to ensure that all our needs were meet and was a pleasure to meet. I have traveled to many hotels over several countries and my 2 day stay at this hotel was one of the best vacations I have had because of the service and beauty of the hotel. Congratulations to them and I look forward to going back there very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very well appointed and comfy. Somewhat detached staff.”
Reviews.Author: J&CinNM
Reviews.Content: The US Grant really shines in a couple of categories. The rooms are exquisitely comfortable and classy. The bathroom was roomy and elegant. The art in the lobby and on the mezzanine is truly exceptional. The history of the hotel is well documented in photographs that adorn the wall. The lobby is sparkling and very tastefully designed. However, the service was acceptable, but not impressive. You could easily walk into this hotel and have nobody greet you or ask you how you are doing, if you need anything etc. I would imagine if the staff knew that I was rich that they would have treated me differently. I booked through the hotel website. Construction noise made naps impossible. That said, I would stay again without hesitation. In terms of service I guess I just expected more friendliness and accommodation. Even thought i'm not a "high roller" I did pay good money for my room and I believe I am entitled to the exceptional service I saw others enjoying. Location is fantastic, right across from Horton! I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: This review is partly influenced by the fact that we got a great deal through AAA that included parking and a $50 food credit. Nevertheless, the staff was welcoming, the room was wonderful (although the mattress was a little hard for my taste), the view from the room was great and the food at the Griil (dinner and breakfast) was excellent.. It all absolutely felt like luxury. My main criticism is that there is a high charge for WiFi, which is rediculous for a hotel in this class (Or, for that matter, any hotel these days. It's like charging extra for cable TV or air conditioning.) And with such a high parking fee (albeit waived as part of our package), there is no excuse for the valet bringing us to the wrong car.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars must not mean what it used to mean”
Reviews.Author: jonnymint
Reviews.Content: Our vacation to San Diego could have been a LOT better. Let me first say that a 5 star rating implies high end service, amenities and attention to detail. The US Grant in downtown San Diego is touted as a 5 star hotel but failed to meet any hint of such quality. I will detail our observations from our 3 night stay. Some may see these criticisms as petty, but in a 5 star hotel, these details would NOT be overlooked. Although of no real bearing on the hotel's quality, the immediate neighborhood was quite crowded with homeless individuals. I mention this because atmosphere usually an impact on ones enjoyment of their chosen accommodations and have nothing against the unfortunate people who have no place to go. When checking in to a hotel, a major first impression is given by the professionalism of the front desk staff. The ill fitting, cheap looking suits should have been our first warning. Along the way to our 5th floor room we noticed dust and dirt in the corners of every hall and outside the service elevator. It made us feel as though we'd just entered a flophouse. Throughout our stay midday and into the evening, the heavy room doors in our hall were slamming shut over and over again. Some of this happened when guests came and went but the majority was at the hands of housekeeping who should know better. In the room (check-in day and the following two nights) we found several unfortunate things: On two separate nights there was a cleaning rag left on the floor by the bed, one night a sponge was left in the bathroom and the cover to the tissue was left on the bathroom counter. One lamp was left unplugged, lamp shades facing the wrong direction and crooked, and only one bathrobe in the closet. The crooked lampshade was never noticed by housekeeping as we left it just to see what kind of attention they paid such details. The bathroom sink water pressure was a mere dribble and the amenities were not fully replaced each night as one would expect. The bathroom mirrors looked as though they were washed by a blind person with smears and spots left behind. On our second night we arrived back at the hotel at 3:30 and the room had not yet been made up. Our last night there the bed looked as though there was someone sleeping it it because the comforter (with a ripped cover) had been laid out as though it were thrown on the bed. Our first morning we came to find a scratch in our rental car which was adequately handled by management, but you would think that at $32.00 per day for parking, some sort of compensation would have been offered. Nope. The $42.00 bottle of wine in the room was sad to see whereas in the Joie de Vivre hotels such a thing is complimentary. We tried the hotel bar and paid more for one (small) glass of wine than what the hotel paid for the entire bottle. In that bar, on a very slow night, our table was filthy with fingerprints and rings from previous drinkers beverages. And of course a massive glaring flat screen TV over the bar all but obliterated any sense of escape and luxury we had hoped for. Even the staff maligned the installation of this thing. Overall this was a HUGE disappointment based on the Hotels history and promise of 5 star service. We would have to say that the one GOOD thing about the US Grant hotel was the Valet Staff. A pleasant, professional and swift group of guys I'd be pleased to see again, as long as they don't scratch my car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Parking $32 Stings With no other option available!”
Reviews.Author: nkeogan
Reviews.Content: I emailed prior to arriving about the car park fee. $32 per night. Had I known that the only option available was valet parking, I would have reconsidered my options. The email did not mention this. It is disapointing that whilst the email was correct, it was economical with the truth. The hotel had a good ambiance, an incredible art gallery attached, run by a very charming Russian lady. Its location is central for everything, you do not need a car!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: robincolbert
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff greeted at all times 5 star personalities. Only complaint parking is expensive. Coming from Las Vegas all hotels have free self parking and valet.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: abetr
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels. Never have i seen such a great hotel. From the moment you pull up till you leave they give you the royal treatment. The staff is extremely friendly and nice. And the rooms are fit for kings. From the carpet that feels like butter. To the furniture that is fit for a mansion to the stunning bathroom. The US Grant is one of a kind.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Service”
Reviews.Author: havekidslovetravel
Reviews.Content: Though I was reluctant to stay in such a grand hotel as the Grant with a 4 year-old and an 8 month-old, my husband insisted and I am so grateful he did! The service was top-rate and the splendor of the property was fantastic. The US Grant was renovated in 2006, and every guest room features an original drip-painted piece of art over the bed. The decor is beautiful blend of turn of the century classical and chic "old Hollywood" glamour. The carpets were plush, the bedding luxurious and the bathroom was lovely. Staff were helpful and unpretentious, and even the bar tender and fashionable waitress were happy to serve our less-than-elegant brood. Each night we stayed featured a half-price happy hour in the hotel's restaurant, which we took advantage of. Breakfast (not included) was worth every penny of the roughly $20 we paid each for our shrimp fritatta and poached eggs with truffled hashbrowns. Fitness facilities in the hotel were in the basement. Not ideal, but given that the Grant is a Starwood hotel, we were invited to use the pool and fitness center at the Westin across the street. Location was great for visiting the Gaslamp District and waterfront, and given that San Diego is quite a compact city in many ways, we were able to drive to other attractions (e.g., SeaWorld, Zoo, Old Town) in no time. Valet parking was our one and only gripe--$32/day seemed a bit high. All in all, though, our stay at the US Grant helped us make some great memories of our time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay for SDCC if you want an oasis”
Reviews.Author: ArtInsights
Reviews.Content: loved every minute of staying at the US Grant for Comic con. Not for everyone, it doesn't have the insane party vibe the Hyatt does or the proximity other hotels have, but if you want to be surrounded by luxury, treated like a VIP (even if you aren't Harrison Ford) and have great food consistently during your stay, this is the place. True any time, but especially appreciated by a weary con worker after slogging through the crowds and interviewing all day.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: LA310
Reviews.Content: I have zero complaints about this hotel. The staff is perfectly courteous and helpful, the location right where you want to be to enjoy a walk through the gaslamp district. The decor is traditional in the lobby and the rooms are stylish, trendy, urban, large and very comfortable. The bedding surpasses the westin heavenly bed and the toiletries are gilchrist & soames. Wifi is not free but available throughout. Best valet service i've seen. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “So Beautiful...so comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: islandhopperx2
Reviews.Content: Met my daughter in San Diego for a weekend and booked 2 nights at the US Grant. What a fabulously beautiful hotel in the classic style of historic hotels! Our room was very spacious, subtly elegant with oh-so comfortable beds and a wonderfully chic bathroom. The lobby itself is worth a visit with vases of well designed flowers in every marbled corner. The staff was gracious, the experience warm and inviting. This hotel is worth the 3,000 mile flight!

Reviews.Title: “"Upgraded" to this hotel....not worth the price and was lacking...”
Reviews.Author: kaleli
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were traveling for Comic-Con. Original reservations were to the Westin across the street (owned by same company) and had to pay full price as we were unable to get in on the reservations through Comic-Con as they were sold out. Got a call a day or two before we were scheduled to head down and advised that our hotel had been "upgraded" to the US Grant. Cool, or so I thought.... Overnight parking is $32 bucks on top of the $469 we paid for a room. Oh, despite being upgraded with the same amenities as the Westin (two beds), my confirmation read one. I called and was put on hold for 45 minutes before I called on my girlfriend's phone and advised I was still on hold. Eventually it was sorted out. One thing I will say was cool is we could park the Truck before we checked in and after we checked out at no cost. The parking cost only applies if the vehicle is kept overnight. Upon arriving and checking in, the lobby is very nice. The elevators are pretty small and designed to encourage you to bell-hop your bags. Once we got out of the elevator, the first thing we noticed was the floors. I don't know if it was the lighting, which was very dim, but the floors looked like they had been flooded or had serious water damage. If this is their aesthetic flare, then I would say it didn't work for me. We were in Room 733. As we got to our room around 8:00, there was a dinner tray with some left over food to the room next to us, likely 735. It looked fresh so we paid no attention. Inside the room was pretty small, especially for the price. Motel 6 could have probably been bigger. One of the bathroom lights didn't work and one of the main room lights didn't work. However, even with the lights, I believe the rooms are too dimly lit (personal preference). The double beds we got were ridiculously small. I am 6'3 and I was not very comfortable when I tried to sleep that night. One plus is the shower heads. Because of my height, a lot of showers are positioned way too low and I have to hunch over to take a shower. This shower head was above my head and I like that. Upon waking up, we needed to know if the hotel would allow us to keep the truck while we went to Comic-con. There are 2 phones in the room. We tried the phone next to the bed. To use the phone, you keep the phone on the receiver, punch the line you want and then push the department you want. All calls failed to go through, which was aggravating. I then used the phone on the desk and all I had to do was push the service line. 2 attempts both went to voice-mail. Finally called the front desk on my personal phone and got our question answered and also requested bell-hop to come and hold our bags while we went to Comic-Con. On our way out at about 8:30 in the morning, the plate of food was still in the hall and was dried up and giving off an odor... I went to check-out at that time and was told I had a $470 balance due on the room. This was quite a shock since I had already been charged and paid in advance. They then indicated that they credited my original CC a day earlier and needed payment. I tried with my original card but it failed. Luckily I had my back-up card. This upset me because my original card I wanted to pay with because I wanted the points on that card. The card I ended up paying with does not collect points. Second, it is now 5 days since the card was supposedly credited and I have not been credited the funds on that card, so I am closely watching that matter. So we go to Comic-Con and come back to pick-up the truck and are told to go back to the front desk because there was an issue. Turns out to be the card issue again for the $32 overnight parking fee. They couldn't have notified me at the time I paid the room fee that I had an outstanding vehicle fee?? Needless to say, it was a nice Comic-Con, but the sleeping arrangements and the hotel was lacking. Really a 4 Star/4 Diamond? Huh...not in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Ever”
Reviews.Author: Agrimensora
Reviews.Content: As a surprise for my birthday my husband wisked me off by train to San Diego. When he stopped in the lobby of the Grant I thought he was going to ask for directions. Lo and behold he had made a reservation for my birthday. The room was gorgeous and included a separate sitting area. We loved the location as we were in town with the comic con crowd. Great for people watching. The gaslamp is an easy walk as was convenient shopping. We had breakfast in bed served in style and elegance. At the grill our server, Pablo, was exceptional. Don't let me forget our greeter at the front desk, Colin, with his warm welcome. Best birthday ever....

Reviews.Title: “Simply phenomenal!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rhkgt
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in San Diego and we booked a deluxe room at the US Grant. Our vistas included San Diego bay through one set of windows and Horton Plaza and the gaslight district from the other windows. At night, it was really pretty. We entered the room through a small foyer with an adjoining closet. The room was spacious and well appointed. The bed was comfortable and provided a really good night’s sleep. The marble tiled bath was also spacious with accompanying nice amenities. The staff was pleasant and accommodating. Housekeeping missed our room the first morning. We mentioned it to staff as we departed to the San Diego Zoo. As expected, the room had been serviced upon our return, but we also received a hand-written note from the general manager along with a chilled split of wine. It was nice to see service with a special touch still exists. The staff was again helpful in moving our luggage and securing a taxi to the San Diego Cruise terminal. No regrets from us; we would readily book a room at the US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally outstanding accommodations and service.”
Reviews.Author: mellennyburbs
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed historic hotel in a great central location restored to perfection with THE MOST gracious and attentive staff. Rooms are decorated artistically with a perfect balance of elegance as well as every modern convenience and comfort. Yes, there is turn down service with those yummy chocolates on the pillow, and the ample supply of bottled water is always replenished. The staff are personable and helpful, and detail oriented to the extent that they often anticipate needs. The ambience in the grand lobby combines opulent elegance with wonderfully comfortable furnishings arranged in separated sitting areas perfect for meeting with friends or business associates. The bar area is open and comfortable and happy hour is an especially good value. The appetizers available in the bar area are fabulous, and the restaurant is a fine dining destination. In the morning, the coffee available off the lobby is really, really delicious and can be enjoyed on site or as take out. Room service is terrific and always right on time. Looking forward to our next stay in San Diego at the U.S. Grant.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel all the way!”
Reviews.Author: tripandfall3
Reviews.Content: Located right at the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter, this hotel is close to everything we wanted to do. The staff was extremely helpful. The room was immaculate. The bed was heavenly. Although it is a pricey hotel, you get what you pay for. Turn down service each night with chocolates on our pillows and bottles of water by the bedside was a nice touch. The ONLY downside to the hotel is a typical city hotel problem - parking. If you have a car, the parking is $33 a day. It was more expensive to park the car then to rent it! But I would go back to the Grant in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a Princess”
Reviews.Author: sarahc8208
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this beautiful, historic hotel. The rooms were luxurious and comfortable and the staff went above and beyond to ensure my contentment. Fantastic art and photography lined the walls and rooms and no detail was spared in the decor. The hotel is in the tourist-friendly Gaslamp District and directly across from Horton Plaza, a huge open-air shopping complex. Drawbacks include - small fitness center, no swimming pool, and lots of panhandlers in the downtown area (seemed mostly harmless). Lots of shopping and restaurants in walking distance as well as fine dining within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: snowgirl62
Reviews.Content: From the second I arrived, the the moment I left, this hotel stands as one of the best I've ever been to. Upon arrival, the valet staff was right there to open my door, retrieve my luggage, and even welcome me by name(!!) and stating that they were expecting me. The rooms are small, but very comfortable. The bathrooms are modern and great also. I did get down to the fitness center a few mornings, and although small, it was adequate for a decent workout. I'd say that one of the best surprises was the nightly turndown service complete with complimentary water and chocolates! All in all, a great experience from start to finish! As for the location, it could not have been better! I was in San Diego for a conference in the convention center, and this hotel was a great walking distance. Situated on the northnern edge of the Gaslamp District, you are right in the heart of downtown and some great food, entertainment, and nightlife. I'd highly recommend Dicks Last Resort for a very causal lunch (their "thing" is to be rude to customers - its entertaining!!), The Field as a great Irish bar with very good food, Nicky Rottens for a great burger, and Cafe Sevilla for a great upscale tapas menu. For nightlife - the Whiskey Girl is also a great spot! As this was my first time in San Diego, I wasn't sure where to go, but everyone said you can't go wrong with the options in the Gaslamp, and they were right. If you can make it out to Coronado Island, you need to check out Candela's resturaunt. Pricey, but very good! In summary - US Grant doesn't simply have a great staff, but their location also helps to make it a wonderful place to stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: samsunday
Reviews.Content: Good: We stayed in the deluxe corner room which is larger that the regular one. The hotel is beautiful, and the room decoration is impeccable. You truly feel you are in a five star place. Bad: - the reception staff although professional is pretentious and is not really there to help you like in any other hotel chain such as Marriott. We also called the front desk on a saturday afternoon, nobody picked up after 30 rings - the room was on the street, and it looks like that they do not have double glazing: it was extremely noisy, you could hear every noise coming from the street: people, cars, sirens...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a drawback”
Reviews.Author: jheffernpt
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the US Grant during a combination business and leisure trip. I was impressed by the decor, particularly the stunning lobby. We ate at the Grant Grill for a dinner and for breakfast and were quite impressed. While walking from the convention center on the waterfront to the hotel, the neighborhood takes a turn from one filled with tourists and restaurants to a poverty-stricken area with homeless people dominating the street. This was an interesting contrast to this luxury collection property. The hotels biggest fault is its inability to block out hallway noise. Most nights of sleep were interrupted by loud guests walking down the halls late at night as well as early in the morning. It seems that renovations may have left a large opening under the door that allows for significant sound to enter the room. Additionally, the door essentially opens up in to the sleeping area which does not buffer the noise. The third source of noise was the ear piercing sound of a dining cart being parked in the service elevator doorway to block the door while room service was being delivered. The noise, in addition to a lack of swimming pool, I will probably choose the Westin if I return to this area.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Decorations. 3 Star Service.”
Reviews.Author: lpkitten
Reviews.Content: The U.S. Grant has a lot going for it and really has the potential to be a stellar hotel. It is absolutely gorgeous with thick soft cushy carpets that melt under your feet. The rooms are impeccably decorated with contemporary artwork. The location is great near lots of restaurants, bars, and shops. Everything seems great....at first. For me, this hotel lost a lot of points based on the small details. The first thing was that as soon as I walked into the bathroom, I noticed a very unpleasant smell. At first I thought that someone had recently graced our toilet with their presence but then I realized I was smelling raw sewage. Ewwww? I called down to the front desk to ask if this was normal and she said she would send up an engineer to take a look at it. We waited around for the engineer to show up and all she did was pour some deodorant down the drain. It did take care of the problem in the toilet but later as I was brushing my teeth I noticed that the smell also emanated from the sink as well. Not exactly a pleasant aroma while you're trying to get clean. Also, I felt our room was less than clean. This could be because of the icky feeling that was left by the errant cleaning glove left behind in our room. Uhhh, housecleaning, I think you forgot something. We found it rather amusing that after we set out the empty glasses that they failed to remove earlier with the glove inside, only the glasses remained. I guess they didn't want management to know that the glove was left behind in the room but didn't want to bother themselves with taking the glasses? They also threw out our newspaper (that we brought with us) that we hadn't even had a chance to read yet. Why would they leave behind dirty glasses but throw out your paper? When we notified the front desk, they said they'd look for another one but called us back and told us they were plum out of papers. Basically, the front desk wasn't really going to go out of their way for anything. Like others have mentioned, parking is atrociously expensive. You're not going to get anything free, not even complimentary coffee. I also didn't like that you couldn't use your refrigerator because if you moved anything inside you'd automatically be charged for it. We normally bring water and some snacks with us to the hotel but were a little annoyed to find our refrigerator inaccessible. Yes, it is loud. I normally sleep right through the night without interruption but I woke up several times to the sounds of people in the streets and ahem...in their rooms. At one point I asked my boyfriend if there was an earthquake because of the people in the next room "enjoying themselves" at 4 in the morning. There's also no pool but you can use the Westin's across the street. Another thing that irked me...there was no bathtub. Only a shower. Overall, this hotel LOOKS like a five-star hotel but the service and the amenities just weren't there for me.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking for bicycles”
Reviews.Author: Joewaterford
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about the U.S. Grant ("USG") on Trip Advisor, I can't understand what the complaints were about. From the time we arrived until we left, the staff and Hotel are above and beyond anything I have ever experienced before. I'm not a world traveler, (my girlfriend is though) and I don't make a ton of money, but the USG was the absolute best hotel I have ever stayed in. The two things that really stood out for us were the room cleaning service people and the valet parking. When my girlfriend and I arrived, she had a terrible migraine and was throwing up. When the room service people found out how sick she was, they brought her chicken noodle soup and chamomile tea---free of charge. The best part for me though was the valet parking. I rented a bicycle, and I asked the concierge where I could lock up my bike. He replied just take it to the valet parking, and they would put it in a secure storage area. At the end of the first day of riding, I ride into the parking garage and ask them if they could store my bike, "Yes sir not a problem, let me get your name and give you this ticket, and when you're ready to get your bike just call down and we'll have it ready for you"---Whoaa---how cool is this? The next morning I'm ready to go and I call down to tell them I'll be down in five and please bring my bike out. Again, how cool is it to walk through a door and have a guy (or girl) holding your bike and asking "How was your ride yesterday Mr Mathis"? I felt like Lance Armstrong. Another reviewer complained about no bathub in the bathroom---are you kidding me???? I'm guessing that person is in the minority. Who would want a tub in the bathroom when your on vacation or a business trip. I loved the large (room for two) shower stall and no tub to climb over and the huge glass doors were awesome. I wish there was a bit more water pressure, but the shower head was one of those large rain shower type and got the job done. We were on the 4th floor, and the hot water came up fast. We had a corner room on Broadway and 3rd, and while there was noise form the street below, it never really bothered me, and I was never awakened by sirens or traffic going by. The windows are single pane, but they do add to the charm of the hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable for a hotel, nice and firm. The refrigerator was well stocked, and we didn't see the notice about taking stuff out and being charged for it. We rearranged it so we could put in our own soft drinks and milk. A few days later we realised that we would be charged for taking the items out of the fridge even though we didn't drink them. When we explained to the front desk what we did they pulled up our bill and immediately took them off--no charge, no problem. And we learned we could ask for a separate refrigerator for our own use free of charge. I was concerned about all the street people around the hotel, but after a couple days I realized they weren't a problem. When they asked for money, I kept going and for the most part they didn't bother me. One evening we took our leftovers to a homeless man we'd noticed earlier in the day, and he was very appreciative. Like another reviewer wrote, I felt completely safe walking around that area after dark, and had no problem walking from Petco field after a ballgame. (stinkin' Colorado Rockies won). All the hotels in the gaslamp district had street people hanging around, but not in front of the hotels bothering people. San Diego is a phenominal city. I have been describing it to my friends as compact and easy to get around in. Everything is with in walking distance. The USG is an awesome hotel, with an exceptional staff and I hope to get the chance to stay there again. The valet parking for my bicycle was just the best. Thank you U. S. Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: lauraSwiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant for 5 nights in June 2010. This is a Luxushotel with friendly staff, clean. elegant and large rooms. I would definitively stay again at this hotel. For us it was just perfect, except maybe the fact that the hotel does not have a pool nor a terrace. On the other hand, the US Grant is ideally located in San Diego downtown. Very good stay for leisure and probably the best business hotel in town. I am very picky and I feel like recommending this hotel to all those who want to stay in a perfectly clean, luxury hotel at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkim3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W before at San Diego downtown, but I always had problems there. I like the decor at the Grant and the hotel always upgraded my room to a suite and the rooms are very nice. The bathroom is very small but it is not a problem. I like the wooden floor. I look forward to going back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Very Small”
Reviews.Author: Tarjida
Reviews.Content: I won a gift certificate to this hotel and was excited to stay here, but I must say I would not pay to stay here again. It is a beautiful and luxurious hotel, just like most Starwood Luxury Collection hotels, but since it was in downtown San Diego, the rooms were tiny. We were upgraded to a suite and I was surprised at how little space there was. It felt claustrophobic. The service was phenomenal though and the hotel is close to everything. They only have valet parking and there is a "per night" fee for it, in addition to the gratuity that you would give to the valets. This is the only time I have stayed at in downtown San Diego so I have nothing to compare it to, but I would imagine that most of this is to be expected when staying downtown somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!! Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladymags_1
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobby, elegant trendy decor! Rooms are very well appointed! For a luxury collection, I expected a little higher end bathroom, but otherwise the room was great. Bed was super comfortable and location is outstanding. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully old hotel that's been beautifully rennovated with warm, rich decor.”
Reviews.Author: 60750Havinfun123
Reviews.Content: Service was great. Location is good in terms of being close to all however when you walk out the front door the first thing you see are a bunch of homeless folks staked out right across the street. It's a fact of life yes but takes a little away from the 5 star experience you receive in the hotel. Parking is $32 but there are several lots real close to the hotel that charge $12 day vs. $32 with in and our privledges. We ate breakfast at the Grant Grill in the hotel and it was excellent. We were on the 4th floor and our room had no view which was a little disappointed because all you could see was the room directly across from you so you had to keep the blinds shut. The other thing that bothered me as a woman: the sinks have zero room for you to put any of your toiletries. This did not seem to be the case for every room as I did see some larger vanity areas in rooms across my mine but it was a real pain for me. If you're a woman . . . ask for a room with a large vanity so you can at least put a comb down without it dropping to the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Travellotte
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a perfect place to stay for those taking a cruise. A quick $15 taxi ride (tip included) from San Diego Airport will take you to a beautiful hotel with excellent, helpful staff. My wife and I loved our room which was spacious, clean and quiet. The daily complimentary water was a very nice touch! There is a small, well-equipped gym but the sea wall is within easy jogging distance for those so inclined. All the attractions we wanted where within easy walking distance (e.g. Horton Plaza, the Gas Lamp Quarter , Petco Field, the USS Midway and the port). There is a pharmacy and a number of convenience stores close by as well. The Zoo, Balboa park etc., however, are further away requiring a taxi ride. There are plenty of places to eat close by and the concierge recommended a rustic Italian restaurant called "Asti". It was excellent and definitely a must try! Downtown San Diego, in general, can be a bit "interesting" with the locals but my wife and I felt safe to walk about. The port is a 5 minute taxi ride away but be advised that the taxi will drop you a little ways (~ 50 yards) from the port entrance because of the traffic volume. Not really a problem though unless you have many cases. All in all, an excellent stay and a beautiful, friendly hotel. We will certainly stay here again on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and it smells really good the moment you step in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: RMC06
Reviews.Content: I travel for work 2-4x a quarter and it has always been tricky booking hotels online. You just don't know what to expect until you step in the lobby. US Grant was well worth the adventure. My stay was simply awesome....very clean, quirky staff, and great access to a lot of shops for a quick me-time while on business trip. One of the few hotels at its price range that really smell good. The only downside is that I had to spend personal money on top of company allowed accommodation rate. Well, you always get what your money is worth!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, rich vibe”
Reviews.Author: carolsott
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the U.S. Grant. It's a historic property, built in 1910, that has gone through a couple of makeovers, the most recent a $56 million renovation in 2006. Hotel is plush, with fantastic lobby featuring huge crystal chandeliers and comfy rooms sporting original art. But the real draw is the service. Every employee is at your beck-and-call. If you wander around looking a little lost in the lobby, someone will be at your elbow asking if they can help. Don't like your room's location? They'll gladly change it. Sitting in the lobby working on your laptop? A staff member will soon appear with a cold bottle of water. I have only one criticism: Free Wi-Fi should be included in the rooms. Also, be aware of two potential issues: This hotel is located in downtown San Diego, so parking is expensive (as it is at all downtown hotels). Also, a sizable number of harmless, but sometimes aggressive panhandlers wander nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Gem Shines Again”
Reviews.Author: chicagoboi
Reviews.Content: Great: Service, Design/Decor, Beds/Linens, Housekeeping- very clean!, Pet friendly hotel with great pet amenities, top quality Restaurant. Bummers: Lack of fitness/spa/pool facilities (this is SoCal, after all), Bathrooms (Small and no tub in my suite!), not the best location downtown (a little rough around the edges), NO FUNCTIONING WINDOWS OR BALCONY- makes room quite stuffy. Overall, the US Grant is a very comfortable, stylish, updated and luxurious historical property with a few minor downers, depending on what you are looking for in a luxury hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: James5199
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very courteous and helpful. As a historic hotel, it has a lot of great features and is very well maintained. It has a great lounge area downstairs and has an art gallery with some beautiful works. I would definitely stay there again. It's also in the Gaslamp District in San Diego, which is a great location for restaurants. The only regret I have is that I was traveling for business and did not take my fiance with me. She would have loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Way Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: jdip2010
Reviews.Content: During this trip I stayed at the Omni, the HardRock and the US Grant. The omni and HardRock are located next to one another close to the bay and at the entrance to the Gaslamp area. Both were very nice, modern decor, very comfortable. Both had nice pools and fitness centers. Bars and restaurants withing blocks. US Grant......what a let down. Was the last of the 3 hotels I stayed at. I was looking forward to an awesome place being that it has a 5 star rating, boy was I let down. First of all, it is located deep in the gaslamp a far walk to the bay. The further in from the Bay you travel, the worse the neighborhood becomes and while this place may look fancy, the neighborhood is far from it. So the hotel is 100 years old. The AC is really loud, the furnishings are so so and the fitness center is located in the BASEMENT and is nothing more than a few exercise bikes and a treadmill (far less than what is offered at the above 2 hotels) . There is absolutely no view from the hotel room. Lets just say, if I was 70 years old I might find this hotel nice. It is the complete opposite of a modern hotel such as the OMNI. I have to say, staying at the US grant was my own fault. I did see the pics online and did look at the map. i am just hoping this review will have others think twice before booking and not just base their choice on the 5 star hotel rating. Trust me, if you are younger, looking to have some fun and like the modern look and feel of a newer hotel, do not book here.

Reviews.Title: “Just want the doctor order”
Reviews.Author: Amourflower
Reviews.Content: Both me and my two daughters went on a short trip to San Diego. We stayed at the US Grant hotel. we were right in the middle of SD. we had a wonderful time in that city. We rented a car, so we were able to really see want this wonderful city has to offer a person. Plenty of resturants and plenty to see and do. We plan to go back, only because there was still more we didn't see on our first visit. The hotel Staff were very good at giving us tips on places to see and things to do, while in SD. For the most part we had a very good experince and I do recommend that at least one of your trips need to be to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gourmet_bc
Reviews.Content: Working in the hospitality industry, I had high expectations for this hotel. They Delivered. I had requested a higher floor room and larger sized room as well. Both requests were fulfilled on a sold out night. Each inquiry that I had made at the concierge desk was followed by a hand delivered envelope with all of the requested information and an invitation to contact them for further assistance. The service we received from all the staff was incredible and genuine. We even received a historical tour of the hotel from Clifford, a senior employee that highlighted the unique facts of this timeless hotel. We found out later that he was featured on a PBS special about the hotel.Upon departure, I placed a call to the General Manager of this property to congratulate him on our flawless stay. I received his voice mail and left a message of great satisfaction. I honestly didn't expect to hear back from him, but within 5 minutes he called our room. He apologized for missing my call, and really took the time to thank me for the comments that I had left. It was clear to me that the outstanding service that I had received from all the staff had been initiated from a General Manager that cares about his guests. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with issues....”
Reviews.Author: howarth
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and polite staff but its location and lack of soundproofing will wake you up starting a 6 AM when the garbage trucks pick up the trash from all the downstairs businesses. Add the 35 dollar a day parking fees and the Business center that charges by the minute to use it (20 dollars to print 4 pages with use of their computer) When will these Hotel Owners realize that they greatly upset their guests by nickel and diming them to death for everything. I can go to a 2 star Hotel and use their business center for free. Go figure..

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Property, Yet Vaguely Impersonal and Disappointing ...”
Reviews.Author: Misterhawk
Reviews.Content: I had been to the U.S. Grant before, but the first time I ever stayed there was when I was home on my mid-tour leave from Afghanistan. I was really looking forward to my stay and the hotel is beautiful, but I got the overall impression that, while the service was excellent, it lacked any sort of genuineness. I mean, it was a big deal to me that I was home on leave, but it clearly didn't matter to the U. S. Grant. I'm sure I expected too much, but I still couldn't help feeling disappointed. Still, it's a very lovely place and if you are looking for a luxury hotel in San Diego with a lot of history, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Could Use New Soundproof Double pane windows”
Reviews.Author: affluent_traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a deluxe corner king room,725,7th floor. The room luxurious and exquisitely detailed. Bed heavenly;room needs more bright lighting. Location pretty central, walkable to a lot of attractions. My problem with this hotel is they did a renovation but did not change the windows and it felt like we were sleeping on the streets below. Fire engines & ambulances every night,blaring bass booming music from the cars below while they wait at the light & we were 7 floors up from the street. Maybe if your room was on the back side of the building it would not have been so bad. You have to pay for Wifi but from our room we picked up next doors Wifi connection(Westgate Hotel). It is free in the lobby. The Grant grill was great for lunch,ate there two days but for dinner it was not the same. Expensive & not good at all except for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly staff, great food, pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyawayToronto
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is spacious and beautiful, but the extremely friendly staff make it very cozy. I particularly am grateful to the following individuals: Alberto, Andresa, and Pablo who made our stay so great. The concierge staff are also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: DanZOntario
Reviews.Content: excellent overall the staff was extremely helpful and polite they made our stay very enjoyable and memorable the service at the restaurant was amazing, Alberto, Pablo and Andresa made our stay welcome we highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TracyLee13
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a beautiful hotel in a very walkable area of San Diego. Rooms are very comfortable and quiet. Lovely place to stay for a romantic weekend or even with the family!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay! Lovely city!”
Reviews.Author: Citybrarian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 811 - a lovely suite. Unfortunately we had to wait quite a long time to get into the room, but we were served complimentary cocktails to make up for that. Staff were very accomodating and pleasant. Room was nice, large. The living room area had a strange arrangement of furniture and we ended up not spending any time there. Bedroom was amazing! Gorgeous, huge, soft bed. Somewhat cramped bathroom but what really killed me was - NO BATHTUB! Ugh, I was very disappointed but I lived. Hotel is situated smack dab in the middle of downtown, was very easy to pop out for some quick shopping and stop back in to drop off bags ;) Close to delicious restaurants and quick coffee shops, wasn't necessary to use the hotel restaurant but it was also very, very nice. Turn-down service was great and I really appreciated that they filled the ice bucket for us. There was a small coffee maker in the room but we didn't end up using it. The refrigerator can't be used as it's full of billable items and is computerized. Checked out the fitness centre but it was really, really small and dark - no outside windows or tv's. Better just to take your workout outside like everybody else and head to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Lynnepaula
Reviews.Content: Harry,Sergio and Jennifer go beyond the call of duty to ensure a wonderful stay. Hotel is service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: AB2007
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, gorgeous rooms and an unbeatable location smack bang in the middle of San Diego. The only thing that's missing is a pool. Would thoroughly recommend it, though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service-recommend high floor.”
Reviews.Author: mary1138
Reviews.Content: The service is fantastic from the moment you pull into valet to the moment you leave. Never had to touch my bags-all taken care of by the staff. Housekeeping fulfilled every request even changing sheets in room to feather-free/hypoallergenic within one hour after our arrival. Bellman asked us about the room upon our arrival and made sure it was to our satisfaction as he put bags in our room. Even offered to call down and have it changed to another room if we were not happy with size of the room or location. Our room was on the seventh floor-I highly recommend requesting a high floor as the bar crowd can get loud in gaslamp when they let out at 3am. Especially if you have an infant sleeping in room as we did. The front desk purposefully chose the interior facing/7th floor room since we had our infant w/us on this visit. I can see how street side rooms could be loud w/street noise, etc. Again, not an issue if you are baby free. Close to gaslamp and mall-hotel is beautifully lit in blue at night and green during twilight hours. Has a Caesar's Palace feel w/dark hallways since the hotel is historical one built in 1902. Fully remodeled inside. Our room had no tub but shower was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most exceptional hotel experiences I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: pickycustomer81
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to 28 countries and hundreds of cities around the world and this hotel is one of the most beautiful and comfortable I've ever been in or stayed in. The decor is absolutely gorgeous (it's a renovated historic hotel w) in every area of the hotel. The detail is stunning and the staff impeccable. Artwork is everywhere The manager Tom went above and beyond the call of duty letting me stay in the room late because I had a red eye flight. I got a great rate on Hotwire and it was the best value in a hotel experience I've ever had. I felt like a princess in the super comfy beds and robes. Fantastic bathrooms and even free bottled water in the rooms!! LOVE love love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unquestioned Service”
Reviews.Author: sjlierman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the US Grant on March 7th for a six night stay to visit friends. I chose the hotel based upon the reviews of the property and the proximity to Gas Lamp Square. Similar to a couple of other posters we checked into the hotel (room 804) and were disappointed. The room in and of itself was appointed well and comfortable but was much smaller than we expected. Generally we roll with the flow but as we don't get away too often I thought I should at least mention our disappointment to the front desk. Much to my delight they made an immediate adjustment upon our request and placed us in a truly remarkable room (802). Again, the room was appointed well and very comfortable but was also quite large. In addition to our room, the ambiance of the hotel speaks for itself. From the lobby, to the restaurant and bar, it is absolutely beautiful. The restaurant was very good, the bar enjoyable, and the art gallery off the lobby was a nice touch and a fascinating diversion. While all of these aspects of the hotel contributed to our opinion of the hotel, what really sets them apart is the service. I travel fairly frequently and have had the good fortune to have stayed in many well thought of and highly respected hotels. That being said, the service at the US Grant was far and away the best I have ever encountered. There wasn't one incident where someone didn't excel at their job. We were there for just about a day and I had several members of the staff greet me by name. I still haven't quite figured out how they do that. The front desk staff, the concierge, the bellmen, the wait staff, and the bartenders were all incredible. Truly some of the nicest people I have ever met. The US Grant is a good hotel because of the ambiance, it is a phenomenal hotel becasue of the staff. Now, be aware, it is not a budget property. The foor and drinks are expensive. There is not a pool although you can use the Westin which is a very short walk. The gym is very small and would be a disppointment to anyone looking for a quality workout. I might suggest the management look at forging a relationship with the 24 Hour Fitness that is a short walk form the hotel. Other than that, we were quite pleased and are looking forward to visiting San Diego and the US Grant again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: MreddyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is very friendly & helpful , room is clean , bed is very comfortable & the decor of the room is exceptional . But the room is very small theres no bathroom vanity , the chair in the room is nice looking but very uncomfortable very hard to sit in , you have to keep your curtains close if you want privacy , people from other rooms can see into your room . The Resturant decor is exceptional but the food is over price for what you get 150 .00 for two no wine , coffee 6.00 a cup, I had venison as a entree it tasted good put was portion like a appetizer ..The waitress was frielndy but seem to be over work , I had a apple cobbler for dessert that was small stale 10.00 . We had breakfast on Sunday that cost over 50.00 that was a little better quality than Dennys , orange juice was sour not even fresh 6.00 a glass . To park your car is 32.00 a day . The nieghborhood outside the hotel seems run down there sems to be a lot of homeless people . There was a homeless man drinking beer in the hotel lobby Saturdy night .

Reviews.Title: “A classy and unique property....with a few caveats.”
Reviews.Author: benzz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to head down to San Diego for an extended Valentine's Day weekend, and were able to book a King Superior room at the US Grant for $149. Upon arriving, we were assigned Room #603, which is undoubtedly the worst in the building....it's very narrow, looks out onto a row of windows from another wing of the hotel (a la "Rear Window"), is located next to the elevators and, most importantly, features a single full-size bed. According to the website, this room doesn't even exist in the hotel....it claims that all of the Superior rooms have either king or (2) double beds. And yet, I still love this place enough to give it four stars. Why? Service. Every employee in this building is friendly and eager to please....they'll do anything to make your stay enjoyable. When I called down to complain about the room we were assigned, the front desk apologized profusely and explained that we'd literally booked the last room for the night (which was probably true, we hadn't booked until 11pm the night before), and that they'd gladly move our luggage into a new room while we were out on the town the next day. Our new room was much larger, had an honest-to-goodness (and exceedingly comfortable) king bed, a lovely view of the city, and was located on the 10th floor, opposite the Presidential Suite. Truth is, though, even our original room was something to behold (tiny bed aside). It was like a tiny luxury apartment from a bygone era....beautiful wall etchings, original art, period-style carpet and a minibar finished in leather. The bathroom had a design-first, functionality-second basin sink and an oversized shower....no tub, which is expected in a hotel of this vintage. Every room in the building has at least one 32" LCD, and in our second room the TV was connected to a Bose sound system with subwoofer (!). The rooms are full of tiny little touches that you don't see in higher-end chain hotels; the closets have little wall-mounted valets stocked with umbrellas, shoe horns and brushes....all of the lights in the room are on dimmers, so you can control the mood....the toilet has a soft-close lid....etc. Not everything's perfect, of course....the period-style curtains do little to block out morning light, and the walls and windows aren't as thick as they should be (to be expected, given the hotel's vintage). And the fitness room leaves a lot to be desired...it's small, inconveniently located down a long hallway in the basement and, at least when we visited, had several machines that were out of order. Unacceptable in a Luxury Collection hotel, IMO. Overall, though, this is a great place to relax and be pampered...even if I'd probably be a little more harsh if I hadn't paid only $149 for our room. We'll be back, I'm sure. P.S. - You can avoid getting the bargain-basement room by asking for another room if the one you're assigned ends in "03" or "04" and is located on the 7th floor or lower. "03" and "04" rooms above the 7th floor are much larger and have actual city views. :)

Reviews.Title: “Class and style with excellent service make for a wonderful relaxing weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Brigitte_from_CA
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3-day stay in this beautiful hotel. The service was very friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The room and the lobby are beautifully designed and carefully maintained. It was a wonderful time-out for us and the calm and pleasant environment was fostering a deeply relaxing mood. The happy hour in the lobby and bar is a wonderful treat and sometimes enhanced with life music. Also, tea is served in style. We travel quite a bit and this stay will be a memorable very positive experience in the upper top of places to stay for us! If you are a light sleeper, you might want to ask for a room not facing the street traffic although it was no problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and service with a great location”
Reviews.Author: LalaB94
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the US Grant with my husband on a combination business and sightseeing trip. Really he worked and I went sightseeing. This hotel suited both our needs. Our room was quite spacious for a non-suite room. The bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slept on. All the staff was very helpful and friendly-attentive without being obtrusive. Just what I'd expect for this type of hotel. The valet parking is on par with what I've paid at other hotels in a city. (Actually, I paid a lot more at a hotel in Washington, DC at the beginning of this trip.) We did have a problem with our billing. We had prepaid for the stay, but for some reason they didn't have our payment in their system and they put a hold on our credit card for the cost of the whole stay, no small amount considering we were there for a week. It was supposed to have been fixed on the first day, but we found out the hard way that it wasn't when our card was declined at a restaurant. I thought that was a pretty big thing to mess up on. My only other complaint was the charge for WIFI in the rooms. I know that a lot of hotels charge, but it's really a pet peeve for me. By the way, it is free in the lobby. The hotel is a historic property, so the windows don't block out all the street noise. If you are overly sensitive to the noise, just ask for a quiet room-some overlook an inner courtyard, so you won't hear anything. The rooms are also not all the same size, as far as I could tell, but I think we got pretty luck in that regard. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel and would definitely return. The location is excellent. There is so much to do with a few blocks, that a car really isn't necessary. This is an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but don't pay full price!”
Reviews.Author: Sielah
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night stay at the US Grant. Good points: 1. Our room was large, bright, modern, clean, well appointed with very comfortable bed. 2. Great location in center of downtown; easy walking distance to more bars and restaurants than you could shake a stick at 3. Staff were very helpful, and always available; never had to go and find somebody or wait for assistance. Bad points: 1. Rooms have old, single-pane windows; sound-proofing from outside is non-existent. 2. Doors open straight into rooms; sound-proofing from corridor is also non-existent. 3. No coffee or tea making facilities in the room, so have to order from room service, or go find a Starbucks. First option is expensive, second is inconvenient. The in-house Earl Grey tea almost makes up for this, but not quite. 4. Can't park your own car in the garage, so have to use the valet service. Annoying and expensive. 5. We had a Superior King room, but no bath in the bathroom, only a double shower. No way to soak off walking round the zoo! 6. This is a five star hotel, but no pool, hot tub or steam room?!? 7. Had to wait 45 minutes for check in staff to find a room for us. They tried to fob us off with a room below what we had paid for, and we had to get a bit nasty with them before they finally came up with the goods.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good Experience”
Reviews.Author: NickT1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a deluxe room over the weekend and paid about $180 per night excluding taxes and fees. I Pros: 1) Overall service provided by everyone including the front desk, valet, baggage guys, and cleaning staff. 2) Decor of the rooms 3) Comfortable beds 4) Elegance of the lobby 5) Historic feel of the hotel 6) Complimentary Water 7) Walking distance to Gaslamp Cons: 1) Rooms are very small 2) Dark, depressing hallways with no windows 3) Constant slamming of doors in the hallway 4) Noise from outside at nights (ambulances, homeless guys or partyrs screaming, etc.) 5) Unexpected valet charge ($32 per day Ouch!!!)

Reviews.Title: “The classiest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: xanderfinch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the U.S. Grant the night of our wedding and honestly, I never wanted to leave! We were upgraded to the Presidential Suite, treated like celebrities, greeted with fruit and chocolate, and given the best treatment imaginable. Our room was larger than our house. Our view was incredible. The decor was so sophisticated yet agreeable to the historic nature of the hotel. The U.S. Grant was impressive in every way, and I can't wait to have an excuse to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: foxfire44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a landmark, older of course, but tastefully decorated. It is a great location close to Gaslamp District, a few minutes from harbourfront, San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park. What makes it great is that the staff make you feel special. They go out of their way for the customers. They offered to go to the airport to get my luggage that was lost. That was pretty nice. This was a side line from a big trip to Australia. It was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, classy & relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: nebraskaresident
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop of an 11 day stay in San Diego and surrounding areas. My husband and I celebrated a wedding anniversary, Christmas Eve and Christmas at The US Grant for a total of 4 nights. Where do I start? The beauty of this historic hotel is enchanting. The lobby area is so lovely and welcoming. The staff were all so kind and warm with exception service. While unique to many hotels, the restaurant at the hotel was spectacular....food, service, ambiance, everything. We enjoyed both Christmas Eve dinner and Christmas brunch there. The bar area is so inviting as well. The appetizers offered during happy hour were delicious. It was really nice to have the option of not leaving the hotel in the evening. The location of the hotel is within the gas lamp district and directly across the street from Horton Place Mall. I look forward with great anticipation to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, totally worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Claudiajp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were nice (small but I was expecting that). Everyone that worked at the hotel went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable. The concierge was very helpful. The restaurant (The Grant Grill) was amazing, a little bit expensive, but worth it every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for a Luxury Collection hotel”
Reviews.Author: huitres
Reviews.Content: As an SPG gold member I stayed at this hotel from the 24th to the 28th of December with ny family. I was astounded by the poor level of service as I had to take my own bags to my room. Staff were extremely unhelpful. I noticed that the good reviews this hotel received were usually from people who had been upgraded. Beware following their advice! The rooms are small especially if travelling with two younger children. There is no bath but then again I was aware of this when I booked. Just a shower cabin. Gilchrist and Soames amenities that are nowhere similar to Motlon Brown or L'Occitane that you get at Four Seasons. The bathroom had an awful smell that was probably due to a blocked drain. Once agian staff failed to address this. Tea and coffee making facilities available upon request but ours leaked ALL OVER the floor. No Spa. They triple charged for laundry and when I queried this the front desk made me stand at reception for 15 minutes while they confirmed that I was being honest! What happened to trusting the customer? Very poor standard of service if you are used to a 5 star establishment. You may be better off at the Hyatt or Marriott. Even the Westin 2 blocks away is better (I stayed at both). Avoid being disappointed and give this place a wide berth. Do not be fooled by cheap rates- it ain't worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, great service, great location - fun and romantic”
Reviews.Author: jglamar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec. 28, 2009 - Jan. 1, 2010 and had a great time. Beautiful room - though I would disagree with other reviewers who cited their "Simple elegance." I would categorize these as leaning more towards baroque than simple, and again, unlike other reviewers I would not call them small. (Ours was a basic double, not a suite, and there was ample room for the two of us.) Street noise on the 4th floor not a problem for us - and again, I would disagree with other reviewers who found the area to be sketchy at night. Though there are homeless folks everywhere in downtown SD the vibe is not at all threatening. We spent a lot of time just exploring on foot around the hotel - Gaslamp Quarter, Embarcadero, Horton Plaza, Little Italy are all easy walking (we are young and fit). The concierges I dealt with were like ninjas in their ability to make reservations in choice spots on short notice over a busy holiday week within tight criteria from us - major kudos to them. Service all around very good. The overall atmosphere is old-fashioned cosmopolitan elegance mixed with modern zip. Warm friendly service throughout. If you want modernism - black walls and techno music in the lobby - go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: manson5150
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to SanDiego for two days after Christmas and stayed at the US Grant. The hotel is fantastic and unique. The rooms are very stylish and while small we expected this knowing that it is a historic hotel. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable. We asked for restaurant suggestions and they delivered multiple times over. The valet is great although $32 per night. That being said this price is par for SanDiego.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful surprise.”
Reviews.Author: iluv2trvl24-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 29th wedding anniversary and thought we would splurge on a quick weekend getaway. Checked in at 11:00 PM Christmas night to find out we had been upgraded to the Event Planner Suite. The suite was beautifully decorated, simple elegance. The staff were all very friendly and polite. Thouroughly enjoyed our two night stay. Will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.. Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: aak88
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is an outstanding luxury hotel in downtown San Diego.. From checking in to checking out the all the staff we encountered went truly above and beyond to ensure our needs were surpassed in all aspects. Julie was kind enough to upgrade my reservation to a nicely decorated legacy suite, Sergio printed out my documents at 3am while Albert at the concierge desk planned our entire itinerary and gave us some great restaurant recommendations and finally the gentleman at the bell stand on dec 23 evening (i forgot his name) were all extra ordinary in performing their job duties. Located right opposite the Horton Shopping Plaza and just a 5 minute bus ride to the zoo and seaworld the location cannot get any better. Room Service was really good too. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: fiownah
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay we found everyone that we encountered at the hotel to be friendly and helpful. They seemed anxious to help make our stay enjoyable. We particularly found the front desk and concierge to be full of helpful suggestions in terms of making the most of our time in San Diego. Location was excellent. Right in the heart of downtown. Buses to Balboa Park/San Diego Zoo right outside and trolley to Old Town also on next street. Shopping mall right across the street and one block to Gaslamp District. We will definitely recommend the hotel to friends who might be travelling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: HCABraz
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a very luxury hotel and they do have a good staff (not great, just ok). The waiter Augusto was an exception. He really care about the guests. The other waiter was just "ok", nothing more than that. The hotel itself is gorgeous and the room is superb. Unfortunately they have an alarm at the minibar that don´t let you use it for put your staff there unless you pay for it. They are a little bit greedy. Anyway, it was my third time in San Diego and I can say it was by far the best hotel I´ve been there. I would definitely recommend it although they do have some unnecessary flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our Anniversary night !!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTravelingWifey
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that my Husband and I have stayed here before and had a wonderful time but sadly I have to write this review... We are Starwood members and booked in advance for a deluxe room for our Wedding Anniversary. I am very un-happy and rather troubled by the way things turned out especially since we are Starwood members, it was our Anniversary and we were return guests ! Upon pulling up to the valet the guys took a few minutes to even acknowledge we were there (that's never happened before) but once they acknowledged us they were nice and courteous as always. Check-in with Sergio went well and he even noted or Starwood member number and told us Happy Anniversary so I figure we'd get upgraded for sure. Then our Bellman Anthony came over and he was very nice, he took us up to our room (910) and upon entering I was a little disappointed as it was not upgraded and did not even have the full length standing mirror that deluxe rooms have, and to be quite honest the other Superior rooms we've stayed in here were better and even had more windows. Then while the bellman was bringing in our luggage he told us our room was actually joined with the Presidential Suite and that's when I heard all the noise actually coming from the other room (originally when I walked in, I thought the noise was from the "dream machine" that was playing) but I figured it was just a tour of the Presidential suite being given and I didn't think about it because that room is $3,500 a night and didn't think anyone would be staying there (so wrong). So when our bellman left he ask what time we'd like our turn down service, I said 8:30pm and would also like our champagne to be put on ice, he wrote it down on a piece of paper and said no problem. After he left I could still hear the people in the Pres. Suite talking and then all of a sudden the joining door was swinging back and forth and I went up to it and started talking to the other guy through the door and he said they were staying in there that night and we should call up security to have them come lock the deadbolt, so I called them up and they locked that door and said 'sorry'. At about 5:30pm my Husband decided to go look around the Horton Plaza while I take a shower and get ready for our night out and when I got out of the shower I noticed that housekeeping had been in our room while I was in the shower !!! They attempted to do a turndown service but instead of leaving when hearing the shower running they just did a BAD and quick job at turndown; no slippers out, no robes, no ice for the champagne and my high heels that were set out were trampled into the hallway. I couldn't believe they entered while I was in the shower after I asked for turndown at 8:30, not to mention the bathroom door didn't even lock and I had my purse out on the bed and my jewelery on the bed too ! After we went out and came back to the hotel I noticed that they still didn't come back to finish the room, they left it with a crappy turndown, but I still forgave it and continued on with the night. That is until 12:30am.... that's when the party in the joining Presidential Suite started, it was awful, I can't even explain how bad it was, yelling, cussing, annoying woman cackling, loud rap music, it was like we were in the room partying with them, it was SO loud ! We let it go on a little bit in hopes they would stop but at 1:30am my Husband went to the lobby and he was told "there are no more king beds, but we will send up security", I was pissed because I couldn't believe they just said they had no more king beds, I didn't care what kind of bed it was I just wanted to enjoy my Anniversary night in peace! So by 2:30am the party is still going strong and my head is throbbing with a migraine and I'm in tears because this experience was ruined, our romantic night together turned into a keg party we weren't even invited to, so my Husband called down to the lobby again and they said they would send up some keys for a new room but that we "could only sleep in there"... WHAT !?!?! We weren't allowed to shower and get ready we would have to come back to our original room to get ready, I have never heard of that before ! even a motel 6 wouldn't have done that. So I was not about to be okay with that, I just couldn't believe it. So about 10 mins later a guy brought up the new room keys and my Husband asked him again "so we can only sleep in there" and he said "yes" and that's when I lost it, I was crying and saying it was unacceptable and no other hotel would do this and then the guy said "on behalf of the hotel we would like to apologize and offer you a comp breakfast from the Grant Grill". We didn't end up changing rooms because that was ridiculous, what woman is going to want to change floors and rooms at 3am and then again at 7am to get ready !?!? So we just waited for the party next door to end, and at about 4am we were finally able to sleep. The breakfast in the morning was great but hardly worth the trouble, the tears and our Anniversary night to be ruined. I am so disappointed that our favorite hotel, the US Grant did this to us. I don't know if I can ever come back. How could they book a Starwood couple spending a romantic Anniversary night next to a loud party in the joining room !?!?!? I have videos of how loud it was in our room, please listen to how awful it was.

Reviews.Title: “Sucky Stay”
Reviews.Author: Randeer
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that staying there (2 weeks ago) was the worst idea ever! First of all I seriously saw a roach in the bathroom, I called the manager and she said that they would send someone to take care of it, but they took too long. That was a really bad thing I had to deal with and story way too long, but another thing I noticed that one of the house keepers was making out with one of the other maintenance guys by the stairs, really unexeptable, they are supposed to be working! The staff had lots of attitude and the view was awful. It's infront of this shopping center that has many homeless people wondering around drunk and pissing everywhere, even by the side of the hotel. Not to mention the noise of the Trolley and buses, should have chosen a hotel near the convention center, next time I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at the US Grant Hotel, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: aclapper
Reviews.Content: The service we received from the staff was top notch. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, excellent service, super value”
Reviews.Author: mirepoixjoe
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the glistening crystal-chandeliered lobby of the US Grant, we felt welcomed and special. The hospitality was unparalleled; the staff knowledgeable and unassuming, with a friendliness that we found engaging and genuine. The location of was a perfect one block distance from the gaslamp district, just far enough away from the Friday night noise and bustle (think Times Square, or French Quarter). True, I am 46 and my days of mosh pits and head-banging have transitioned to twilight al fresco dinners and people watching. If any of this is resonating with you, then trust me when I say the Grant was a fine respite from the gaslamp’s excitement. Our two-day stay in San Diego was our first foray into California vacationing, and coming off a five-day cruise to Mexico, we thought a few days in San Diego would be a great way to wind down, prior to making the flight back to New Jersey. Don't know what we were thinking. The food was as delightful as the weather, and with so much to do and see, returning to the Grant after a long day of shopping and sightseeing felt like coming home to my own personal castle; my room spotless, my bed turned down and adorned with chocolates, beckoning me to crawl into the lush array of down pillows on a bed that any millionaire would envy. We booked through hotels.com back in June, and don’t know how, but somehow I scored a room for $110 / night. I had forgotten the rate I had secured, and was shocked when I received the final bill. I could get picky about the size of the room, or the location, or the view, but anyone who has traveled in Europe would have paid 4 times this amount for a comparable room in Paris. I travel frequently for business, and will often opt for a cheaper hotel to save the company a few bucks. There is no sacrifice here. If you want to spend a few more dollars, book a bigger room, with a nicer view, and hop into bed. But definitely stay in this hotel. A few folks have complained about the homeless. Yeah, homeless folks are a downer, especially juxtaposed against such a classic hotel when you’re on vacation, but you can't beat up the hotel. If I was homeless, you wouldn't find me in New Jersey, I can assure you. Offer them that pizza you know you're not going to eat anyway, and count your blessings. A special note of thanks to concierge Lee Ann Kinkelaar, who made our stay extra-special. Whether referring us to the best seafood restaurant or hamburger joint, to charging an ipod or giving us a history lesson, Lee Ann exemplified the spirit of the US Grant; elegant, yet approachable, appropriate, genuine, and accommodating. She is a star representative of the hotel, so tell her we said hi.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: nahlalee
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here after Thanksgiving for 3 nights. Overall it was a pleasant and positive experience, but there were a few issues. I would give 3.5 if I could but will push it to a 4 because the staff were always courteous and helpful. We asked for a crib to be placed in the room before we came twice. No such luck. Had to call again down to the front desk after we got in, way past my 7 month old's bed time. The next morning we went out for breakfast at 10am. Came in at 1pm. Still no service. They knocked on our door around 3pm. We asked to service our room in about an hour. We left for dinner and came back at 6pm. Still not serviced. At leas tthey were prompt when I called down. They came and turned down the room promptly. I also called the spa concierge few days before our arrival to try to set up a massage for my wife and they never called me back... it was the day before Thanksgiving. We did need a separate fridge for my baby's frozen food and milk. We also needed a coffee maker to make hot water to warm up the milk/food. They were prompt in bringing that up. The hotel is luxurious and the staff are very friendly and helpful. You can find hints of it's age, but the recent renovations definitely help. Our "superior" room was on the smaller side but the bathroom is nice and large. The room has very luxurious decorations without being gaudy. The shower, my favorite part, can probably fit 3 people. No bathtub though. The windows are a bit thin and the noise of the gaslamp late-night crowds and police/fire sirens are quite loud. Especially on the east side, and we were 7 stories up. It's in a great location, on the north end of the gaslamp district and right across from a decent mall. It's a few blocks from a 24 hour Ralphs. The parking is ridiculously expensive at $32/night and the wifi is free only in the lobby. Although I have some valid complaints, I probably would stay here again if the price was right.
