Reviews.Title: “Must stay at the US Grant, the people are second to none”
Reviews.Author: Marliam
Reviews.Content: The front desk people are full of knowledge and will advise you the best places to see. The rooms are a luxury and the hotel is ideally situated. Probably the only thing to watch is the the homeless are begging for a dollar every time you leave the hotel, but that has nothing to do with the location itself.

Reviews.Title: “Truly exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: mellis1047
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a moment share with you my experiences during my recent stay this past weekend. I have lived in San Diego County for over 20 years, currently I live in Riverside County. My husband and I enjoy the downtown area and over the years we have stayed in many different hotels to include the Marriott on the Marina and the Hyatt. We have also stayed at the other Starwood Hotels in downtown, our experiences have always been good. This weekend was very special to my husband and I as we were celebrating our 13th year wedding anniversary. We decided to go all out and we didn't skimp anywhere, we made reservations at the US Grant hoping it would be a good stay and different from any place we have stayed in downtown. We planned on a wonderful dinner at Ruth's Chris and spending the evening in the Gas Lamp Quarter. My expectations of this trip were no different from other years, I knew we would have a good time and it's always nice to get away. My reason for writing is because I felt it necessary to share with you that every single employee from the valet gentleman to the desk clerk who checked us in and escorted us to the elevator and even house keeping, the service we received was unbelievable, it was like nothing we have ever experienced. We felt like we were dignitaries. Most people don't take the time to acknowledge and compliment a job well done so I have to say your staff working on November 6, 2009 are very deserving of recognition. I see many future stays for us at the US Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: dcalixto
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at your hotel this past weekend for my daughter's 21st birthday. I wanted to let you know how happy I am with everything. The reservation was seamless. The woman I spoke to at the reservation desk, Marissa (I believe that's her name), was extremely nice. I also spoke to a woman in Client Concierge who was so helpful. Then, when my daughter came home she only had great things to say about her stay. Your staff did so many things to make my daughter's 21st birthday amazing. We have never had an experience like this at a hotel before. Thank you for going above and beyond and having so many qualified people working for your hotel. We will definitely stay there again, any chance we get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value”
Reviews.Author: digbyl
Reviews.Content: Opposite a shopping centre & close to great places to eat. Within walking distance of the conference centre as well. Has it's own car park. Helpful staff & smart rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Looking forward to returning on my own dime!”
Reviews.Author: Royiv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and fell in love with this hotel. The rooms are decorated and furnished just like how I would like for my home to be. The staff, from check-in to the room attendants, were all very friendly and professional. Since I was there for a conference, most of the meals were served by the banquet staff and I thought they did a great job. Mass produced meals at hotels for large meetings are typically pretty boring and blah, but the food was actually pretty good. Not amazing, but I don't expect amazing in such situations. Overall, I'm really looking forward to returning, this time on my own dime, and bringing my girlfriend for a weekend getaway in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: DiBruccolino
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very helpful staff but in general I did not find it truly impressive. The location of the hotel is terrible, while it is in the center of downtown, there is nothing nice surrounding it. Actually, every night there seems to be a congregation of dicey characters outside every single corner of the hotel block. Although this is not a problem of the hotel per se, after, staying 5 nights in downtown San Diego the area is pretty dull. The room- I stayed in one of the SPG rooms and while the room was spacious, the details were missing. Two out of five night I had to complain about the cleaning service, the sink and the shower were clogged and the AC was noisy. I have to say that the common areas of the hotel are nice, especially the lobby. Bottom line- I do not really see the point in staying in downtown San Diego, one is better off renting a car and staying in one of the nice places in La Jolla or all the little town around.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful room & very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: thescoot
Reviews.Content: hWe stayed there from a Sat thu Wed. The architecture was magnificant with lots of history all around. The staff will show you around if you ask. The bar was pretty cool looking too. We didn't eat in the restaurant but it's award wining but expensive. The staff was the most friendly I've ever come across and we travel a lot. They directed us to some great restaurants too. They upgraded us to a suite. The suite was small but it was nice to have an extra tv room and desk. We asked for quiet room because we read a few reviews indicating it could be noisy. We felt it was a normal amount of noise that you get from being downtown in a good size city. This trip will always stand out because of this charming beautifully decorated hotel. We would highly recommend. Scooter

Reviews.Title: “Splendid experience”
Reviews.Author: Snuup
Reviews.Content: Top notch service and facilities. Great off season rates. Can only recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: teenytinytina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant for just one night in August with my boyfriend. We drove down from LA in terrible traffic, and got to San Diego on a cloudy, almost-rainy afternoon. Before check-in, we were both in the worst moods. The second our car pulled up to the valet, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff magically made our sadness and worries disappear. Check-in was fast, friendly, and amazing. The hotel was full so we weren't able to get a room upgrade. As a SPG Platinum member, I often get a little cranky when I don't get a nice room, but with the great attitude of the staff, I knew they had done their best to make our stay wonderful, and I was happy with that. The room was clean and nicely adorned, and the next morning we had a great breakfast at Grant Grill. The restaurant staff were great as well! There was an elderly couple sitting at the table next to ours who only spoke Spanish and looked a little bummed. The staff spoke to them in Spanish and followed up quite often -- this really turned their day around. Seeing those smiles on the couple's faces really put us in a good mood for the day. I don't know if it's just San Diego, but I cannot say enough good things about the service and the friendly staff here at the US Grant! I would definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel/ service in the world”
Reviews.Author: Tdiggs
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed in, great staff, great room, great location. everything from the service to the location was magical. The room was huge and the bed OMG i almost didnt want to leave. The staff was so awesome, everyone i ran into was so helpful and eager to help .

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: smyl4me56
Reviews.Content: i have to admit when i first drove around the building, i didn't think much of the hotel, but as soon as we walked inside, it was gorgeous! and the bedroom and bathroom are even nicer!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic getaway”
Reviews.Author: USCTheta
Reviews.Content: my hubby and i booked our 2 night stay for our 1st anniversary down in SD... we chose the starwood property since we prefer their hotels... and the US Grant did not disappoint! upon check in we were greeted and escorted from the valet {which isn't cheap approx. $30 a day} by a bellmen to check in. the staff working the front desk were very helpful and noticed we were staying for our anniversary and offered to upgrade us to a corner room and to send up a bottle of champagne! not a shabby way to start off our weekend... i will say that the lobby is quite beautiful, still retains it's historic charm, complete with little vignettes about the history of the building, lots of photos of it through the years as well. and the rooms are fantastic as well - luxurious linens, and top notch toiletries, and the furnishings were a great blend of the historic architecture with a modern twist.... ok enough about the decor... the hotel's really in a great place, we had thought about staying at the nearby "W", but we were glad we chose the Grant since it's pretty much walking distance to all the restaurants and bars we planned to visit, plus, since the Grant doesn't have a pool you are welcome to hop over to the W to use their's. the service was pretty prompt, however, that bottle of champagne didn't show up to our room until after we returned from dinner around 9pm, even though we had checked in around 5pm...but hey, can't complain too much when it's on the house! the only real complaint we had about the hotel was that the room we were upgraded to was a corner room on the 4th floor, but our front door faced the housekeeping elevator, so every time the elevator stopped we could hear it chime, as well as all the conversations of the housekeeping staff... not too fun when you are looking forward to sleeping in past 8am! but honestly, that was our only complaint... overall, i would highly recommend it to couples and those looking for a classy business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Tellyjan
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the US Grant Hotel as I type this review for 4 nights. What a marvelous place! Starting with the staff, everybody is so friendly & helpful. From the day we arrived, the bellhop & parking attendants were all eager to assist us. The front desk check-in was a breeze. What an impressive & elegant lobby! A 5-star hotel with character & class. It is a historic hotel in San Diego and it's been renovated. It is BEAUTIFUL, the understated elegance shows throughout the hotel. The concierge is so helpful (Mr. Mark Peak especially). The cleaning staff does an excellent job, cleaning mornings and turning our beds before bedtime. Whoever is training the entire staff must be commended! The room is spacious, comfortable, beautiful with modern treatments & big flat screen TV. The bathroom is modern, big and very nice. The landing on our guest floor (5th floor) is spacious & nicely decorated. You don't find landings like these in most hotels, it's different. Location is very central and accessible. It's across the Horton Plaza mall, a short walk to the Gas Lamp district, the Convention Center & the waterfront of San Diego. We enjoy the early morning walks since checking in 2 days ago and we have explored all the areas around by foot., Awesome! We have a car rental, parking fee is not cheap at $32 per day, however, it is in & out at no additional charge. The car valet is also fast so we're able to zip in & out freely as many times as we wish. Internet at the lobby is wifi and free. Inside the room, wifi is not free. There's free coffee available inside the Grant Grill restaurant next to the lobby. We were able to get a very reasonable rate booking this hotel from Hotwirel.com. For a 5-star hotel, what a steal! There are many, many things that make the US Grant Hotel top notch but above all of these...the STAFF makes the biggest difference! We can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: rjose
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is very lovely. It's elegant and the rooms are a decent size. The decorations in the room are superb! In our room in order to go to the bathroom you have to go through this small hallway, which I think really makes the room bigger than it is. The placement of the bathroom was very well planned out. The bed is huge, the rooms are clean, and the service is great. Check in went really well and overall the staff was nice and welcoming. The location is great, great, great! Westfield Horton Plaza is literally right across the street. It is extremely close to the Gaslamp area and a couple blocks away from the port. The restaurant at the hotel is delicious! It's expensive but the food and wine was delicious! Overall, I wouldn't give this hotel a 5 star rating, it is more of a 4.5 star hotel, but that's still pretty high. Cons: Parking each night is $32 dollars! Also, they over charged me by $141 and I called them a couple days ago and they said they would refund me this money but they still haven't given it to me! Also a con, there was no pool area. The bathroom doesn't have his and her sinks and the sink is a big white bowl, which is fancy and modern but as a result water splashes everywhere! It does get kind of noisy at night, but if you're out all night then you get pretty tired and simply crash, so you don't really worry about the noise. There is only a shower and no tub (most 4 and 5 stars hotel have both tubs and a shower). The worst part was the shower head, it just did not have enough water and power coming out of it. I literally had to take an hour long shower just to feel clean because the shower head just didn't give out a lot of water.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - not so beautiful customer treatment”
Reviews.Author: CheshireElaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant at the end of a 3 week tour of California. We arrived late in the evening after a long drive from LA to be told by Daniel, the check in guy ,that we had no room. He was quite open about this, saying that we had bought the room at a discount through Expedia when the hotel was half empty, but as there was increased demand they had sold our room to someone willing to pay full price.They also said that a booking through Expedia was not, in their view, a confirmed booking. We were told that we could stay at their sister hotel for the evening, and could return the next day to have a room at the US Grant as per original booking. We were also told that we would be refunded for the one night we hadn't been at the US Grant. The sister hotel was ok, but we returned to the US Grant the next morning hoping to get our room. We were again told by a very cheerful girl that we had no room for the same reason and we were asked would we go back to the sister hotel? I think it was at this point that I told them they were treating us like luggage and we were disappointed, etc, ..we did then get a room and a complementary breakfast. Thirty days later I have just found our from Expedia that the hotel has refused to honour the promised refund for the night we weren't there, and that the Daniel had told us something that wasn't true in terms of our booking not being a confirmed one. Expedia have been great, they have refunded us to compensate for the dishonourable conduct of the hotel. This is a beautiful hotel without a doubt but it is a real shame that the owners/managers haven't realised that surface elegance and beauty are no substitute for real old fashioned customer care. is not that attractive afterall.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: omega5
Reviews.Content: Forget the Hotel Del; that's just for the families. This is luxury for the grownups. Amazing room, amazing service, amazing food, amazing architecture and interior in a beautiful historic building right in the heart of downtown San Diego. Transport and shopping on your doorstep -- if you really want to leave the lobby, speakeasy and four-diamond restaurant in the hotel. Free wifi in the lobby and the best cocktails ever at happy hour prices. Complimentary turndown service and absolutely fabulous staff. We would return to San Diego for this hotel alone; it is the destination. (We'll go back anyway to see some more sights, but even if we didn't want to...this place is worth the trip.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Value, but Not Five Star on the Details”
Reviews.Author: curlyjoeNJ
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, and at $150 a night it is an incredible value. The lobby is gorgeous, and our room was also lovely and very comfortable. I loved how it combined the historical details of the mouldings with the modern touch of the painting behind the bed. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful, and her advice made a big difference in our trip. We noticed the street noise (it is very hard to miss) but were able to sleep mostly because the AC was loud enough to muffle it. It is true that they don't have a pool, but guests have access to the pool at their sister hotel across the street. The U.S. Grant did not feel like a five star hotel, though, because they were missing a lot of the details. These are just a couple of examples. When we arrived, we drove around the block twice, pausing by each entrance to look for the door men and valets, which are hidden in this tiny alley that is badly marked. I called the front desk of the hotel for help, and they acted like it was impossible to miss but then gave me bad directions. We cannot be the first people to have this problem, so it seems like they could be more helpful. Our room had only one robe, so I called housekeeping, only to receive their voicemail. I left a message, but they did not come by with the other robe until we called back later that night. They cleaned the room each day but did not replace any of the bath products we used (shampoo, cotton swabs, etc. for our entire stay). None of these things are a big deal, but you just do not expect issues like this in a five star hotel. We ate at the Grant Grill for dinner and found it good but over-priced. The bread was particularly tasty, but $24 for a small plate of vegetables (the only vegetarian entree) just doesn't pass the red face test. The cocktails and wine list were quite good, though, so it might be a better idea to do drinks and/or happy hour instead of dinner. Overall, we had a lovely stay and thought this was a great hotel. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends, but it feels more like a three or four star hotel (which, to be honest, is completely fair for the price).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great service, convenient, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: dominique412
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel with refined character and great location. However, with the seemingly endless noise from drunk club-goers on the street, engines roaring, and radios blaring, it made it very difficult to get a good night's sleep. It's too bad that I will never stay here again because, other than the noise, this is a fantastic hotel, but I need to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dark hallways, comfortable room, noisy street, unacceptable food.”
Reviews.Author: yhiga
Reviews.Content: We attended a family wedding and dinner reception at the hotel and stayed in a room on the 7th floor. The room was comfortable, but the HVAC was annoyingly loud. Street noise is noticable, but did not disrupt our sleep - probably because the rush of air from the HVAC offset the street noise. The bathroom is a good size with a very nice shower, but the sink faucet was wobbly and difficult to use - more form than function. The seventh floor had full view of what appeared to be a flop house with a full cast of characters hanging out of the open windows. The view from the penthouse on the top floor was much better.. I would rate the cusine as low grade dog food and the service as unacceptable. I recommend an open field tackle to snag a server. There is a charge for a WIFI connection in the room, but it is free in the lobby. As you might expect, notebooks and netbooks were found primarily in the lobby. The concierge was somewhat knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Book a regular room and ask for an upgrade...”
Reviews.Author: MonacoEurotrash
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel's signature suite for a special evening at a whopping 600$ per night. The room had no view and sadly we were placed on the 3rd floor. Apparently, a higher floor was not available. The room was large and the 10ft x 10ft shower was cool as was the Bose surround system. The sofa and chair of the living room were badly stained and this gave the whole room a more modest feel. The turndown service was a maid hastily giving us some ice and some very mediocre chocolates. The in-room movie system did not work but the two LCD TVs were nice. 42 inch in the living room and 32 inch in the bedroom. The bathroom was generally clean but I found several long dark hairs, a put off even at a Motel 6, so imagine at 600$ a night. The staff were fantastic and very professional. I am SPG preferred guest and I usually book a basic room and hope to get upgraded but this time I wanted to go for something a little more extravagant and well it was not worth it! Had I been upgraded to that room I would have been very pleased but pay 600$ forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown scene, great service, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Trot_Girl
Reviews.Content: PROS: This is a wonderful hotel. The valet parking was very smooth and we were promptly checked-in. It was maybe 15 minutes from when we pulled up until we were in our room. The front desk answered all of our questions and were very knowledgeable/friendly. The location of this hotel is superb. Don't listen to the comments about a bad location!?! This hotel is directly across the street from Horton Plaza (se pictures) and within easy walking distance to the Civic Center, 4th and B, the Gaslamp and Petco Park. It’s a short cab to Balboa Park or Hillcrest. You can't get more central. Yes, there are "homeless people" but it's a city center and you will encounter all types here. It is in NO WAY a bad or improvised part of the city. We had room service which was excellent and was setup beautifully. The rooms were nicely arranged and the bed was great with lots of down pillows. The lobby is very grand with beautiful furniture and chandeliers. CONS: I can't comment on the room rate because I used my starwood points for a free stay. However, the parking was a bit pricy ($32/night). I guess we could have parked else where and walked to the hotel but that seemed like a hassle. I suppose its not too bad, but was more than we expected. If you want a room with a view of the city then there will be a bit of street noise. It did not effect our sleep or relaxation at all, but it is something to note. If you want a very quite room I would suggest requesting a room on the inside. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: My first trip to San Diego and the US Grant. An old world, historic hotel that is not my kind of thing but has a great location for a first tour. The staff is what makes this hotel great or better than average not the rooms. the staff here are very welcoming and make you feel welcomed, will try and do anything for you right from the valet to the front desk. I really like having good service and at the US Grant you get this. we were here on a Monday and Tuesday which weren't that busy but I simply hope that on the busier weekends the service doesn't alter. The rooms feel old and although large just don't have any "wow" factor. We were on the 6 floor and looked out over "Broadway". One thing to point out is that it seemed like a huge number of homeless people reside close to the US Grant and that end of town. As soon as you enter the street from the hotel the begging etc would start. it didn't seem as bad the closer you got to the water. Some nice restaurants are close. the valet charge of $32 per day I felt to be a little steep. I am not a US citizen and don't know if that is the norm. If you like service stay here if you like nice modern rooms with all the mod-cons keep looking. Still a nice stay. SPG points accrued at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “appalling management”
Reviews.Author: Hermia01
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a suite for two nights costing over $450.00 per night so expect a good standard of hotel but was sadly very dissapointed .The building its self is nice and first impressions were good however on closer inspection quite a few of the chairs , sofas etc are looking rather shabby and need a good clean as does some of the carpets but the main concern we had was the managemnet. Our room was not ready when we arrived which was fair enough as we arrived at 2.30pm but was told by check-in staff that it just needed a final check and it would not be long. When we retrurned an hour later we were again told the same thing ! After waiting for some time we asked to speak to a manager which the check in staff( who were pleasent) duly paged. When the operations manager arrived he was obviously annoyed at being troubled! and was most off hand and unpleasent and when my husband commented on a similar problem he had encountered at the same hotel on a previous visit he more or less called him a liar!!!!!!!! charming man ! We then spoke to the general manager who did at least apologize for the room not being ready but would not hear a word said against his ops manager and told us that he had worked with him for a year and doubted that he would speak to guests like that !! where we just called liars again ..?!! !! We had no choice but to stay that night at the hotel as all the other hotels were unavailable at short notice due to a big conference being held in San Diego but we checked out first thing next morning. The room itself was disappointing, it was very small and had the tinest bathroom i have ever seen , only one person could fit in at a time. The air conditioning was noisy and only worked in the lounge area and not in the bedroom. The television in the bedroom did not work properly either!! but the worst aspect of the room was the view, the room looked out over a derelict building which was being used as a squat ! not a pleasent view, it was awful. The hotel is not in a good postion in San Diego , it is in an area that is noisy at night and full of homeless people sleeping on the streets ,it is in a very run down area. We travel alot and have stayed in many 5* hotels and due to the SENIOR management I have to say this is the worst we have ever had the displeasure to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if this were a Holiday Inn. Highly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WJReviewer
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in room 421 on 8/22. I expect more from a Luxury Collection hotel, especially one with a history like the US Grant: 1. There was no clock or clock radio in the room. There was no way for me to tell the time or listen to music.. 2. The bathroom sconces had at least 6 months worth of dust on them. 3. The vent, which is placed oddly inside the shower, at eye level, showed more than an inch of dust. 4. The bathroom scale did not work. Minor problems: 5. Two of us checked in, but there was only one bath robe. 6. Two of us check in, but there was only one bottle of water. 7. The television image was stuck, stretched across the screen, so everyone looked like hobbits. If the US Grant does not want to offer HDTV, then please do not pretend that it is HDTV. I prefer to watch TV in normal proportions. 8. The TV image was snowy on most channels. 9. There was no DVD player even though I asked and was assured there would be one. 10. Some people in my hallway got a newspaper. I was one who did not. No one asked me if I wanted one. 11. I told the check out personnel all of this, but I am not confident they will relay the message.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: clfam
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. After requesting an upper floor during check in, we were extremely happy with our room location (7th floor over looking a small garden). Hotel building is shaped like a "U' our room overlooked the center of "U" not on the street. After reading numerous complaints re: noise level we were quite surprised that the room was extremely quiet. Once or twice we heard sirens from a firetruck...but one must remember that downtown San Diego is located in a city not the country. The rooms were a nice size and were updated with a mix of contemporary and historic decor. We really liked the bathrooms, the shower doors and travertine tile gave the shower a clean look/feeling Restaurant row in the Gaslamp Distict is about a 5-6 block walk. I had no problem walking in high heels to and from...As with any city there are some homeless people but no one bothers you nor asks you for money. There seem to be a fair amount of police patrol cars around the Gaslamp District so safety never seemed to be a factor. We decided to forego the hotel parking and found a $10 a day lot around the corner. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: francesca9371
Reviews.Content: We stayed the the US Grant for 2 nights in August as aprt of our 15 days trip to California. The hotel was simply fantastic. Very luxurious but not pretentious. The hall is very impressive, the room was very nice and comfortable, nice bed, all the luxury we expected and which was on the website. The photos published on their website do really depict in a truthful way the hotel. The bathroom was very nice, we had a shower case with very practical glass doors (instead of the nasty-sticky curtain full of someoen else's hair...), there were many amenties, from the mouth cleaner to the cutton buds, etc. They also have valet parking (in line with all the prices paid for valet, I think it was 30 USD per night). The hotel is located in the city center, few minutes away from the famous Gaslamp quarter and not far from a Starbucks (across the road) for breakfast :-) We also had dinner at the GRANT Grill (the hotel's restaurant), which was very nice, good food, good service, nice setting. We really do recommand the hotel, the only negative point (if we really have to find one) is that the hotel does not have a pool....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and helpful, attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: AngusArabTraveller
Reviews.Content: Located smack bang in the centre of downtown San Diego this hotel is perfect for a 4-5 day city explore - which is what we did. If you're travelling by car it's extremely easily accessed from the main highways into (and out of) San Diego - but beware the valet parking cost is $32 per day. We paid extra for a corner room with a city view and the additional space was well worth the money. We slept well - bed was really comfortable and the road noise was surprisingly low for a city centre location. All the staff were very polite and attentive and weren't sniffing for tips. We did tip a few but never felt under any obligation to do so. Special mention must go to the Concierge service - in particular Mark and Lee Ann - who provided assistance above and beyond the call of duty. We will certainly return to a beautiful city and I'd be surprised if we don't stay here when we do. Only minor qualm was the lack of an integral Spa, however preferential rates are available at one 4 blocks away which I can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cali0581
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on and off between March 2009 to July 2009 and had a wonderful time each visit. The hotel itself is beautiful and historic but this doesn't just end at the lobby the beauty extends to the rooms. I stayed at a variety of different rooms from their standard rooms to their suites (where I got a free upgrade because of my starwoord membership!). Room 524 is one of my favorites, although it isn't a suite it is set perfectly with windows all around the room. The rooms are clean, comfy, and gorgeous! My only con is the pricey valet, I think it was $32 or $34/night, but I think there is a parking lot that is half the price down the street and there is no free internet in the rooms, but they do have free wifi available in the lobby area. The gym is good enough, they have weights, couples treadmills and some eliptical machines and provide water bottles and fruit for free. The Hotel is located right across the street from Horton plaza, which is a mall that includes stores such as Nordstroms, Banana Republic, Starbucks, etc... and it is only a couple blocks from the historic gas lamp district. There are many homeless people on the streets but that is all over the gas lamp area, but the hotel staff monitor the hotel at all hours so it is still very safe (I am a single female and felt perfectly at ease at all hours). Once I became a platinum member of starwood they upgraded me to this awesome suite that was breathtaking! Overall my favorite hotel of all time!

Reviews.Title: “The US Grant - Very beautiful and stately hotel with historical accents, as well as a central location”
Reviews.Author: psmoove
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant overnight stay at the US Grant. Very beautiful and stately hotel with historical accents, as well as a central location. Wife and I also loved the theme colors (dark wood and blue). Lobby was magnificent and service was above average (as I only had to deal with the front desk). We are Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) members and upon reservation I indicated that the stay is for our five year wedding anniversary. Upon check-in, we were upgraded right away to the suite on one of the top floors, so the noise issue from below was not a factor. So make sure you let them know what you are celebrating and it also helps to become members of SPG (free). The suite was beautifully decorated and well appointed. Two LCD TVs (a 50" LG for the living room and a 32" LG for the bedroom - more on this later), dark wood desk area and furnishings, marble floors on the bathroom (sadly though, no bathtub), Gilchrist & Soames toiletries, a plush love seat, and of course the centerpiece of it all - the King sized Heavenly Bed with lots of pillows. Although we ourselves have a Queen sized Heavenly Bed at home, the King was a nice treat. About the TVs. I am a videophile that appreciates the latest electronics, so it excited me to see that the suite had not one but two HDTVs. What utterly dumbfounded me was when I discovered that both TVs only show standard-definition TV programming! Unacceptable. So needless to say picture quality was terrible. What an absolute waste of technology. The one saving grace was that the Bose DVD player was available and was connected via component cables so our DVD movies at least looked great. Another tech letdown was that although this place markets itself as a 5 star hotel, it befuddles me that they charge $13 per day for Internet access in the rooms. It should be included (or, at the very least, it should be complimentary to SPG members). While Internet access is free down at the lobby, who wants to schlep down there in their pj's to check email? Two money saving tips: do not, under any circumstances, move anything out of the mini-bar. These latest versions have a sensor that automatically detects (and charges) you for anything you remove that you don't replace within, count 'em, 60 seconds. We wanted to put a couple of bottled waters in there that we brought from home as well as to chill some chocolate covered strawberries but unfortunately we weren't able to do that. Regarding parking, if you don't want to fork over $32 for the valet parking you can drive around the neighborhood to find some street parking. We found paid parking just north of the hotel on Fourth Avenue. The lot charges $8 and there are no restrictions for overnight parking. I added $10 to the slot just in case and we were OK the next day. As for the location, the hotel is centrally located. We caught a movie right across the street at the uniquely laid out Horton Plaza and had dinner a few blocks down at the Oceanaire Seafood Room. Gaslamp is very lively in the evenings and it was fun to hang out in the area and not have to drive anywhere. Final thing: I hope that the hotel management consider green improvements to help the environment. They can easily replace the incandescent bulbs in the rooms for example with CFLs as a first step. I felt guilty just turning on the lights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: cathyinwv
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, but very nice, clean and updated. Bedding was nice and bed very comfortable. I heard complaints about street noise on lower floors, but this is right downtown near the Gas Lamp District and great restaurants and bars, so of course you hear street traffic. Only complaint was the view of homeless and buildings next door. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Playatrav
Reviews.Content: I booked the room for my husband's birthday weekend and thought the Grant would be a nice surprise because we like older hotels and it's part of the Starwood Luxury Collection. When I confirmed the reservation the woman who helped me said she was giving us a great room "with an awesome view." Now, some people might think a third floor room overlooking the Sam Goody store across the street might qualify as "awesome" but after laying awake the whole first night because of bus and street noise - not to mention drunken bar patrons from the nearby Gaslamp quarter - we asked to move to a different room. A pain in the neck during a 2-night stay and our second room was equally average but at least not so loud. Next time, I'd stay at the W or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: mlstravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the US Grant this weekend and had a wonderful time. We were visiting family and wanted to stay in a hotel that was convenient and relaxing. We love boutique hotels and have stayed in the Ivy Hotel but knew that would be too noisy for what we were looking for this weekend. The US Grant was perfect! We requested a quiet room and received a room on the 10th floor which was large and beautifully furnished. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was huge. All of the staff from the front desk, to the concierge to the valets were very friendly without being intrusive. Turn down service with chocolates on the pillow are always a nice touch. We enjoyed a light lunch at the Grant Grill which was delicious and very reasonably priced. They make their own potato chips which are excellent! The parking is a bit expensive, but I think it is pretty much on par with the other hotels in the area. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to our friends. If you are looking for a nice dinner, we tried Suite & Tender at the new Se Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is not cheap but it was definitely worth it to us. Lobster and braised short ribs on the same plate. Need I say more?!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Gonecuttinghair
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were getting away for a little R&R. We took advantage of a travelzoo.com deal that gave us a deluxe room for $169. a night and since this hotel was situated in the Gas lamp quarter of San Diego we decided to stay here because of the value and location. We had read the details on the mandatory valet if you drive to the hotel so we were aware of the $32 charge per day. We really enjoyed the valet attendants as they were charming, helpful and very good looking. When we first arrived and checked in we didn't have a good experience with the lady at the desk. I had asked for a quiet room when booking the room a month in advance and after she gave us our room keys I double checked it wasn't facing Broadview and unfortunately it was so I asked if we could get another room in a quieter part of the hotel....she took the keys out of the sleeve and tossed the sleeve to the side rather flippy and starting punching keys on the computer. Then she put the newly scanned new cards into the sleeve and began her fake "if there's anything else we can do for you to make your stay better please don't hesitate to ask" (If you're looking for a pleasant check-in stay away from the lady with the long curly hair, fake smile, and only nice to customers in the end because she has to be kind of attitude) Other front desk help were very friendly and extremely pleasant. Concierge also very friendly and full of great suggestions. We loved our room that looked over the courtyard. Everything clean and well appointed. Loved the extras you expect in a 5 star hotel such as the turn down service, closing of all the drapes and chocolates at night. The only things that did not work is one light in bathroom and our clock radio. Other than that the room was perfect. Beds were so comfortable that we could have stayed forever. Definitely take advantage of the art gallery downstairs as there are some interesting art in their gallery. We walked to the mall across the street and all the restaurants. We did try to get back before dark because of all the homeless people around the area but I never felt threatened by any of the homeless people in the daytime hours. We had heard not to eat at the Grant Grille as the food is only so so and very expensive so we opted for other restaurants that were very good. We ended up trying the Yard House and Bella Luna which both were great in our book. Enjoy this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little let-down”
Reviews.Author: cardiophys
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was to take our 3 year old daughter to the Zoo and Sea World and a business meeting for myself. Upon arrival we were not offerred any help with our luggage. Check-in was smooth. The room was quite small and congested. The bathroom only had a shower. The sink is what was out of place. The room is of classic design but the raised bowl sink was of contemporary design and didn't fit. There was also a sewer smell initially when the faucet was turned on. We never got room service since we ate out but the food in the hotel that was served at my meeting was so so. Try Bandar(persian) and Hard Rock for food options as the hotel is a very close to the gaslamp. Overall, I will not stay at this hotel again if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nona_9
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at the US Grant and it was wonderful. The staff was great and I felt like they were really trying to give us a great weekend. They remembered our names, and made sure we had everything we needed. The rooms were absolutely gorgeous. I didn't mind that they were on the small side because they were so pretty. This is the first hotel where I actually liked the bathroom - great lighting, nice layout, and shelves and hooks for my toiletries. I felt a bit claustrophobic when I realized the windows didn't open. There was a slight musty smell when we first arrived, but it went away soon, and I think it's to be expected from a 100 year old building. You should know in advance that the parking fee is $32 a day and the Wi-Fi is $20. Ouch, but you are probably used to it if you're an SPG member. I will definitely return to the US Grant and recommend it to everyone. I have only nice things to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic historical hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: soccermom13
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a fabulous hotel in a perfect downtown location. It has a real sense of history to it and the decor and furnishings reflect that. The hotel recently underwent a major renovation so it looks spectacular but it is still a hotel that is close to 100 years old so it has its own eccentricities - we were in a corner room which was really large and spacious but since the building is in a u-shape when you open the blinds in the washroom you are looking out at other hotel room windows and can see people moving about. There is no pool on the premises but you can walk across the street to the Westin Gaslamp and use their facilities with your room key. The hotel is across the street as well from the Horton Shopping Plaza which is convenient and The Old Town Trolley Tours have a stop there so its very convenient. Great spot!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing is the word of the day”
Reviews.Author: pccdonl
Reviews.Content: When I reserved this hotel for myself and my colleagues, I expected it to be a very good hotel. The staff were welcoming, when it got to the room it was disappointing. The room I was given overlooked a central roof area, and you could see directly into the adjoining room across the way (about 15 feet). When I came down to have the room switched out, I was told there were no other rooms they could put me in. I asked to be moved to a different room, even if it costed more. They refused and would not upgrade my room, then said a room on the 7th floor would be open later after it was cleaned but it had two beds. I arrived at the hotel at 2pm, I am sitting here in the lobby writing this review and it is almost 5pm. Maybe I should just walk across the street to the Westin? I do have to say the hotel is beautiful albeit from a customer standpoint severely disappointing. When you pay this kind of money for comfort and ambiance you should not be disappointed. Just my two cents.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: amandurrrr
Reviews.Content: We just left San Diego on our trip through California. My husband and I are Starwood Preferred Members, and we chose to stay at the US Grant. From the pictures online, it looked wonderful. It truly exceeded our expectations. We have travel many places in the world, and this was by far one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The location was perfect. Everything was within walking distance; shops, restaurants, waterfront. The best part of our stay at the US Grant was the service. Everyone called us by name, and willing to help us without even being prompted. Albert, the concierge, was a wealth of knowledge on the San Diego area. He pointed us in the right direction for the best fish tacos, cool breakfast places, and much more. We will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Extreme comfort & ideal resting place for our funfilled 4th of July weekend”
Reviews.Author: Swirlz5
Reviews.Content: Ever since I began planning our short family vacation to San Diego I was set on staying at the US Grant. The reviews and photo's had me hooked and I just HAD to see it for myself. . .our two nights at the US Grant were just as I dreamed they would be (minus not having a view but that was fine for our short stay). Prior to our stay I had emailed the hotel and received phenomenal assistance from Demi, the Guest Loyalty Coordinator. She was a tremendous help and answered all my questions so I knew our stay would be great. We previously spent one night at the Sheraton Marina and departed early for downtown. We arrived around 9am and did a pre-registration for our Signature Suite room (326) before spending a long & full day at Sea World. We were pleased the hotel would store our bags until our evening return. We then met Mark at the concierge desk. Mark was so pleasant and friendly and such a joy to ask for assistance. I had done quiet a bit of research on the trolley and bus systems and new we could take both to Sea World. However, when we had stored our bags I had also left all my research and schedules in them. Mark was quick to produce the schedules we needed along with detailed information for getting around. We head out to the back side of the hotel to await the trolly to Old Town. After a half hour of waiting someone had called and found the system had lost power and was backed up. . ."back" to the hotel we wend and Mark provided a bus schedule. The bus picked up in "front" of the US Grant after only a 5 min wait and off we went for our day at Sea World. About 8pm we had caught the trolley back and with two very tired 6 yr olds, sore feet, & in need of a good nights rest we finally went to our beautiful room. Waiting for us was a wonderful welcoming gift of chocolate covered banana's and a bottle of wine. Again, I was living my dream & the wine was the perfect end to our long LONG day at Sea World. We showered our boys in the HUGE 10X10 ft shower. . .Yes ten by ten feet, 6-jet/headed shower and tucked them into a huge king bed. Exhausted ourselves my husband & I headed for our king bed after our short glass of wine. We slept very soundly in very comfortable beds. . .after having stayed at the Westin Villas in Maui, we knew there were indeed hotels with heavenly beds and bedding. . .the US Grant did no fail us. The array of feather pillows and soft clean bedding was perfect. In the room we were also provided with robes, slippers, coffee/tea, bottled water, & turn-down service with chocolates. The Signature Suite is made up of an entry way, two large King beds, 2 large screen TVs, a desk/office station ($11.95 per day internet charge), a huge bathroom with double sinks and living-room & dining-room. On the downside there is a fridge filled with mini-bar items but no room for your own items. The next morning was the 4th of July and I had first planned on taking the family to the Le Cake Chateau (up the street about 3 blocks), we arrived only to find it closed and walked back to the Grant. The Horton Plaza across the street didn't have much open but we were able to make a breakfast out of Starbucks items (the kids seemed happy). We spent the day at the USS Midway, road the ferry to Coronado Island, recommended by the front desk, (had lunch at Spiro's Gyros) and road the ferry back. . .being the 4th of July everything was busy and they were running an extra ferry to accommodate the extra traffic (but they were still full and standing room only). Then back to the US Grant for a rest (too many people and too much walking around between this morning and Sea World the day before). About 5pm we decided to catch the #7 bus to Balboa park only to find all the Museums were closed due to the 4th but also because of this the park was fairly quiet with little amount of people. We enjoyed the beautiful buildings and came upon the Moreton Bay Fig tree and took a few sets of stairs down to a quiet little forest area that seemed right out of a book. Our boys enjoyed playing with the squirrels running around. About 7pm we'd had enjoy walking and tried to catch the bus back to our hotel. . it never showed up. . we began walking and crossed the freeway stopping a Mc Donalds, then finally saw 2 or 3 buses go by (either they had been stuck in traffic or broken down for 30 min). Near Mc Donalds we found the trolley and happily boarded for the short ride to the US Grant. Again exhausted we were too tired to head out to watch the fireworks and instead enjoyed the Bose sound system with both large flat-screen TV showing the fireworks on local news channels. After the display our boys fell asleep. I wasn't exactly hungry but wanted to order room service from the Grant Grill and we decided to get the cheese tray (for 1 @$18 - you can order for 1 or 2). We still had some red wine left over and I figured cheese would be tasty. Room service took awhile and the total bill came to $27 for 6 pieces of cheese. One might find this disappointing but it was more for the fun of it and to try something different. The presentation was lovely and along with the cheese were some gourmet bread & crackers, thinly sliced meats, mixed berries and the best honey we've ever tasty. Since it was an order for 1 I hadn't expected much but the extra $10 in charges were a bit excessive for room service and taxes. The experience was fun and the dish was brought in on a silver tray. Along with the wine we made a picnic out of it in front of the living-room tv. This was a great end to our last evening. You can see from my photos we did not have much of a view but the lack of street noise more then made up for it. . .we didn't hear a thing our entire stay. Though this hotel is recommended more for adults our two small boys LOVED it, loved the shower, loved the beds and watching cartoons in the room. Though we didn't use it we found we could have gain access to the Westin's swimming pool if we had so wanted. We took a long relaxing morning and headed for the airport. I missed the opportunity to meet Demi in person but she along with the concierge, Mark, made our stay perfect. I look forward to returning in the future (maybe without the kids).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: lilroy0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant on a business trip while in San Diego for a conference and was pleased with the stay. When I arrived I was given a suite on the 8th floor based on the deal that I booked, and was actually upgraded to a nicer one, though in reality I couldn't tell the difference. The suite itself was very nice, albeit perhaps a bit small. The bathroom was nice and the turndown service was a huge plus after a long stressful day. On my 2nd day there was a crazy dog down the hall in one of the rooms that would not stop barking - when I called to complain it was fixed within a short amount of time. Not sure what they did, but I was appreciative of the responsiveness. The gym on the basement floor was kind of strange as it had no windows, but was pretty decent in terms of equipment. Whie the hotel doesn't actually a pool, it is my understaning that the front desk will give you a pass to use the pool at the nearby Westin property as they are both SPG hotels. The location of the hotel was great. For small complaints, the high charge to use the internet is rediculous in this day and age, especially given that many hotels offer this as a free amenity. For staying at a luxury hotel, one would think that this small service would be included. Oh, and from what I could tell from visiting the business center you have to pay to use the computers and printer? Are you kidding me? Overall a great hotel - I got the opportunity to check out my co-workers "event planner suite" on the 2nd floor, which was absolutely incredible and basically the size of a large apartment.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: runner27
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that is comfortable and classy. I stayed in a deluxe corner room on the sixth floor. Very comfortable and nice. The bar and bartender (Bruce?) were top notch. The food was excellent. This place is also walking distance to the Harbor (10 minutes) and the gaslamp quarter (1-5 minutes). Lots of fun night clubs within blocks. Would repeat if there on business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: MaritimeExplorers
Reviews.Content: It's not every day a hotel really stands out, but this one definitely does! The US Grant has paid attention to all the details, our room was fantastic, and staff were extremely friendly. Especially one Pittsburgh employee who helped us check in, go Pens go! Our room was very large and had modern touches and decor, especially for an old building. It had a very large bedroom, large bathroom with walk in shower, and a living room area as well. Little touches, like fruit and treats delivered to our room the first night, wonderful turn-down service, will make us loyal to the US Grant! San Diego was a great city to visit! Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The food was great, and we even visited the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars Plus!”
Reviews.Author: Tripfantastic
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I knew I was in good hands. The lovely person who checked me in, Demi, took great care of me, providing me with an upgrade to a fantastic suite. Since my daughter was joining me for a birthday treat, she made sure to make us both were very pampered! The suite was incredibly spacious, comfortable and clean. All of the staff were quite helpful and friendly. The whole hotel had an air of quiet luxury. The location was great - just close enough to the boisterous Gaslamp District and wonderful restaurants as well as Little Italy. The concierge was very accommodating in locating breakfast places as well as a car rental agency that picked us up and dropped us off without a hitch...that doesn't always happen. Our drive to La Jolla was short and wonderful. The zoo is also a must-see, truly world class. I would return tomorrow if I could. Thanks to all for making my daughter's and my stay a truly memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, room alittle small”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in a king room. Our room was on the top floor overlooking Broadway, but it was very quiet. The walls have the most beautiful molding. While the room was lovely, there was not much space to move around. The bathroom had a beautiful shower with a great shower head, but there was no tub. The towels were a not as plush as I would had hoped for in a luxury property. This hotel was beautiful and I would stay here again, but I will bring a sleeping mask. There is alot of light that comes in the room in the night. It would have been perfect with blackout blinds though. The staff was excellent, best out there. They were so kind and polite and very helpful down to every little detail. The location is in the Gaslamp just across from a mall. It is an easy walk down to the port to the fish restaurants, the Midway, cruise ships, and train station.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel but WATCH the Mini Bar Charges!”
Reviews.Author: busyguy74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for business. Room was on the 11th floor and was great. Good views and very big flat screen TV. The hotel is older, but tastefully modernized. Huge Bathroom and great shower. Room service was very good however a bit overpriced. I was very happy with my stay untill I checked my credit card today. Sure enough there was a mini bar charge. I did not touch the mini bar and actually had no clue where is was. I called the hotel and after a bit of a run around, they agreed to credit it back. I stay at SPG properties all over and I have gotten mini bar charges at the high end placed. Its kinda weird, but I think it might be housekeeping or something. We will see if I actually get the credit.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant as a Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: SoCaPoster
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding ceremony and reception at the US Grant. The hotel is beautiful, the staff at the front desk, valet, concierge, waiters, etc. were wonderful. We got a lot of compliments from our guests about the ballrooms and guest rooms. But, the catering department was completely unsatisfactory. They made mistakes with our food and beverage, and when I noticed during the wedding, the catering manager argued with me about it, and basically yelled at me and blamed me (during the cocktail hour!!). To top it all off, we ended up getting charged for all the mistakes. I was still dealing with this issue during my honeymoon and for a couple months after the wedding. The head of the catering department sort of addressed the issue with an apology, but she did not fully address the issues on our final bill, and it was obvious to me that they still did not think they did anything wrong, and still attempted shift the blame onto me by pointing out other complications in the wedding unrelated to food and beverage. While I do think the hotel is beautiful, I would not recommend anyone getting married there, or at least not if you are working with certain catering managers. I am sure that the incident that happened at our wedding was just a fluke, but the catering department's defensiveness and handling of the situation post-wedding is very telling of their customer service standards. Frankly, I expected MUCH better service from a "Luxury Collection" hotel, and am very disappointed with what I received for the amount of money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant-the Kumayyayi victory”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesian
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a six day stay in the US Grant and its landmark suite. The welcome from the sales manager, the front office manager and all the staff can onlz be summed up as astounding. The suite was decent in size, spotlessly clean, had several welcome gifts in it and was perfect for the purpose. There is a wee bit of noise from the street and earplugs might come in handy, but, on the other hand You do not wake up to the bloody train that hoots its way through downtown San Diego and especially the waterfront!!! NO earplugs keep that [--] away! The general areas of the hotel are very gently renovated, and there are books about the Sycuan nation that owns the hotel which give You a background of why they chose this one to renovate. Needless to say, the US Grant is once again the jewel in the crown of SD hotels. Breakfast is a la carte and not terribly overpriced, nor the bar. In many Luxury collection properties, the price level is FAR higher. They even have decent minibar prices, as well as room service prices. The only thing I really lacked was a bathtub, but they do have suites with baths. A rooftop pool would be nice as well. Rumour has it, though, that the hotel is in the process of restoring the original Roman baths in the basement. I alreadz look fwd to returning in order to see how they progress. The US Grant and all its employees, I salute You!

Reviews.Title: “Should of Stayed at Westin Across the Street”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: The Westin offered me a suite across the street. I thought it would be best to try a new hotel. I booked a very expensive room at The US Grant during Thanksgiving with a friend. As an SPG Gold member, we received no upgrades, only late check out. This was a four night stay and our room was way too small for that period of time. The staff had an attitude. I was so mad I asked the GM to give me a scissors as I tried to cut up my Gold card. He stopped me and we sat down for a chat. I explained our room was too small for the visit and that an upgrade should have been given. I also explained that I did not like how they treated us seeing we were a younger clientele. We felt looked down upon. Whenever we go to hotels we are respectful and usually never make a mess. He gave me bonus points to make up for it. The tub was fantastic, but I still wonder what the suite at the Westin looked like.

Reviews.Title: “What makes This one of the Greatest Hotels In All of California”
Reviews.Author: THEGUYFROMSOCALIF
Reviews.Content: 1. The Staff - incredible. None nicer than the Front Desk manager, Harry! 2. The location - On the edge of the Gaslamp District - easy walk to many cool restaurants and bars! 3. The Value - Where else can you stay in a hotel for around $200/night that has had close to a dozen US Presidents stay there already? Name one!! 4. The rooms - the upgraded suites with the "killer showers", super clean rooms, great comfortable beds, big TV's, etc. Can't wait to got back!!

Reviews.Title: “US Grant is a great LC Starwoods property”
Reviews.Author: singtx
Reviews.Content: Recently had a two night stay at the Grant. Booked a standard room and was upgraded to Deluxe corner room four days prior to arrival on SPG.com. Location was great and easy to get to from airport. Arrival was nice, great entrance and employees. Check-in was fast and efficient, no line! Was on 7th floor. Got a great running map from front desk on a small laminated (around 3 by 5) card. One route took you 3 miles and another 5 (to the sand and some sights). TV had no HD channels to speak of. Work out room was on the small side but adequate, free water and fruit. Grant Grill was nice place to people watch and have a drink. Two drinks and dessert set me back 45...Wife asked for blue cheese stuffed olives and they didnt even blink! In fact the employee said she made some fresh ones earlier in the morning!!...pricey, but had fun! Great pictures all over this hotel of Grant and other iconic figures. My wife and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a shower!”
Reviews.Author: McLovin70
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the US Grant for family that were coming into town for a cruise. I figured it was close to the pier and still close to the Gaslamp if they wanted to go out. I was lucky enough to find a special room rate where you were able to get a complimentary upgrade to a suite if there was available room. Upon checking in we were lucky to be upgraded and found the room to be very nice. Of special note was that the shower in a suite was AWESOME! 6 shower heads, a full bench seat and enough room for at least a dozen people if you really wanted to cram them in. The rest of the room was still on the smallish side for a suite, but it was still quite comfortable for 4 people. There were 2 king sized beds which were wonderfully comfortable, and had what seemed like premium bedding which is always a huge plus for me. 2 flat screen TV's, one for the beds, and one for the couch. The dining table was nice for playing cards. In the evening, the whole outside glows a pretty purple, which was easily blocked by the thick curtains, once you were ready for sleep. The service here was really quite good. From the valet that helped my grandpa, to the bellman who offered a lot of advice (I am a San Diego local, so knew it was in fact good advice), to the front desk, to the maids that did a turndown service, and refilled the ice container. It was all quite wonderful. They offered a late checkout as well, which made getting to the cruise ship just that much easier. I only have a couple observations of what could be small negatives. Those being that the elevators are SO SMALL! That being said, they move quite quickly. Secondly, that there are some area rugs in each landing area for each floor that has a pile that is so thick that it caused my grandpa to trip several times.

Reviews.Title: “A great place-a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: LarTraveler
Reviews.Content: To end spring break, we ventured from our home in LA to SD. I was able to get a great rate with Starwood Preferred Guest awards. If you like historic, wonderfully restored hotels-this is the place in San Diego. From the moment we arrived, the staff was wonderful and accomodatingl. We were offered a top floor, corner room that was simply classy and very well done. We could easily walk or use the SD trolley to venture out with young children. This is an urban hotel, downtown, safe...but with the expected street people. It is next to the hottest dining and night club area (Gaslamp District). If noise at night is an issue -request a room located in a quiet area. We had a great quick get away family weekend. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the U.S. Grant!”
Reviews.Author: minifalda78
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the U.S. Grant and we had a great time. The hotel is within walking distance to the Gaslamp District (several blocks of streets with multiple bars, restaurants, and shops), and you can either walk or take the trolley to Seaport Village and docks where the cruise tours leave. All of the staff were very friendly and polite. We got there rather late, and ordered two turkey sandwiches from room service. They were very good, but they were huge! We definitely should have ordered just one and split it! We also went to "happy hour" at the Grant Grill, but it isn't much of a happy hour. There aren't any drink specials, but appetizers are half off. There are, however, many bars in the Gaslamp with real happy hours! We had never been to California before, so we needed some help with activities and tours. The concierge was great and told us where to go and how to get there. We didn't rent a car, and it turned out we didn't need one, as the buses and trolleys (and walking) are an easy way to get around. I didn't think our room (standard king-size bed) was small, but my husband seemed to think so. However, we were not in our room much, other than to sleep and shower. I loved the bathrobes! You may want to bring earplugs. The windows are very thin and you can hear people talking and traffic on the street below. I always wear earplugs when I sleep and the noise didn't bother me. There are homeless people outside the hotel, but there are homeless people practically everywhere in the city. We were never approached by homeless people around our hotel, but we were approached three times outside a Starbucks in the Gaslamp. I am glad we stayed here. We originally reserved a room at the W, but the price turned out to be better at the US Grant. The US Grant is in a better location than the W, too.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: SBF.Dublin
Reviews.Content: A key factor for me on this visit was comfort and location and the US Grant didn't disappoint. I had been a little nervous reading other review about a park close by and tramps in the area, but be assured the location is excellent. The park is tiny, more a patch of grass across the road and directly beside the busy shopping Mall of Horton Plaza, so all very safe. Plenty of people around. The beauty of being so close to the plaza , aside of the shops and food outlets, was that it was one of the main stops for the trolly bus. A must when in San Diego. All the night activity, restaurants and bars of the Gaslamp area are on your doorstep. The rooms are different, not particularly large even though we upgraded to a mini suite and I wasn't mad about the dark decor - black floors and doors etc, but it is a comfortable hotel, The bed and bathrooms are very good. The dining room is lovely, if a little expensive. We enjoyed a fab breakfast with good sized portions (it wasn't a buffet). I would stay in the US Grant if visiting San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovexryanx
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here two years in a row during ComicCon and it's always great. The staff is super nice and the location is close to everything. The rooms are luxurious, yet understated and just overall pleasing to the eye. My boyfriend is a huge fan of their turn down service. If I had to find one fault with the place, it would be not having a pool, but when the beach is a 20 minute drive away, who needs a pool?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: rayjay80
Reviews.Content: We had one night to stay in San Diego after our cruise, and this was an excellent choice. Our room was fantastic. One of the most lavishly decorated we have seen. The bed was incredibly comfortable. I researched the other hotels in the area and selected this one despite some of the negative comments I saw on this site. We did not experience any. We heard very litle street noise and none from other rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If we return to San Diego again, we will definitely stay at the this place.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: borstalboy
Reviews.Content: The hotel it beautiful! A 5-star all the way. I got there early and was able to get in a room. I asked for a fridge for medication and was given it with no charge very quickly. The room was perfect! Small, but very clean and the bath products wre great! They even have turn down service! The hotel is right next to the San Diego Civic Center where I was attending RENT. Great trip all around! Very close to the airport. $10 cab ride. OH, and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: chk69
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the staff were friendly and the hotel has such a grand feeling about it that if the staff weren't friendly it would be easy to feel out of place. We got a special over the internet, so our rooms were a little small, we had the Superior Double Room, but with the luxury of the hotel for under $400 for the night who can complain. The rooms were spotless and the breakfast fantastic, even with a healthy diet option. The location was fantastic in the Gaslamp Quarter and right across from a shopping centre. This elegant hotel is perfect for any special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Historic, High Class.”
Reviews.Author: seniorboyd
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our anniversary trip to San Diego and wanted to stay in a classy 5 star hotel. We called the hotel after noon on the day of our arrival. The best price they could give us was $209. Five minutes after checking in we had to leave because my wife felt did not feel comfortable in that room. Later we both used the term "spooky" to describe it. The halls on our floor were a little dark. The room was light but smaller than what we are used to and old fashioned but elegant. As we tried to check out the management in the same sentence stated 1) He had other rooms he would love to show us and 2) All the rooms were full, he could have rented out that room to someone else and wanted one nights rent was their policy. We left with the assurance our credit card would not be charged for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it but didn't "LOVE IT"”
Reviews.Author: VacationersNJ
Reviews.Content: My friend who lives in SD recommended this hotel to me and told me that the hotel had "recently" completed a large rennovation. The US Grant is part of the Fine Hotels & Resorts program with Amex and so I called Amex Platinum Travel Services to book all my travel arrangements. Upon my arrival, albeit late, I walked into a grand area with stunning chandeliers by the reception area. I had orginally booked a King Deluxe and was offered an upgrade upon check-in but decided to decline it as it had a whirlpool tub and was located on the 11th floor. I entered my room that evening and was quite astonished on how small the room was and at the same time missing a dresser for my clothes, needless to say the following morning I took the upgrade (tub or no tub). If memory serves me correct, I think I was upgraded to a Legacy Suite, not 100% certain but the room offered 1.5 bathrooms and a separate living room and bed room which was quite nice. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the rooms are nicely appointed, but again the rooms are somewhat on the small side. All throughout my stay the staff was very accommodating and extremly friendly and it is for these 2 reasons my stay was made memorable. When I return to SD, I don't know if I will stay here again but only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with a Few Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Therapist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant this February for three nights to visit and friends. We were then going to depart on a cruise. Here is a brief breakdown of my impression of my stay and a couple of tips: First, the positives: The lobby was beautiful, impressive and comfortable to hang out in. The staff who checked us in were welcoming and professional. The room we stayed in was small, but exceedingly well decorated and clean (see pictures) and the bathroom, though small, was mostly marble and so well-appointed that you I could almost forgive the lack of space. The bed was amazingly comfortable. My husband and I rarely find a bed that we both can sleep well on, and this was one of them. There were actually free bottles of water in the room (something of an oddity anymore in city hotels) and turndown service. The hotel's location was also close to a lot of restaurants and shops. If you're a mall fan, Horton Plaza is right across the street. The not-so-positives: For some reason the hallways on our floor did not appear to be vacuumed for the entire length of our stay. There were some pretty large pieces of debris that were on the floor that were visible (and were joined by other debris) during the course of our stay. The lobby was so clean that this discrepency was quite jarring. Also, this location is great to get to downtown locations but there are also a lot of homeless people in this area. My understanding is that they are not supposed to ask you for money, but if seeing homeless people is something that you don't like to see on vacation, this may not be the spot for you. Tips: (1) Internet access in your room is available for a fee ($12, I think), but if you go in the lobby you can get connected for free. (2) If you are going to be staying a night or two in San Diego before a cruise, you can actually walk down to thte terminal from the hotel. A taxi would also be inexpensive, but if there are more than two cruise ships departing from San Diego, you may be better off just walking (and the walk is all downhill). (3) For a really nice breakfast, try St. Tropez, which is right across the street near Horton Plaza. Ask the concierge for directions if my direcctions are lacking. The breakfasts are really good, and the roasted potatoes are sauteed with rosemary and are crisp and delicious. All in all, I'd stay here again. I've already recommended it to friends who are going to San Diego in the next couple months.

Reviews.Title: “Class and comfort in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kapohokine
Reviews.Content: I love older historic properties. My favorite hotel in San Diego is the Hotel Del Coronado, and I've stayed there many times ALWAYS in the original Victorian building. The US Grant was a revelation. The Gaslamp and Horton Plaza are right at your doorstep. Shopping, restaurants and all kinds of activities are within an easy walk. The building itself is, as noted, quirky. Totally expected, and this is what gives an older property it's charm. Rooms can be odd sizes and hallways can lead to nowhere, but the finishes and quality were flawless. Speaking of rooms, I was upgraded to a large corner room. White walls set off by dark Wenge wood floors, dramatic original art, flat screen TV, a large desk area, and an enormous bathroom and dressing area made this room terrific. I did notice noise from the windows, and I also noticed noise from the creaky floors in some of the hallways. The hotel has a really cool urban vibe that sits really comfortably with the historic nature of the property. The staff was always professional and friendly. The restaurant and lounge are simply stunning. Comfortable, funky and expensive feeling. Very easy to find a little area with a couch and a couple of chairs to hang out and people watch or meet up with friends. The charges for the room, parking, internet, etc are all acceptable for a property of this caliber. The central downtown location with the ease of getting around from here, mixed with the historic nature of the property and the top shelf modern amenities makes for an incredibly cool and understated experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but cheese-paring”
Reviews.Author: daustins
Reviews.Content: I was here at the 24th International Science Fair...in 1973. It's had a wonderful makeover. The restaurant is very good, the rooms very nice. Like all well-remade old hotels it's pleasant and quirky and nice and the staff takes pride in that. This is great. I like it. But this is a Starwood Property. Which means it's very well run, very pleasant, very nice, and they charge you for each breath of air. Really, folks, better hotels, like the Adolphus (Dallas), and the Boulders (Phoenix) and the London West Hollywood (LA) GIVE you internet. Starwood doesn't have to squeeze out the last penny because this makes me less loyal to Starwood. If I'm paying $500 a day in toto there's no reason that I ought to pay for internet.
