It's a good hotel but be prepared to pay for everything, even things that ought to be free in 2008-2009. Or you can bring your modem. If a Hilton will give something away, that says something, doesn't it? Stop with the jokes.

Reviews.Title: “It's got a dark theme and charges $30 for parking”
Reviews.Author: Appreci8life
Reviews.Content: It's a clean and decent hotel but it's definitely too dark somehow. Even the bathrobes are actually black. The room we stayed in was very clean and yet it was very small. The most off putting aspect was the parking. As soon as we pulled in front of the hotel they were very polite to take the car keys and to take our luggage and yet didn't mention we could self park but attached a ticket which I only saw later when I asked for the car that the vallet parking was $30. The check in was smooth and the carpet on the hallways was very plushy. And yet the room also as well as the hotel seemed to have a dark theme which wasn't my thing at all. Did I mention even the bathrobes were black. You can't use the mini fridge at all as it is full with their drinks that they want you to purchase. No room at all in the mini fridge. The internet charges in the business room were shockingly high: $2.99 just to log in and then 69c per minute. Come on mr manager, this is pure greed. Isn't enough the money spent on the room? Apart from the dark theme and the exorbitant internet charges all was ok. Would I stay again? Definitely not. That dark theme just isn't me at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The US Grant”
Reviews.Author: HHICNSAND
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Diego CA the week of December 3. We stayed for two nights at the US Grant in the Gaslamp District. We decided not to rent a car due to hotel parking fees and instead took a cab from the airport to the hotel that cost $13. We were immediately greeted by a friendly face in the corridor, then off to the front desk for check in. Magdelane checked us in and was very friendly and helpful with restaurant recommendations nearby. Our room was perfect except for one detail. It was a corner room and because the hotel was not allowed to change the windows due to historical significance it was in a word loud. Although the loud a/c unit drowned out a good bit of the outdoor, traffic noise. Aside from that, the room was very clean and beautiful with a comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The next day we were up early and consulted with Mark Peak, Chief Concierge on ideas of things to do and travel plans due to not renting a car. He was extremely professional, helpful and kind. We decided to purchase the Old Town Trolley tour and we took off at the 9:30 departure from Horton's Plaza. We enjoyed the trolley tour and spent most of our day hopping on and off at Coronado and Old Town. We we arrived back at the hotel we hit happy hour at Ra and the Yard House. Then it was off to Bertrand's at Mister A's for dinner. Cab cost $6 one way. The view was fabulous from the deck and the service and food were wonderful. The following morning we shopped at Horton's Plaza, a wonderful outdoor mall. Upon check out I asked Magdelane about the noise and if they would have moved us to another room had we requested it, she said yes. One other note regarding the local element of people. There are homeless people on the streets surrounding the hotel and gaslamp district. We were not bothered by any of them. Overall, very happy with our stay at the US Grant and its location is fabulous with so much to do nearby within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HillsofGR
Reviews.Content: Very formal, and nice hotel. Super clean inside and out. I was there for a convention, and this hotel is around 7-8 blocks from the Convention Center. The only complaints I have are the number of homeless people that seem to gather in the park across the street from the hotel, and there was a bar across the street from our room that was pretty loud late into the night. But as for the hotel itself, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL, CAN'T FAULT IT”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the US Grant for a week from 1 November 2008. The hotel can only be described as majestic, it is architecturally magnificent. On arriving from the airport in a cab ($10, but the 992 airport bus stops right outside the hotel for $1.25), I was warmly and genuinely greeted by the doorman, he took my bag and somehow without speaking to the staff at reception, passed on my name to them and they subsequently welcomed me by name and informed me that the room was ready for an early check in, they being aware that I was arriving from Australia. I must say at this point that during my week long stay I found all of the staff to be so kind and friendly, I never went unacknowledged, whether I was just passing reception or doormen etc. Just a smile or a hello, nothing irritating like American conversation that never ends! The room was stunning, and overlooked Horton Plaza, the small shopping mall. Housekeeping was mainly of a high standard. The king bed was lovely, air con was great, TV was great with lots of channels to choose from. I must give a big plus to the Grant Grill, the in-hotel restaurant. I would return just for their steaks, words fail me, the best in the world. The staff are subtle but caring, never seeking tips constantly like most American hotel staff. It is unlikely I will visit San Diego again in a long time, but I will always remember the US Grant and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in downtown San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLondon3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably one of the best hotels I've stayed at. (although to be fair, I mostly stay in hostels while traveling) However, this was a special occasion - it was my going away party right before I moved to London. A few friends and I decided to get a room and have a night on the town. The hotel itself is ultra nice - great service, great amenities, very clean and an all around a wonderful experience! The rooms are immaculate - very nicely decorated, one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in and extremely clean! I would definitely pay the price to stay here again. In addition, the location couldn't be better either - on the corner of Broadway and 5th, right across the street from Horton Plaza and just steps away from the Gaslamp District, Petco Park, the Convention Center, and Seaport Village. If you are going to be staying in San Diego - and want an unforgettable experience - this is your hotel! (I'm a local - and would have all my family visiting stay here)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: kar882
Reviews.Content: I recently had business in downtown San Diego and decided to stay and US Grant. As others have noted, the location is very convenient to the gaslamp district, Horton shopping plaza, the convention center, and it's just a five minute walk to the harbor The hotel has been wonderfully renovated and the staff is very warm and accommodating. Not only was my room ready for me when I arrived at 2PM, but I was also able to confirm a late checkout for the day of my departure. I stayed in a legacy suite, and while I thought the room (two rooms, actually) was beautifully appointed and the bed quite comfortable, I found that there simply wasn't enough counter space in the bathroom to make it very functional. Another thing I discovered was that it was very difficult for the air conditioner to keep the room at a comfortable temperature, and there was no way to open a window. The only way I was able to keep the room at a comfortable sleeping temperature (could not get the room below 72 degrees ever) was to keep the AC fan on "high" all night long. The problem with the "high" setting is the amount of noise the fan puts out...very loud. Also, I called housekeeping as I was leaving my room in the morning to let them know that I would be out for several hours and I requested that the room be made up, so I was a bit surprised and disappointed to find that my room had not been touched when I returned at 4PM. I called housekeeping again and someone was there to makeup my room within five minutes, but still... Overall, I would say that my stay at the US Grant was pleasant, but I am not sure it would be my first choice upon a return trip to downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: DohertyWilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant on October 9-11, as a mini-break prior to taking a Mexican Riviera cruise. The hotel is really quite beautiful and the location is excellent...right in the heart of town, near the Gaslamp District and Horton Plaza. An expensive hotel, but we received lots of amenities included in our package price. The area is frequented by homeless people, as the bus terminal and tram to Mexico is nearby, but they do not cause any major safety or security concerns. The hotel is not very happy about their being there, though. We were promised an upgrade to our room by our travel agent, and were very pleased to receive this upgrade. The room was very nice, but there were some disappointments. First, there was a huge mirror that was just sitting on the floor, not mounted on a wall. The A/C system had to work really hard to keep the room at a comfortable temperature. There was not a great deal of storage space in the room, and the bathroom could have benefitted from a corner table to hold the toiletries, as the modern sink took up most of the space on the vanity. It would have been nice to have a bath as well as a shower (not the most powerful of showers, but survivable). The kleenex ran out and was not replaced; there was a lightup make up mirror in the room that did not work, and while reported, was never replaced. We were also disappointed that we had to call to get the room cleaned one afternoon at 3PM. We also had some difficulties with checkout, in that our credits were not applied properly, and it took much much longer to check out than we would have liked, owing to having to negotiate all the credits in order to receive an accurate bill. On the upside, free bottled water in the room, large "living" area in the room, decent flat screen TV, friendly room service staff, a most excellent and helpful concierge service; even though we faced the main street, reasonably quiet; a nice restaurant in the hotel, although we thought some of the wait staff did not behave as professionally as we would have liked. We've stayed at the Westgate next door as well. Both would be recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but no ocean”
Reviews.Author: boris4432via
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because most of the other hotels in the area were a bit pricey. I was hoping we would have received a larger room. We asked for a quiet room, and boy was it away from a lot of things. As we were leaving the hotel, sneaking a peek in other rooms, it appeared that all of the other rooms were bigger than ours. We got the rate online that if you pay for it that moment, you would get a reduced price. Anyway, the hotel bar was beautiful. Wine was not cheaper than $12 a glass (but good). Bartender very friendly. Later that night we went to Strip Club (a steak house not too far away) and loved the steak and wine deal. Next time, most definitely we will go for an ocean view at a different hotel. I was hoping that the US Grant would be better quality than anything on the ocean, but because it was so small I would have opted for something a bit nicer for a couples getaway. Also, no pool. The staff was certainly very polite. We tried to joke a little with the concierge and she wasn't having any of it. Overall, a beautiful hotel, but I would check out one of the other hotels before coming back. Just seemed like we needed more entertainment, things to do, and people to see.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ZippyPinhead
Reviews.Content: Recently I spent two nights at the US Grant Hotel while on a business trip. The rate for my room was $139, plus $17.50 for local taxes, per night. On the Web, I saw that the retail rate for the room is around $340/night, if I recall correctly. The hotel-- what I saw of it-- is beautifully decorated. It was completely remodeled a couple of years ago, and it looks to me as though they spared no expense. It really is a beautiful hotel. Unfortunately, most of the beautiful decoration is wasted on me... I felt that it was like perfume on a pig. In my room, the carpet on the floor looked to have been custom-made to fit the room. It was wall-to-wall, and the middle portion was a decorative pattern, surrounded by a dark border that went all around the room, effectively framing the pattern in the middle just like a framed picture. I couldn't tell what it was made of-- wool or something else-- but it was probably the nicest carpet I've ever had the pleasure to walk around barefoot on. The bathroom floor and shower were tiled with some kind of stone. I suppose it could have been man-made, but looked like real stone to me. It seemed to be similar to travertine, but the color was like milk coffee... a very light brown. The headboard of the bed was some kind of giant canvas, on which an "artist" had sketched some kind of characterization of people or something. I'm not an aficionado of art; looking at this drawing, I couldn't help but to wonder if the artist responsible could actually draw a realistic, recognizable human figure, or just this distorted stuff. I thought that if he could actually draw a skillful, accurate, recognizable image of a person, it would somehow make it less unreasonable/more tolerable for him to turn out these nearly unrecognizable sketches, which for all I know could have been made by an orangutan or an elephant. I'm sure the hotel paid this guy thousands of dollars, as his stuff seemed to be nearly everywhere in the hotel. Anyway, as you can see in the pictures-- taken with my cell phone, so I'm sorry they're not better quality-- the room is very well-decorated, with some unusual touches, like an enormous mirror that leaned against the wall near the front door. But from a functional standpoint, I thought there was some room for improvement. For one thing, the room really isn't so big. That's not a deal-breaker, as I only use the room for sleeping. It also wasn't very well lighted, which I didn't appreciate. The windows were single-pane, and quite a bit of street noise comes through. The bed was much too soft, and even though I brought my own pillow, I found it to be far too soft for me. At home, I have a pretty firm mattress, and it hurts my back when I sleep on a bed that is too soft. The bed was also covered with a thick down comforter, which is too much blanket for the sort of weather one experiences in San Diego in October. So I didn't sleep very well. Aside from that, the staff at the hotel was great, and overall I enjoyed my stay. If I can get a firmer mattress next time, I'd be happy to return to this hotel. It is located in the middle of the so-called gaslamp area, and there are great restaurants all around it, including a Yardhouse-- a personal favorite-- right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chung0912
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant for 1 night and it was wonderful. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel is beautifully decorated. It is also walking distance to the Gas Lamp District with plenty of restuarant. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gfgooner
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at The US Grant and had a fantastic stay. The hotel is located right by the Gaslamp area of San Diego, so great for restaurants, shops and bars but was also very quiet when back in the room. The room was very really nice with a huge bathroom and the staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Still got some kinks to work out...”
Reviews.Author: wannatakeatrip
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about our little getaway to San Diego. Found a great deal through Hotwire, that included free breakfast. We arrived at 3:30 for the 3pm checkin time, our room was not ready. 4pm, still not ready, so now I'm getting a little impatient. They cart us off to the bar till our room is available. Fine, we'll deal & have a free appetizer. The room is gorgeous!! We have a wonderful meal blocks away in the Gaslamp. Free breakfast, couldn't be more excited. Wonderful presentation for room service & the food was delicious. Check out, pricey parking, whatever we had a lovely time. Today, I check my cc statement & guess what? Charged for the free breakfast!!! Grrr, so now I have to deal with the accounting department. Overall, a great place, but they have some kinks to work out, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT HOTEL And AREA!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eyeluvpets
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a 8 night stay in Southern California (after this we went to LA and stayed at another ‘Starwood hotel’ – the ‘W Westwood’- also a top pick of mine) The US Grant is very nice, upscale everything. The lobby is gorgeous, the people were courteousand had much knowledge about the area. This hotel is in the PERFECT location to everything! I can’t stress this enough We were in walking distance to Petco Park, to the Pier, to the famous SD Zoo, to Balboa Park, great restaurants, shopping, bars etc. The hotel is in the Gas Lamp district…there is an outdoor mall right across the street with great stores, restaurants, bars, entertainment, etc. This hotel was in the best possible location, is clean, beautiful, everything you need! The only thing our particular room lacked was a standing mirror- being so used to getting dressed with one I found it odd. The room itself is beautiful- I agree with what another review said about not much counter space in the bathroom- but there was plenty of it elsewhere. I would absolutely advise anyone who is looking to stay in SD to stay here…..I hope to be back again!

Reviews.Title: “US Grant experience”
Reviews.Author: DOCELP
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this hotel since we had a busienss conference hosted at the hotel. My wife and I were very satisified with our whole experience. Starting with check in we were greeted in a very friendly manner and helped to our room. All of the hotel staff including front desk people, concierge, bellmen and cleaning people were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in a very nice area with the gaslamp district nearby and other shopping venues. The room was extremly comfortable with a very nice bed and nice bathroom. The hotel did not seem overcrowded and were able to get an elevator with miminal wait time. we really enjoyed our experience and look to our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleZG
Reviews.Content: After extensive research on where to stay in the Gaslamp District of San Diego, I finally decided on the US Grant based on Trip Advisor reviews. The reviewers were right on target. I originally booked one of their 770 square foot Signature Suites. On the eve of my trip I received a call from one of the managers telling me they were working on their weekend upgrades, and they were upgrading me to one of their Presidential Suites. It turns out this was a large bi-level suite with a living room, dining room, and large balcony overlooking Horton Plaza. The staff at the hotel could not have been friendlier. Any requests we made were promptly handled. The property is upscale and luxurious. The next time I go to San Diego I will be sure to stay at the US Grant again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: CaryandDayna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the U.S Grant mid august. We booked through SPG.com for 16,000 points a night. I feel this is a little steep but it is a very nice hotel and close to everything. We are Gold Spg but an upgraded room was not given, although we were given room 635 which faces the courtyard and garden so it was quieter than an outside room. The drawback is the bathroom faces other rooms and you must draw the shade for privacy as the windows are not frosted. Rooms are not huge but nicely done and the bed was great. LCD tv. Single vanity in the bathroom, no tub but fairly large shower. Turndown offered every night and housekeeping friendly and efficient. Front desk, bellmen, and concierge were all friendly and helpful. Did not feel forced to give tips although we always do. Dinner in the Grant Grill as well as the bar was quite good although wine at $18 a glass was a little high. $10 cab to the airport. $10-12 to the zoo and $25+ to Sea World. Always a cab outside with never a wait. Walking distance to waterfront and lots of shopping. Enjoy the new feeling of the U.S Grant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really nice people”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the US Grant for four nights because we wanted somewhere central in San Diego, not too far from Sea World and the San Diego Zoo. The location turned out to be excellent; it's just next door to the Gaslamp District and about 10-15 minutes' drive to the attractions. Check-in was very good, and valet parking (although not cheap at $30 day) was efficient and very courteous. We'd just driven down from Disneyland and my children were clutching soft toys. Later that evening a member of staff turned up with milk and cookies and typed notes from the staff addressed to Mr Tigger and Mr Pluto wishing them a nice stay. Great touch. In fact, all the staff were really helpful and pleasant. The room was very nice although my wife would have wanted one with a bath. A missing coffee maker was delivered inside 10 minutes. The renovation of this hotel has been nicely done; it looks and feels very classy. Probably better for couples and those on business conventions rather than families with young children. But we were made to feel really welcome. Only serious negative - no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: cscs4211
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip and all arrangements were made before arrival. I only stayed for one night. I arrived at 10.30 am in the morning and was given a room even though the check-in time was 3.00pm. Unfortunately, Room # 604, is located next to the elevator shaft and that is very noisy. I would think all the rooms located near or next to the elevator shaft have this problem as this was previously an office building that was converted to a hotel. I would suggest to that the hotel does something to dampen the noise. The windows faced other hotel rooms' windows. You must pull down the shades to obtain privacy, especially in the bathroom. Room was nicely decorated, even providing a bathroom scale which I have not seen in other Starwood hotels. $11.95 for internet connection in your room, this is the norm for all Starwood hotels. I had breakfast, lunch and dinner as part of the business meeting at the hotel and the food was good. The conference facilities were very good. The temperatures in these rooms were too cold - had to find a sweater in the middle of summer. The hotel was within walking distance to the Sea Village, Gas Lamp district and the USS Midway museum. I would stay there again - though in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with rich history.”
Reviews.Author: njgalinwt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work in March 2008. The hotel lobby is stunning post renovation. Checkin was quick and easy. My room was small, but the furntiure was top notch. Beside the king size bed, it fit a desk and tv stand and chair. There wasn't much room to move around otherwise. My room overlooked the courtyard. The bathroom was small, but nicely done. The sink had one of those bowl sinks that sits on top. While interesting, it splashed you every time you used it. Only negative of the hotel is that the windows need to be sealed better to block out the street noise. Every night around 3 am I heard the sidewalk cleaners across the street. Thankfully I could get back to sleep but someone who is a light sleeper might have problems. The windows were just too thin. Also, pigeons like to congregate on those window sills so bird poop was evident and it was not pretty. Location is ideal and right across the street from the outdoor mall area and a few blocks from gaslight district. Location can't be beat and you can walk to just about anywhere. I found the concierge helpful for getting directions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Historical - yes; Luxury - no”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights over the 4th of July holiday weekend at this hotel. One of the shortcomings of this property was obvious when we pulled up to the curb to check in – the valet parking situation is lousy for this grade of hotel. The interior driveway is closed and since the crew was not prepared for the rush of Friday arrivals, we had to wait in a line amongst the street traffic for our turn. There was no one to help us with our bags but once inside, check-in was professional and prompt. However, in spite of my SPG status and because I had negotiated their lowest rate, we were assigned a NS King on the somewhat shabby lowest level. The room was very small and even thought the hotel has been updated recently, it already appears dated and worn. The bathroom had limited counter space and has a modern bowl sink which seems out of place in this historic setting. We had to run the AC unit on the noisy high setting to get the room moderately cool. I understand that this hotel is used for high profile special event dinners and receptions, but I am at a loss as to why. One of my main complaints about this property is that the hotel lobby environment is not conducive to hanging out and the receception/concierge desks are back in the corners so there is no interaction with the desk staff as the guests enter and leave the hotel. On a positive note, housekeeping was thorough and offered a nice turn down service. As far as location, the hotel is conveniently located on the edge of the Gaslamp District, but it is surrounded by dilapidated and abandoned buildings. Every one that we came into contact with was pleasant and helpful, but there are too many negatives to ignore. Considering all aspects of my disappointment with this hotel, next time I visit San Diego, I would choose the Omni, Marriott or Hilton by the Convention Center or even stay at one of the beach communities like La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: chib0
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is impeccable. Stylish, but not kitchy, opulent but still descreet. Everything about good service and perfect location is true. The room, although may not have been the largest I have seen, was certainly the most pleasant I've stayed in. Design, style, amenities, little touches here and there, it was perfect. I do have a few grudges against them: (1) In a top hotel in S. California, I would really expect a swimming pool. Their explanation was 'because of the historical nature of our hotel, there is no pool'. Well, the historical nature has not stopped them from sticking a gym, wifi access (free in the lobby) and convention rooms there, so that is a lame excuse. They do let you use the pool of another hotel next door, but it was not very good. (2) The service is sometimes over the top. They go around doing their room cleaning in the morning, then in the afternoon they bring you some mineral water (why not leave the bottles at the cleaning time?). Finally, they do an evening shift asking whether you would need some ice. So no sooner than you get back to your room, take your clothes off before nipping to the shower, someone knocks the door, offering you water or ice etc. Sometimes that felt too much. Why not sticking an ice machine there? The historical nature I guess. (3) In the end, they wanted to charge us an awful lot of money for stuff from the minibar we did not take, but without any questions corrected the bill when I complained . They also charge 2 bucks for each toll-free (1-800) phonecall from the room, something no other American hotel does in my experience. But overall, a very positive experience. And that room... ah...

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, but weak service”
Reviews.Author: spycygrl
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at the US Grant during a conference in May. I convinced my company to put us up there when I realized the deal through my Starwood Preferred membership was better than what we would have gotten at the Marriott on the harbor. I am such a fan, usually, of Starwood resorts and the photos of the property looked phenomenal. The rate was $289/nt. We drove in from LA and went straight to the conference, not arriving at the hotel until 4 p.m. Check-in is 3 p.m., but one of our two rooms was not yet available. The desk clerk assured me it would be ready in about 15 mins. While I was a bit annoyed that as a Preferred guest, my room was NOT ready at check-in, I agreed to wait in my colleague's room. After 45 mins, my room was STILL not ready and I had to call down to the desk twice to get anyone to help me. After explaining that I really wanted to take a shower and get ready for the evening event I was attending, they finally upgraded me to a Jr. Suite up the hall. The room itself was fantastic and the furnishings, wood floors, bath, linens, acoutrements, LCD televisions (there were two!) were all top notch. My colleague's deluxe room was gorgeously appointed, too, and had I not been upgraded for free, I probably wouldn't spend the extra on the Jr. Suite. The bathroom was actually SMALLER in my room than in hers. The second night we were there, I called down to ask for extra towels and they never came. The housekeeper had taken all of my dirty towels, but not replenished the supply. I had to call again to get the towels finally. Upon checkout, we noticed that my colleague's room was still attached to my credit card even though she had given HER credit card upon check-in. They had to re-run the charge on hers and remove it from my credit card. When she got her bill, they had actually charged her twice! The hotel is well-located near the Gaslamp and the seaport and is truly a beautiful hotel (they have done a fine job modernizing this classic beauty). However, for the money and for being a Starwood property, I really expected more from the staff. They were all very kind and polite, but just couldn't seem to get it right in terms of actual service. I would definitely give them another chance, but am a touch disappointed with the service quality.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous & Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: wherecanwegonext23
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel with our 2 children. It was very nice and clean. The beds were very comfy. The rooms are not huge but they are perfect for 2 people!!! Well decorated. The best part of this hotel is were it is located. You can walk anywhere you need to go. Valet is pricey just like every other hotel in SD. But they are very quick to get your car. The only problem we had was with the air conditioner unit, if we turned it on high it made a terrible noise. We never ate at the hotel because there are so many places around you can walk to. Also, shopping is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I booked over 20 rooms at this hotel for my staff and the entire staff loved the hotel with the exception of one employee. I was given an upgrade to a Jr suite and my room was amazing. The room had a small area in the front for coffee and it opened into a small living room. The living area consisted of a sofa, TV, and a desk. This area became my living space for 10 days. The living area lead to the bedroom. The bed was VERY comfortable. The bathroom was huge... the room was great. It was comfort at its best. I loved this room. It was so nice and comfortable. The one complaint I got from a co-worker was that his bed was so close to the door he felt trapped. I never saw the room, but everyone else in my party loved their rooms. The gym is small... but its free. Room service was excellent, expensive, but the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fun4Travelers
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, beautiful, hotel, centrally located within walking distance to the harbor, the Gas Lamp District, the ballpark and a short drive to Coronado Island. The service was very good but the hotel was off just a little in a number of areas. The valet and doormen were wonderful, the reception personnel professional but I"m not sure about the concierge who gave us a very mediocre Mexican restaurant recommendation. We had reserved a top floor room with king size bed which upon arrival were told they were sold out and only had double beds available. After a moment or two the receptionist found a small suite on the 8th floor. We were aware of the noise potential problem but figured eight floors up we'd be ok and we were. The windows did rattle when the air conditioner went on and off due to the pressure change but not enough to keep us awake. The room was decorated very nicely with a great wall to wall persian style rug, wonderful linens and a great bed. One problem, no shower curtain. Housekeeping is called, one is brought up but it's too short. Second call to housekeeping brings a correct shower curtain. Valet parking service was excellent with the car being availabe within 5 minutes of calling down but at $30/day with unlimited in and out I'd hope so. We had breakfast at the Grant Grill which was excellent. However, we were told the Grill opened at 6 am which their literature also states but when we left for the airport for a very early morning flight, the Grill was not open and we were told it opend at 6:30 am. Still not sure which is correct but when we left at 6:30 it was still not open. All in all a beautiful hotel but when we come back to SD wel will stay somewhere else, probably nearer the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Great service. Loved the hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mckcluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Every Memorial Day weekend, my husband and I go to San Diego. If you want to experience excellent customer service, stay at the US Grant. The hotel is impeccable. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom spacious. The location is fantastic. You can walk to the mall and to the many restaurants in the Gas Lamp District. The only drawback is paying $30/day parking. But all the hotels charge similar parking rates. This was our first stay, but we'll return soon

Reviews.Title: “Not a Single Complaint”
Reviews.Author: lapel555
Reviews.Content: Our original plans were to stay at the Embassy Suites Downtown because it was fairly close to the Convention Center. There were problems with rates there, so I went to Expedia and Trip Advisor to find another hotel. I was really happy it worked out that way because the downtown location is so much better than the harbor area (very touristy). There are plenty of restaurants, bars, coffee shops and a shopping mall and its still close enough to walk to the convention center (about 10-15 minutes). Our room was not ready when we arrived and the front desk staff was very accomodating, offering water while we waited a short ten minutes. It is very historic, beautiful wood work, art work and chandeliers. I would not recommend it for children as it is a bit refined. The room was very clean, with comfortable bedding and a bright, roomy bathroom. The valet parking was $30/day but they allowed us to park our car from Sat. 2pm until Sunday 10pm, so it was worth it to us. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIMD
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Old-world charm in an updated setting. The location is great and the service was close to impeccable. My only complaint is that my room had almost no view. I was literally staring into another room (the hotel is U-shaped). While I was paying the conference rate, I am a GOLD SPG member and I thought I should have had a better room location.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful anniversary getaway there”
Reviews.Author: Happy travelor13
Reviews.Content: My husband & I wanted to go someplace special for our wedding anniversary and chose the U.S. Grant Hotel. We had toured it once before & were favorably impressed. Prior to checking in we were contacted via e-mail by the hotel to see what time our arrival would be & if our stay there was for something special. I did respond that we would be there for our anniversary. When we checked in we found that we had been upgraded to a mini-suite which was quite nice. Shortly after we checked in the staff delivered a beautiful tray with goodies on it with a card congratulating us on our anniversary. The Concierge was wonderful about getting us dinner reservations at a very busy restaurant on Mother's Day. On Mother's Day there was a box of wonderful candy with yet another card by our bedside for Mother's Day. I must commend the staff on their attentiveness, politeness & promptness. We really got superb service in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at US Grant”
Reviews.Author: nctraveler5108
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at the US Grant Hotel - a lovely historic hotel, restored and refurbished elegantly. The service was fantastic and the room very comfortable. The location is good for a walk of some blocks to the waterfront and Gas Lamp area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmax291
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a magnificent historical hotel with a fabulous rennovation. The lobby is classy and upscale. The rooms, though small, are beautifully decorated with flatscreen LCD TVs, original artwork, and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was very appropriately sized, with ample room for 3 people. Parking was $30/day, but the Valet service was prompt and polite. The concierge scheduled dinner for our family for 2 nights. They slipped an envelope under our door with reservation details and walking/driving directions--very professional and thorough. The location is a bit outside of the Gaslamp district, but well within walking distance. Overall, if you can afford this hotel and don't need to be in the middle of everything (especially if you have a car), it's a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you can”
Reviews.Author: alexk50
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay quickly....lucky for me a room was available. Historic grand hotel.Service outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellirpa
Reviews.Content: I booked through Expedia, paid in advance to get a better deal ($215 a night which is a steal for this place.) I really loved this hotel. It's gorgeous if you like old-school historic hotels. Positives: Great location if you want to stay in downtown San Diego. Directly across the street from Horton Plaza Mall (cool outdoor multilevel mall - great shopping and great food court. I highly recommend the mexican take out place in the food court, really yummy!) Customer service is outstanding. Loved the bellmen and the valet. They are true professionals and charming. Offered great directions everywhere I needed to go. Beautiful, i mean really beautiful huge lobby with gorgeous furniture, lots of couches everything. Everything really beautifully done. This place has undergone massive renovations and you have to give them kudos for doing an amazing job of restoring it to its (i'm assuming) former glory. Chocolates on the pillow every night. And not just any chocolate. Really good chocolate! Excellent "free" coffee available just inside the restaurant entryway every morning, with to-go cups. Bathroom in my room was wonderful, fully redone. Loved the towels, toiletries, full size blowdryer, nicest iron & board i've ever seen in a hotel room. Beautiful furniture in room. Really comfy bed. Great pillows. Free wi-fi. Worked great. Negatives: I had a room right next to the elevators. Loud weird noises (i'm assuming these were elevator related noises...or else...ghosts? :-) throughout the night, as well as people being noisy coming and going from the elevators. Luckily i always travel with ear plugs which helped somewhat. I did specifically ask for a room away from the elevators, but pretty much every hotel i know of always says there are no guarantees with exact room location you get. No self-parking available, and you're right in the middle of downtown, so street parking is pretty much impossible or highly unlikely. Attendant/valet/bellman are not right outside of the front entrance of hotel, they are outside of the side entrance. This took some time to find and get to since you deal with lots of one way streets downtown. They should really give people a heads up in advance for this. Valet parking was $30 a day. However, I always feel compelled to tip every time I gave my car to the valet or got it out of valet, so this adds up quickly! Downtown San Diego is the only area in San Diego where you pay for parking. They do have great transportation options downtown, so as long as you aren't planning to be anywhere other than downtown, you won't need a car. You can walk, take the trolley, taxis, buses, etc. However, if you want to go to the beach, SeaWorld, the Zoo, etc., you will need a car. This is not a place to stay if you want to go to the beach in San Diego. If you want a hotel by the beach in San Diego, definitely look elsewhere! Room service at this hotel is incredibly expensive. One night i was feeling sick, and did not want to have to go out anywhere to eat so I ordered a ceasar salad with shrimp and one glass of wine. This cost close to $60 with the tax and tip (already on the bill - beware - there is also the extra line on the bill to write in a tip even though it has already been added in to the cost!) Plus the shrimp on my ceasar salad were yucky - and there were only 3. They still had their legs, and the excrement line unremoved. The salad dressing was scarce, couldn't hardly even taste it. I wound up eating about two bites of my $35 salad. The glass of wine was tasty though! The room service was supposedly from the restaurant downstairs, which they tout as being one of the best in San Diego. I never ate actually in the restaurant so I can not judge it. It looked nice! I also have to say that the person who delivered the room service was very polite and very nice. At night, there are homeless people and/or druggies lurking around everywhere on the streets surrounding the hotel who aggressively ask for money (following you, yelling, etc.) I live in Seattle where we unfortunately have a homeless problem as well. I don't generally have problems with homeless people, but they were particularly aggressive here. One night i walked back to the hotel from a restaurant at Horton Plaza (right across the street) and was harassed by a man. I think he was either stoned or drunk. I was a little bit scared by this. I would recommend not walking around at night in this area alone. The view outside my window was of other windows in other sections of the hotel, plus the roof of a lower area of the hotel with trash discarded on top of it. At night the hotel has red lights all around the hotel shining onto it (I have no idea why they would choose to shine red lights on their hotel?), which comes through the windows. They have thick curtains on the windows that blocks out most of it. One other negative: they made a mistake on my bill. They charged me for two cars in valet parking. It may have been an honest mistake since I switched out my rental car for a different one. I explained this when I returned to the hotel with a different car, but apparently it got entered in the system as a second vehicle instead of a replacement. Anyway, when I went down to the front desk on my way out to check out, I explained what happened, and they removed the extra charge without any argument. Again I want to point out that their focus on customer service is really outstanding. They are incredibly responsive and professional without being stuffy. Very nice people. Overall, i really loved this beautifully restored historic hotel in a great downtown location with superior service by everyone I encountered who works there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Princess55
Reviews.Content: My husband, three-year-old daughter and I stayed at the U.S. Grant for three nights prior to Easter, 2008. The hotel is lovely: very elegant, beautifully designed and appointed and the staff was charming throughout from car valet to concierge. Although this is not really a "kid friendly" property in the sense that it's very high end and definitely designed for adults, we did not get any attitude or disapproving looks despite having a young (very well behaved) child with us. Breakfast, which we ate at the hotel two days running was phenomenal (Grant's Grill). World class preparation with fresh fruit, truly fresh juice and French toast that was about 1.5 inches thick. Sheets were high thread count and silky cotton. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Stayer Here First”
Reviews.Author: CleoDoylestown
Reviews.Content: Checked in here because I was unhappy with first hotel. Very friendly staff and upgraded to a beautiful room. The shower was huge with jets everywhere. Very stylish decor throughout the hotel. Very pleasant restaurant. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A truly historic hotel - but rooms are bit small”
Reviews.Author: pactio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the US Grant in San Diego during a 4-day visit (Dec 24 - 27). This hotel is a beautiful historic hotel - it's celebrating its 100th anniversary in 2008, and you can see the sense of history everywhere you go in the hotel. The furniture, the furnishings, artwork, etc. were all chosen because of their historical significance. Good things about the hotel: 1) Location - it's right across from Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp Quarters, so you have shopping and eating right on your doorstep. There is a convenient store a few blocks up (Rite-Aid). If you don't have a car, the bus stop is right across the street, and the tram is behind the hotel. Very convenient location! 2) History - this hotel is great for history buffs. Ask the concierge for a free tour of the hotel. They'll take you on a private tour (approx 1 hour) of the public and private areas of the hotel. It's well worth your time! 3) Concierge service - this is a Luxury Collection hotel, so you expect the service to be top-notch. I wasn't disappointed! The concierge was very helpful in securing restaurant reservations and more important, the photo safari reservation at the Wild Animals Park. 4) Free wireless Internet in the lobby - don't bother paying for Internet service in your room. 5) Restaurant - the Grant Grill is one of the top restaurants in the city. We unfortunately didn't get to try it, but we heard great things about it from the locals while we were in SD. Not-so-good things: 1) The room - the room is a bit small, but it's likely because this is an older hotel. The bathroom is at least a fair size so no complaints there. The room is beautifully furnished though - the bed was very comfortable, and there was original artwork in every room (by the same artist) above the bed. The TV wasn't flat screen either. 2) Valet parking - $30 a day (with in and out privileges) to park at the hotel! We thought LA was expensive, but this was worse! There are other parking lots around the area if you look carefully that'll be cheaper, but they might not be as safe. 3) Downtown San Diego - downtown is not as exciting as I thought it would be, because at night, the area gets a bit "seedy". Even the Gaslamp Quarter isn't as lively as expected. If you have to stay in downtown San Diego and you don't mind a smaller room, then US Grant is a great hotel to stay. You definitely feel pampered while you're there. But if you have a choice, stay in La Jolla instead, where it's a lot livelier in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “US Grant”
Reviews.Author: justpastone
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The US grant as part of a longer road trip for two nights. I booked the hotel based on the excellent reviews it had received on trip advisor, and the general appearance from travellers photos, and indeed the hotel was lovely and the pictures did it justice. Unfortunately, we arrived later then expected, and being on a road trip, we arrived rather more scruffy than the average clientele. This was reflected by the man at the check in desk who took a very snooty attitude to the way we looked. I have stayed in quite a number of 5 star hotels, and haven't always arrived looking smart, but I have never received the sort of look I did from this man. We took our own bags to our room - no bell hop was offered. The room was nice, if a little small, it was only just possible to open the bathroom door, as the bed was in the way. I had booked a superior room, but would be interested to know what the difference is between the the room I booked and a standard room, as it can not be size. Bathroom also had no bath. The other issue I had were with the lack of things in the room. I had to call guest services to get a coffee maker, somewhat of a standard in most hotel rooms, and then coffee mugs (which didn't come with the coffee maker) and then wine glasses. It got a little boring ringing down, especially when I had to do the same thing again the following day, as everything had been taken away. I also felt uncomfortable about the homeless people in the park right outside the hotel. I am an early morning walker, and if the overriding smell of urine wasn't bad enough, the pan handling was very pleasant especially for a woman on her own. This hotel seems to cater more to the business person on a short trip, and if I was visiting San Diego again I would choose to stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Hotel in the Middle of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: DavandNat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in December 2007 while attending a holiday event at the hotel. The Grant is in a great location, on Broadway and across from the Horton Plaza shopping plaza. Very close to most downtown sights; lots of restaurants, clubs, etc., within walking distance. Valet parking is a bit difficult to find, but service quick and efficient. Big lobby with lots of couches and seats. Check-in/out a breeze. Had a very nice corner room on the 4th floor overlooking Horton Plaza. A word of warning: if you are bothered by street noise, you may want to ask for a different location. Room was average size with a big closet in the entryway, very comfortable bed, desk, chair, bureau. Nice LCD TV and very nice clock radio/stereo. Old style bathroom, refurbished a year or so ago. Nice amenities, including robes and slippers. The room - and the hotel - maintains the feel of a 20s style grand hotel updated to the 21st century. The hotel bar is itself something of a landmark and is not to be missed. Overall a nice high end place to stay if you're interested in downtown SD.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Top-notch-Tastes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our first trip to San Diego. We are quite picky with our choices and were very pleased with this hotel. Our big "musts": cleanliness, location, ambiance, and as close to 5 star quality as possible. CLEANLINESS: This hotel was impeccably clean. Not one complaint. LOCATION: located in the Gas Lamp district of San Diego. Buses run by the hotel. Across the street from a great mall with outdoor walkways. Restaurants galore in the area, including a great bar restaurant across the street with over 100 different types of beer on tap, very unique. The USS Midway is a 10-15min walk down Broadway to the pier. At the same pier at the end of Broadway you can also catch a ferry to Coronado Island. From the hotel, a quick 10min taxi ride and we were at Balboa park and the zoo. AMBIANCE: my husband and I dislike fussy and overly ornate décor. The hotel is exquisitely decorated. Tones of beige and cool blue with touches of chocolate. The hotel has great presence, completely renovated it has a new feeling and old world charm. Great photos of the hotel in the early days are on the walls in the lobby area. This hotel is quiet and pleasant to return to after long days of site seeing. The staff were always pleasant to talk to and frequently asked for any way in which they could be of service. Friendly doesn’t do enough to describe the staff there, they made the experience top notch. The hotel bar is very nice and dining at the Grant Grille was delicious. Great food and drinks along with amazing staff. ROOM: The room was wonderful & completely new. The linens we nice, crisp white and there was a huge painting for the headboard wall. The room also had a gigantic framed mirror leaning up against one wall. We had a medium sized flat screened TV, a desk and nice sized closet. Coffee and tea pod maker in the room. The bathroom was wonderful. Marble countertop, huge step-in marble shower. The hotel personnel were a highlight of the stay. From the doorman, to the concierge, to the front desk, to the room service, etc. Every person we interacted with had the 5 star hotel communication hat on. They were great! The hotel was perfect and we really enjoyed our visit, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel in a fun area of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: dukektown
Reviews.Content: I generally enjoyed my stay at the U.S. Grant in San Diego. The hotel is well located in the central downtown area directly across the street from Horton Plaza, a nice semi-outdoor shopping complex that includes a Nordstroms and Macys. I was in San Diego for a meeting and was able to walk to the convention center in about 15 minutes. The hotel is quite impressive from the outside. It is a classic design and has the presence of an established landmark. The inside is equally impressive with an expansive lobby. Check in was smooth and efficient. My room was visually appealing with a nice king size bed, a side table with CD clock radio, a 32 inch LCD, etc. The bathroom was somewhat modern with a great basin although there was only a shower and no tub available in my room. The Grant Grill is their only restaurant. I enjoyed the food there and everything seemed well-prepared. There are many nearby alternatives not only at Horton Plaza but all along the Gas Light District as well as near the convention center. I was able to easily find a Mortons, a Flemings, a Rock Bottom, and many local establishments. The health club is fairly nice although small. The equipment appears quite new and includes built-in television feeds. a Just for reference, there are a few issues that should be noted. Although I find the nearby areas interesting, there are quite a large number of homeless people even directly across the street. One morning, I counted at least 30 homeless types (sleeping bags + carts) well within 50 yards of the hotel’s front entrance. I was never bothered by anyone, but if you have anxiety after dark in those situations, you might just want to be aware of it. In addition, there was an error on my bill that developed because the minibr fridge automatically charges you when the items in the fridge are moved. I told them I was just seeing what was in there, but it would be nice for them to confirm the use before charging since the sensor seems quite sensitive. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. I would likely consider staying again although I might opt for the $100 suite upgrade that was offered to me when I made my reservation. Since I was there by myself, I declined. However, with more than one person in the room, the extra space would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Addison_texasWendyw
Reviews.Content: The US Grant is a nice hotel located conveniently downtown. The valet/bell service when we arrived made us feel welcome. Check in was easy and we loved our room on the top floor. Nice spacious bathrooms and luxurious soaps were a nice touch. The linens were wonderful but the beds were a bit hard for me. The room was a little stuffy but we couldn't keep the windows open since it was quite noisy outside. Room service was good and the only drawback to the Grant was the $30 parking fee. Would definitely go back and stay for a longer visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the US Grant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joseph_richard
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at The US Grant Hotel, where we were pleasantly surprised of the accommodations. Service was excellent, pleasant staff. Average size rooms were cozy and quite luxurious. King size beds were very comfortable. Overall renovations of rooms and bathrooms were excellent. Ask for the history tour of the hotel, we found it interesting. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant "The Grant Grill", as we were happy to walk the downtown area and found lots of interesting places to eat. Although the original windows were not changed as of yet, we found out it is in the future plans. Room was a "little" noisy, but not enough to ruin a good nights sleep. Gym in the basement was not too exciting, we did not use it. We would definitely stay there again on any future trips to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Had several types of rooms at the US Grant”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: Our family occupied four rooms at the US Grant for three nights. We had two regular rooms, one medium-size suite and one large suite. The positives: Gracious, helpful, friendly staff. Very helpful front desk staff and concierge. Excellent valet service. Very good catering service and banquet facility. Large, well-appointed suite with huge bathroom and shower. Good location next to the gaslamp district and a lot of good restaurants and shopping. Lovely lobby, restaurant, common areas, great elevators. Good value - excellent rates for the week between Christmas and New Year's. The negatives: Regular rooms a bit small. It was cool outside(50's and 60's) and despite room thermostat set at 65, rooms were still too warm, so I'm not sure if the air conditioning/heat was working properly. We opened the windows, but it was rather noisy outside. Fair housekeeping (despite the fact that we left a very good tip the first night, they did not always replace towels at evening service, sometimes failed to replace bottled water, failed to clean coffee maker after use, failed to replenish toiletries). Despite recent renovation, some areas in need of paint/stain touchups. Expensive restaurant. Staff (especially concierge) very good but definitely overworked; had extensive wait every time we tried to speak with him/her. I would stay here again if I wanted to be near the gaslamp district and could get the same very good room rates; otherwise I'd try a different hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Stay”
Reviews.Author: T-BoneMN
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate on a Landmark Suite via the hotel's Web site. The room was in great shape and the artistic elements (like the customized headboard) were really amazing. Other than that the bedroom was a little bright at night, the room was absolutely perfect. Also I thought the hotel had really impeccable service. Everyone was very polite and courteous. People did a good job of remembering your name and making you feel very welcomed. My wife and I loved our stay here and we'd go back in a heartbeat. One note on location: I attended a convention and this is a manageable walk to the Convention Center or any stops in the Gaslamp Quarter (although there are certainly closer hotels if that's important). I enjoyed having a little walk every day since San Diego has such great weather.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excetional service, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: kkrtraveler
Reviews.Content: Since I tend to get wordy, here is my bottom line: I thought this was a beautiful, glamorous hotel in a great area and I would stay there again. Service: really great, helpful people, a highlight of the hotel. They were very gracious. Rooms: We were on the top floor- we splurged on an upgraded room with a special whirlpool tub- they were beautiful and relatively spacious (coming from nyc at least) but this is an older hotel, even though it has been upgraded, there is no mistaking that this is an old building and therefore did not have as moderna feel as some hotes. We had a view of the city which was beautiful at night. The bathrooms were also nicely decorated, marble, glass and wood. Food: we didn't eat at the hotel since there are just so many restaurants in the area, the proximity to so many is a bonus. . Transportation: we rented a car and valet parked- the valets were very nice and helpful and did their job with a lot of professionalism. this is a beautiful, upgraded hotel and we thought that the service was great. It was not the most luxurious hotel we have ever been in because of the historic feel to the building and the rooms, but it is still very nice. The proximity to things is a plus. let me know if anyone has questions!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: datwahine
Reviews.Content: As always, I searched the internet for the best deals for a weekend getaway to San Diego. The goal: to view the Dead Sea Scrolls. (Read the bottom for my point in telling you that I searched the internet -- you'll love it!) As a single parent and a high school teacher, I am always on a budget. I do, however, prefer to stay at hotels, not motels, that offers that extra touch of class. Such as the orchid and ti leaf leis that the Westin Maui greets its guests with or the free room upgrade and creamy chocolate mousse drops at Costa Rica's Hotel Grano de Oro. The US Grant is one of these hotels. We booked the 9 a.m. viewing of the Scrolls and were done sooner than expected. I called the hotel and requested an early check in -- no problem, which is great, especially if you have two teens who felt like they spent way too much time looking at old pieces of scrap paper! The hotel is aesthetically pleasing. The room we were given was also above average, boasting a flat screen television, marble bathroom, SO comfortable beds with crisp, but smooth, linens. I also love it when the rooms come with plush robes. The toiletries were a treat (Gilchrist & Soames), which may be a small thing to some, but to me, it makes a world of difference! If location is important, the Grant is the answer! The Gaslamp Quarter, along with a huge mall is directly across the street. Little Italy is about a five minutes drive or 20-30 minutes walk. I wouldn't, though, recommend walking too much at night since I saw a few shady characters and homeless people (?). There is one negative to the US Grant--parking is a nightmare, which almost forces guests to hand over $30 for valet parking. The other option is paying for public parking ($12-15), but as I mentioned, the characters I saw are questionable. Overall, the US Grant is a place I will return to. PS If you are a Starwood miles member, I was able to book this hotel, which can cost close to $300 per night, for 4500 miles + $90. You heard it correctly (I knew I had a story), $90!!! Now is that a deal or what?!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: scottMiami
Reviews.Content: This hotel has received strong reviews in the travel magazines, but the praise is undeserved. It is a middle-range hotel, with strained efforts at being "luxury". Forget any comparison to the Four Seasons. Decoration is minimal (it looks like they're trying to discourage the guests from swiping anything) and efforts are made to create design, without true quality. If you order the luxury package, expect to remind them to deliver the champagne and flowers. Just way overpriced for what they offer...and forget the gym. Doormen only at the valet entrance, none of the little things that create luxury or a memorable experience. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot In Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: The newly restored US Grant is simply the nicest hotel in downtown San Diego for business people in my age range (40-60). The lobby has a grest understated elegance. The rooms are smallish, but very well appointed and the staff is amazing, there is seemingly nothing they will not do to make your stay more comfortable. The young Hollywood crowd is probably heading to the Keating or the Ivy (goodbye W as hippest hotel in San Diego), the old crowd is still going to the Westgate, but the Grant will be my business hotel of choice in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel superb staff delighful stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: aussieitchyfeet
Reviews.Content: Wow we had a wonderful stay. We arrived at 11am and could check in straight away.The staff where excellent nothing was too much trouble. (Harry and James really looked after us well )Our room while not huge was lovely for the 3 of us and very luxurious.( the kids loved it and thought it was very posh )We had room service which was really delicious for dinner and breakfast the extra attention to detail was lovely. Great location ,great staff, great food ,great room, great stay! If you get a chance stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about fancy!”
Reviews.Author: H&SP
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. I had spent ages deciding on our San Diego hotel and finally settled on this one. It was more than we would usually spend but I found most places in the Gaslamp Quarter were quite expensive. We also got one night free since we stayed for five which helped. I knew it was a bit different to our normal hotels when the doorman opened the taxi door for me and it impressed me from there. The staff were all extremely polite and helpful. The room was great, perfect size for the two of us and our shopping! I had asked for a room away from the main road and I'm glad I did as it could be noisy out there. The location was great - easy walk to places to eat, across the road from the Horton Plaza shopping centre and round the corner from the Civic Center trolley stop. Really cannot fault this hotel and enjoyed every minute of it especially the turn down service with the chocolates on the pillow and the ice in the ice bucket!

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel that different than the more modern hotels”
Reviews.Author: Factory_tour_man
Reviews.Content: I read about the extensive renovation of the hotel. I booked it online through a travel site, which locked me into price and days. The lobby was nice and I enjoyed more than my share of free apples. My room had an historic feel to it and was well docorated, but was small. It was near one of the airshafts. I had to move at first because the fans were too noisy. They let me move easily and it improved my stay. I had visited the nearby Westin for the conference I was attending, I was glad to stay at a more historical, yet updated hotel. I could also easily walk to local SD attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Samuel-D
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at US Grant; the hotel is right in the center of downtown San Diego which allows you to walk to almost anywhere and enjoy the Gaslamp Quarter. The hotel has a nice lobby, but I agree with previous reviews, its nothing special, which is a shame. I would make it a more attractive place where people can meet, as this hotel is clearly a Grande Dame. The rooms are great; I am a Platinium member and got upgraded to a deluxe room (1106), on the last floor with view of the city. The bed are large and comfortable and the bathroom is great, with a jacuzzi built in. All in all I would recommend this hotel for its charm, location and good concierge service ( especially the Dutch woman)

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: AmberBock
Reviews.Content: The US Grant has it figured out. Service is impeccable and they seem to make it look effortless. The property itself is very nice. Gorgeous lobby and comfortable rooms. Do understand, this is a downtown hotel so the rooms are not massive. They do not have a pool (I think you can use the Horton Plaza Hotel pool though, I am not sure), the gym is in a basement (although the equipment is quite good) and I believe the spa services are done off site. But if you want something, anything, they will get it for you. Parking is a challenge downtown so I recommend using valet ($30 or so a day). We got particularly great valet/bell service from Michael (or Mike, I am not sure, tall thin guy, really did great by us). The bed might be the most comfortable I have ever slept in and I have traveled a fair amount. Very nice bathrooms, especially considering this is an older property. Towels, etc were all great. I will stop with that, just assume all of the fine finishing touches are in place at the US Grant and you will get the idea. We had one dinner in the restaurant and found the atmosphere of the room to be great and service was great. The food, sadly, was average. I think we just got an unlucky break with a cut of meat. We did not tell mgmt, shame on us. Overall a great place. If you are a discriminating hotel guest the US Grant will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: “OK but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a king bedded room for business. Excellent: Décor Good: Staff. Bed. Desk lighting. OK: Location. Close to the mall but close to eyesores. Internet. Elevators. So So: Housekeeping is not consistent. Lighting by door is poor. Clogged sink drain was fixed but the maintenance staff left the clog blob of hair, etc. in the toilet. I guess it was to let me know they were there and they had fixed it. Room had view of the transient hotels across the street which was at times more entertaining than what was on TV. Lots of street noise (people, cars, trucks, etc.). Shame on the big paint drops on the floor in the bathroom and sloppy paint job in the hallways (paint on the elevator lights, etc.) that make you wonder if they were rushed finishing up. Bad: Trucks would idle outside my window until the wee hours of the morning so if you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs. FYI: The coffeemaker is hidden in the credenza in the entry way. This hotel has very good bones and will improve with age. When the neighbourhood catches up with it it will be a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, 9 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: tjk1976
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights over a recent weekend. The staff throughout the stay were unusually friendly and helpful, which is obviously the result of some great training. The location of the hotel, right on the edge of the Gaslamp District, is superb with many great restaurants and shopping choices within steps (including Horton Plaza mall which is directly across the street). We stayed in a “Landmark Suite” (which is one of their mid-sized suites). The suite was pretty impressive with modern and comfortable furnishings and amenities including a Bose stereo, separate living room, modern marble bathroom, etc. I would estimate it to be around 500 sq. ft. The room decor was fresh and done in an "old meets new" motif with traditional style moldings and carpets juxtaposed against modern halogen lighting and flat panel TVs, etc. Due to the location of the hotel, the view from the room was non-existent (not surprising). Strangely, despite the recent $50 million plus renovation, the room windows are of the old single-pane variety whereas modern double glazing would be helpful in cutting out street noise. The lobby is beautiful but didn't knock our socks off. I think they could have made it truly spectacular by restoring the old wooden surfaces and Corinthian columns to their original 1910 glory rather than cladding the columns in beige marble and painting the carved tops in a blue distressed looking metallic finish of questionable taste, as they have done. As a result, the lobby, with its huge glittering crystal chandeliers, has an almost Vegas-like grandeur without the historical authenticity that it rightly deserves. Overall though, they have created a modern and comfortable hotel while retaining some of the historical charm of the building. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: todarcie
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on a deal on Sky Auction.com. My husband and I spent 4 days there and enjoyed every minute of it. The service of this hotel is wonderful. All the staff is very friendly and helpful, some of the best service I have ever had in a hotel and I have stayed some nice places. The Grant Grill is pricey but it was the best food I had all my vacation, the chicken hash is not to be missed. If you like beer, the yard house is right next store and it has the largest draft beer selection in the world. Overall this hotel met all expectations. I would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Location Is A Blessing & Curse.”
Reviews.Author: edwardla
Reviews.Content: Design-wise, the hotel lobby and restaurant/lounge are nice and decent, but not breathtaking or cutting edge. That's why it's surprising when you walk into your hotel room. It's quite gorgeous, as well as the bathroom. Very nicely decorated, the painted headboard is a nice touch. Some might find the room size a tad bit small, but we had no complaints. The location is perfectly situated in downtown San Diego. Pretty much everything (Gaslamp, Petco Park, Convention Center, etc) is within walking distance. However this becomes a problem in the morning when the downtown rush hour traffic wakes you up. The hotel's not very high, so it's very difficult to escape the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Memories of US Grant”
Reviews.Author: asiangirl007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for 2 nights last weekend. I initially chose it for it's history and recent remodel. The hotel is smack dab in middle of gaslamp district with plenty of shops, restaurants, clubs within walking distance. Trolley and bus stops are steps away from hotel doors. Hotel itself is gorgeous! **Ask concierge to view the hotel's archive photgraph book.** I booked the romatic getaway package for about $300 per night. This was supposed to include king bed room with view, floral arrangement, champagne, and breakfast up to $50. The room itself was fabulous and I was pleasantly surprised as it looked much like the pictures from hotel website. It was also clean and well decorated. It was extremely quiet and I never once heard anyone next door - as is usually the case in hotel rooms. Now here were my issues: The room had a view of parking structure and a condemned graffitied building behind that. Shortly after we arrived to our room, a maid entered without knocking to ask about turn down service (which I thought odd). The bottle of champagne was probably one of the worst tasting champagnes I've ever had. I certaintly wasn't expecting Dom but I did expect a nice Verve or Piper. The flowers didn't arrive until the second day - halfway through our trip. The breakfast was excellent. I highly recommend their version of hash browns - it's flavored with shitake and the subtle flavor of mushroom infused into the potatoes is very tasty. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would most likely return to visit this landmark hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fabulous service!”
Reviews.Author: leeala
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! We stayed at the U.S. Grant for six nights 7/26-8/1. This hotel is absolutely beautiful and the service is top-notch. I highly recommend it. I can't say enough about how nice every hotel employee is. The location is great, very close to some wonderful restaurants in the Gaslamp District and right across the street from Horton Plaza. I stayed with my husband and two children, 8 and 10 years old, in a room with double beds. Our room was a nice size and well appointed. Keep in mind that there are only showers in all but a few rooms - this was not a problem for us. There are two robes in the closet for your use. I needed more hangers which were brought up within a few minutes after I requested them. If you are easily bothered by noise, then definitely request an inside room as suggested by another reviewer. Our room was right next to the elevator so we could hear it through the night as well as the people in the hallway. I did not want to pack up and move to a different room, so we found a simple solution to cover up the noise by turning the A/C fan on to low or medium - perfect white noise. Our friends has an outside suite and heard noise until late in the night from the bar across the street. I told them about my fan trick and it worked for them. This hotel does an excellent job at making their guests feel welcome. We found the staff to be most friendly and accomodating - it is obvious they are out to please. We were greeted with a hello and a smile by every employee that we passed. The doormen and valets even remembered our names. They also make great recommendations for restaurants and give very helpful driving directions. The only slightly negative experience was with the housekeeping. They often took our four wet towels to replace them with two or three new towels. I had to call Guest Services daily to have them send up more towels - which they did quickly and with a smile. In the sceme of things, this wasn't really a serious issue, especially with the way they took care of it! Also, they let us have extra towels to take to the local beaches!!! The Grant Grill is quite expensive, about $80.00 for a breakfast for four, and not the best choice for kids (items were too 'gourmet' for my kids!). We found a great local diner - The Cheese Shop - that served the best, huge breakfast. We also had great meals at Hard Rock, Sammy's Pizza, and Croce's. ' Again, stay at this hotel if you get the chance. You won't regret it! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Elysed
Reviews.Content: The U.S. Grant is a beatiful hotel in a somewhat run down part of downtown San Diego. Our room was nicely decorated, but smelled musty..The halls smelled even worse. The housekeeping was very "sub-par", as one past reviewer noted. They left dirty glasses, didn't dust or wipe down surfaces, and didn't refill toiletries or coffee. The staff was friendly, especially the doormen..and we always got a greeting and smiles upon arrivals.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the US Grant!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone. It is a very grand hotel and everything is very tasteful. We had booked the romance package and included in the price was champagne in the room, a flower arrangement with red roses and breakfast each morning. Our bedroom was lovely with a kingsize bed and top quality linens. The bathroom was spacious and again had excellent amenities. The situation of this hotel is excellent . It is across the road from the Horton Plaza shopping centre and also the Gaslamp Quarter, which is very lively in the evenings. It is also within walking distance of Petco Park and we attended our first ball game whilst there. The trolley bus for the sightseeing tour is just across the road from the hotel. The food in the hotel was excellent and all staff gave excellent service. Nothing was too much trouble for them. If I stayed in San Diego again I would not even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Grant”
Reviews.Author: JudiAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at the U.S.Grant in San Diego,and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel is beautiful,the rooms are spacious and well appointed. the staff most helpful and polite, and to top it all off it is perfectly located in the centre of everything
